completion:
Deku and Bakugo were pulled out of class by Mr. Aizawa.None of the two had a clue as to what was going on, and when they entered the room they were going to talk in Deku felt a spike of cold rush down as he noticed it was only Aizawa, Bakugo, and him. "What are we even doing here? I'm going to fall behind in class." Deku took a seat, sitting beside Bakugo, but not close enough to feel the annoyance radiating off of Bakugo as he also took a seat. Aizawa sat at the other end of the table, his sharp eyes seeming to narrow down on Deku's words. "You won't. I made sure of that." Bakugo scoffed and crossed his arms. "Can we just get this over with. And why am I sitting so close to, Deku." Bakugo's remark went unanswered and as the seconds passed, Deku could feel his worries beggining to creep closed and closer.He dug his nails into his pants, the fabric crinkled beneath his nails. But he kept smiling, even when Mr. Aizawa leaned forward and place his arms on the table, leaning on the table.  "Midoriya." Deku gave a small nod, the way his name had been spoken gave him anxiety. He was worried. So worried. He didn't know why. "I have one question. And I need you to answer truthfully," Bakugo's scowl left and suddenly the rooms air turned as tense as the underground heroes gaze. Deku couldn't help the sting in his eyes and the clogging in his throat. His stomach dropped and he could feel his entire body running stone cold. "Yeah?" He didn't want to know. He didn't. He didn't. "Have you tried killing yourself before?"  Bakugo's eyes went wide and his gaze went to Deku.  Deku's smile dropped. And so did his stomach again. It felt horrible. He wanted to throw up. He felt sick, disgusted, and he didn't even know– "N-no? Hah, why would I do that?" Deku's fingers dug even deeper into his pants. His skin stung. Aizawa looked unconvinced. His eyes closed and he sighed, when his eyes opened again Deku could only see worry in them.  Worry for him. "Midoriya. I need you to answer me truthfully." Deku let out a small laugh, it went silent as soon as his laugh decapitated. A nervous smile crossed his face, his eyes going a little wide. His heart began to beat faster, louder, stronger. "No? No-" Deku swallowed. His throat was closing, and he could feel the heat rising all around him as he began to panic internally. Aizawa frowned, his hair falling forward. "Have you tried killing yourself recently." Deku couldn't swallow anymore. His chest stopped, his racing mind raced even faster, and his entire froze against his own will. Bakugo uncrossed his arms, a frown on his face as he began to feel a cold sweat coming on. "Deku?"   "..."   "Did Kirishima tell you..?" Bakugo's eyes went even wider as he looked at Aizawa, the teacher looked even more worried with eyes just as wide as Bakugo's. "Who told me doesn't matter. Have you tried to kill yourself." Deku couldn't help the shaky laugh that slipped out of his mouth, he felt horrible. The feeling of wanting to throw up came back and he cleared his throat to ignore the disgusting feeling. "No." Aizawa sighed again, "Midoriya."   
"Midoriya! Wake up kid!" Deku yelped as he felt a sharp jolt of pain on his head, when he looked up he saw his teachers stretched hand easing back. 'He must've smacked my head again...' Deku looked down at his paper, scribbles of hero stuff was written down and he felt a little proud of it.
 
A little.
 
"You need to focus, unless you want to repeat the school year." There was a silent groan from the teacher, and Deku could feel his head duck lower in shame and guilt. People were laughing at him now, there was even one who three a ball of paper at his head.
 
Why... why was he even here?
 
The class ended, and Deku was putting his stuff in his bag. He lifted his hero notebook, about to place it in his bag when it was snatched from his hands making him let out a small yelp. About to make a snarky comment, he froze when he saw it was Kacchan.

"Trying to be a fucking hero, Deku?" Deku let his hand fall to his side. "..yes..." There was only silence and when Deku looked up he saw the enraged scowl on Kacchan's face. He squeaked and stepped back. 

"Did you just talk back." Deku shook his head and stepped back even more, the back of his legs hitting a desk. He winced and looked down, his lips trembled as he held them in a tight line. "N-no.. no I didn't, I'm sorry, Kacchan. I'm sorry. I'm sorry!" Deku saw familiar grey shoes appear and his vision.

And then he felt the familiar hand on his left shoulder. He flinched as he felt the sting and warmth of Kacchan's quirk being used on his shoulder. "Well. Then you won't mind me throwing this piece of shit out the window." Kacchan lifted his hand off Deku's shoulder, and suddenly blew the hero notebook up.
 
Right. In. Front. Of. Deku.
 
He flinched at the loud sound, his eyes going wide as the smoke left and his burned notebook was left behind. With shaky hands, he made them into fists, looked into the blonde's eyes and— froze— he froze. 

Kacchan chuckled and smirked, throwing the notebook out the open window, 
watching how Deku simply stayed put.
 
"If you really want to be a hero." Kacchan and his two friends walked to the door, Kacchan stopped walking and looked back. "You can get lucky, and take a swan dive off the roof of the building." Deku looked down, tears brimming at his eyes as he began to shake.
  
Did he mean that?... really meant it.
   "M-maybe? Yes...?" Deku closed his eyes, his hair covering his eyes as he looked down. Bakugo frowned even more, his usually angry face was long gone, one of worry and discomfort covered his expression now. Aizawa couldn't help how his eyebrows went up."I-... I was bullied during middle school." Bakugo felt his mouth dry at the mention of middle school. He knew what he did was wrong. And nothing could ever repay Deku for all the wrong doings he ever did and said. "They hurt me– verbally and physically." Deku didn't know why his mouth was running, he wasn't speaking on his own. "They told me to.." Aizawa knew it was coming, he watched how Deku struggled to even form words now. "Told me to kill myself." Bakugo could feel his stomach drop like an anvil.  He was that 'they' "Did you try?" This wasn't meant to happen — it was.. but Mr. Aizawa didn't think it would've been so horrible to actually hear it. "Yes.. j-just once!" Deku was looking up now, his eyes brimming with unshed tears as he lifted a trembling hand to rest on the back of his neck. "M-maybe two times..."Bakugo put a hand on the table, Deku flinched. Mr. Aizawa frowned at the small reaction, it might've been small to Bakugo. But it wasn't to him. "What? The hell, Deku!" Deku's gaze was now on Bakugo. The green-haired boy was shaking his hands as he gave a nervous smile, his head shaking ever so slightly to emphasize his shaking hands. Bakugo didn't seem to take it. "I-i didn't actually succeed!"   "But what if you had!?"  Silence struck the room. Deku's smile swiped away as a small tear slipped down his face, his wide eyes locked on to Bakugo's and the blonde's anger flickered to worry. The hand on the table clenched into a fist, "What if you had, Deku... what then."  Deku wiped at where the stray tear had fallen down.  "Was Bakugo the one who bullied you."   "What?" Deku looked surprised, but worried. Aizawa shook his head and let out a small sigh, his narrowed eyes went to Bakugo and he froze too. Eyes wide with worry and acceptance. "N-no! No- no why would he?! He didn't!" Bakugo let his head fall down. Deku got up from his seat, he was leaning forward and Aizawa could see how the kid simply wanted to protect his childhood friend. "Ard you going to expell him...?"   "Shut it, Deku. I deserve to be expelled." Aizawa shook his head, "Expelling him isn't my choice." Deku looked a little relieved. "But he will have consequences." Deku looked at Bakugo, there was a face of slight fear, but more worry. "Why, why the hell are you protecting me." Aizawa sat there, it would be best not to intervene and to let the two talk it out, even if it meant short simple answers and remarks. But he would stay put, just in case. "..."  "Deku?"   Deku surged forward, Aizawa pulled at hjs capture scarf but stopped short when he noticed Deku was simply holding Bakugo. In a tight, close contact... hug. "Because you're my friend."  Aizawa relaxed back in to his seat. Watching as how Bakugo's arms slowly wrapped around Deku. Watching as how the two seemed to tighten the hug as much as possible. Aizawa didn't think he would ever see Bakugo so non-voilent and... calm ever. But here he was, being subject to watch Deku hugging Bakugo with all his strength, and Bakugo holding Deku with just as much strength.  He knee that these two had a lot to talk about, and to work through. This wasn't going to be solved by some hug. Or some talking. He knew he had to put Midoriya in some therapy, to help the kid with the suicidal thoughts and moments he keeps having. But for now. All he needed to do was keep these two on a careful path with their feelings and actions.   It humored his Dadzawa name.<<EOFANFIC>>

completion: They haven’t kissed yet.That’s mostly what Katsuki’s thinking about as he stares at Shouto’s unfairly pretty face instead of looking at the cup he’s bringing up to his mouth. It’s seven a.m. And Shouto is—well. Shouto. It’s always too early for him to be all ruffled and gracefully sleepy.Which—Is probably (most likely) why he ends up with a burned tongue. Why he yells, “Fuck,” and grips the counter too tightly. Because he took Shouto’s cup, and Shouto’s cup, since the stupid pretty boy has a temperature regulation quirk, is usually scalding. But at least it’s untouched. Not—not that Katsuki’s grossed out by it, or anything. Stupid to worry about it when swapping spit is basically all you can think about the second you’re alone. Counterproductive and ridiculous. But—God. It’s Deku’s goddamn fault that Katsuki even knows that the phrase indirect kiss exists in the first place. But he’s thinking about it now. Worries about it. Because he really, really, stupidly wants their first kiss to be extremely, unambiguously direct.And now—“Are you alright?”“I burned my fucking tongue on your stupid fancy pants tea, halfie.”“Oh,” Shouto says. Then, “But you seemed to like the tea. I’m sorry. Does it hurt?”It stings worse than that time three year old Katsuki tried to stick his tongue in the simmering pan of tomato sauce on the stove because the bubbling looked cool. So, yeah. It fucking hurts.“What do you think, princess?”Shouto flushes, scratching at the back of his neck. He likes that. Being treated all sweet without anyone making a big deal out of it. Being cherished. (Katsuki’s going to cherish him for the rest of his life, but he needs to lure him in with enough soba first. It’s a work in progress.)“I’m sorry,” Shouto says. Katsuki can practically see the cartoon light bulb light up above his head before he opens his mouth to speak again, to say, “Wait, I know how to fix it.”And then—Fucking hell, it’s way too damn early in the morning. Shouto’s pretty. Katsuki is gay. The sky is blue. And Shouto chose him. Wants him. Wants Katsuki when he could have everyone and has been slowly gaining awareness of the absolute veracity of this simple fact.Katsuki wants to kiss him, is the thing. Is staring at his mouth right now. Like an idiot. Like a pathetic, love-smitten fool. Shouto deserves that, though. Being loved and cared for until it’s too much for one human body to contain. Until it spills and Katsuki is more love for halfie than he is human.“Yeah?” Katsuki asks. “How? You gonna kiss me all better?”His palms are sweaty. It’s a lame joke. Really fucking lame. Katsuki shudders to even say think it, but it’s Pikachu-level lame.Shouto smiles a just a little before nodding, “Yeah,” he says. “Exactly.”And then he’s softly and gently cupping Katsuki’s face with delicate, long-fingered hands that smell like the blackberry hand cream that Katsuki knows for a fact Shouto only got because he thought the packaging was cute, exhaling a puff of cold air against Katsuki’s lips, easing the ache even as he sparks up an entirely different one.He’s close. Katsuki is in love. (None of this is news.)Shouto slots their mouths together like they’ve done this a thousand times before, and the chill immediately starts helping with the burn. But the heat grows, too. The visible red too high on Katsuki’s cheeks, and the friction generated by his heart pounding against his ribcage like it’s trying to crawl into Shouto’s palms because it knows just as well as Katsuki himself does that that’s where it belongs. No way is Katsuki half-assing this shit.Shouto is pretty, and Shouto is kissing him, and he must like Katsuki at least a little bit in that case, and the ice cold tip of his pink tongue is poking persistently against Katsuki’s tightly closed mouth (self-preservation) and Katsuki didn’t even realize he was getting hard, but he might actually come in his pants any second now. In public. Because Shouto wants to bring European inclinations into the concept of a first kiss. Katsuki doesn’t particularly like french fries or french toast, but he’s got a pretty good feeling that he’d enjoy french kissing as long as Shouto’s the one offering to help him test the hypothesis out. But—God, he can’t.He wants to, but he can’t.Shouto pulls back, arches a single eyebrow. “Was it bad?” he asks. “It didn’t help?”Katsuki, rather eloquently and with surprising physical resemblance to a literal tomato, hisses, “Fuck off, pretty boy.”And then he grabs Shouto by the collar and of his pajama top and shoves his tongue into Shouto’s mouth. Cold enough to immediately send shivers down Katsuki’s spine, to make him want to get his hands in Shouto’s silky hair and taste more of his toothpaste.“I think I like kissing,” Shouto says eventually when they pull back, and Katsuki’s mouth hurts considerably less and his dick considerably more.“I think I like you, princess,” Katsuki says, and kisses him again just because he can. Strokes his cheek. “Course we can,” he says. “My tongue still hurts. Take responsibility, pretty boy.”“I think I’d make good nurse.” Shouto giggles. Giggles. completion: It was a bright, sunny day at UA, and Shoto Todoroki was slumped against the rear wall of the 1-A dorms in the fetal position, arms crossed. The look on his face told people that if they dared to look at him in even a slightly wrong way, then he would unleash unholy vengeance upon them. However, even this didn’t deter a certain green girl with long, fluffy hair…“There you are, Todoroki! I was looking for you!”“Piss off…Midoriya.”Izuko “Deko” Midoriya frowned. “Todoroki, is something wrong?”“Did you not just hear me? I said ‘piss off’!”Deko pointed her hands palm-first at Todoroki. “Todoroki, I can understand if you’re angry and want to be left alone, but please don’t swear at me!”Todoroki got to his feet and thrust his index finger at Deko. “You know, you’ve got a lot of fucking nerve standing around here, telling me what to do! I should crush your skull right now!”Deko formed an angry look on her face and put her fists on her hips. “OK, I don’t appreciate you threatening me like that! If something’s bothering you that much, I’m willing to help you out with it, but I’d appreciate a little cooperation!”Todoroki clenched his fists. “I’m warning you, if you don’t leave me alone, I’m gonna have your brain for dinner!”This time, Deko formed a look of sadness on her face and clasped her hands together.“Todoroki, you’re one of my best friends! Please, don’t make me cry! All I wanna do is make you feel better! That’s not so much to ask for…is it?”Todoroki continued to give Deko the meanest, nastiest death glare he could manage. All he wanted to do right now was kick somebody’s ass, but the longer he looked at the green bean and saw her on the brink of tears, the less easily he was able to hold on to his anger. With a deep breath, he unclenched his fists and relaxed his stance.“All right…I’ll talk.”Deko loosened her stance as well. “OK, what’s up?”“It’s Bakugo. Earlier today, at sparring practice, I was beating him decisively when he got angry and started saying hurtful things to me.”Deko took a few steps towards Todoroki. “Do you remember what he said to you?”“He brought my father into the equation, telling me that if my father wasn’t such a famous hero, then I never would’ve gotten into this school.” Todoroki clenched his fists again. “God, what is wrong with that guy!? I swear, he has the worst attitude problem of anybody I’ve ever seen! And he’s supposed to be training to become a hero!”Deko got even closer to Todoroki. “I don’t like Kacchan’s attitude, either, but I’ve known him since we were kids, and deep down inside, he’s a good person. He just needs somebody to be there for him, you know?”“That being the case, then maybe you can tell him to get a goddamn clue!”Deko briefly stopped and backed away, making a gentle pushing motion towards Todoroki. “H-hey, it’s OK, Todoroki! It’s OK!”Todoroki took a deep breath and loosened his stance as he hung his head. “I-I’m sorry, Midoriya; I can’t help my anger right now.”Deko smiled as she continued to step towards Todoroki. “I know, it’s hard to let go of, isn’t it? But you don’t have to be alone and let your anger keep burning! I’m here for you, Todoroki!”“M-Midoriya…”Deko gave Todoroki a big hug, which caused him to gasp and blush. Despite not being used to beautiful girls hugging him, he returned the gesture. There he stood, without a sound, praying for the anger and pain to go away. He’d always found her to be extremely beautiful, but at first, he rejected her. Ever since this green bean had given him her words of encouragement during the Sports Festival, though, he wanted to get to know her better, and now that she was offering him her kindness and caring, his self-esteem rose like a hot air balloon, and anger and pain were replaced by joy and happiness. Deko’s soft, cuddly body helped, too.Despite being scared by Todoroki’s angry outbursts earlier, Deko felt no fear holding him in her arms now. As she felt his arms around her, she actually felt like he cared about her feelings as well, which grew the seed of happiness within her. Even before they’d become formally acquainted with each other, she could tell by his body language and his general loner nature that he was secretly crying out for somebody to love, but she was afraid of being awkward about trying to reach out to him. As time went by, however, she let go of the anxiety, and as she remained locked in this caring embrace with him, she too got her own measure of happiness, which gave her that extra drive to be a hero. She didn’t even let go of him until he did so, by which time they could’ve grown old with each other.Deko smiled. “Feeling better, Todoroki?”Todoroki nodded. “Yes. Granted, I still sort of hate Bakugo, but hugging you made everything hurt a lot less.”“I don’t expect you to completely forgive Kacchan overnight, but I’m glad that you at least calmed down enough to open up to me.”“I’m glad, too. I feel like I would’ve done something I would end up regretting. Actually, if you don’t mind, I owe you one for that…”Deko tilted her head. “Oh?”Without saying another word, Todoroki wrapped his arms around Deko and kissed her. Despite being surprised to the point where she felt like her heart was going to jump out of her ribcage, she didn’t push him away. Rather, she gladly wrapped her arms around him and let herself melt before his strong, manly touch. After experiencing his fury and having to do her best to comfort him, it was such a relief to receive such a loving gesture from him. Similarly, Todoroki eagerly held on to Deko, elated that she let him do this to her. After seething in his anger for so long, this was miles ahead for him. Feeling her soft, sensual lips against his, all he could think about was how thankful that she came into his life and how he wanted to share in this moment with her forever. He didn’t even care if anybody else saw them. She was his little green bean, and she meant the world to him. As much as she meant to him, however, he had to obey her wishes when she backed away from the kiss, huffing and puffing, red and tingly in the face, but nevertheless smiling.“T-Todoroki…h-how did you know I had a crush on you!?”Todoroki smiled. “I could ask the same of you, Midoriya.”Deko gasped, and then smiled. “Oh my…you have no idea how happy I am to hear that!”Todoroki smiled. “Speak for yourself, Midoriya.”“Please, call me Deko!”Todoroki stroked his chin. “An interesting nickname. Where did you get it from?”“Kacchan originally gave it to me as an insult, but Uraraka liked it and said I should keep it!”“Well, I guess Bakugo is good for something after all.”Deko giggled. “Come on, let’s go back inside; your zaru soba’s gonna get cold!”“As you wish…Deko.”Deko and Todoroki held hands as they headed back into the dorms, happy that the former’s simple act of kindness had a heroically profound effect.<<EOFANFIC>>

Chapter Text
The thing about adults is that they always feel the need to shelter children. It's always “you're too young for this” or “you’ll get it when you’re older”. There are so many people out there who think it’s better to speak in half-truths coated in sticky sugary packaging. Anything to keep a child's innocence, right? Anything to make you look good, right? The phrase “ignorance is bliss” comes to his mind, but it only makes him feel bitter inside. Never mind your child is slowly rotting from the inside out without even realizing it. Because surely there are people out there who have it worse. Right? Izuku can remember all the stories people told him growing up. “Look at that person” he would hear, “sleeping on the streets. Doesn't that make you feel grateful, child? That you have a roof over your head. A bed to sleep in, warm food to eat?” Like it’s not the bare minimum. Having these things doesn't mean you're living, only that you're surviving just a little easier. But the younger version of himself did not think like this. Because he was grateful, and still is. He knows he’s a disappointment, but his mother still kept him. She could have kicked him out long ago for all the shit he puts her through, but he knows she loves him. She loves him, he knows it. She must love him. She has to . . . Right? Even if there are moments where it doesn't feel like it, it doesn't matter. Even if there are times where she yells, he knows she doesn't mean it. Because the times she yells at him, when she backs him into a corner and gets in his face and starts screaming, he can smell the bitter tang of cheap beer on her breath. And whenever she gets like that, Izuku doesn't really know what to do other than stay silent until she’s finished. It works most of the time, and she eventually tires of him after getting no reaction. But sometimes it’s not enough for her. Sometimes she asks him questions and expects an answer that he cannot give. He is too deep deep deep in the depths of his own mind, to respond. Because that's the only way he could survive all this and not go insane, to not acknowledge the burning rage he can feel festering inside. Because he knows if he does, he will start drowning, and that is the last thing he wants to happen. But because he wasn't good enough to pay attention, this angers his mother even more. So much that she strikes him. She never hits him with a closed fist, so he doesnt think too much of it. It’s nothing like how some of the kids at school touch him, hurt him, burn him. She only ever slaps him across the face, so the term abuse never crossed his mind. Because abuse ment lingering marks. Bruises, cuts, something that draws blood. His mother never did that, definitely not something that lasted more than a few hours. Because she loved him, and could never do something like that, and he was just being silly. Now don't get him wrong, Izuku is a smart boy. He knows something isn't right here, he just doesn't know what. He's a very observant person, even if most people don't know it. So he watches, observes, and takes notes. He watches how people act around their family in public. How they refer to family around friends at school. Hell, he even analyzes the families he sees on TV. Even though he knows TV isn't a very accurate source, how it is portrayed in multimedia is a very important factor as well. So based on what he learns from this, he begins testing the waters. Begins experimenting with what he’s allowed to say and how he’s allowed to act, and whenever he gets a negative reaction, he adjusts accordingly. And this is how Izuku creates his mask. He begins acting like the person Izuku believes he's expected to be, and does it for so long that now he can't even tell the mask apart from his true self. It has been worn for so long that the edges have become frayed, corners chipped, and the fabric is stained a multicolored tie dye mess, that all blends together into this muddy almost black shade, and he can't tell if he was once a single one of those colors or a mixture of them all.

Katsuki stared around the dimly lit bar with irritation. He was tied to a chair, quirk canceling cuffs completely covering his hands so he could not easily escape. Burnt Chicken Nugget, or, when he was lazy, Crispy, had told Misty not to tie him down so tightly, which Katsuki was definitely not grateful for, but he was not upset about it either. The rope around his shoulders, keeping the upper half of his body tethered to the chair he was sitting in, could have easily rubbed his binder in an uncomfortable way if it was any tighter. Still not grateful.The only two other people with him were those two though, one cleaning glasses behind the actual bar, and the other in a nearby chair (that looked a lot more comfortable) just staring at him. In absolutely no way did that unnerve him.Maybe a little. He'll never admit it.“The fuck do you want?” he snapped, looking between them with narrowed eyes.“What is best for you,” Burnt Chicken Nugget told him, sounding suspiciously nice, at the same time Misty said, “To get you to join the League.”They looked at each other and Katsuki rolled his eyes. “No.” They could decide which of them he was responding to.“Master Shigaraki will not be pleased that you said no,” Misty told him. If floating mist could sound disappointed and uninterested at the same time, Katsuki decided this would be what it sounded like. He did not care.His gaze shifted to Crispy when he opened his mouth to speak, but Katsuki shut down immediately when the words, “I want you to be free,” left his lips."Free of what," he snapped, glaring at Burnt Chicken Nugget. "Free to what? Be a villain? No way, not happening! You all are constantly on the run from heroes, that's not free!"Crispy stared at him. He should be mad at Katsuki, but he seemed more… sad. Gross. If he wanted to be sad about his villainy, do it on his own time, not Katsuki's. He was here as a captive, not a therapist.The next words he heard should maybe have been expected, because of course Burnt Chicken Nugget stalked him, but it still blind sides him. "Free of your mother."If sheer force of will and thrashing could have released him from the ties binding him, the chair Katsuki would have been free. As it was he was still forced to remain seated in the uncomfortable chair. He seethed."The fuck do you know about my mother?""Enough," Crispy told him quietly. Katsuki felt his body go rigid, because that was too vague. It could mean too many things. And if this man knew enough about his mother, how much more could he know about him?Burnt Chicken Nugget looked at him with pity and all Katsuki wanted to do was retch. The fuck did he think he knew about Katsuki to believe he could pity him?Then he said it. "I know that she is destroying you from the inside out, what she says and does behind closed doors, what she calls you."Katsuki wanted to scream at him to shut his goddamn mouth, but it wasn't said out loud. Still, he seethed. The League of Villains knew?!Crispy's voice dropped, looking at him so he would be able to read his lips more than hear him. "I haven't told anyone."It was good that Katsuki was excellent at lip reading, because he was sure no sound passed between them when he spoke. Crispy pointed at his own ears, and Katsuki realized he had heard no words because none had been said, they were being mouthed. Burnt Chicken Nugget realized he was hard of hearing and was speaking only through lip movement, hoping Katsuki could read what he was saying so no one else overheard. He'd admit that was smart, if only because anyone realizing could be a weakness of his own he would not want getting out.Then Crispy was talking again, out loud. "I saw you and her at the store one day and got curious because she was smacking you around the store. You're not normally one to put up with bullshit like that so I followed you home." He left it there, not saying anything else out loud, but what he was implying was enough to set Katsuki off."Fucker! You just followed? And then what, watched?! I'm sure you enjoyed seeing a hero kid get the shit beat out of him, hmm?!"Burnt Chicken Nugget watched him passively, letting him scream. Once he stopped, the only thing that was said was, "I should have stopped her, you're right."If looks could kill Katsuki hoped the one he was leveling at Crispy would cremate him, just like his stupid name implied. The longer they stared at each other the longer Katsuki decided he would just keep staring, this asshole didn't deserve anything else. Crispy finally broke their standoff. "You have every right to be mad, but I'm here to free you now.""No, fuck no, I'll never be a villain," Katsuki spat."That's not what I'm asking you to do, kid."And now he was stuck, because what the hell did that mean?"Join me," Crispy offered."That's no different than joining the League!"Burnt Chicken Nugget shook his head. "I don't care if you join them.""That is exactly what Master Shigaraki wants the child to do, though, Dabi," Misty piped up from the bar, obviously having been listening in.Before Katsuki could even bristle at the word 'child' Crispy was speaking again. "I've told you all, time and again, I'm not here for the league. I'm here for me, and if that stops being useful I'll leave." Then he was looking at Katsuki again. "I'm just telling you that your options are open.""And I'm just supposed to believe a villain is going to treat me better than my own mother?" Katsuki knew he was being combative with no hope of defending himself if he set his captor off, but he would not just take this guy at his word. It was suspicious.Crispy made sure their eyes were level before he spoke again. "Do you honestly believe most of us become villains because we have no experience with abuse or neglect?"It could be possible, but just as much as people wanted to be heroes just to do good for the world, Katsuki assumed people could want to be evil too. He answered as much.The Fire Fucker sighed and leaned really close, which absolutely did not cause Katsuki to twitch backwards into the chair he was tied to, seeking to put space between them both. "Endeavor," was all he said. There was no stopping the twitch Katsuki made in response to the word. And it could be, if the extent if burns covering the extra's body was anything to go by."I already told you, I won't become a villain," Katsuki told him in response. No way, not when he was dead set on proving himself to his mother. He was going to become a hero, come hell or high water, and he would do it his way."I'm not asking you to." completion:
Sakura blossoms are in bloom, making the air fragrant and the vista from Izuku Midoriya’s apartment window look like something out of a tourism advertisement, as petals rained down on passers-by like snow. Spring was Izuku’s favourite time of year. It was rejuvenating, seeing the world go from the stark whites and gloomy greys of winter to bursts of colour everywhere. People seemed happier this time of year too. Less closed off and more willing to greet one another with a smile.
Then there was the fact this time of year reminded Izuku of when he first met his boyfriend. It had been his first day at U.A. high and the two of them started off on rocky footing but after several life-or-death battles fought side by side, Izuku’s former homeroom teacher Shota Aizawa slowly became something much more precious to him. When Eri entered the picture, she helped bond the two men and make the three of them a family.
But it wasn’t until after the wars, after they both suffered great loss, after Japan found a new way to function that didn’t blindly worship heroes, that the pair confessed their feelings and quietly began dating. Even now, not many people know about their relationship status. Aizawa was a deeply private man and Izuku’s life was a popular topic for the general public to discuss and speculate over. He had saved the country, after all. Only the remnants of class A knew, along with select close friends and family. 
Some of his friends had been a little weirded out or surprised about the revelation at first but eventually, all of them supported the couple, just happy that they’d found peace together after the hell they’d survived. Eri was easily the most thrilled about the match out of everyone. Sometimes, it seemed, more than the pair themselves! She had been using every trick she could think of to get Izuku to come over for dinners or spend the day out with them somewhere. It was adorably obvious, not that either of them minded.
Now, it was approaching their first official anniversary. Novelty eggs and plush bunnies could be found spilling out of the entryway to every Don Quijote in the nation. Eri was unusually excited for her first proper Easter with both Izuku and Shota, insisting they spend a day doing all the things she had researched online, together. Izuku didn’t mind letting Eri dictate what they did during the day of their anniversary, so long as he could enjoy a quiet evening alone with Shota afterwards.
He had graciously offered to go buy white eggs, vinegar and food dye on his way to their new townhouse while Eri roped Shota into helping her put various tacky decorations up around their living room. The young girl had them both wrapped around her little finger. By the time Izuku arrived at the Aizawa residence, the place was a pastel paradise, with kawaii baby chicks and bunnies plastered all over the walls. Shota took the grocery bag from Izuku’s hand with a quick kiss to the lips and replaced the bag with a woven basket.
“You’re just in time for the egg hunt!” Eri bounced her way over to Izuku excitedly, wearing adorable bunny ears on her head.
“Oh! Well, that worked out well, didn’t it?” Izuku smiled down at her beaming face, “Is it a race to see who finds the most?”
“Yeah! And there’s a special egg with an extra special prize inside!” Eri’s eyes sparkled with joy.
Shota had an odd expression on his face but it quickly morphed into his usual mask of tired apathy, shrugging at Izuku before waving for them to start the egg hunt. Eri took off with a shrill giggle, scrambling to get as many of the foil-wrapped chocolate eggs in her basket before Izuku got them. The green-haired hero allowed himself to get swept up in the innocent fun of the moment and may have used his quirk to manoeuvre around the room to reach the eggs that were hidden in spots clearly only meant for him to find.
There was a pink one resting on the metal bar of the curtain over the main window. There was a blue egg hidden inside an empty vase. There was a yellow one tucked away inside one of the house slippers on the floor. There was a chocolate bunny pretending to be a bookend on the shelf. And then there was a plastic green egg nestled in the arms of the custom made Eraser Head figurine Izuku had given Shota after graduating. This one wasn’t chocolate.

It has to be the special egg Eri mentioned before, with the prize inside. 

Izuku went to put it back so she could be the one to find it but a small, delicate hand stopped him.
“You found the special one! That means you have to open it and get the prize!” Eri smiled up at him and watched with avid interest as Izuku slowly cracked open the viridian egg.
His breath caught as a simple black ring with subtle emerald green engraving fell from the egg into Izuku’s palm. 
“Shota?” Izuku whispered his boyfriend's name, vision going blurry as he stared at the ring.
“We were thinking… it was about time you started living here with us, since you spend most of your free time here anyway," Shota stepped closer to Izuku, nearly close enough to reach out and touch but not quite, "But I’m selfish… I want more than that. I want all of you, Izuku. As my husband. As Eri’s dad. Everything.” 
“I-if we get married, people will find out about you. About us.” Izuku wanted to say yes immediately but he needed to know that Shota was really okay with all he was asking for.
“Good. Then they’ll stop inviting you to star on one of those obnoxious reality tv dating shows.” Shota quipped.
“This is really happening?” Izuku felt like he needed to pinch himself.
“It is.” Shota took another step forward and caressed Izuku’s cheek tenderly, “Marry me, Izuku.” 
“In a year… or Christmas Eve. Next month. Next week. Tomorrow. Today! Just say when, Shota!” Izuku answered tearily.
“Was that a yes?” Eri double-checked.
“Yes, that was a yes!” Izuku's joyous laugh was cut off by Shota kissing him passionately.
Eri squealed with delight and threw her arms around them both. The newly engaged couple broke their kiss and picked Eri up in their arms for a big family hug.
“Told ya there was a special prize in the egg!” Eri said proudly as she nuzzled into Izuku’s neck.
Izuku locked eyes with Shota as they continued to hug their adopted daughter, happy tears spilling down his cheeks.
“The best prize.”

So the best thing the police force could do was to create nicknames for the vigilante.Since the vigilante always didn’t attack first and usually ran into situations to get hit first, the new vigilante shall be nicknamed, “Provoked”.Provoked wore a black hoodie with a zipper with black pants. You could usually see dark green curls out of the hood, usually. The vigilante also wore a pure black mask that covered his mouth and nose, but his eyes were forest green, too. And he was quite short. The vigilante is suspected to either have a speed quirk or an intelligence quirk.After two whole years of Provoked escaping, an underground hero, Eraserhead, managed to arrest the vigilante. When Eraserhead arrived with Provoked, Provoked looked calm, accepting of his situation, and didn’t even have any scars. When one of the police officers asked how Eraserhead managed to capture Provoked, the underground hero just replied he went with me. An interrogation was almost immediately organized for the vigilante. They decided to do the interrogation in thirty minutes. Detective Naomasa Tsukauchi was organized as the integrator, as he was the head for the case. The police force was quite surprised when Nedzu, the principle of UA, requested to see the integration of the vigilante. The police force accepted it as soon as they saw the request.Three minutes before the investigation, Detective Tsukauchi took a deep breath as he gathered the materials on the Provoke’s case. The case only have Provoke’s hair, a vague unconfirmed bio of him, images of the vigilante fighting, and a very long list of activities the vigilante was in. Honestly, the detective wasn’t nervous about who he was integrating, but who was watching the integration.Detective Tsukauchi walked in, as he showed his ID to one of his co-workers that was guarding the integration door. As his co-worker nodded, the detective walked in.The vigilante had his hood down, which rarely was a case. Provoke’s curly hair was all forest green, but had a tint of black on the man’s bangs. The mask was also off of him, the guy had freckles. The vigilante was sitting quite calmly on the seat, while chained to the table with one his right hand, as the info about him states that he was right handed.The detective eyed the man as he sat down across from him.The vigilante gave a small smile at the detective, before the detective destroyed the awkward silence with a cough. “I’m Detective Tsukauchi, and I’m here to integrate you, Provoke.”The vigilante blinked a few times. “Okay…?” The vigilante sat up straighter as he smiled. “Ask away, Detective.”The Detective narrowed his eyes before asking his first question. “What’s your real name?”The vigilante smirked at the question. “Too bad I have a tad bit too many ‘real’ names. I mean, my name is Provoke, as the police force has named.”The detective sighed, this was going to be a long one. “What is your official documented name?”“The vigilante rolled his eyes before laughing. “You could have just asked that. My official documented name is Deku.”The detective gave a confused expression as his quirk didn’t sense any lies in that.  Did his parents really name their kid useless? “What?”“What? My teachers documented that name down on my file, so I dunno.” The vigilante shrugged.“What’s your official name on your birth certificate?” Todays going to be an annoying day, isn’t it?“Ohhh, that’s what you meant. My name is Izuku Midoriya, then.” The vigilante gave a bright smile, and held out his right hand, as if asking for a handshake. “Lovely to meet you, Detective Naomasa Tsukauchi.”Naomasa blinked. “I never told you my real name?”“Yeah, but a little research online would be all that’s needed to know your full name, detective, “ replied the vigilante, Izuku Midoriya, playfully, as he dropped the hand.Naomasa cleared his throat before asking another question. “What’s your age?”“Oh, fourteen, “ stated the boy carelessly.Naomasa stared at the boy in shock.The boy batted his hand. “What? Did you really think I was twenty-four through twenty-eight?”Naomasa narrowed his eyes when he heard the numbers. “You know what’s on your case file?”“Of course I do.” Midoriya brightly smiled.“Ah…” Naomasa didn’t exactly know how to react, but now he knows this vigilante was more dangerous than he thought.Midoriya then tapped on the table playfully. “You know, you can’t exactly arrest me for vigilantism, right?”As the detective looked more confused, Izuku smiled. “I’m quirkless. Vigilantism can’t be charged for a quirkless, as they only apply to people with quirks.”Naomasa gulped. “We still charge you with assault.”The teen gave a questioning look at the detective, before giving a very innocent, almost angelic, smile.  “Detective, it was self-defense though. I never attacked first.”“Thievery.”“What proof do you have that I stole anything?” The teen narrowed his eyes.“Your case file, “ stated the detective, determined.The vigilante shook his head. “Whatever do you mean, sir? I never stole it.”“You knew the information off of your file.”“I never stole the file to know the information.”“Fine, hacking.”“I didn’t hack for the information either, detective.” The vigilante gave another small smile, before clasping his hand together, very like how Nedzu usually did it.Naomasa narrowed his eyes. “Property damage?”The vigilante blinked at the accusation. “Urm, no. And charges for property damage are just a fine, not prison.”Naomasa was quite surprised that the vigilante didn’t lie at all, during the whole investigation.“Breaking into houses.”“Nope.” The green-haired teen shook his head.Naomasa was running out of crimes.The vigilante just bored smiled at the stressed detective.“Honestly, detective, do you have any real accusations that have proof, or are you going to let me go?” asked the green-haired vigilante with a smirk.Naomasa stared at the vigilante for a few moments before the door of the interrogation room was opened, and Nedzu walked in.The vigilante smiled and waved at Nedzu. “Hello, Nedzu-sama. Lovely to see you again!”The UA principal returned the smile, “Lovely to see you as well, Izuku-kun.”Naomasa glanced at both of them with confusion.“Were you worried I would get imprisoned?” asked the teen sweetly.“If you did, I'd be horribly afraid that you weren’t the person I knew you were, Izuku-kun, “ answered the white-furred animal.“Aw, you care about me, Nedzu-sama!” The teen took that comment as a compliment.“Of course, I would, Izu.” Nedzu smiled at the vigilante.Naomasa wondered if the Ua principal perhaps considered the vigilante as a friend, but shook his head, this couldn’t be possible, the animal never trusted any human.The teen then lifted up his sleeve and looked at his watch. “Eek! I really should go back before my mother yells at me for going out so late with an injury.”“Injury?” repeated Nedzu.The teen turned to Nedzu in shock, “Oh, urm, Kacchan kinda exploded my left shoulder, and dislocated it.”“Why did you come out with an injury, Izuku?” Nedzu rubbed his head with his paw.“Urm, civilians' lives are first?” Izuku tilted his head with a hopeful smile.“You’re an idiot, Izuku,” Nedzu blandly stated.Izuku snickered, “Thanks, Nedzu-sama.” Izuku turned to the detective and smiled, “And yes that’s partially why I didn’t fight Eraserhead.”“Wait, you got captured by Shota?” Nedzu’s eyes sparkled with mischievousness.“Yep.” Izuku popped the ‘p’.Nedzu gave a smirk that stated that he was going to torture the underground hero with something when he got back to UA.Naomasa blinked at the two, during a moment of silence. “Should I just let you go or?”Izuku rapidly nodded. “Oh, urm, please do. I really want to get home before my mother starts calling Nedzu-sensei, and yells at him because of it.” “Please don’t let her yell at me. Mothers are always scary when it comes to their children.” Nedzu gave a pleading look at Izuku.“Sensei?” repeated Naomasa.“Yes yes.” Izuku and Nedzu both nodded. Nedzu put a paw on Naomasa’s cheek. “He’s my secret student, afterall. Don’t tell anyone, dear detective.” Nedzu then took off his paw with a smirk that told you that if Naomasa did anything, he would be in deep trouble.“Okay okay.” Naomasa glanced between them. “You’re cleared of all charges for now.”“Good.” Izuku gave a feral smile. He then broke the chains by pulling on them.Naomasa stared at the teen in surprise. “You broke the chains that’s suppose to cuff people when strength quirks?”“These chains cancel their quirks. I don’t have a quirk, detective. It’s just my pure strength.” Izuku licked his lips.“Okay, both of you go.” The detective sighed. He opened the integration door and led them out.Izuku and Nedzu both smiled at each other with similar smirk, as they walked out of the integration room.A bunch of the detective’s co-workers all asked what happened. The detective’s only response was “I need a drink, and please don’t tell the underground heroes to try and capture Provoked.”When one of his co-workers asked Naomasa, why?He responded with a sigh. “Don’t try it. You can’t even accuse the kid of anything, and we wouldn’t want to provoke the UA principal’s personal student, now do we?”<<EOFANFIC>>

Chapter Text
A faint light showed in the dark atmosphere. The more he ran the farther the light got. He didn't want a repeat of the same thing, not again. The piercing pains and cries of civilians being crushed or torn apart, heroes yelling at each other to collect those still alive.
A faint cry in the back made his head turn. ‘No! Not again!’ he yelled, but his voice was unheard. A little girl, pale, with yellow eyes and a claw mark on her arm sat there, whimpering and crying. Her body was shaking in fear, her hair all dirty and matted.
A muscled hand reached out, the clawing nerve to grab her and take her to safety drove his instincts. Then it happened…...Eyes shot open as he sucked in a heavy breath. Eyes bugged out, as he looked around. ‘.... The same dream,’ he said in his head. Reaching down, he touched the bandage on his arm. Blood seeped from the white cotton bandage.He wanted to taste it, he wanted to feel the flesh on his arm sink into his teeth, the fresh smell of- “Endeba-san!~,” the door slammed open, as the blonde, short male with red wings walked in. His smile was bright as he saw Endeavor laying in the hospital bed. “I heard what happened…so you were caught up in that, huh?,” He asked, tipping his head. His smile faltered as he looked at Enji’s bandaged arm.The flesh was swollen, as red liquid seeped through the white bandage. Enji shrugged as he looked away. “...Keigo,” the blond male looked up at him, eyes filled with wonder. “D-did they catch them,” his head turned. Their eyes met, the sadness and confusion warped on Enji’s face.“...No…We couldn't find any trace of them, they disappeared like ashes in the wind,” Keigo’s face contoured into an angry one, as he clenched his fist.
The aggression of not finding who did this to Endeavor made Keigo want to punch their wolf-like face until they turned into mush. “I promise Enji, we will find them, and make them pay,” he said standing up and leaving the room.“....,” Enji sat there looking at his hands. They shook, the screams and pained cries of those played in his head. A tick of flames danced on his face as he clenched his fists tight. Tears welled up in his eyes.
He didn't want this, he wanted them to be gone, gone and never return. So, no one can face the pain he went through.His head shook as he clenched his hair. More blood seeped through his bandage as he hunched his back and screamed. A piercing pain went through his head. The pained cries and screams getting louder and louder.
“Endeavor, Endeavor! Snap out of it!” voices sounded, booms and screams of those who are innocent pleading and crying for help. The feeling of hands and someone yelling at him to stop rung in his ears, as he shook his head rapidly. “I-I can’t! It hurts!”, just then, a pain shot through his neck and the voices started going away. The echo in his mind telling him to give in and that's what he did.—-----
Shoto, Fuyumi, and Natsuo watched as their own father slumped back. His face was calm and sleepy as they watched him close his eyes and heart rate beep steadily. “This has been happening for a while now. He would just scream and scream until we had to sedate him. Last time he attacked a nurse! It was so bad that she had to be sent to trauma care,” Recovery Girl looked at the 3 siblings.
“C-can we bring him home?” Fuyumi asked, her voice cracking as she looked at her father.  Recovery Girl shook her head. “He's not stable enough to go with anyone. Not even for his own family,” She turned around, her small hands clasped against Fuyumi’s.“I promise he will make it; we just need to see how he will do.” Natsuo clenched his hands, as he looked away in hurt. Fuyumi stood there, pain striking her face as she slumped to the ground.
Shoto stayed silent. His emotions haywire. “What's going to happen to him. I mean. If he attacked a nurse, what else can he do?” Shoto looked at Recovery Girl, eyes hard as he wanted an answer.“There’s no prediction that I can say. The only thing I can say is…...just wait.”

completion:
When Izuku was a kid, all he ever wanted to be was a hero. Now 14 years later, Izuku still wonders when did his life change so drastically. Was it when he first meet All Might, when he got his first glimpse of what heroes are actually like. Or maybe it was long before that, when he was diagnosed quirkless. It could have been the millions of time, someone failed to save him for being beat up by the kids on the playground.
He doesn't know the exact date when his mind suddenly switched from become a hero to hate them. Maybe it was just bound to happen someday, and he never knew.
Maybe he really never would be a hero, just like they all said, what they all never let him forget. Maybe he'll die a sad life with no friends or parents, and maybe just maybe at the end of the day he'll smile a sad smile and jump.
Just like they all said.
Or maybe he'll rethink jumping and go back down those stairs and do something, anything to prove them all wrong. Prove the world wrong.
But maybe this time, when he's back on ground level, he'll find another way to do it.
Maybe he won't jump, and maybe this time he'll finally give up on his dream.
And just this time he'll prove them all right, and he won't become a hero.
But maybe afterward he'll make them regret it.

Izuku will make them regret everything, he'll make them regret pushing him and beating him. He'll make the regret and take back their words, but what's done is done.

And maybe, just maybe, once he's done punishing them for their mistakes, they'll feel just a bit, sorry.

But it's too later.

And now all of his emotions are gathering and about to explode. White-hot anger and rage will fill his lungs and drowned him. What he does today will solidify whose side he's on tomorrow.
And maybe today the world will look up at him and understand their mistakes.Or maybe not, it really doesn't matter it's too later anyway.
Izuku kicks into the girl's stomach as she swings her arms wildly towards his face, trying to deny her fate. She topples to the ground with an irritable thump, and he can hear her start to gagging for air, but Izuku just stumps on her chest. Blood splatters the sidewalk as she continues to squirm underneath his glaze. He gives her one last look before he kneels down and slit her throat.

Blood and dirt coats his fingers nail as he watches the blood spill out onto the cold cement. A wry smile forms on his lips as he turns down into familiar alleyways. After a minute or two he stops at the entrance of an old bar, the door is rusty and creaks when he opens it.
The bar is barely lightened but when Izuku turns the corner he is face to face with crimson red eyes that almost replicate his, and pale unkempt skin, that look raw with the many scars they scale the sides of the man's neck.
Light blue hair falls forwards onto the man's face as he begins to speak. "Did you really finish your assignments that quickly?"

"Yup!" He said as he sat himself down onto one of the stools. Shigaraki gave him an unimpressive look before continuing to sip on his drink. They both sat there in silence, content with just each other's presents.

Izuku was picking at his nails, trying to dig the dirt out from under them. The silence was calming, and Izuku felt at peace with the world, but it barely lasted a second before the static of from the television shattered it.

A slow monotone voice crept its way out of the speakers, and at the sound both him and Shigaraki paused before, quickly, spinning around. There was no man on the screen before them, only black and white dots that scattered in its reputable box. All there was of the man was his voice and what their two minds could conjure of him, nothing more and nothing less.

Izuku himself has never seen the man, but from what Shigaraki has described, this man was 'Sense' or better known as "All for One", the reincarnation of evil. 'The bogeyman' of the night, the greatest villain, or shall he say super villain of his time, and he still technically continues to be as the legends describe him, but really he's nothing more than a misty fairy tale.
No one has actually seen him for years, because technically All for One should be dead. Now Izuku not going to get into the logistics here, but to summarize it, this man should be missing all limps and both his lungs should have 28 minor punctures and 7 major. And that's not all this man should have, at least most of his ribs crack or broken at best.But for now, Izuku just going to keep it simple and say, that his man should be very dead. The only catch here is that he's not, and Izuku knows it make zero sense, but when he digged deeper into it, he found that the man's quirk could be the only possible reason.

🧡He was the Boss of an Agency. Hold on, lemme just reiterate that. He is your Boss and your assistant. When you first met, he expected you to Fangirl , but you didn't. He felt your extraordinary determination to work at this agency. Of course, this is one of the top agencies where you could get the best salary, so who wouldn't want to work here.🧡  On your First day, papers filled your table, the phone rang the whole room, and the email pings were everywhere. Hawks was testing you. Whether you are up for the job or not, it's a natural routine. I mean, last week, you were reeking of determination to have the job, and now, you must have the will power be a worthy person for the position.Beginning the day, you started your task filled with doubt and unsureness, mediocre at best, quirkless, and clumsy. He was ready to fire you at the end of the day. Lunch break came, and you were exhausted. "Welp, Im grabbing lunch; good work!" he said as he flew off the balcony, leaving you alone in his office.🧡  Lunch break, alone in the office, you sat down at your desk and pulled out your small, relatively simple bento box. Proceeding to eat it in silence while scrolling through your phone. "I can do this. I'm gonna make her proud and make my family happy". You said, motivating yourself while staring at a picture of  you and your daughter. The lunch break nears its end, and your ready to face the inevitable. Sure, you started off awkwardly. You were surprised that this agency accepted you despite the many more applicable fitting applicants. It reminded you of some schools where the entrance exams were easy as pie, but good luck getting out of the school with a diploma. This agency totally has that vibe.Hanks returns just in Time to start working again. To Hawks's disbelief, He thought you were a different person because of how well you manage things, full of confidence and professionality. That my folks just made him intrigue to you more.🧡  Days and months go by. You are the most severe person he met, so strict on schedules and meetings that he thoughts you are his Boss now. You were just doing your job. Right now, he is running late for an interview. You told him to meet you at the front of his agency. Furious, you took the elevator back up to his office. Upon reaching the door, you knocked. "Hawks, you are late for an interview " No reply. You knocked, no response again. That's it, you opened the door, and he is night there..... dancing? No more bopping his head and listening to music via headphones. Feeling the vibration from his wings, he immediately looked towards the door. Seeing you, he realized his mistake immediately removed his headphones, faintly letting out a familiar tune, "Your late for an interview was all you just said, he chuckled. "Got lost track of time, I guess," he awkwardly said.🧡The music he was listening to was your own song covers. When you discover that he listens to your cover, you internally panic. "You listen to that?" you asked. "Oh yeah, do you know her too? -"You cut him off by saying, "Her voice is too cringe" " Then let me hear you try." he said, smirking. Thankfully, He doesn't know it is you who runs that channel.🧡 Time has passed, and your relationship with him took a more friendly turn, although you are still strict towards him, especially on his schedule. Aww, c'mon dove, you know the traffic can't stop me. I can Fly us there!" he tried to convince you. "Are you serious? Have you forgotten that I am quirkless??" you reasoned, clearly angered that no matter how many reminders he still forgot this damn meeting. "Of course not, but I promise you I won't drop a beautiful person like you," and that's it... "I'm not taking the risk. I'll just take the service there, cya." sad hawks stood alone in his office, disappointed that his move didn't work on you. He sighed before taking off" Oh, dove, you don't have to be that tough to reject me' and took off.🧡  When he learned that you have a daughter. He was devastated. He thought his chance of courting you was over. "Your joking, right?" he asked, trying to hide his heartbreak. You laughed in return, "I'm not joking, hawks. I had her when I was 19. Say hi to him, sweety"  you said as your daughter went and introduced herself. "Hello, mister Hawks. My name is Yua; it's nice to meet you!!" "Show him your special skill, sweet pea." Hawks got intrigued when you told the child to show him something. "Will he not get mad?" she asked. "No darling, in fact, he would be happier" When you said that, she nodded and began to focus. Then 2 water-like wings sprouted From her back and amazement struck hawks face.🧡Ever since you introduced your daughter to Hawks, he wouldn't stop bugging you to bring her ever." DOVE!! Please get her here!" he begged. "Hawks, I will bring her here After her school," you said, trying to calm down, massaging your nose bridge. He seemed pleased with the reply, "And do your paperwork, please" you plead, and he agreed and played your cover songs on his office speakers. It became his work playlist, and you got used to hearing your voice, but to be honest it's kind of distracting.🧡  Finally, you could brought your daughter to the agency again. The Hawks can finally quit bugging you about it. "Alright, kid! excited for your flying lesson?" "Absolutely, mister hawks!" she said excitedly. "I hope I can fly like you though I don't know if water would help me to Fly," she said, dejected. "Be optimistic, kid anything can happen if you believe in it. Let's get to the balcony before your mom over there gets angry at me," he said, making the child giggle. He played his work songs and started the lesson. "Alright, kid, First things." "It is one of Mom's songs!" she said enthusiastically, 'What? He thought, confused."Okay, I'm ready for the lesson now, mister Hawks," she said, switching her Focus back to Hawks. An hour passed, and with much determination, your daughter was able to fly. Hawks felt like a proud dad, For real."Mom! I can fly!" "Now, my sweet pea Im so proud!"Hawks, Following behind, ready to tease you with a new found knowledge."and I Didn't know you could sing song bird." he started. "how come you never told me, that it was you I was listening to, hmm?" he said nearing close to you, from personal to intimate space. You blushing and a child giggling. Your gonna lecture your child later.🧡  A year has passed, the both of you got closer, and hawks heart Basically yearns for you. He is passionate about loving you now that he knows about your past relationships. A Jerk who promised the world to you and then left when he learned you were pregnant. He wished he was there for you, when you were dealing with pregnancy alone.To him you aren't just his assistant now, he sees you as someone he can rely on and, you also have warmed up to him too, trusting him with your problems. He loves what you both have, a good relationship, seeing each other as equals, and he wanted more, his instincts saying more.He is determined to earn your trust and your  heart "one day" he whispered, siting on his office desk alone staring at a selfie of him, you with your daughter smiling genuinely, and somewhere on his mind he imagined a family with you.

prompt: write a story about Haikyuu!!,  Mature Graphic Depictions Of Violence Major Character Death Gen 僕のヒーローアカデミア | Boku no Hero Academia | My Hero Academia (Anime & Manga) Midoriya Izuku Midoriya Inko Bakugou Katsuki Hatsume Mei Hadou Nejire Yagi Toshinori | All Might Sensei | All For One Shigaraki Tomura | Shimura Tenko Alternate Universe - Canon Divergence Quirkless Midoriya Izuku Powerful Midoriya Izuku Midoriya Izuku Has Issues
completion:
Chapter Text
Just a little Note before the chapter. In this fic I wanted to blend the world of My Hero Academia and Cultivation. If you don't know what that is, it'll be explained later in the story. You should know that Izuku is the only one I plan to have cultivate but quirks will still be capable of competing.Other than that, enjoy the chapter.....................Not all life Is created equally, a fact made more apparent in this superhuman society.Some, are inexplicably born stronger than others.An Ant could never defeat a Man, just as  Man could never defeat a God, the strong ruled over the weak.In this world of God's and Super-men, Izuku Midoriya is born an Ant, with no hope of ever becoming something extraordinary. Doomed was he to live the rest of his short life doing menial labor and looking back with regret in his heart as others live the dream he had craved so much.However, what if an Ant didn't have to remain an Ant?Watch as Izuku forces his way to the top and become something Truly Extraordinary.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~Izuku leapt spryly from one trash spire to another, his small frame and agile body perfect for navigating the City-like structure that was the Dumping Grounds of Japan. A fact he capitalized on often as most scavengers were grizzled adults with large bodies and even larger stomachs. The moment they tried leaping atop the towers of loosely packed garbage, they'd most definitely have wished they'd stayed along the lowest of levels, even if it meant losing hours navigating around all the twists and turn that made up the DGJ.Only Izuku, dirt poor and small enough to not mean much to the towers, was free to navigate the Dump as he pleased.In otherworldly, Izuku was the undisputed king of Dumpster Diving....Anyway, after performing the same strenuous motions back to back for what felt like hours, but was 30-minutes in all actuality, the boy made his way quickly through the rusted hellscape, undaunted by the the jagged centuries-old-metal. After another half hour navigating his way by, he couldn't stop the smile that plastered itself across his fatigued face as he spotted a faint glimmering in the distance. Quickly maneuvering himself through the heaps of garbage, Izuku made it over to his destination some 20 meters over in record time, barely panting from the effort it took, though he paused briefly to gently wipe away the few droplets of sweat the rising sun had managed to inflict on him.Approaching the target of his latest excursion, Izuku observed the material, 9 shimmering jade shards, with a careful eye before letting a satisfied smirk fall over his face."20... No looks closer to 30% purity. That's... 80 credits a shard, I think?" Quickly performing some math, his eyes widened in glee, his already beaming smile turning into a spotlight as a giggle threatened to burst its way out.His biggest find yet!This combined with his savings should be just enough for the item he wanted from the Support Shop.All these months slaving away in the junkyard were finally worth it!Snatching the shards with gusto, careful not to disturb the surrounding junk, he packed them In the small pouch attached to his side, before lurching forward suddenly, eager to turn in his findings and finally get some much needed support gear. Though he made himself a mental map of the location, thinking it could be useful later.Izuku managed to move his body onwards by a combination of adrenaline, skill and sheer effort as he began the arduous trek it was to the entrance, but he had spent years building up his endurance and he figured his aching legs could do with a little punishment if it meant exiting sooner.As he mock-flew along the twisting spires, his only thought was if this was what it felt to have a quirk, to have pure power coursing through your veins and making you untouchable, before shaking such thoughts away and doubling down on his speed.He had spent roughly 3 hours scouring the place and it was nearing noon, it would be in his best interest to leave before the rising sun transformed every scrap of metal into a scorching hellscape.After some period of time, he finally neared the exit.Quickly crossing the small border formed by the lackluster gate, Izuku made his way out of the dump, shaking off the disgusted looks others gave him as they took In his dirt stained clothing and foul odor, before heading in the direction of Hatsume Industries, allowing his mind to wonder as he did so.In the last 400 years since quirks first emerged, 98% of the population had come to be in possession of one, typically uniquely suited for the owner.With nearly every person possessing a superpower of their own, being born without one was among the cruelest fates one could suffer in this modern world, and unfortunately he was among the few to be labeled as such.To any aspiring superhero, being born with a disability would be a huge blow towards their ambition, but fortunately for him he was Izuku mother-fucking Midoriya.Hearing this news, where others would be crushed, Izuku had formed an unshakable resolve that day, he would NOT remain weak.His idol, All Might, the Hero of Heroes and Bringer of Peace wasn't weak.From that day on, he had put his all into closing the insurmountable distance between those with quirks, and himself.Unfortunately, he wasn't quite good enough, as the quirks of his peers grew and mutated, the distance began to widen and had never been so great...But!Now that he could finally afford the Grappling Gloves, he felt confident he could finally start making some real progress.While not the flashiest support item available to the public, nor the most powerful, he felt they would be the most useful for himself.Not only could they propel a small metallic disc from the palms that could be controlled mentally for a short time, it also had an insane magnetic force that can attract the user to the disks at short range.If he can get UA to sign off on his usage of the support equipment, he might actually stand a chance at passing the entrance exam if he could figure out how to combine it with his simple Akido Mastery.Maybe then he'd get to see Kacchan again.The boy was shaken from his train of thought suddenly, having arrived at his destination-The Sales counter of Hatsume Industries, or at least their branch in town, one of the best support companies and was among the few to sale to civians.The interior was mostly white, going for a minimalist appearance, with the barest hints of pink, gold and black which garishly coated the shelving and glass casings that contained some gadget samples."HI! how can I help you?" Chiped the energetic clerk, a cute purple-haired girl a few years older than himself greeted.returning the favor, he pulled the nine shards of jade from his pouch, placing them on the class counter."HI! I'm here to exchange these for an item. I'm hoping I can use some of them with existing credit." He managed out after a brief pause, hoping his lack of social awareness wasn't apparent.If she noticed, it didn't show. Instead, the bubbly girl smiled as she reached down and grabbed one of the lightly glowing shard, observing every detail before moving on to the next before finally all nine had been observed.Smiling to herself in apparent satisfaction, the girl finally spoke."Nice! All nine are nearly of 40% purity, that's almost mid-grade I think." Her smile turned suddenly into a frown, before locking her blue eyes on izuku, her voice lower one octave as she spoke"You didn't steal these did you." her eyes traveled down his grime-covered clothing and unkempt hair, lowering Izukus self-esteem for a few moments as he struggled to voice his objection, his voice teetering out as he shook his head in denial, his arms flailing in the universal message of 'No!No!No!No!Noo!'Fortunately, life began to give him a break as the girls accusing stare spontaneously morphed into a smile as her eyes closed and took on arches resembling a rainbow(A Quirk, maybe?)"Just Kidding!" She blurted out, the suddenness of her change leaving izuku with a still fiercely beating heart and a total confusion of the situation, the girl, at hand."Do you have an account ID?" She continued, back on track seemingly, but Izuku was mentally preparing himself just in case.He proceeded to tell her his info, which she typed In and pulled up his Information."Okay, so crazy fanboy ID aside, you've got a total of 2,221 credits. that's just about enough for anything on the civilian market, what was it you were wanting?""The Grappling gloves, ma'am." Though he said the words politely, Izuku could tell by the way she scrunched up her face he had made a mistake."Ew! Eww! Don't call me that!" she said, shaking her head vigorously."I'm not a grandma! call me Nejire. No, call me Nejire-chan! Yeah, that's better!" Shaking her head enthusiastically, she refused to get him anything till he complied, stuttering out the all too familial name. Mentally, he swore to start avoiding here when she worked, sure that if he didn't he'd die from a sudden stress induced heart attack.On the bright side, he left the shop soon after, his measurements taken in a matter of minutes, all that was left was to wait for his order to be delivered, and it would finally be time to join His Hero Academy.Izuku smiled, things were finally looking up.
<<EOFANFIC>>
