completion:
You are at home.
 
You do not like this home. 
 
It is warm in a way that burns like the Sun and you are Icarus, falling and flying from being burned. Your whole being feeling that warmth in your body and in your soul, and everything falling apart. But you wish you were Icarus, for he loved the Sun and was willing to be burnt for getting close.
 
You were burnt from the moment you were born.
 
( It is your destiny

, someone whispers. But you are sure it is not the Gods, or Fate, or even the Stars, for these entities could never have a voice that burns into your mind and soul. 

)
 
There is no moment in your life that has none of the scorching red. At one point in your life, you remember the calming white ice that soothed you when you were burned. The one with gentle hands that bandaged your arms and treated your wounds. But ice and burns have never gone well together, and one day it all falls apart. The white ice melts, and it burns your eyes. You find your mother screaming with a kettle over you but she’s blurry and it hurts, 

hurts, Mama, help me, save me, why did you pour that over me, stopstopstop-

 
You return to the world with your left eye bandaged, and your mother gone. It doesn’t stop your father from training you, burning you all over again. 
 
( 

And yet, that doesn't stop them from whispering anew, 

It is what you were born for

. 

)
 
( 

You hate the whispers

. )
  
You only fight with your right side.

 

It’s understandable, isn’t it? The left side is unsightly as it is the one that resembles your father the most. It is why you were abandoned by your mother, and why you are beaten by your father. It is the side of you that made you lose everything. You don’t use it and is called ungrateful, but you’d rather be the ungrateful child than be called the perfect mix, the perfect child.

 

( 

You figure out the voice is of the one who played a part in having you, the one who has hair red like fire and hands that embodies that red fire. The one that calls you masterpiece instead of son. With that much fuel in one person, who else could it have been all this time?

 )

 

Someone called Deku changes your mind in battle. 

 

He is the definition of green ( 

the soft grass, the calming forest, the shade your home will never be

 ) and so much like your father’s rival. Red and green compliment each other. But this shade of green is a contrast to the red in your mind. This fights that red, and you find yourself listening to them instead of the red screaming behind you. The passion they show is amazing, and for the first time in your life, you use your right side and the fire is all-consuming in its intensity.

 

( 

“It’s your power, isn’t it?!”

 )

 

It is the best fight of your life.

 

(

 For a whole day, the green is the only voice that occupies your mind. You find that you don’t mind, for it is better than the red. 

)

 
 
You find yourself being comforted by your teacher while you cry.

 

It’s funny, really. Your teacher isn’t one for coddling, he is harsh and demands the best, but it is never in the way your father is. And you, who is always silent, always stoic, isn’t one for crying. But in these circumstances, where you are bruised and bloodied and this hug is your first in what feels like a million years, you allow yourself to break through the persona people had made of you.

 

( 

“Aizawa-sensei, it’s okay. I accepted it long ago.”


 


“I do not care, Todoroki. It is wrong, and I need you to recognize that. Abuse is never right in any form, even with your father parading around as a hero, it is not right.”


 


“But, sensei… They need Endeavor. The hero society will fall with the loss of the new number one. And my sister, she wants to repair our family. With him. She’ll be happy. The world will be safe.”


 


“But what about you? When will you be happy? When will you be safe?”

 )

 

This is something your family would disapprove of. Mother would freeze. Touya would scream. Fuyumi would cry. Natsuo would glare. But for once, you feel like pushing that all away. Who has ever questioned your happiness? Your safety? Who has ever questioned the way your father treats you?

 

(

 No one’s ever told you that you need defending. That you need to be protected. Because, after all, you are the one who should be doing the protecting. Isn’t that your purpose?

 )

 

In this life, you believed help would never come. But it came in the form of one scruffy-looking teacher with tired yet kind eyes, and this is one you trust. You bow your head to your fantasy, and indulge yourself in the impossible. Because you want to feel how to fly in the clouds for once.

 

 

You’ve always known Icarus’s tale.

 

It’s simple, really. The favorite God of your mother, and the most hated of your brother. The story of creation, pride, and hubris. It is the first legend you hear, and the first you learn to read. It is the tale that defines your family.

 

But the thing is, Icarus’s story was always misunderstood. Redefined and altered to fit the world’s own meanings, to fit the reality into their own fiction. You find out that there are things that people need to remember ( that 

you

 need to remember ).

 

Icarus never burned because he loved the Sun. He burned because he loved to 

fly

.

 

And maybe that was all the difference you needed.

 

( 

“Freedom, Shoutan. It was freedom that made him love it so- that made him fly too close to the sun. Because he was free from the bars that contained him.” 


 


“Will I ever be like Icarus?” 


 


“You will never be like Icarus. Because I’d never let you fall like that. I’d catch you even if you were burning.” 


 


“Really, Yamada-sensei?”


 


“Really! I’d even shout it to the world for you, to seal my promise.”


 


“It’s okay. I believe you, sensei. After all, you’re still here with me.”

 )

 
 
This is your taste of freedom.

 

No more of the burning red hair, no more of the flaming red hands, no more of the pain, no more of the warmth that overflows and overwhelms ( the warmth that you want to stop- 

stop stop, father, it burns, i can’t take it, helpme-

). Your father is locked away, and you find yourself weak in the knees at the relief.

 

And finally, you understand why Icarus flew too close to the sun. 

 

It’s exhilarating, really. Icarus had a taste of something he’d never had before, and it was the one thing that helped him escape. His wings of wax and feathers was his liberation, and when he got a taste of the warmth of the sun, he wanted to reach that again. And it’s truly like your tale. Your friends that helped you escape, and that feeling of warmth that you wanted to reach once again. But instead of falling and crashing into the waters, you find yourself being caught by hands that are strong and tender. The same hands that extinguished the fire that burned you.

 

Something warm unfurls in your chest. This is that pleasant fire you’ve missed during your childhood ( not like the fire that had 

burned

- ). Surrounded by your family that held on, your classmates that supported you, your teachers that made a path for you, your friends that did everything for you, there is nothing to feel but warmth. You can’t help but think maybe this was the ending Icarus was chasing for.

 

( 

The whispers are gone by now. For once, a voice that sounds like yours echoes in your head

, This is your destiny. This is what you were born for. This fire is 
right
. 

And what else can you do but listen to it? 

)

 

( 

You like this voice.

 )





You are home.

prompt: write a story about Haikyuu!!,  Not Rated Creator Chose Not To Use Archive Warnings Gen 僕のヒーローアカデミア | Boku no Hero Academia | My Hero Academia (Anime & Manga) Aizawa Shouta | Eraserhead Banjou Daigorou | Lariat Midoriya Izuku Kan Sekijirou | Vlad King Shinsou Hitoshi Uraraka Ochako Every character other than Aizawa is mentioned i simply thought Banjo’s and Aizawa’s goggles looked the same so I wrote this oneshot bcuz why not :) Introspection Character Study i guess? Joint Training Arc (My Hero Academia) Featuring: my headcanons for what Banjo’s life was like
completion:
When he was younger, around his second year of being a full-fledged hero, Shouta Aizawa acquired his iconic capture scarf.It was only logical to have a long-range alternative for when his fists and quirk didn’t do the job: bones break, and although erasure is an incredibly versatile quirk, it doesn’t really do much on, say, a snake-mutation villain who can coat their entire body in fast-acting venom.
Even ten years later, Shouta shivers at the thought of meeting Aspik ever again.But back to the capture scarf.He had asked for something simple: he needed a weapon that could be long-range, preferably one he didn’t need to hold all the time. It needed to look discreet, yet be easy to access. The support company, using a metal alloy and assorted other things that he would have to ask Maijima about, created the scarf. Unfortunately, because not many other heroes had a quirk like it, much less the actual thing, it came with no guide or a manual. So, while not doing hero work, Shouta had to learn with only experience and whatever information he could scrounge up of heroes with similar quirks. For weeks on end, he pored over fighting techniques, studied grappling form, and inevitably, got himself tangled on every lamppost in Mustafu. Multiple times.Until one day, dry eyes even drier from lack of sleep staring blankly at his computer screen, Shouta found him.An old hero from the dawn of heroes, one with a quirk almost exactly like his capture scarf.
Lariat.
It was a video of one of Lariat’s fights: the man was fighting a Kaiju-sized villain, spinning and twisting his way through blasts of green energy as if he were born in the air. Then, he brought his quirk, some kind of…black tendrils(?) to grapple the villain, bringing himself close for a quick punch to the jaw. He began to fall, but shot out a whip to wrap around the villain’s wrist, and used the momentum to fly all the way to the villain’s other shoulder. From there, he began to wrap the villain up in his quirk, allowing the authorities that had arrived once he was finished with the wrapping to use sedatives on the villain.His control was perfect.His moves were perfect.Shouta remembered how he jolted, suddenly very, very awake. Then he jolted from a bad wave of head pain and resolved to go to sleep, even though he then spent a good hour tossing and turning, unable to get Lariat’s fight out of his mind.After enough sleep to make his head calm down from its furious pounding, Shouta knew he needed to study the man’s movements: how the quirk came out of his body, how he used his momentum to swing with it, how he wrapped villains up with it, everything.Well, that was the justification (that was both a justification and a genuine thing) Shouta told himself as he watched that video over and over in the wee hours of the night.However, while he was in the process of, and even after he mastered the damn capture scarf and began developing his own unique style, it didn’t stop at simple appreciation.Shouta began looking up interviews with Lariat, trivia around Lariat, information about his life down to the smallest details. Anything about the man he could find.

He bought shitty old posters off of shady websites.He redesigned his goggles to look as close to lariat’s as he could get them.Hell, he even cosplayed as Lariat when Hizashi and Nemuri (both also in cosplay) forced him into going to HeroCon that one year.Safe to say… he was a bit obsessive about it. 
…at least he wasn’t as obsessive as Midoriya was about All Might?

And hey, the trivia he found wasn’t half-bad either.Originally from Okinawa, Lariat moved to Tokyo in his late 30s for more prospects in heroism. Along the way, he suddenly gained a noticeable boost in power that was…never really explained. Even the old hero forums Shouta frequented threw their hands up trying to understand it outside of “he just practiced really hard.” and “other heroes had boosts like that dude, remember Skywalker?”(In all of the interviews Shouta could find post-boost, Lariat simply laughed off the question, made a joke, or acted like the reporter spoke in a foreign language to him.)(It…reminded him of All Might.)

(Uncomfortably so.)He was a hit in Tokyo, thanks to his style and personality, but never really broke the top ten, probably thanks in part to his penchant for property damage while trying to look flashy. (Hey, Shouta could have an irrational favorite, alright? Besides, Shouta liked how he handled his quirk, not the batshit insane stories that went around about the hero.)He had a few sidekicks, like Smokestack and a young Crimson Riot, but those were really the only ones Shouta could find a lot of info about.Unfortunately, at the age of 45, Lariat’s life would come to an end thanks to a freak earthquake caused by a villain fight.

And, from the photos Shouta’s research into the old hero found, what an earthquake it had been.But, why?Why think about all of this now, as his and Kan’s students are in danger thanks to Midoriya’s quirk going haywire?Because those inky black whips bursting from his student’s skin are uncomfortably familiar.It’s like meeting an old friend: the whips that dance across Midoriya’s body and sway in the air are that same inky black and teal from grainy videos of hero fights. The same whips from interviews, from news clippings. Those whips are as ingrained into Shouta’s memory as…well…Loud Cloud’s death.But, unlike the energetic yet guided whips of Lariat from almost 100 years ago, the whips of Midoriya are erratic and crazy. They dart and lash out at every living and non-living thing that so much as twitches in a certain radius of the hero student.

It’s then that Shouta’s personal pupil, Hitoshi Shinsou, manages to subdue the other, and with a flash of orange light and the activation of Uraraka’s quirk, Midoriya is floating down, safe and sound.Ignoring Kan’s blatantly biased reporting of the situation, and All Might’s warbling, Shouta takes the time that the final teams have left to think.

He had many, many questions about what just happened: Doesn’t Midoriya have a strength enhancement quirk? How did that whole debacle happen in the first place? What was the flash of orange about? Those and many others swirled through his mind.But one question had clawed its way to the top:
How the hell did Midoriya get Blackwhip?<<EOFANFIC>>

 Himiko didn’t quite get why the other kids didnt like her, she was a good girl, she always listened. Maybe not always, but she tried to, she never disobeyed on purpose. Himiko was a good girl.(Momma wouldnt look at her weird if she was good, that’s okay, she just has to do better for momma.) 

 Momma wanted Himiko to be normal. Normal kids have friends. Himiko didn’t have friends. 

 “Hi..um, do you wanna join me..?” Himiko glanced up to see a brown haired girl.(“They’re called brunettes you’re too old to not use proper terms,” Himiko remembered her mom telling her once, she felt embarrassed even if she only used the word in her head.) “It’s cool if not…but you seem lonely over here and idk…I like heros and thats what’d they’d do.” Oh, it’s a pity invite…of course she didn’t want Himiko around. Himiko probably looks weird again, just starring at the other girl. 

 Himiko glanced back at the ground, “no thanks.” She let out a quiet mumble. Momma always told her to not be too loud, she was, often, loud and bad.  

 The others girl face scrunched up in thought, it was kinda funny. “You sure? We’re playing kickball, my quirk gives me an unfair one up in things like basketball..heh!” It was Himiko’s turn to scrunch her face, the mention of quirks made her squirm.  

 She glanced up than back down. “No thanks.” She repeated. Only a little annoyed(also overjoyed, she shouldn’t get her hopes up,) that the brunette wouldn’t drop it. 

 The other girl’s eyes twinkled with determination. “I could leave the group and hang out with you if that’s what’s bothering you..if you want, of course!” She has the tendency to ramble, Himiko noted. Why won’t she stop trying? Why is she acting like she wants to be around toga?  

 Himiko’s heart seized, Dont give in, you’ll hurt her, poison her. “Don’t leave your friends for me..”  please please please stop before you get hurt!She grins, a pretty grin with normal teeth, a grin without Himiko’s ugly fangs. Why is she so persistent, why is a smile like that coming her way? “Oh no!! I completely forgot to give you my name, I’m Uraraka Ochako,” she paused for a movement, probably waiting for Himiko to introduce herself. “We could be friends!” Himiko’s eyes sparkled every so slightly and her chest bubbled with hope, before reality sank in.

 Himiko lifted her head and lifted the corners of her lips, trying to smile softly without showing her teeth. “You don’t want that.” She almost whispers to Ochako(it’s rude to use peoples first names, but it’s okay because it’s in her head.)
 Ochako’s face scrunched up again. “How could you know?” She uses the tone her Momma uses when Himiko’s being annoying and she stiffens, barely suppressing an ‘I’m sorry.” at the tip of her  tongue

 "Himi, you know I love you, but I cannot watch another crime documentary”"Please please please, just one more""Noooo, something else""Ocha-Chaaaan pleeeasseeee?"and who could say no to Himiko(Certainly not Ochako.) 

 °•°•♤♡◇•°•° 

Laughter filled Himiko's Room, a delightful change of pace from the usual dread and silence that filled the Toga House, she was sure to be punished later, but that was fine.

Once the laughter settled, they sat in silence. Himiko looked over at Ochako, she was beautiful, her best friend, Himiko was beyond lucky. Lucky to have Ocha in her life, she would die without her, certainly. Himiko's inlove with her but she'd never tell, afraid to ruin what they have.
Ochako is the only person in this world truly capable of loving Himiko, all of her, even the parts that are weird and unsavory. Ochako thinks her smile is cute, even with her fangs. Ochako thinks listening to her talk about true crime and human anatomy is interesting, or at least she lets her ramble. She's so grateful for Ochako.  
"I love you." She states, three simple words."I love you, too." Four simple words, three said back.It means the world to both girls.

°•°•♤♡◇•°•°

If only that is the case.  Touya Todoroki doesn’t give a shit about any of that. He finds the majority of the school intolerable anyway, and making friends has never been his forte. Besides, he has got his own reputation that keeps people at arm’s length—much to his parents’ disappointment, Touya is somewhat of a problem student at the school. Rebellious, violent behavior, unpredictable emotional outbursts, in addition to his laughable attendance record, he would have found the lack of disciplinary action enforced on him more to be more entertaining if he isn’t acutely aware of the reason behind it: the school has no intention of upsetting his very high-profile, wealthy father. So they tolerate Touya’s behavior, no matter how bad it gets.  Touya hates having this special treatment all because of his shitbag father; it only makes him want to rebel even more. But occasionally he does find pleasure in pissing off the principal, it’s what he gets for allowing this double standard to go on for so long.  He sticks out like a sore thumb among his classmates, which is completely fine by him. Frankly, he had no interest in getting to know anyone in his grade until the one day he had another argument with the teacher. Off the corner of his eye, he caught Keigo Takami watching him with sparkling amusement, the corners of his lips curled up in a smile he was trying so hard to conceal. The thing is, Keigo isn’t anything like Touya. He gets good grades and is adored by the teachers because of his respectful attitude. He is a stellar student by all accounts, but from what he could tell, Keigo Takami was finding his little outburst to be quite the show.  Touya turned his head and flashed Keigo a smile in return.  From that point onward, Touya finds his gaze to constantly land on the blond. Most people aren’t aware of this, but he is actually quite observant. He learns a lot about the blond, like how he is smart, like really smart. Answers to questions come to him naturally. Keigo probably can get first place in class rank if he wanted to, but he allows himself to fall comfortably in the fourth to fifth place range, probably to avoid drawing more attention to himself. His quirk aside, he is good at sports even without having to use his wings. He is humble and never takes credit for himself.  He also notices how even though he generally doesn’t seem to have an issue with anyone, Keigo also isn’t close to a single person in their class. While he isn’t exactly the least popular person in their grade (let’s be honest, that’s probably Touya), he doesn’t seem to have any friends and is usually one of the last students to find a partner anytime there is a group assignment. Which is absolutely bizarre to Touya.  “Alright class, now we are going to split into groups of two……” The blond’s expression barely changed, only briefly showing a hint of acceptance in his downcast eyes as he watches people quickly turning to their friends. He must be thinking about how he is going to once again have to convince someone to be his partner, being the leftover ones never feel good.  Everyone in this place is an idiot.  Touya thinks to himself as he walks straight towards Keigo, watching the surprise grow on his face as he gets closer. He plops himself on the seat right next to the blond.  “You wanna be my partner, little bird?”




 Turns out Touya and Keigo together is a beast not to be underestimated. Even since the first time they worked together, they quickly realized how well they mesh with one another. Touya’s grades might be somewhat of a tragedy, but it doesn’t reflect his intelligence. Most of the time, he just doesn’t care enough to put in the effort. But working with Keigo is fun, and sometimes they even get competitive amongst each other. Now without even having to think about it, Touya always picks Keigo as his partner.  It’s lunch time, and Touya heads towards the rooftop after buying two sandwiches at the cafeteria, knowing Keigo will already be there. That’s the blond’s favorite hideout spot, another thing he learned from his observations. As expected, Keigo is sitting on the edge of the roof with his back towards him, sun shining over his golden hair, his large red wings fluttering in the wind. Touya almost forgets what he is about to say. No matter how many times he sees him, he still can’t quite get used to just how stunning Keigo is.  “Knew you didn’t bring lunch again.” He mumbles, tossing one of the sandwiches he bought to the blond. Keigo turns around with a smile and catches it with one of his feathers.  “Thanks……You really don’t have to keep doing this, Touya, I just don’t get that hungry at school.” Another lie slips by easily that Touya doesn’t bother correcting. He always knows when Keigo isn’t telling the truth, plus this one isn’t particularly convincing, just by judging the way Keigo takes no time removing the packaging and taking  huge bites of the sandwich.  Touya doesn’t say anything, quietly taking a seat next to him and eating his lunch as well. They don’t always talk that much when they are in each other’s company, mainly because Keigo isn’t one to discuss his personal life. Despite all the time they spend together, he still feels like he knows practically nothing about him outside of school.  “You busy after school today?” Touya throws out a question, testing the waters tentatively. “I can use some help on that English paper.” “Sorry, can’t do today……” A rejection that he knows is coming. “I can help you tomorrow though, yeah?” “Yeah, tomorrow is fine, thanks.”





Keigo Takami has secrets. Plural. Touya has always known that there are things the blond is purposefully trying to hide from him, but he just didn’t think he would find out so soon. Realizing that he had left his phone charger in his locker, he grunts and turns back around to the school building. They just had a big exam that day so most of the students are more than excited to go home as quickly as possible. Touya is no exception; he is already looking forward to that nap he is about to take as soon as he lands on his bed. What stops him in his track is the sound of a familiar chuckle. From a distance, he can see Keigo leading another student, an upperclassman, towards the back alleyway of the school. He can’t exactly justify why, but he decides to follow. What he sees next positively spikes his blood pressure in a millisecond—long fingers twisting into Keigo’s gold locks, the older student is yanking him by the hair to expose his throat, which he is busy burying his mouth against. Keigo is pressed against the wall, leaning back willingly, eyes heavy lidded. “I am raising my price this time, if you want to get to third base with me……”  The upperclassman is about to answer when he notices the temperature around him went up a couple degrees higher. Almost a bit too…… hot. Abnormally hot. He turns back with a startled gasp, “T-Todoroki……” Now, remember how he has quite the reputation for being an unpredictable, violent maniac? It’s been a hot second since that side of him came out. Touya glares at the man as blue fire dances around him, the coldness of his eyes a stark contrast to his flames. Keigo’s expression goes from confusion to disbelief to a slight panic, but before he can say anything, the other student has already let go of his hand and backed off. “Hey, I didn’t know you two have……a thing, alright? And h-he is the one that offered.” He stammers defensively, “If you want him, then go ahead, half the school probably had a go at him already anywa—” He never gets to finish his sentence, because Touya’s hand is wrapped tightly around his throat. The student’s eyes widen in horror.  “You should know that you are lucky to still have your vocal chords.” Touya whispers darkly. “Now, get the fuck out if you don’t want some third degree burn.” He lets go of his hand, grimacing as he watches the upperclassman running off without looking back. He heaves a sigh and turns to the blond, who hasn’t said a word since he showed up unexpectedly.  Keigo stands against the wall with his arms across his chest, his expression closed off. The golden eyes that light up whenever he sees Touya are now distant and guarded. He can still see the mark the student left on his neck. Feeling a surge of possessiveness taking over, Touya grabs him by the wrist.  “Whatever he was going to pay you, I’ll double it.”  He regrets those words nearly instantly, because even he knows this is a real asshole-y thing to say. He expects Keigo to push back, perhaps even shout a few angry words at him for being such a douchebag. What he doesn’t expect is Keigo trailing his finger up his arm, the blank look on his face replaced by a seductive smile as he flutters his eyelashes.



“Sure, Touya, I’ll show you a good time.” 



 And no matter how much he tries, the moment he feels Keigo’s soft lips on his mouth, all inhibition he has remaining flies out the window.

completion: · Midoriya Izuku · Izuku wiped away at his cheek. A frown pulling on his face as he stared at the painting.It wasn't turning out the way he wanted. The shading was all wrong. He glanced up at the Prince sitting on the couch in front of him. "The fuck is that look for Deku." He scowled at the nickname, "Firstly, I've already told you not to call me that– I'm not a kid anymore. And it's just...I'm struggling." Katsuki rolled his eyes, standing up. "Take a break idiot. We've been here for 2 hours already." Izuku stood, throwing his paint brush onto the easel and storming out of the room. He turned to find comfort in cleaning around his room. Something he did quite often when he was angered.He was given the room in the palace during his stay. Izuku was being paid to paint a portrait of The Prince; Bakugo Katsuki. Since, in only 2 months from now he'd be King of Draconian. It was stupid, really; he couldn't get any of the colours right and he couldn't focus. At all.He grabbed at his hair, yanking on it. It was a horrible habit he picked up when he was younger. Tearing at his hair till his scalp was irritated and red.He couldn't help it. Izuku heaved a sigh, letting his hands fall. He decided running a bath would be something to help him relax. It had officially been 3 hours since he had taken a break. Katsuki hadn't come and fetched him to finish the painting, so he was reading. Simple. One of his favourites, Pride and Prejudice. It was an old book, but he had grown fond of it. Quite fond. Izuku closed the book and laid it gently into the table. Rubbing at his head to try and ease the headache. He couldn't focus, not even on a book. A measley little book gave him a headache. So much for fond. He tossed the book onto the side table, standing to stretch.Maybe a quick trip out to the garden would help. Perhaps it'd clear his mind. Even just for a bit. He cleared his throat, and pushed open his bedroom doors. Peeking out into the hallways, he made sure no one was there. Izuku grinned happily at his victory and made his way quickly down to the garden. He had left his green vest in his room. So his basic white button down and black slacks will have to do on keeping him warm. He truly regretted that statement as he sat on the bench. It was freezing, too cold outside for a mere button down. Izuku stared at the darkening sky. He didn't think he was cut out for this. The painting was turning out horribly and he hadn't even gotten that far in it. It was truly a dilemma he had gotten himself into. His body tensed. A heavy weight falling onto his shoulders— startling him out of his stupor. Clutching at the fabric, which he noticed was a red cape, the fluffy top seemingly familiar. He turned and looked over. Katsuki. He frowned, "Prince Bakugo..." "Deku." he answered, a smirk settled onto his face. He scoffed, "What do you want." Katsuki rounded the bench settling next to Izuku and throwing an arm over the back— behind Izuku's neck."Just here to sit. With you." "Speaking of which," he didn't give Izuku the time to respond,"What /are/ you doing here?" "Finding inner peace." he snarkily replied. "You have permission to be here, Deku?" "I didn't think I'd need it." he shrugged halfheartedly. Katsuki grunted. Not really giving a verbal answer. He leaned over Izuku. Staring him down with a heated look and an evident frown. "You need something to take your mind off it, Izuku?" He shuddered at that, "What do you mean, Kacchan?" He snorted at the childish name, "Whatever you'd want it to mean." Izuku tugged on his bottom lip, toying with it thoughtfully. He couldn't be implying what he thought Katsuki was, right? He was just taking it the wrong way. Right?Right. Katsuki leaned in further. Izuku saw the look in his eyes. "Oh." Katsuki smirked."/Oh/." he mocked. "What do you mean 'oh' Izuku? You crack the code yet?" He shook his head. It was quick and made his hair bounce with the movement; catching Katsuki's eye. "No– I don't think I know what you mean. Prince Bakugo." he uttered, bowing his head to turn away. Katsuki leaned back, frowning at his words. "I really want to marry you. Take you as my bride. I mean come on, who wouldn't? Look at you, basically your own piece of art work. If I had the time I'd stare at you all day. s'The only reason I even stayed for that shitty painting— because I could watch you and get away with it." he shrugged halfheartedly, being as blunt as ever. The rumors really didn't lie. Katsuki's changed since childhood. Izuku gaped— "What do you mean? As your bride? Do you even hear what you're saying, Prince?"Katsuki nodded, "Course I do. The only question is– Would you let me?"Katsuki's eyes said it all. Red eyes, full of love, possible lust, and longing. Searching between his own, /begging/ for Izuku to say yes. The way his eyebrows furrowed upward, the way his eyes swirled with that questioning look. It made Izuku blush. Bakugo Katsuki was begging. For him. And only him. He blurted out his answer without thinking, "Yes." Katsuki chuckled and leaned his head back. "Thought so." Awkward silence, well: awkward to Izuku, fell upon them. He found himself huddling the cape closer to hide his face. It smelled, really, really good. "Stop sniffing my cloak you creep."He stiffened, "I am not! It's just really cold. Out here." He laughed, "Sure, Deku, sure." Izuku went about his temper tantrum, "I wasn't! Why were you even watching me anyways?" "Why wouldn't I?" Silence fell again. "I...don't know." "Cause you're my bride, idiot." "That's not a very nice word, Kacchan." "I don't give a fuck." More silence. "Come on." Katsuki stood, holding out his arm for Izuku.Who followed him in standing, wrapping his arm around his, linking them together.He leaned against him, clutching Katsuki closer to battle the cold. The cloak fluttered behind him. Izuku tried using his other arm to bunch it so it didn't drag, gods forbid it gets dirty. Katsuki pushed his door open, waving the servants away. "You can finish that dumb painting later, for now, I just want you near me. Got it?" he puffed, pulling Izuku towards the bed. "Yeah..Yeah I got it.." Katsuki nodded briefly and sat down, scooting towards his side and stared at Izuku expectantly. Izuku averted his eyes and, more hesitantly, moved to sit on the bed. He fiddled with the bed covers. The bed was so soft.It was huge, compared to both him /and/ Katsuki. The end of the bed inches away from where Katsuki's legs layed. Snapping out of his trance and rested his kick and moved towards Katsuki. Who in return layed back and tugged Izuku down with him. Sighing in content they both fell asleep. Izuku would worry about that portrait later. Now, he could truly match those colours like he needed to. Izuku definitely praised himself for going out to the garden.<<EOFANFIC>>

completion: 1:Izuku was always a lover. He always has been and always will be. He loved his mom and All Might he loved the trees and the grass and the birds that twittered on the tree outside his window every morning. He loved his friends and he loved analysis, he loved Katsudon and he loved the stream by the park he went to with Kacchan. There was no doubt about it. Izuku loved, and when he loved he loved hard and deep and fast. So it was no surprise to Inko that one day, walking home from preschool, before any of the kids in his class got their quirks, Izuku proclaimed that he had a crush on Kacchan. Inko just laughed, giving her son's head a soft pat and telling him that he should let him know. He never ended up telling Kacchan as by the time he'd worked up the nerve he found out he was quirkless and was being bullied by Kacchan. He lost those feelings quickly, even though it made him sad when the feelings turned sour he was glad to be rid of them. 2:Four years later he entered second grade. There was a new girl who had a weak quirk that started being bullied right along with him a few weeks into the year. She protected him quite a few times, and he did the same for her. They built a sweet friendship as the year went on and soon, Izuku began seeing her through heart-shaped eyes. When he began liking her he fell hard. He told her during the third quarter of the school year that he had those feelings. She liked him back and they began the second grade equivalent of dating. They held hands in the playground, shared snacks at lunch and always chose to work together for group projects. This lasted until the end of the school year when they found out she would be moving away during the summer. They sat together at the park after the last day of school, hugging and sobbing. Izuku loved her, he wished she could stay. But she couldn't, her parents being absolutely pissed when they found out about her being hurt and ridiculed at school and so they decided to move somewhere else. Izuku got her new address and they wrote letters back and forth for months, until the pretty girl who he'd dated and who protected him slowed in her letters. Instead of sending two per week it became two per month and one every other month and then they stopped all together. Izuku was heartbroken. He cried for months after she stopped sending letters. The only person he'd been able to count on outside of his mother had forgotten him. 3:In fourth grade he began liking a soft looking boy from another school that he had become friends with online. He had baby blue hair and sweet eyes and Izuku thought he was incredibly pretty. He was so nice to Izuku, he called him nice nicknames and he was angry at the world with Izuku. Six months after Izuku met the boy he told him that he liked him and the boy liked him back. But then his father found out about them and made the boy stop talking to Izuku because he thought it was disgusting that he was "tainting his son". The man's words broke Izuku. He was already gross because of his lack of quirk, already bad because of how he hyper fixated on things, already annoying because of his rambling, and now there was even more wrong with him because he liked boys? His mom comforted him when he came to her about it but he didn't get over that feeling until the end of middleschooll. 4:In sixth grade Izuku liked another boy he'd met online. They started talking on a quirk analysis webpage and became fast friends as the boy had an almost non-existent quirk and was being bullied the same way Izuku was. He shared the same fondness for learning and the same obsession with All Might as Izuku. Izuku began falling for the boy immediately. It was an amazing feeling. But he was scared. Scared that he was wrong for liking the boy, scared that the boy would get in trouble if his parents found out, scared that the boy he'd become so fond of would start hating him for his feelings. So he pushed them down until he moved on. And it hurt, god how it hurt. He fell asleep crying on many nights. Eventually he stopped liking the boy but not without many days spent hating himself for his feelings. The two continued being friends until mid way into seventh grade when the boy got all of his social media taken away because of bad grades. Izuku was heartbroken, both about his feelings for the boy but also because of losing the only true friend he'd had in so long. 5:When Izuku started getting crushes on random celebrities between seventh and eighth grade, (boys, girls, you name them he's probably had a crush on them.) he decided to research if it was normal for him to like boys. He found a whole community of people like him, people who loved the same gender, people who loved both like him, people who weren't interested in romantic love at all, people who were born one gender that didn't fit them so they transitioned to another, people who didn't feel like either gender, he met every kind of person under the sun and he began realizing what his first boyfriend's father said to him wasn't true. Izuku wasn't wrong, he wasn't gross. The only one who was gross and wrong was that man. And slowly, he began becoming comfortable loving that part of himself again. He was happy, so, so happy that there were other people like him. And then he met Delilah, they were quirkless just like him, they loved all genders, just like him, they even shared his love for analysis. He really liked Delilah, they were in the year above him and they seemed so much wiser than he was. While he'd only discovered his people that year Delilah had been interacting with the queer community since they were ten. They were so kind and Izuku fell fast and hard for Delilah. The only problem was that Delilah had a long time girlfriend who they were very happy with. So Izuku never told Delilah even though it hurt. He would never want to come between Delilah and their girlfriend, they were so sweet together and it was clear that they loved each other immensely. So he backed up a little until he stopped liking Delilah and by that time he found himself liking a beautiful boy at U.A. called Todoroki Shouto. +1: When Izuku walked into class 1A for the first time his eyes were immediately drawn to a pretty boy with red and white hair and a scar lining his heterochromatic eyes. He was gorgeous and gave off such an air of intelligence. Izuku wanted to be friends with him immediately. Blushing, he took his seat. When Shouto pulled him aside during the sports festival to spill his life story and declare war on Izuku, he wanted Shouto's friendship even more. He was quiet and socially awkward. He didn't understand social cues and he seemed anxious when people talked to him just like Izuku. Izuku knew he wanted to help. Shouto was truly incredible. AND HE WAS SO PROUD OF HIM!!! After Rahat Shouto started talking to Izuku more, choosing to work with him for group projects rather than by himself and trying to partner with him for sparring a majority of the time. Izuku was ecstatic. They liked a lot of the same foods, and they liked the same movies and video games. They had the same sense of humor and were both queer.They both were filled with anxiety all the time but when they were together they found that they weren't so anxious and they were actually able to let loose and have fun without the constant nervousness. They soon discovered, during a sleepover, that the nightmares they shared went away when they were together. And that, in the summer between first and second year was when Izuku realized he was absolutely, positively, undoubtedly in love with Todoroki Shouto, his best friend in the entire world. He jumped into Shouto's arms and kissed his cheek. "I love you too Shouto. I was just about to say the same thing." Izuku laughed wetly. Shouto smiled wide. "Can I kiss you Shouto?" "Please," Came a soft whisper. And so he did. ~Time skip brought to you by Aizawa Shouta singing Poor Unfortunate Souls~ Two years later they stood at the altar, getting married in front of all of their friends but the audience didn't matter at all to them as all either of them could pay attention to was the other. When they were told to seal the vow with a kiss they did. It was almost just like their first, not as messy and hesitant, but there was so much love, so much passion and commitment to one another there in that kiss. And they knew they'd love each other forever. ~Time skip brought to you by Izuku tripping over Shouto's feet the first time the dance together a week before prom~ Four years later Izuku and Shouto had two small children running around in their 5 bedroom house and a third on the way. Delilah, their surrogate, staying in the guest room with their wife so they could make sure they were taken care of. The house was full of love and joy. "I love you Izuku." "And I you, Shochan." Loving one another and their lives. <<EOFANFIC>>

completion:
It’s sometime in the evening when you wake up, the sunset’s light streaming through the curtains and tinting the room a soft orange. A serene silence surrounds you, lingering even with the birds chirping and cars driving by outside.

A yawn escapes you, tears welling in your eyes. As you lift a hand to rub them, you hear the crinkle of paper. You blink the sleepy haze away, tilting your head down to see your opened notebook resting on top of your pillow. The pages are wrinkled beyond belief and your notes are partially faded in some areas.

Your cheek is definitely marked with ink, your once neatly written equations no doubt smeared across your skin.

You had been studying for exams earlier. You don’t remember falling asleep, nor do you recall feeling tired. You 

did

 zone out a few hours into the afternoon, but you never thought it would lead you to napping for a good chunk of the day.

Working on your bed hadn’t been the smartest of ideas, however you can’t complain since you feel well rested. Even now as you lie on your side, the softness of the mattress calls back for you. You feel your body sinking into the sheets, yearning for you to succumb to sleep once more. Another yawn decides to come out, and you’re quick to make up your mind.

As you shift to place your notebook on the nightstand, you pause upon feeling something long and firm around your waist. It’s only then you register the sudden warmth against your back and faint puffs of air tickling your neck.

After gingerly setting your notebook down, you peer over your shoulder. To your surprise, Shinsou lies behind you on his side. One of his arms is curled beneath his head, cushioning it instead of the second pillow beside yours. His other arm is draped over you, loosely hanging but heavy enough to keep you in place.

You look past his closed eyes and steady breathing, finding his own opened notebook resting on top of the sheets not too far behind him.

With extreme care, you maneuver your body until you’re lying on your other side and facing him. His arm doesn’t move much, only slipping further down to your hip. You don’t complain, focusing on his face instead. You take in the lax expression he wears as he snores softly.

It’s rare to have Shinsou this close to you, at least willingly from his end. In the many years you’ve known him, you understood that he wasn’t a touchy person like yourself. When you gave hugs and high fives and linked arms, he hadn’t reciprocated much beyond a smile.

And you had always been fine with that, never once pushing him to be more affectionate towards you or in general. You told him that early on in your friendship, even mentioning that you would tone down your actions in case they made him uncomfortable.

Shinsou, however, encouraged you to remain the way you were. Although he was thankful that you respected his lack of response and offered to change, he didn’t necessarily want you to stop being yourself. He confessed that he didn’t have many friends, and if you were a friend who often expressed yourself through close physical contact, he would accept you as is.

You ran free ever since then, happily cheering him on with light bumps to his shoulder and ruffling his hair when you both were in teasing moods. True to his word, Shinsou had taken every gesture you gave with stride.

It’s new and unexpected to have him here in your bed, huddled close and embracing you first for a change, but you’re happy he came out of his own volition. Maybe this is his way of showing you he’s changing, or open to the idea of it, however you won’t comment about it until he does first. Despite how over the moon you are at this development, you will cling to your self control and stay patient.

Your excitement aside, this one in a billion sight is also very relieving to you.

You knew of Shinsou’s dream to become a hero. You learned of his drive, to prove that his quirk can be used for justice and not for the awful villainy people often subjected it to. Although you didn’t attend U.A. with him, you eventually heard of the rigorous training he was assigned by a teacher he looked up to. Your heart sang for him when he told you that someone saw potential in him, and you knew it had been the same for Shinsou at that very moment, just by how hopeful he looked.

However, the promise of getting to where he wanted to be came with steadily increasing sacrifices as time went on. He understandably spent more time at school after classes, wanting to get every minute of training under his belt to prepare for the following days.

Your phone would chime around the same time in the afternoon, receiving his texts of regret that he wouldn’t be able to make the walk back home with you. You hadn’t allowed him to be guilty, spamming him plenty of cheers and stickers before assuring him it wasn’t a problem. It truly hadn’t been an issue, not when he was making progress in achieving his dream.

What 

had been 

an issue was knowing how little Shinsou slept as the months went by.

On the rare days you two were able to meet up, you would see and hear just how worn down he was. The dark circles under his eyes had worsened significantly and his shoulders gained a slouch that lingered even when he stood up straight. You’d catch him trying to suppress yawns as you two talked, biting back your worry each time he apologized after letting a couple slip.

You knew Shinsou had been working long and hard as of late, but you often wished that he would get more chances to rest properly. Like now, with him sound asleep in his nap. It’s not the full cycle that he needs, but you know that for him, especially with the effort he’s putting into all of this, any sleep is good sleep.

Reaching out, you lightly press your thumb on the curve of his cheek. Shinsou doesn’t twitch from the touch, his breaths continuing rhythmically as you gently brush beneath his right eye. It’s the first time in a long time you’re seeing him so at ease. He looks a tad bit younger without his signature frown, his wild strands of hair splaying over his arm only adding to the image.

It reminds you of when you were both back in middle school, when you had all the time to sleep without a care in the world. Now that you’re much older with responsibilities, and Shinsou with his goal so close within his reach, you know that you just have to keep moving forward.

You blink, watching Shinsou’s face slightly scrunch up. A crease forms in the skin between his eyebrows, his lips gradually thinning into a disgruntled line. Without much thought, you lean in close and press a featherlight kiss on the angry ridge. Once you pull away, you witness the instant effect. Then tension fades as if it hadn’t appeared at all, and Shinsou looks peaceful once more.

Shifting closer, you tuck your arms between your chests and carefully rest your head beneath his chin. You’ll soak up his affection for as long as you can, not knowing when next you’ll be able to experience it.

The steady beating of his heart is enough to lull you back to sleep. Before you can drift away into the throes of slumber, you hope that Shinsou knows you’re proud of him for making it this far. You also hope that he’s proud of his own strength, because there’s no other person in the world that he’s working so hard for other than himself.

As you finally doze off, the world fading away, you absently feel the tightening of the arm wrapped around you.
<<EOFANFIC>>

completion:
Chapter Text
Izuku walked down the street with his head hanging low. Kacchan had decided it was gonna be one of those days he shows Izuku ‘his place’ with his group of ‘friends.’ At this point Izuku was slowly getting fed up with it.  It first started when he they were four and Izuku had been misdiagnosed as quirkless. Keyword: Misdiagnosed. About two years later after that it was revealed he did have a quirk after all, simply a passive one. Mental Block, a simple Mutant quirk that protected him from any sort of manipulation quirks or quirks that would force him to do things against his will by simply reflecting it back. An overall simple quirk they only discovered after Izuku had been caught up in a widespread attack involving a villain that had some sort of brainwashing quirk. Izuku figured since he wasn’t quirkless anymore Kacchan would want to be friends again but that simply wasn’t the case. If anything Kacchan picked up his antics even more, putting all his effort into letting Izuku know his quirk was useless for Heroics and he shouldn’t even bother. It was infuriating.  So Izuku could only wonder what deity he had pissed off for today to be such a horrible day the moment he saw a giant bee-like thing flying right at him. 💛 Kuin Hachisuka was in lack of better terms, out of fucks to give. She was desperate for a host, a strong one. For the past month she had been jumping from random host to random host and each time that blasted police force had managed to track her down. She was out of options and nearly out of time. She didn’t have time to waste picking strong bodies. So she didn’t question the pull she felt from her quirk when she spotted such a pathetic looking green haired boy. This was her last resort? The kid looked like a simple breeze would blow him over.  But her quirk was pulling her to him for some reason so she didn’t question it any longer, she just went straight for the eye. Once she was finally implanted, a more human form manifested in the boy's mindscape. She prepared the process for the parasitic take over when suddenly a green chain shot out from nowhere and wrapped around her wrist. What? Soon another wrapped around her other wrist. No. Two more chains shot out and quickly wrapped around her legs. No No No No. She felt herself get dragged to the back of the mindscape where suddenly a large green gate slammed down to keep her there. NO NO NO  NO!      The fucking brat had some sort of mental defense! She couldn’t feel her quirk! She couldn’t infect the body! She was stuck and the brat got to reap all the benefits! Kuin struggled against her chains as she tried to crawl towards the gate only to be violently pulled back. She felt herself getting more sluggish every second.  She wanted out. She needed out, this couldn’t be how this ended, why would her quirk tell her to infect a host they could not control, why… Her struggles soon came to an end as she curled up against herself, as everything faded to black. Kuin Hachisuka, The Queen Bee had fallen dormant. 💛 Izuku was in unbearable pain. Whatever type of bee that was had flew right into his eye and somehow managed to trigger his quirk to headache inducing levels. The only thing he heard before everything faded to black was the sound of cars pulling up and police sirens. 💛 Izuku’s eye shot open as he sat up straight. Immediately upon looking around two things became clear. One, he was in the hospital, that one wasn’t very surprising.  Two, was the fact that only a single eye had opened. Before he could panic about his missing eye his room door opened, revealing his mom and two detectives. “MY BABY!” His mom shouted as she nearly tackled him off the bed. He started to reassure her he was fine when the detective drew their attention to him with a cough. “Sorry to interrupt, but I’m Detective Tsukauchi and this is.” He said pointing to his partner that appeared to have a cat mutation. “My partner, Officer Tamakawa and we were wondering if it would be alright to ask you a few questions.” Izuku tilted his head to the side confusingly, what would they need to question him about? “Um sure i guess?”  Naomasa nodded and pulled out a pen and notebook. “Starting simple, can you please tell us your name?”  “Izuku Midoriya, detective.” Alright now for the real questions. “Alright this question may seem odd but please bear with me. Is your name Kuin Hachisuka?” Izuku was even more confused than before. “No?, I just told you my name…?” The Detective simply nodded and wrote something down. “Trust me it all makes sense in a second. Do you know who Kuin Hachisuka is?” Midoriya simply responded ‘no’ so he moved on. “Are you currently Queen Bee?” That got Izuku to pause. Queen bee? As in the Villain Queen Bee? The same Queen Bee who had recently attacked Naruhata? “WHAT?!” Izuku couldn’t keep his shock contained, they were asking him if he was a  villain . “Of course not! I would never be a villain, I always wanted to be a hero, I would never resort  to villainy! As the kid started to spiral into a mumble storm his mother quickly pulled him out of it allowing Naomasa to continue. “My apologies but we needed to know if she had taken control of you or if your quirk prevented it. Izuku could only stare at the detective confusingly as he tried to process what he was just told. Taken over? What did they mean by that and what did his quirk have to do with anything about. “What do you mean Detective?” His mom asked, beating him to the punch. The detective sighed as if he was mentally preparing himself. “To keep it short, Kuin Hachisuka is a parasitic bee with a quirk. You may know her as Queen Bee.” Izuku’s single eye widened as he ran his hand over his face, finally realizing he was wearing an eyepatch. “In order to survive she takes over her host's mind and controls them against their will” The Detective continued, looking right at him. “Thankfully that isn't the case here due to your quirk.” No, he couldn’t be implying what Izuku thought he was. “Congratulations kid, you have full control as the new host of Queen Bee.”
<<EOFANFIC>>

completion:
Nemuri woke up to a delicious smell wafting up to her from the kitchen. She opened her eyes, sat up, and breathed deeply. 

"Pancakes," she breathed out. Then her face broke into a wide smile.

"Pancakes!" She repeated, more audibly and with a lot more excitement.

Nemuri practically ripped off her pink covers (Sleeping Beauty themed), and ran downstairs to get the pancakes.

"Shouldn't you get dressed?" Her dad asked, placing bacon on the stove.

"But… pancakes!" Nemuri complained.

"They'll still be here when you get back." He said, moving away from the stove to gently steer her in the direction of her room.

Nemuri ran back upstairs with record speed. She undressed quickly, leaving her bee themed pyjamas discarded on the carpet. She stopped hurrying when she reached her closet. 

Nemuri was the cutest girl in class. Her dad told her constantly, so it had to be true. However, if there was a day when Nemuri didn't look cute, Takeyama might take her place. Nemuri stared into her closet for a long moment, before finally making her selection.

Then when she was dressed, she ran downstairs, leaving her short purple hair unbrushed.

When Nemuri returned, her big brother Kaito was sitting at the table, spinning the chair back and forth.

"Hey," Kaito greeted, not looking up from his phone.

"G'morning, Kaito," she responded, going to sit next to her brother.

"Are we making pancakes with shapes?" Nemuri asked, her eyes shining.

"Not today, Pumpkin." Her dad said, giving them each a plate with pancakes, fruit, bacon, and an egg.

Nemuri pouted, before realizing her pancake had been made into a happy face. That cheered her up greatly.

"Thanks, dad." Kaito said, finally setting down his phone.

"You're welcome. Did you kids remember to wash your hands?" Dad said, walking back to the sink to wash his own.

"No," Nemuri grumbled. She walked to the bathroom to wash her hands anyways.

When she returned, they were finally able to eat the delicious pancakes.

Kaito dumped syrup all over his, before their dad poured a little over Nemuri's pancakes.

"Why can't I pour my own syrup?" Nemuri complained.

"Because Kaito is bigger," her dad answered, moving on to his own.

"But Kaito does so much! I would do less," Nemuri whined.

"Just wait a few more years, Pumpkin. Kaito, you're drowning your pancakes," Her father told them. Nemuri stuck out her tongue at Kaito, who pretended not to notice.

"My pancakes can't drown," Kaito argued. 

"If that's true then WHY ARE THEY DROWNING?" Nemuri asked.

"Nemuri!" Their dad said sharply.

"Sorry," she mumbled.

"The first day of school is coming up, are you excited?" Her dad asked. 

"Lucky," Kaito grumbled. He was a bigger kid, so his school started a lot earlier. 

"No," Nemuri grumbled.

"Why not?" Kaito asked.

"You've been looking forward to kindergarten for ages!" Her dad said.

"What if I'm not in the same class as Aizawa? What if he decides I'm not a good enough friend anymore and leaves me! I might get stuck in the same class as Takeyama, with no friends!" Nemuri said, her eyes widening.

"Aizawa isn't just gonna abandon you. You've been his friend for too long for that." Nemuri's dad said.

"Besides, if Takeyama gives you any trouble I'll deal with her." Kaito promised.

"If you're that worried about it, how about you go play with Aizawa today?" Her dad suggested.

"Okay," Nemuri sniffed.

And so after lunch her dad helped her brush her hair, and she put on her shoes to go outside to Shouta's house. He lived in the house right next to hers, with a door painted purple. When she knocked, it was Aizawa's aunt who answered the door.

Aizawa's aunt was a tall woman with sharp features. She kept her hair in a tight bun behind her head, and frequently wore long shimmering dresses.

Nemuri crossed her arms over her chest.

"Are you here for Shouta?" Aizawa's aunt asked upon seeing Nemuri.

prompt: write a story about Haikyuu!!,  General Audiences Major Character Death Gen 僕のヒーローアカデミア | Boku no Hero Academia | My Hero Academia (Anime & Manga) Midoriya Izuku & Sensei | All For One Midoriya Izuku Sensei | All For One Sensei | All For One is Midoriya Hisashi Sensei | All For One is Midoriya Izuku's Parent Midoriya Izuku Has All for One Quirk
completion: When Garaki-sensei comes into his room that night, Izuku had been unaware of all that had happened that night. There’d been nothing to cue him into what he was about to lose until that moment. As far as he knew, it’d been a completely ordinary night.He knows that what his father does isn’t exactly right, but he’s never considered his dad a bad person. He’d always seen it as the other way around. His dad helped him with homework and showed him incredible things. He’d raised Izuku to the best of his ability and at eight years old, Izuku feels like he couldn’t have had a better childhood.For all that his dad had gone through as a kid, it only made sense that he is trying to reshape society into something better – a place for them to be happy together. Izuku has always thought that if people just stopped trying to fight his dad, they might understand that he has good intentions. Some people don’t deserve the power they’re given, so why shouldn’t his dad take it from them?His dad taught him that lesson when Izuku was four and getting bullied by someone who didn’t understand how they should have been using their power. Back then, Izuku had thought it cruel to take that boy’s power from him. He has since learned that with that ego and attitude, he simply would have gone on to hurt many others as both an enforcer and a victim of their warped society.“Izuku,” Garaki-sensei’s voice pulls him out of his book. Izuku looks up at the doctor and an uneasy feeling comes over him. There is something off about the way the doctor is standing and looking at Izuku. He looks somewhere in between a panic and a grievance.“Is something wrong?” Izuku asks, naïve in a way that had been cultivated by a childhood protected from harm had brought him. Any threats to his happiness had always been dealt with efficiently. This will be the first time something severely hurts him.“Your father,” Garaki-sensei starts, “he’s dying and asked to see you,” the doctor says, the pause in his speech the only sign that he was trying to prevent the inevitable hurt that would be dealt Izuku’s way. The doctor was never one to soften his words.At that, the young boy jumped out of his bed and begs to know, “Where is he?”“Operation Room 4,” Garaki-sensei gets out and then Izuku takes off in a desperate manner.Izuku thinks most would argue that the compound wasn’t the best place for him to grow up in. It is a rather drab place. Plus, considering how isolated it was from most of society, he didn’t have easy access to friends or any socialization really.That isn’t even mentioning the experiments and haunting noises that echoed throughout the concrete structure.Yet, for all these points, Izuku has a counter argument. He was free to decorate his space how he wants, and his accomplishments are littered around the structure. He doesn’t need friends when he has his older brother Tomura around. And he owns a great pair of noise cancelling headphones.His dad did the best he could considering their special set of circumstances. Izuku believes that more than anything else in the world.So, imagining that his father would die soon feels impossible. His dad had always been there for him. They hadn’t always been the perfect father and son duo like in the movies. Izuku didn’t have enough fingers to count how many times they’d had arguments. But his dad remained his main support in the world and had helped him grow and learn every day.Each step he takes towards his dad is charged with a strength Izuku didn’t know he possessed. He doesn’t know what will happen when he arrives, just that his journey is taking much too long. Part of him wants it to never end. If he just keeps running forever towards Operation Room 4, surely that would mean his dad couldn’t die.Because there was no way his dad is going out without saying goodbye to Izuku.Yet, this is not one of Izuku’s daydreams and his dad isn’t Schrodinger’s Cat – neither of them can exist in a manner of non-existence. If Garaki said his dad will die then he will, regardless of whether or not Izuku makes it there in time.Outside of the room is Tomura. He’s standing with his shoulders tense and his brow furrowed. His expression doesn’t ease when he catches a glimpse of Izuku.Izuku doesn’t stop before going in the room nor does Tomura attempt to slow him down. In that moment, time feels like infinity wrapped up in a few puny seconds. Every breath feels like a roaring wave and the flap of a hummingbird’s wing. There was no time for comfort before the confrontation of the truth. Both of them understand that more than anything else.Operation Room 4 is only minutely colder than the rest of the compound. Even still, a shiver goes down the center of Izuku’s back.On the bed, the majority of his dad’s face has been wrapped up in bandages and there’s a blanket pulled over his body. A gentle whirring floods the room, it’s the sound of the machines keeping his dad alive and breathing. Even still, it won’t be enough. Garaki-sensei said that his dad was dying. That there is truly nothing that could be done.His dad had always said that Garaki was the smartest man he’d ever met.And yet, Izuku still wants to hope. He walks over and grabs his dad’s hand. There is already a smile on his dad’s face, no doubt he had sensed Izuku coming before Izuku had even stepped through the door. A warmth surges through their hands and Izuku recognizes it as the passing of quirks.He and his dad share nearly the same quirk, apart from some technicalities. Sharing quirks, talking about them, and analyzing them, has always been one of the ways they bond. But now, Izuku can feel something different. His dad is unloading quirks onto him like they were somehow killing him faster. Izuku attempts to send them back, a feeble grasp at trying to resist the truth of the matter. But his dad has been made faster with years of practice and a death grip on Izuku’s hand.Izuku’s returning of quirks is cut off by his dad’s stern voice when he says, “Izuku,” his voice is cracked and hoarse, like he’d been screaming all night, “There was so much more I wanted to do with you. But now, this is all I have to offer. I need you to take these.”“I don’t want these quirks, I just want you here, Dad,” Izuku begs, “This can’t be the end. We could find healing quirks or something, anything. Dad, please, there has to be a way.”“You’re a smart boy, Izuku. As long as you have my quirk, I will live on in you. It’s enough that I know you are protected. You don’t need me, Tomura will be here and you can still make use of Garaki, I’m sure,” his dad says with a small chuckle that quickly turns into a coughing fit. Izuku clutches his dad’s hand as the rest of the quirks flow into him.He doesn’t feel any different for having them. All that has changed is the hurt deep within his chest.“It won’t be the same, dad,” he protests.His dad’s hand fumbles its way upwards, its movement is hindered by the loss of his quirks and lack of eyesight. Once it lands on Izuku’s cheek, it shakes for a few seconds before coming to a gentle pause, finding stability. Izuku leans into the touch.“You’re going to be okay,” his dad says. Izuku shakes his head in his dad’s hand, “You will,” he says as forcefully as he can, “You are much stronger than most and brighter than your age should allow,” his dad quirks a smile though it looks more like a grimace, “Though the world has never understood us, we have always persevered. I know that will live on once I’m gone.”Izuku chokes out a sob and raises his hand to hold his dad’s against his cheek, “I’m going to miss you, more than anything.”“Just remember, I’ll always be with you.” His breathing halts for a second and he releases a row of coughs. Izuku puts his hand back down on the bed but refuses to let go.“Is there anything I can do?”“Just, sit with me, for a bit,” his dad asks. Izuku pulls the chair behind him close to the bed and listens to the beeping of the monitors.In the end, he sits there for hours – well after his dad passed away – simply holding his hand and trying to be as strong as his dad had thought he was.<<EOFANFIC>>

completion:
Chapter Text

The roof was tall. 

Izuku could see everything happening below. There was a lot of traffic, people… oh look, Izuku knows those kids. 

Everything could be seen from a rooftop, because it was so high. 
 
But… when you're high above the ground, no one can see you from the bottom. 
 
Izuku was smart. Izuku was agile. Izuku was this, Izuku was that, but Izuku was also quirkless. 

Izuku, in essence, was like a rooftop. He had all these skills, all these talents, any of which could aid him to be a hero… yet, everyone was always on the first floor. 

Ground level. 

They never saw what he saw, because all they could see was his quirklessness. His weakness. 

They could never look up and see everything Izuku had to offer, because they were forever looking at his quirk status. 

All they ever cared about was his quirk status. 

They don’t care about 

him

. They don’t care about what he could possibly do, because if you’re quirkless, it’s simply 

common knowledge 

that you can’t do anything. Why pay mind to weakling when you have all these other fantastic, physically built, perfect-hero-imagine kids right beside him? 
 
And so, if Izuku is incapable of doing anything… Then why is he here?
 
Izuku had no one. 

No one to believe in him. No one to encourage him. No one to hold out a hand and say, “here, let me help you reach your goal.” 

Because he was quirkless. 

A worthless, useless, Deku. 

A worthless, useless, waste of space that should’ve never been born. 
 
Which is why Izuku is even on this roof in the first place. 

He’s contemplating. Thinking. And isn’t it a shame it’s even a thought in his head? 
 
If Izuku jumped… would anyone care? 
 
It’s a real question, because right now, it seemed that Izuku was more of a liability than anything. 

His mother worked herself to the bone just to give Izuku everything he needed, and Izuku would most likely never repay her for that. How would he? A quirkless person like him can’t even get a 

job

 in this society. He would never be able to pay his own bills, never be able to buy his own food or clothes. He’d probably live with his mother forever, and Izuku would hate to do that to her. 

So… should he just prevent all this from happening and jump? 
 
It was a pretty long way down. 

Long enough for Izuku to regret his decision.

If he jumped, then suddenly came up with a reason why he shouldn’t, he’d just be ruining someone's day all over again. Whoever found his body- which right now would be a lot of people- would likely be traumatized. Does Izuku really want to do that to them? Some of those civilians are innocent people. They didn’t do anything to Izuku, so why should Izuku do anything to them? 

But then again… killing himself would take a weight off a

 lot

 of peoples shoulders. 

His teachers, his peers, his family. After getting over the grief that Izuku isn’t even sure will come, their lives will most likely change for the better when he’s gone. Right? 
 
Killing himself might be the one thing worth doing that Izuku ever does… 
 
And… That’s a good thing… right? 
 
Izuku feels himself creep closer and closer to the edge. 
 
 He feels himself begin to wonder the little things like, “would it hurt?” or, “how long will it take?” He wonders if he should tell his mom, leave behind a note saying why he’s doing this. Those are all… ideas, he supposes, but right now, Izuku almost feels a 

pull

 towards the edge. A pull that whispers in his ear, “you know you want to, Izuku.” 
 
And he does want to. 
 
He wants to so badly. 
 
So, with tears flowing freely down his cheeks, Izuku turns his back to the ledge, closes his eyes and falls. 
 
Finally free.  
 
~oOo~
 
Katsuki liked the library.

It was quiet; free from those annoying underlings that latched onto him. 

Katsuki could do whatever he wanted without having to worry about the prying eyes of his peers. Those little shits were really annoying. 

But, you know who was the most annoying? 

Deku. 

Just the thought of him alone set a pot filled with anger stewing in his gut. 

Deku, or Midoriya Izuku, was a quirkless nobody. 

He would never amount to more than Katsuki- never in a million years. 

So, then, why is he smarter than him? 

Why is he faster than him?

Why is he a better person than him? 
 
Deku was better than Katsuki. He was. There was no other way to put it. Other than his quirk, or lack thereof, Izuku was better than Katsuki. 

He got better grades, tried harder in his studies- tried harder in 

everything

, now that Katsuki thought about it. 

What right did that worthless loser have to try harder than him? It’s not like he could ever make anything of it. It was stupid. Stupid because Deku had no right to be better than Katsuki when, in the eyes of everyone including himself, Katsuki should obviously be better than him. 

Katsuki should be the best. 

Katsuki 

is 

the best! 
 
So then… Why is Deku better than him? 
 
That’s not how the world works. 

Katsuki is the best. Was always the best and will always 

be

 the best. 
 
But, perhaps this afternoon was a bit over the line. 


No

, Katsuki told himself sternly, shaking his head to clear those silly thoughts. 

Deku’s just a worthless waste of space. He doesn’t deserve to be here. 

 
From the window beside him, Katsuki notices a strange shadow cast over the book before him. 
 

What the-

 Katsuki thinks, turning to his side. 
 
And wow, what terrible timing. 
 
The body of Izuku Midoriya fell on the other side of the glass, a smile on his lips and tears in his eyes. 
 
Katsuki doesn’t stop to think. 

He’s in motion before he realizes it. 

Rushing for the exit, not even caring to grab his backpack, his mind is only thick, thick fog. 

There’s no way that was real, right?
 

RIGHT?!




<<EOFANFIC>>
