She dusted her hands off as she monitored the flames, "Your name," she heard the hedgehog say and looked over her shoulder, "What is it,""Aria," she said and looked back at the fire."Aria..." he repeated."But everyone calls me Ari, it may only be a letter shorter but it saves a syllable," she explained, "And what about you?" he blinked, "What's your name?"He narrowed his eyes, "My name is Shadow. Shadow the Hedgehog,""So you really are a hedgehog?""Why do you seem so stunned by that?""Because hedgehogs here are small and fit into the palm of your hand," Ari explained, "not to mention they don't speak, let alone wear clothing. Where are you from?" he crossed his arms, I get it. He wants to keep wherever he calls home safe, "Okay, I understand. The best way to keep your home safe is to not talk about it...but..." Ari thought back about all the legends of places, all the warnings she's picked up over the years of areas to avoid when one came to mind, "It wouldn't happen to be a place called South Island, would it?" Shadow's head snapped to face her, "Looks like I'm right,""How do you know about it," he demanded, getting defensive."It's not just me, everyone knows about it," he flinched and bared his teeth, "Relax, most people believe it's a legend and that it's cursed. Not many believe it's real,""And you're one of the few who believe?""There is always some truth in legends," Ari replied as she sat down by the fire, "Never in a million lifetimes would I have believed I'd meet someone from there though,""Suppose that makes you think your lucky, huh?""I wouldn't say that. I've got a Jupiter party up my ass cause I stole their prey, but considering they haven't found us and they seem to be getting further away, I'd say you aren't their only target," He narrowed his red eyes, "So, Shadow, are you alone out here?"The hedgehog glared at her harshly, but she didn't move. She was unflinching in the wake of his gaze, and he noticed this, "No. I am not," he admitted, "There are others,""How many," Ari narrowed her eyes."Two more,""Both hedgehogs like you?" he nodded."One is blue, the other is light gray,""And how did you get here?""We were hunted, obviously," he growled, "captured on our island and sent here. We were defending our home from another human, and he came with metal machines and took over our home. The others and I tried to stop him, but we were defeated and rendered unconscious. When I came to, I was held prisoner,""Did the others escape as well?" Ari asked."Blue hedgehog did, but we went separate ways to avoid being captured again," Blue hedgehog? He says that as if it's a nickname or something... Ari shook her head, "Do you think they're around here?""I would assume so, where we were held isn't too far from here and he's not the type to leave someone behind," he sighed, "Why does this matter to you?""Because that means this 'blue hedgehog' might be in danger too. I noticed you have speed and some enhanced strength, even what appears to be magic but it's unlike anything I've experienced before. Does he have abilities like you?""He's faster...and has a quick mouth," he grumbled, crossing his arms."If speed and wit are all he's got Jupiter will find him in no time, especially if he's hanging around here. On top of that, if he was held in the same place you were, I guarantee he's probably just as injured," Shadow blinked, "Those broken ribs and dislocated shoulder aren't new, I'm guessing you popped your shoulder joint to escape,""What are you getting at?" Shadow questioned, "What are you going to do?""Isn't it obvious?" Ari smirked, "I'm gonna steal some prey,"
- - - - -
Despite Ari making that proud remark, she seemed to forget the hardest part about hunting. The waiting. And that took several days. In that time frame, she reset Shadow's shoulder. She made him put a cloth in his mouth so that when she did relocate it, he wouldn't make any noise. At first, he commented that it was unnecessary but when she started, he changed his mind. His cuts were healing well and so were his ribs. But his ankle was still broken, making him unable to walk properly. She made sure they were both fed and safe from Jupiter, but despite everything she was doing Shadow continued to watch her constantly. As if he was just waiting for her to slip. His glare was untrusting and menacing, but she was unmoved. Ari was keeping watch over the entrance, hiding in the treetops just above it. She watched over the area and studied every sound, when footsteps caught her attention, "You shouldn't be walking on a busted foot," she said, not looking back."It appears I underestimated your abilities," Shadow said, his tone even."And I underestimated your stubbornness," she retorted, still not looking back, "You need to stay off that foot as much as possible until I can get you to a healer,""And when is that?""After I find the other two, once you're all healthy enough to travel, I'm gonna take you home,""So you've decided on taking us back," he said, "Do you even know how to get there?""Believe it or not, I do," she said and glanced over her shoulder, "now get off that foot," he narrowed his red eyes at her, but he disappeared back into the cave. A short time passed and the forest grew still, so Ari chose to retire. She stretched and dropped back down to re-enter the cave, her eyes drifted to see Shadow asleep. His arms were crossed and he was slumped over. Ari shook her head and dug into her bag to pull out a light blanket. She draped it over the sleeping hedgehog before getting herself settled."I don't understand," Ari turned to face the hedgehog, his red eyes gawking at her, "Why are you helping?""Cause it's the right thing to do," Ari said, continuing her work to make a place to rest, "I don't need a reason other than that,""What about bothering Jupiter?""That's a bonus," she replied, "but something tells me that there's something else you don't understand,"He was silent for a moment before he spoke again, "Most mobians on the island avoid me, fear me...""They only fear you because of your intimidating appearance," “So why aren't you?"Ari stopped and sighed, "Because you remind me of someone. Someone...very dear to me,""Are they gone?" his voice seemed gentle."Oh no, not gone gone," and she glanced at the entrance, "But he's probably wondering where the hell I am right now..."<<EOFANFIC>>

completion:
Chapter Text

February 26th, 9am
Middle school in the aftermath of what came to be called the Aldera-Taya Incident had been a cinch. Both Bakugou and Izuku had the brains and, now, brawn to get through anything, especially together. They both only applied to UA, with the confidence that only teenagers could have at their age.The day of the entrance exams was here! And as usual, Bakugou had a sour demeanor early in the morning."Why does today of all fucking days have to be cold?!" He grumbled, bundled in a puffy jacket and hat his mom made him put on. He was slouching, one hand stuffed angrily into his coat pocket, the other holding Izuku's."Look on the bright side Kacchan! You won't overheat as badly." Chimed Izuku, always the optimist, and always superhumanly warm."Overheating helps my quirk work, dumbass!" He said, affectionately insulting."Then it's a good thing your mom put you in that dumb hat." The green haired teen giggled, quipping back, "Rather have a dumb ass than be dumb all over."Bakugou spouted several more swears and chased Izuku into the school gates, right past several other potential students. Notably, one aubrun-brunette boy who shouted after them in a stiff, formal tone, "LANGUAGE!" His name was Nathan Rire. His uncle had moved them to Japan in the summer after his 9th grade year in American school."Japanese, smartass! Do you speak it!" Bakugou shouted back at him and Nathan growled, a bit flustered. He didn't dignify that with a reply.A taller boy next to him with blue-black hair and stiff posture adjusted his glasses. "If it's any consolation, I agree that such language shouldn't be used in the fine halls of this establishment." He bowed and offered a hand, "I'm Tenya Iida."Nathan took the offered hand and bowed a little himself, stiff because he was awkward rather than just polite. "Nathaniel Rire. Please just call me Nathan.""A pleasure, Nathan. Best of luck in there today." They separated and started walking into the area where the written exam would be administered."Same to you. Thank you kindly." He spoke with an obvious American accent, and his Japanese was very formal. He was technically conversational, but still had a long way to go with slang and more finessed causal tones.The written exam was proctored by the hero Present Mic. He seemed very… enthusiastic this morning. And loud. No one else seemed to match his energy except for Izuku, who jumped up and gleefully shouted "Plus Ultra!" with the hero on cue. He was quickly pulled back into his seat by the blonde he came in with.Nathan wasn't quite awake enough for any of this. He was up late, as usual, tending to his least favorite 'responsibility' at home. He refused to complain though. Not here. Not now.Soon enough, they were briefed and bussed in groups to the training grounds for the practical test. Izuku seemed confident enough. The blond wasn't standing near him anymore. Iida was there too, and Nathan stayed quiet, plotting a strategy.Everyone would likely go after the ones near the front first, so Nathan was going to head to the back and work his way towards the front. That way he also wouldn't have too long of a walk back after.Izuku's stores were pretty full. He stretched and flexed, warming up to take down the robots on his quirk-enhanced strength alone.Bakugou's plan was even more simple. Just blow shit up.Perhaps it was just the prior training Nathan had done, but navigating further into the model city was easy. And he was right, no one other than him was back here, but there were plenty of targets for him to use his quirk on. His quirk was called Stellar Light. He could light up various parts of his body using his body heat and make some basic light constructs, like the balls of light like miniature suns he can place or throw. He heated up his hands hot enough to melt the metal of the robots' chassis and punched through them like paper. Others he threw his mini suns at, disabling them. He navigated towards the exit through the point-based enemies. He had little-to-no trouble taking them out, but his body was heating up from using his quirk so hard. If he wasn't careful he could give himself a fever or bake himself alive. He often would have to treat burns on his body if he lit up a part for too long.Izuku was well warmed up when he ran in. It was chaos! He saw the auburn haired boy from the entrance that Kacchan insulted parkouring up a building and out of sight. He wondered quietly what his quirk was and if it helped him climb as he ran to find a target to take out. He had to go moderately far to find any enemies to take out, and he opted to run normally rather than use his quirk to boost his speed now. He would still have to ration his use of the boosts if he would get enough combat points. His quirk was Incubus Boost. Through sexual (even perceived or simply flirtatious) contact, he would get an energy boost he could use to physically enable himself to push harder, faster, or stronger. The strength and type of boost varied. Some even had different "flavors" or rather "vibes."Bakugou had more than enough combat points! He was blasting the bots left and right and even managed to 'save' an 'under-qualified' potential student from a bot they couldn't handle. They didn't even bother to thank him!! He was getting into UA, no sweat! Well… Some sweat. It's what he exploded after all.During all this, everyone tried their hardest and scattered pretty far throughout the pseudo city. It wasn't plaster and wire though. It was made to scale with actual concrete and rebar, very real bricks and asphalt, and all to code with local and federal regulations. What this meant was when the Zero-pointers emerged, the debris was real and actually dangerous to be hit with. They smashed through the buildings and herded the students back to the exit. The cowardly and smart made haste and scattered like cockroaches. Nathan was smart, but he was far from a coward. Today was not the day for bravery, and he knew that, but luck was never on his side. He was halfway back to the exit when a parking garage exploded and he was pinned under a boulder-sized hunk of rebar and concrete."Aw, crud…!" His heart pounded as he looked around for help, "HELP!" He called to the panicked students running a mere block away, hoping someone's quirk was super hearing. No dice.Izuku's ear pricked slightly as he ran from the Zero-pointer with a herd of other potential students. He thought he heard someone call for help. He turned around to double check, and saw the boy from earlier who went far into the city reaching out to presumably another group. He must have been running from that robot forever and tripped! He ran over without thinking as another building burst at the seams and he got to him as the dust settled."Hey, I'm Izuku Midoriya. I got you, 'kay?" He grinned and used the last of his boost to try to lift the boulder. It moved a little, but not enough to unpin the poor boy."Midoriya…" he committed the name to memory, "I'm Nathaniel Rire. Please just call me Nathan." Izuku nodded and sighed. He needed a boost and there was only one person here to get it from. It wasn't his quirk partner Kacchan, but he had to do something!"Okay Nathan, sorry 'bout this." Izuku said quickly and kissed the other boy, opened mouthed. He added tongue for the extra boost and stroked a thumb on his cheek. The boost was neutral, allbeit a surprised one."Mwah!" Izuku pulled back and the other boy chased after the kiss a little. It was actually really cute but there was no time for thinking. He used the boost to practically toss the artificial boulder off of Nathan and scooped him up bridal style."Th-thank you!" Nathan stuttered out in a stiff Japanese, "I would be a goner without you!""Anytime! Just glad I could help!" As they ran they saw a girl with pale chestnut hair under another boulder. But she used her gravity quirk on it and scrambled out on her own and to the nearest trash bin to 'toss her cookies.' She seemed fine otherwise so they kept moving. Nathan's right ankle was pretty damaged. Izuku pinched his thigh a little and got another blush out of Nathan before running faster using the boost it gave.Together they got to the first aid station at the entrance. Izuku set him down on a cot and stood up.
"Here we are. You're good from here, right?""Yes, thank you again. Midoriya, right?" Nathan was still getting used to all the last names around him."Yep! You can call me your boyfriend though~" he teased him a little. He was too cute when he blushed!Nathan lit up in a deep blush, just like Izuku wanted. "W-what!?" His mind raced. A boyfriend?? Already?"Kidding! You're super cute though. Maybe one day." He winked at the American as Bakugou walked over."Don't tell me you got yourself hurt, Deku…" Bakugou growled out quietly."Nope! Just being a good Samaritan!" He grinned."And a huge flirt, by the looks of it." Katsuki sighed."I gotta practice for my quirk, y'know!"As the pair talked, Nathan got lost in thought. Of course he didn't have a boyfriend. No one in America would be that forward, let alone Japan. He was just practice for Midoriya's quirk, and that was all. His shoulders slumped a little. He didn't like this train of thought.Recovery Girl walked over with her cane and gave Nathan a smooch while he spaced out. He jumped a little.
"Ah!""Easy there, kiddo, I'm not that sneaky!" She cackled a bit, amused. "Thanks for the confidence boost though."But with that, Nathan's ankle was as good as new, and he wanted a nap. Unfortunately, there's never any rest for the wicked.
<<EOFANFIC>>

completion: Izuku woke up in a cold bed, the usual warmth of his wife gone. Sitting up and surveying the room, he saw the rack where his wife kept her hero suit empty. Izuku sighed before getting out of bed, resigned to his fate of being alone for a day. He showered, dressed, and made his way to his kitchen, which he looked upon with horror. Pots and pans littered about. A large, purple stain on the counter. The stove, still on and greasy with crumbs all over. The aftermath of his wife trying to cook herself a meal. “Might as well get the cleaning done early today”, Izuku grumbled to himself while turning the stove off. The cleaning itself was easy, but the amount of stuff that needed to be cleaned made Izuku’s heart sink. The kitchen, living room, dining room, bathroom, heck when Izku entered the guest room to check if it needed cleaning, he sneezed 7 times from the sheer amount of dust! “ I won’t back down from this challenge!”, Izuku yelled comically while he scrubbed the stained counters to perfection. “ It will be taxing, but it is worth it”, he thought to himself. An hour later, he looked upon the kitchen with pride. Shiny counters, shiny floors, shiny stove, and clean dishes. But he was not done. “No”, he thought, while looking at the rest of his home with disgust. “Not done yet.” Pov: Uravity “Sir, I need you to stay focused. Does your body hurt anywhere?”, the pro-hero asked the man calmly, snapping his gaze back to her. “N-no, I don’t hurt anywhere, just….I’m just anxious to see my wife” he admitted. Uravity smiled at him. “I’m sure she’s fine sir, but I need to get you to safety. I am going to use my quirk on you. You will feel like you’re flying, and I will carry you to safety”, she explained to the elderly man. The man nodded, and she touched him with five of her fingers. Immediately, he began slowly rising, but Uravity was quick to grab him. She navigated the ruined city block, searching for medical tents, when out of nowhere, a knife flew past her, nearly grazing her throat. She looked around wildly for her attacker, and spotted the grinning knife-wielding woman. “Hey Ochako! You look so pretty today! Say, why don’t you bleed a little so you can be prettier!” Himiko Toga said, a demented smile on her face. Uravity shuddered at Toga’s comment, releasing her quirk on the elderly man and gently setting him on the ground. Then she attacked. Sneakily relieving a chunk of concrete of its gravity, she hurled it at Toga, expecting for her to dodge and attempt to stab her in retaliation. Uravity was quite surprised when the concrete chunk did hit Toga, and Toga seemingly fell unconscious. For a solid five seconds Uravity stood frozen at the sight of the downed criminal, confused as to how she won the fight so quickly. Shrugging her shoulders, she approached Toga with caution, ready to relive the insane woman of her gravity at any moment. Uravity pulled a pair of handcuffs out of her utility belt, and easily snapped them on Toga. Her heart thumping wildly in her chest, she used her quirk on the elderly man and Toga, carrying them to a medical tent in the distance. Uravity’s constant wondering as to how she defeated Toga so easily came crashing to a halt when she realized she would get more paperwork due to subduing a known serial killer. Groaning, Uravity carried on with her job. Pov:Izuku His imperfect reflection was staring back at him. The mirror was dirty with greasy smears and fingerprints, as well as the occasional splatter of hair products on the lower edges. Izuku looked at the empty bottle in his hand titled “Super Mirror Spray”, and looked back at the mirror. The rest of the house was perfect. Clean floors, walls, furniture, appliances, pictures, everything. Except the mirror. Letting out a sigh of frustration, Izuku walked to the kitchen, throwing away the empty bottle, and turning to the list of groceries on the fridge. Grabbing a pen, he wrote down “Mirror cleaning spray”, before folding the list and putting it in his pocket. Fetching his jacket and wallet, Izuku exited his home, and began his walk to the grocery store. He passed many people on his way there, and each and every person took one look at him, and practically bolted. People running away from him left and right, fear in their eyes. Izuku rolled his eyes at this. It was a common occurrence, and one he was getting sick of. Usually, some policemen would show up to question him, and then when he turned up clean, give a half-hearted apology and move on with their day. But today was no such day. The neon sign signifying that the store was open was blinking brightly, and Izuku felt his mood lift at the sight. At least he could get some shopping done. The automatic doors opened, and he was greeted with the best sight in the world. A yellow sign saying “ ALL FOOD PRODUCTS ON  SALE TODAY! 35% OFF! “. Izuku felt his heart swell, and with the excitement of a child, began his shopping.Pov:Uravity All of the civilians had been safely evacuated, all the villains were subdued and in police custody, and most heroes were back patrolling the streets. Most. Uravity was still on the job, helping clean up debris, while thinking of her attempt to make herself a meal that morning. Horror dawned on her face when she realized she left the stove on. She was about to reach for her phone, but a smarter part of her brain realized she was still on the job, and that Izuku probably turned it off. Reluctantly getting back to work, she began thinking of ways to thank her husband for preventing their house going up in flames. Pov: Izuku Izuku was like a predator, stalking the aisles, searching for his prey. His cart was full of meats, vegetables, fruits, and noodles, it did not matter that he completed his list already, he was hungry for more. Turning the corner, he was greeted with the second most beautiful sight in the world. On an unassuming shelf in the clearance aisle, marked with a 60% off sticker, was an undamaged action figure of the pro-hero Thirteen. Ochako’s favorite hero. It was in his hands in an instant, happiness swelling inside him. “Ochako’s gonna love this” he muttered to himself. He made his way to the self-checkout, paid for his items, and began his trek back home. But not all was as it seemed, as Izuku’s peaceful day was shattered. A tearing sound could be heard from Izuku’s paper bags, and before he could react, the bottoms of the bags ripped open, spilling their contents on the ground. Izuku stood still for a few seconds, rage building up in him. First the kitchen. Then the house. Then the mirror. Shopping and finding the 13 figure alleviated his anger some, but now it was back in full force. The mid-afternoon sun glared down on his body as he was ready to snap. But, the gentle voice of a woman snapped him out of his fury. “Izuku?”, Ochako asked from beside him. Pov: Ochako Ochako’s hand was still aching from all the paperwork she had to do. Her hero suit was in a briefcase, and the briefcase was tucked under her arm. She was enjoying her afternoon walk, when she heard a tearing sound, and the sound of items hitting the ground. Being the good samaritan that she is, Ochako walked toward the sound, ready to help pick up any dropped items. She rounded the corner, and froze at the sight of her husband holding torn paper bags, groceries all over the ground, and the look of pure rage on his face. “Izuku?”, she asked her husband, hoping to snap him out of his anger. He snapped his head to her, his eyes wide in surprise. “Ochako? Why….Why are you here?”, Izuku asked in response. “I got off work early today. Is everything okay Izuku?” she said while getting closer to him. “I could be better”, he muttered. Izuku felt the muscled but soft arms of his wife envelope him in a hug. He hugged her back, and as the weight of the whole day came crashing on top of him, a few tears ran down his cheeks. Pov: Omnipotence They were getting many looks from the strangers they passed by. Who wouldn’t stare at a man and woman walking while their bags of groceries floated in their arms. The couple were silently enjoying each other's company, the comfort the other brought needing no words of expression. They walked all the way to their home as the  sun slowly set behind them, the beautiful clouds echoing their moods. When they did get home, Izuku took his newly bought bottle of “Super Cleaning Spray”, he finally wiped down the dirty mirror, and admired his clear reflection for a few seconds before joining his wife in putting the groceries away. He slyly hid the Thirteen action figure away while her back was turned, wanting to give it as an anniversary gift. When they were done, Izuku realized he didn’t make anything for dinner, so he sheepishly ordered food. With their bellies full, the couple layed in bed, watching a movie. Ochako was drifting off to sleep when Izuku kissed her cheek. Drowsily, she kissed him back and cuddled closer, wrapping her arms tighter. Izuku embraced her tighter as well, and they both soon fell asleep, their love for each other not needing words.<<EOFANFIC>>

prompt: write a story about Haikyuu!!,  General Audiences No Archive Warnings Apply Gen 僕のヒーローアカデミア | Boku no Hero Academia | My Hero Academia (Anime & Manga) Shinsou Hitoshi & Yamada Hizashi | Present Mic Shinsou Hitoshi Yamada Hizashi | Present Mic Fluff and Humor Coffee Shops Aizawa Shouta | Eraserhead Training Shinsou Hitoshi Parental Yamada Hizashi | Present Mic Discord: No Writing Academia (My Hero Academia) One Shot Fluff Sarcasm Taken Seriously Villain Magnet Shinsou Hitoshi
completion:
Yamada Hizashi has many regrets.  Being sarcastic with Shinsou is not one of them.  —  It started after Shinsou turned up late to class, looking frazzled and out of breath, clutching a stack of papers to his rumpled uniform. “Shinson. Why do you look like you tried to adopt a feral cat on your way here and it ended up attacking you?”  The boy jumped, his distraction obvious, clearly surprised to have the issue addressed directly. He sheepishly looked at Yamada, his grip on the papers tightening as he drew them closer to his chest. “Because… I did?” The hesitant look and shifty eyes were all Yamada needed to tell that his student was definitely lying. Pointedly, he waited until Shinsou met his gaze, then slowly flicked his eyes down to the papers clutched in his hands, where the all-too-recognizable header of the official Musutafu Police Department was printed across the top in bold lettering. Unfortunately, Yamada was more than familiar with it– he and Shouta filled out at least twenty of those very forms a week. “And this feral cat gave you police papers? What a terrible cat.” “Uhm.” Shinsou sighed and ducked his head, his posture loosening as he began a fast and likely-very-compressed version of how he had stumbled across a purse-snatcher on the walk from his foster family’s flat to the train station, there were no other heroes nearby and so he had no choice but to step in as the rest of the General Education students watched on in silence. Yamada let out a good-natured sigh as well. “How do you always manage to get involved in these things?” “Sorry, Sensei. I don’t mean to. It just… happens.” There was a pause. Then Yamada uttered the sentence he would soon come to regret– or maybe not. “If you're going to be late for class because you had to fight a villain," he drawled, channeling his inner Shouta in the hope that it would deter his student somewhat, "at least get me a coffee while you're at it, Shinson.”  Shinsou rolled his eyes. “Yes, dad.”  A mere three days passed before Shinsou burst into the classroom late again, but this time, his entry was accompanied by the smell of strong, fresh coffee.  Yamada stared. “What– I didn’t-” Momentarily, Shinsou hesitated at the door, shuffling his feet. Then, mumbling a quick apology and explanation– a mugging as he was walking past an alley– he strode to the front of the room and placed a tall cup of coffee onto Yamada’s desk and before returning to his own as the whole class watched in mild confusion. No, Yamada definitely didn’t have the energy to deal with this. So he simply beamed his brightest smile. “Shinson, you got me coffee!” The cup was covered with a lid bearing a coffee shop logo that Yamada did not recognize. But as he took a tentative sip, he discovered that Shinsou had somehow guessed his favorite coffee– a blend of mocha, espresso, and lots and lots of cream. It even had the distinctive taste of a little bit of honey– just the way he liked it! 
 Shouta must have told him. 
 Taking another exaggerated gulp, he continued with the lesson, but as he caught Shinsou’s eye halfway through, he could definitely spot the smallest of smiles on the boy’s face. Yamada smiled to himself too. Well. At least the coffee was good.  The late-to-class coffees were a worryingly frequent occurrence from that point on, as Shinsou was clearly one of the biggest villain magnets Yamada had ever come across, even as a General Education student. But at least the coffees served a purpose: they let him know when he would be having to deal with more paperwork in the upcoming months, as opposed to when the reason for lateness was just something mundane— even if that really hadn't been his intention. To be fair, none of this had been his intention, anyway. The only thing his comment  didn’t seem to be was the deterrent it had been intended as. But any incident Shinsou was involved in tended to be a minor one or something his quirk was especially helpful for, and he was actually meant to be gaining more experience as a hero for his upcoming hero course transfer. That, along with the actually quite good and much-needed coffee he was frequently gifted with, had led him to the decision that perhaps this wasn’t the absolute worst thing that could have come of this. Yamada was decidedly less okay with the situation when, a couple of months later, he was looking at the official hero ranking and Shinsou showed up under the hero name CATcher despite not even being in the hero course (yet), having anything remotely close to a hero license, or having had an official debut—the boy intended to be an underground hero, for goodness’ sake! Yamada released a long-suffering sigh and facepalmed, dreading all of the problems this was probably going to cause. But then again, he couldn’t help but feel a little bit proud of his son student.  “Shinson,” he called out as the bell rang. “Stay after class, please.” The purple-haired boy looked up from the notes he was diligently taking and nodded in acknowledgement. “Yes, Sensei. Did I do anything wrong…?” Yamada shook his head. “Not that I know of- unless you’d like to confess a crime?” Shinsou frantically shook his head, and Yamada let out a chuckle. By then, the classroom was cleared save for the two of them, the rest of the students having exited in the rush to get to lunch. Shinsou hesitantly approached the desk. “Your transfer to the hero course isn’t even finalized,” Yamada began. “I know,” Shinsou answered. “It’s going to be finished in two weeks, right? That’s what Aizawa-sensei said.” Yamada inclined his head. “You’re really trying to make up for all that lost time, even though Shouta’s training you personally, aren’t you?” he joked. His student’s brows furrowed. “I’m sorry, Sensei, I don’t understand.” “You’re not even in the course yet, and you’re already–” he cut himself off. “Have you checked the newly-released official Musutafu hero rankings yet?” Obviously puzzled, Shinsou shook his head. “Middle of the third page, number three hundred fifty-five: CATcher, also known as UA High School student Shinsou Hitoshi. You’re on the hero rankings.” “...What?!?” 

As his son student exited the room, Yamada’s lips quirked up into a smile.  About a block from UA High School, there was a small, out-of-the-way coffee shop where some of the baristas had recently noticed a pattern:  Every time there was a villain attack or an unfortunate incident near the high school, approximately 20 minutes after it was over and everyone within the danger zone was given the all-clear to go about their business as usual, a tired-looking kid with tall, gravity-defying purple hair and concerningly-sized eye bags would enter the shop and order the exact same thing—a large cup with one-third mocha, two-and-a-half shots of espresso, one-third cream, and exactly two swirls of honey—and then left.  Nobody knew why he always got the same super-specific coffee order. Once, he had ordered a second drink—black coffee—and immediately took a long sip, sighing in happiness, so most of the baristas thought that the other order was clearly not for himself.  Sometimes they’d slip the boy a pastry, too, because one time he even stopped a villain trying to steal from their register, and Shizuku also swore up and down that she had been saved by the kid when someone attempted to mug her in an alley.  As he was a surprisingly regular customer, the employees didn’t ask questions, and one by one they also stopped batting an eye at the burns or tears of stains on the fabric of his clothes. Usually, he came in in full UA uniform, sometimes in casual attire.  But what was most memorable (and endearing) was the deep indigo cat-eared hoodie that would be pulled over his clothes without fail. Among themselves, they would affectionately refer to him as a villain cat-cher– a nod to both his tendency for showing up whenever there was an attack or crime of some sort, as well as his hoodie.  Although no one knew whether he was a licensed hero or not, he was certainly one of their most beloved customers, and everyone agreed that it was well-deserved when he showed up in the next official hero ranking.   <<EOFANFIC>>

Prologue
Endeavor’s flame had finally gone out. There he laid in the rubble battered and bruised with his detached legs laying next to him. Blood poured from every pore as every muscle and bone in his body trembled in pain; every breath he took was painful, with every blink more blood spurted from his torn veins. The ongoing battle between the other Heroes and All For One became a hum in his ears.  His breathing became more shallow and his vision began to become spotted, that’s when he heard a voice. “Father!” Endeavor could only turn his eyes to vaguely see the blur of UA uniforms sprinting towards him being led by his son. He averted his eyes, feeling ashamed that Shoto had to see him like this.“Sho-”“No…” Shoto began walking towards his father but dropped to his side.  “No no no no no!”Endeavor watched Shoto cry, his heart began aching as his silver tears rolled down Shoto’s dusty face, he had an itch to wipe away his tears but he couldn’t move. Though he knew he was destined to die a painful death, it didn’t mean he didn’t have regrets. He regretted everything; his parent’s deaths, he regretted not making more friends, he regretted his quirk marriage, he regretted his power…“I…”He regretted his ambitions, his ego and the pain he caused people; the pain he caused his family… “I regret…” Shoto wiped his tears and looked to his dying father, his eyes still spilling tears and shook his head frantically. He began saying something that Endeavor couldn’t hear.  He regretted his passions, he regretted his fame, he regretted his ignorance. Shoto had begun shouting something but the only thing Endeavour could make out was the word ‘Father’.  With what little strength he had left Endeavor inched his hand closer to Shoto and then weakly pinched the fabric of his son’s hero costume. “...not loving you enough”Endeavor neither saw nor heard his son’s dreadful sobs that echoed across the battlefield nor his anger that manifested into a sea of flames that exploded across the battlefield, burning everything in its path. His final destination was the endless void that death welcomed with. 


Endeavor's flame had finally gone out. There he laid in the rubble battered and broken; his detached legs were thrown carelessly by him. Blood poured from every pore as every muscle and bone in his body trembled in pain; every breath he took was painful, with every blink more blood spurted from his torn veins. The ongoing battle between the other Heroes and All For One became a hum in his ears.  His breathing became more shallow and his vision began to become spotted, that’s when he heard a voice. “Father!” Endeavor could only shift his eyes to vaguely see the blur of UA uniforms sprinting towards him being led by his son. He averted his eyes, feeling ashamed that Shoto had to see him like this.“Sho-”“No…” Shoto jogged up to his father and dropped to his side.  “No no no no no!”Endeavor watched Shoto cry, his heart began aching as silver tears rolled down Shoto’s dusty face, he had an itch to wipe away the tears but he couldn’t move. Though he knew he was destined to die a painful death, that didn’t mean he wouldn't die without regrets. He regretted everything; his parent’s deaths, he regretted not making more friends, he regretted his quirk marriage, he regretted his power…“I…”He regretted his ambitions, his ego and the pain he caused people; the pain he caused his family… “I regret…” Shoto wiped his tears and looked to his dying father, his eyes again began pooling. He shook his head frantically, beginning to say something that was, to Endeavor, heavily muffled. He regretted his passions, he regretted his fame, he regretted his ignorance. Shoto had begun shouting something but the only thing Endeavour could make out was the word ‘Father’.  With what little strength he had gathered Endeavor inched his hand closer to Shoto and then weakly pinched the ripped fabric of his son’s hero costume. “...not loving you enough”Endeavor neither saw nor heard his son’s dreadful sobs echoing across the battlefield nor his anger that manifested into a sea of flames that exploded across the area, burning everything in its path. His final destination was the endless void that death welcomed with. “To All Might and his Legacy!” Those words echoed in his mind.Yagi Toshinori sat on a bench at the side of the road, whisking his beer mindlessly. He should’ve been elated to be back in America, to have been reunited with his old middle school friends, but he couldn’t shake the feeling that something was wrong. He sighed and threw his head back, downing the whole bottle in frustration. He slammed the empty bottle down on the bench and wiped his mouth with another sigh. The shadows of passing vehicles rolled off his tired, ageing face.  He wondered for so long, since his legacy was over, what he would do? He thought of buying his grandparent’s old beach house and living out the rest of his days there, peacefully. Maybe staying in America and hanging out with his old friends more? Maybe…just maybe he would find something to keep himself distracted. “May I sit here?” As he thought, a girl, no older than a teenager, stood next to the bench. Yagi looked up at her, she stood there in a simple hoodie and jeans with her hands in her pockets. She wore a mask; the only features visible were her large, innocent amber eyes and silver hair tied up in a messy bun.  Though he was drunk, he didn’t fail to notice the scar under her eye. He hummed. The girl sat next to him, her hands never leaving her pockets. They sat there in a strained silence, then the girl spoke in a low voice. “It’s a beautiful night isn’t it,” she smiled at him under the mask. Yagi nodded and continued looking at the road. She sighed. “Yagi Toshinori, right? Do you know a lady by the name of Ann Hill?” “Uh, I’m sorry, I don’t know her, if she's missing you could ask the…” “No...!”Yagi paused, then looked at the girl.  Though she was still facing the road her large, once innocent eyes were now filled with an inescapable rage; the grinding of her teeth could be heard under her mask. “Are you alright?” The girl breathed out a shakily then chuckled. Yagi moved to comfort her but with one swift motion her hidden hand had a gun aiming directly at his heart. He looked at the gun, shivering as its cold muzzle was digging deeply into his ribs. He chuckled then turned back to the road; the girl's eyes widened then scooted closer to him, pressing the gun deeper into his ribs. "You bastard...Have anything to say?" she grinded her teeth. Yagi sighed "I hate seeing children like you"
Fitz! A muffled shot was fired. 
Toshinori's mouth began pooling with blood, it wasn't a very foreign feeling, his body was becoming hyper aware of everything; his vision became filled with a blinding array of street lights, his skin was buzzing and spewing sweat. From his blurry peripheral vision he could see the young girl walking away, he smirked. Usually this was the point where he should be thinking of everything he missed, everything he lost, everything he regretted...but he couldn't think of anything, though he felt like he was missing something; he had already felt like he had done everything this life had in store for him but...it wasn't satisfactory.  Now that it was finally his time to die, he felt dissatisfied. How selfish of him.  "Heh, some legacy that was..."<<EOFANFIC>>

completion: Shouto doesn’t mean to. Doesn’t mean to mess up. It’s just—He doesn’t understand love. Not instinctively, at least. He didn’t grow up with it. Not—not like other people (apparently, according to what he’s seen and heard, according to how easily all their friends hand out affection) did. And with Katsuki, it’s not just love. No, it’s bigger, and more, and Extra Special. Like everything else with him. Like his smiles and his rough words just to hide how much he truly cares (how much he truly cares about Shouto).So. During their last year of high school, after Katsuki kisses him for the first time ever (the first, the one and only, and—) Shouto starts keeping score. Just in case. Not that feelings can really be quantified or turned into cold statistics, but—When they argue, Shouto usually gets at least one fewer cheek kiss that day. When they really argue, the number decreases by two or three. Once, memorably, after their worst argument to date, Katsuki didn’t even send him a goodnight, sweetheart text. So. Based on this, Shouto does the math. The affection math.If he starts at 100%, then each missing kiss is a subtracted one percent, and each extra kiss or Katsuki being particularly affectionate other ways any given day is an added one percent. Preferably, Shouto would like to keep it as close to 100% as possible, just to make sure Katsuki never ever decides to get up and leave, never ever decides that Shouto isn’t worth the struggle, never ever looks at him and sees somebody he doesn’t want. But fluctuations are impossible to avoid, so he usually settles for around 90%. It’s not ideal, and it does make him worry during the Very Bad Days (clinical depression, officially diagnosed at age thirteen), and thank god (and doctors paid to keep things quiet) for Zoloft and the occasional Xanax. Because therapy, obviously, is for people weaker than Shouto. Or—That’s what his old man used to insist, until the first time Shouto took a sharpened kitchen knife and tried to carve his left arm open with it. (Not—not even to die. Just to make it all stop.) Because maybe his quirk would stop working without a good enough vessel. Shouto had even tried to lock himself in the bathroom just so the efficacy of a healing quirk would be reduced when not used immediately. Obviously, his old man hadn’t been about to let his hopes and dreams slip through his fingers. And he needed Shouto. Not his son. Just the convenient thing, the object with the Perfect Quirk. (The quirk that made his mother pour boiling water on his face.)Shouto got regular therapy sessions with a licensed clinical psychologist after that.So. Now he needs to Make Sure. Needs as objective of a confirmation as he can get that it’s okay. That he’s still actively wanted instead of just passively tolerated. Needs Katsuki to love him. Is that selfish? Is needing things selfish? Is not being perfect selfish? Is wanting to cut yourself into even bits and rearrange the parts into something prettier proof that you’re irreparably damaged? That there’s no hope anymore? That whatever postmodern interpretation of Pandora’s tale we can come up with is just. Well. Either too hopeful or appropriately bleak, depending on how you squint at it.But—Humans are stubborn. At least here, Shouto doesn’t disappoint. And he’s going to keep being stubborn about Katsuki loving him. As long as he’s not forcing himself where he isn’t wanted, it should be fine.(Right?)(Right?)(Right? God—)But then.It’s an accident. They’re fighting, and then it keeps getting worse, and worse, and worse, and Katsuki is yelling, and Shouto doesn’t want to be yelled at, doesn’t want to be hated, doesn’t want Katsuki to hate him (god please no I’ll be good I’ll do better I’ll—) doesn’t want—He starts crying. He starts crying and he’s trying to muffle it and he’s trying not to be weak and he’s trying he’s trying he’s trying. And then Katsuki goes quiet. And then he steps closer. Careful like Shouto is infinitely breakable. Doesn’t say anything, just pulls Shouto into a firm hug. That’s what Shouto likes best about Katsuki’s hugs. They’re always fully committed hugs. Always him holding Shouto like he wants to make sure Shouto is never (never ever) going to go anywhere.And then he’s kissing all over Shouto’s face like he has a point to prove, and—Oh.“That puts us firmly back into the 90% range,” Shouto blurts.Katsuki pulls back, just barely. Just enough to squint at him. To say, “Hah?”Shouto can’t look at him for a breath, two, three. “I keep score,” he admits. “When we—when we fight. So you don’t hate me too much.”“What the fuck?” Katsuki hisses. Then, considerably softer (warm, warm, warm warm warm), “Could never hate you, you idiot. I never will. Okay?”Shouto wants to believe it. He does. But the persistent worry at the back of his mind is cruel and ruthless and sharp, sharp, sharp. Like that knife, the glinting steel he picked up at the age when most kids still sleep in their parents' bed after a nightmare just because they can, even if they’re too old for it. “You won’t.” He nods. “You won’t as long as the, um, the percentages add up.”Katsuki bites at the inside of his mouth. Chapter Text
Ray is in a predicament. After Emma talked to The One, Ray was separated from them, he has no idea where they are. He is working on the assumption that this is the 'human' world since from what he can see everyone is at least mostly human shaped.Having appeared in this world just over a week ago, Ray has pickpocketed his way through living, even managing to pickpocket the apartment key off someone who works a night-shift so he has somewhere to sleep and wash. So no, Ray's predicament is not about where he's going to eat or sleep. It is actually about coming to terms with the fact that the quickest way for a 15 year old to be seen by most of those living around the world, is to become a 'hero', which is subsequently the quickest way for Emma to find him, or for him to get the resources needed to look for Emma.Now, while Ray may have helped save countless children from being eaten by literal demons, he does not consider himself a hero in any definition of the word. Why? Because he also watched countless children being sent off to their deaths. He may not have known at the time what exactly happened to them, but he knew that it was in no way good, but he researches anyway.It takes Ray until the next day to make his decision. After researching as best he could using his new 'roommates' tablet he has managed to find out a bit more about these 'heroes'. As it turns out, they're just glorified police, and police are pretty much Mama's and Sisters but with tasers. At first Ray wondered whether there was another word for someone who was a 'hero' but didn't take any money or rewards (what Ray originally thought a hero was) but as it turns out, those people are called 'vigilantes' and are illegal. This society is weird. What's also weird is that in this society, people assume that those without quirks are unevolved, stupid and fragile. 

Well, you know what? Fuck. That.Emma and Ray talked to a literal God, travelled across worlds, got impaled (Emma) and stopped mass genocide from occurring (he's still annoyed at Norman for even thinking that was a good idea) all while quirkless. So whatever assholes say that 'the quirkless can't do anything' can eat shit for all he cares.Ray will be a quirkless hero and that's that.

Chapter Text

It was a usual day in The League of Villains hideout, well as usual as a group of rejects could be. But perhaps the state of ‘usual’ itself is but a construct invented by the same people that declared the lot of them as rejects. Compress is cut off from his musing when Hawks comes into the hideout. The board game that was being played by Toga, Magne and Twice abandoned to welcome him. Dabi didn’t bother looking up from his phone on the couch, Spinner glancing over and chittering before turning back to his video game. 
 
What should one do? To return to theoreticals would be impossible with the noise level, but then again Hawks does seem thoroughly welcomed. A knife goes flying into the wall, deflected by Hawks from hitting him. It would seem some sort of thanking would be in order. 
 
Compress stands and walks over to the group, the chaotic duo of Twice and Toga leaving rather than calm down. Magne offers a smile and returns to discussing trans rights with the hero. He has his phone out and is taking notes on things that can help. It seems important so Compress stays silent. 
 
Because of this quiet watching he notes some small details, Hawks palm is holding his phone, fingers barely supporting it, said fingers on his other hand are typing far slower than is usual for the hero, and most of all is the unnatural angle that they bend at when he puts out much pressure. Compress watches a minute more, looking at the small details saying that the younger is hiding some sort of pain. The two’s conversation wraps up and Magne returns to the game. 
 
“Did you need something?” Hawks' voice is laid back and open, if it wasn’t for the intelligent and adamant conversation he’d been having a few seconds ago then Compress would think he wasn’t acting. But the hero seems to act a lot, worriedly so sometimes. 
 
“Thank you for deflecting that blade, I should’ve had better situational awareness.” 
 
“I didn’t do anything?” Hawks pauses thinking something over, his hands going up to his chin like they tend to when he’s thinking before a barely covered wince brings them back down. “Ah yes! Sorry, I was mostly doing that on instinct.” 
 
“Well I suppose being a hero must leave those kinds of thoughts, I am grateful for it though.” Compress decides to sooth over after the kid looked panicked about being called out on hero tendencies. Like Dabi and Magne don’t act the same, the former hiding it behind aggression and noncaring. 
 
“Well I guess you’re welcome.” 
 
“Would you like to help me with something?” 
 
“Sure!” The hero is chipper and doesn’t even question what the task is, probably due to the number of murder and arson crimes Dabi has dragged him into. 
 
“Follow me.” Compress leads the two back into the bathroom and seats Hawks on a closed toilet. 
 
“What do you need help with, your cleaning duty or something?” Hawks jokes. 
 
“Could you take off your gloves?” The kid freezes, terror flooding his features for a split second before the mask is slid back on. 
 
“I would prefer not too.” Compress sighs. 
 
“I’m a magician.” 
 
“I know?” 
 
“So most of my work is in my hands. Which means I can tell something is wrong with yours.” 
 
“My hands are fine.” Hawks scoffs out. 
 
“Then you won’t mind showing me.” 
 
“My hands aren’t… pretty.” The hero looks away, face flushing slightly. 
 
“So?” Hawks looks up at him with far more vulnerability in his eyes than Compress can remember ever seeing. 
 
The kid takes a deep breath and pulls off one glove, glancing at the other looking for him to object. Compress just nods for him to keep going, the other one comes off and both are placed on the counter. Hawks puts his hands into the elders, breathing quickening as fear coats his eyes. And Compress looks down, and pauses. 
 
Before ‘not pretty’ doesn’t begin to explain the mess that is the hero’s hands. Black talons that should be beautiful and eye-catching are cut to the base, mangled stubs of them remain, looking under cared for from the lackluster shine to the chipping nature of them. All of his fingers are broken, but beyond that are scars for what looks like years of breaking and not healing right. The veins shine through against the pale skin, his hand bony and underfed looking. 
 
“I’m sorry, I know it’s ugly.” Hawks seems sure of that fact, and while Compress is hit with the strong urge to look away the worry is far stronger. 
 
“Why are your fingers broken?” He keeps a calm voice and makes eye contact with the hero who flinches away. 
 
“It’s stupid, really really dumb, and all my fault.” Hawks mutters out, a fake smile on his face. 

Did he run into a window or something? But this seems to have been going on for a while. 

“Just some stupid part of my quirk-”
 
“Your quirk?” The kid freezes and still hasn’t gotten his breathing under control. 
 
“Bird stuff ya know? Just dumb birdbrain stuff.” Compress frowns at the word choice, sure Dabi sometimes uses it on the other but the rest of it is far beyond what the flame user would say. 
 
“I’m sure it’s not dumb.” 
 
“It really is.” Tears pool up slightly in the hero’s eyes. “I stress grip, like latch down on stuff when I’m stressed. It’s really dumb and a major problem. I thought I was trained out of it years ago but sometimes it just pops up. It was a mistake really, but it’s bad so they had to break my fingers.” 
 
And there was… a lot wrong with that statement. Who’s ‘they’? While that may be something that could be a problem, why would the solution be breaking fingers? And ‘trained’ out years ago? 
 
“Who?” 
 
“What?” Hawks looks up from staring at his own hands. 
 
“Who did this?” The younger's eyes dart about looking for excuses before sighing and settling for the truth. (Hopefully) 
 
“The Commission.” From the way the hero dims and wilts from just the name, Compress is inclined to believe him. 
 
“They hurt you?” Hawks finally locks eyes with him, panic filling them. 
 
“Nonono, they help me! With my bad traits.” And the younger looks sure of that. So sure that he’s 

bad 

and the Commission is helping him by 

shattering 

his fingers. 
 
“Dear, breaking someone’s fingers isn’t helping. I’m a villain and I won’t ever consider doing something like that.” Compress takes out the first aid kit and Hawks reluctantly gives his hands over to the elder. 
 
“It’s to make me better.” The blonde truly sounds like a child in that moment and for a second, Compress wonders how long they’ve had their hands on him. 
 
<<EOFANFIC>>

prompt: write a story about Haikyuu!!,  Teen And Up Audiences No Archive Warnings Apply M/M 僕のヒーローアカデミア | Boku no Hero Academia | My Hero Academia (Anime & Manga) Midoriya Izuku/Todoroki Shouto Todoroki Shouto Midoriya Izuku One-Sided Attraction Angst Past Child Abuse Todoroki Enji | Endeavor's Bad Parenting Nightmares Touch-Starved Todoroki Shouto Needs a Hug
completion:
Shoto had become a master at masking everything. His facial expressions, his body language, his tone. At some point, he started to fear that he’s internalized it. He needed it to survive the last ten years with his father, but living at UA? Reclaiming his quirk as his own? His mask was slowly melting away. On his own terms. No one else’s.
 
All thanks to that damned bone breaker Midoyia Izuku.
 
And sometime between the sports festival and now, he’d fallen head over heels in love with him. 
 
He had absolutely no idea how to show affection. It wasn’t like he could ask anyone in his family, especially when his object of affection was a boy, knowing his father and how he'd react.
 
So, he started with small stuff. Things that always made him feel better. When Izuku had been acting weird around his work study and trying his hardest not to cry, he comforted him in the only way he knew: by giving him half his soba. He would’ve given him all of it, but that would’ve made it look too obvious. Or Izuku would’ve just rejected all of it because of how kind he is.
 
After that Midoriya started to become more affectionate with his classmates. They had all grown so much together. He was always at Midoyia’s side, always trying to fight for him and protect him. He didn’t need protecting, but he was willing to die for the boy that gave him everything.
 
Some time passed and his usual nightmares had gotten worse. Instead of his father looming over him, beating him with suffocating heat, it was Shigaraki disintegrating Izuku as he begged for Shoto to help him. Other times, he had confessed his love and he laughed in his face. Or he would confess his love to Izuku, and he’d react with anger and disgust, wondering how someone as worthless as him could love someone like Izuku who could move the stars themselves.
 
Shoto woke up one night from one of his repeated nightmares. One where he couldn’t save Izuku. This time when he woke up, the room was covered in ice. He couldn’t even imagine how his father would’ve reacted if he’d frozen his bedroom because of a nightmare backhome. Although he did feel bad for Aoyama who must be freezing in the other room.
 
He got out of his sweat drenched bed and melted the ice. He’ll apologize to him in the morning. 
 
Then, Shoto noticed himself crying and it was hard to breathe. He wiped his tears and went back to using the mask that kept him safe all this time. He went to the small bathroom in his bedroom and splashed cold water on his face. He waited until the swelling in his eyes went down and the redness in his face subsided.
 
Eventually, he slowly shuffled his way from his bedroom to the common room to get some fresh air and tea. 
 
It wasn’t until he finished making his cup he noticed a large fluffy ball of hair in the living room hunched over. Izuku hadn’t noticed him yet, or he was asleep. Shoto decided to quietly call his name, “Izuku?” Izuku jumped and looked back at him, face drenched in still flowing tears. 
 
“Hey!” He forced a smile and wiped his eyes. “What are you doing up?”
 
“Same reason as you, I think,” Nightmares. It had to be. What else would someone be up in the middle of the night crying about? Shoto softly said as he made his way to the couch to sit next to the hero he was madly in love with. He felt his heart pound in his chest. They were both so vulnerable and so alone. He put the cup of tea on the coffee table and looked at Midoriya.
 
“Do you… Want to talk about it?” 
 
“I’ve just…” Shoto could swear he saw him blush. Or maybe he was just red from crying too. Shoto was never good at this sort of thing. So he decided to keep his mouth shut and let Izuku talk. “I’ve been spending a lot of time with this girl from class 1B. I know,” he shook his head and the smile Shoto would die for was wide and wavering. “I know about our classes rivalry, but I don’t care! I really like her!” He proudly said as he looked up at his best friend. “I asked her out and she said yes!” He started to cry again. Izuku was crying because he was happy.
 
And he was so grateful he could hide his emotions, because he was completely breaking inside. Izuku was happy, so why wasn’t he? That’s what he wanted, right? Izuku to be happy no matter what, even if he wasn’t there. So why did he feel like he was dying? Like something worse from his living nightmare had come true. He hoped he was dreaming. He prayed he was dreaming.
 
“What about you?” Shoto was snapped from his thoughts. “What are you doing up? If you don’t mind talking about it!” He could tell Izuku felt bad about turning Shoto’s nightmare into talking about his love life. He also didn’t realize how much that broke him inside.
 
Well… Izuku liking someone else was like Ibara’s thorns wrapped around his heart that squeezed it to ribbons, but Izuku was happy. He didn’t hate him. He could never. And why would he feel anything about Ibara? She had nothing to do with any of this. And that's when his mask finally shattered. He broke down crying in loud, violent sobs. Izuku panicked and pulled him into a tight hug and rubbed his back. 
 
It’s just a hug. It’s just a hug that doesn’t mean anything. He knew it didn’t mean anything to Izuku. He hugged everyone. He was a loving and affectionate person like that. He didn’t even realize just how much that meant to Shoto.
 
Shoto, who the last time he ever felt a kind touch, let alone being held so gently when he needed it was his mother. Shortly before she poured the boiling water on his face. Rei was still terrified to touch him after he started to come and visit her as of late. He didn’t blame her, he almost flinched beforehand which didn’t help either of them.
 
But with Izuku… He melted into his body and touch. Savoring every part of him.
 
Deep down Shoto knew he wasn’t special. He was completely devoted and in love with Izuku and he knew he’d never feel the same way.

Disheartening, but a choice nobody could stop him from making.As Tsuyu stood there on the platform waiting for the train, she had texted Midoriya, Uraraka, and Iida to see if they would like to come along. She needed some type of company, plus she hadn’t seen or talked to those three in months. She missed them and wanted to catch up. With the text being sent, her phone buzzed, followed by a cute sounding pop tone. Indicating that a reply was immediately given back. Taken aback by how fast the reply came, she read over the message.Apparently the three had the same idea of visiting their former teacher and were already on school grounds. Another notification. A picture was sent. It showed the three of them sitting on a bench under a cherry blossom tree outside of the school gate. Uraraka was the one holding the phone at a high angle while Midoriya and Iida leaned in to fit in the frame. All of them held a red bean flavored popsicle. All of them were smiling widely.She smiled slightly at the photo and sent the text: “I’ll see you there soon, kero!” a frog and a red heart emoji following behind it. Then the train arrival announcement echoed throughout the platform.The train hissed as it came to a stop. Opening its doors, a crowd of people rushed out. After everybody was off, another announcement came on, telling people that it’s now safe to board the train to the next stop, Musutafu. Holding her phone to her chest, Tsuyu stepped onto the train car. A handful of people followed behind her. Then, a lot more after. Lucky for her, she was able to get to a spot where she could hold onto a pole. More people filed in. Some of them pushed their way past her. Forcing her to bump her forehead into somebody’s back. Making the girl drop her cell phone to the floor.“Oi, watch it,” a low gruff voice warned her.She gently rubbed her forehead with her fingers. Trying to soothe the light stinging that occurred from the impact. She looked up to see who she had bumped into. She blinked once, twice, three times. Letting out a small “ah” once she recognized the person. It was Bakugou. At least it was a person she knew.Turning around looking down at her while holding onto a grab handle, he also let out a small “ah.” Blinking once when he saw her. He was wearing a black button down shirt with a red v-neck shirt underneath, form fitting black jeans that cuffed right above the ankle, and white low top sneakers. ‘Oh, he looks good today,’ she thought.The two stared at each other for a slight moment before she spotted a flash of red shift next to him. She didn’t even have to question who that was. It was Kirishima. Thank goodness he was here to distract her from whatever this awkward situation was.The red headed teen leaned forward to look at her and gave her one of his infamous shark tooth smiles. He wore a sleeveless black hoodie and gray sweatpants with a zipper pocket on each side. Red and black athletic high top sneakers on his feet. “Mornin’ Tsu!” he greeted. Bouncing up and down lightly with excitement.“Morning Kirishima-chan,” giving him a small smile in return. “You look pretty manly today, kero.”“You think so? I just picked out the first thing I saw in my closet haha.” He rubbed his neck bashfully. “You’re looking pretty good today too Tsu. Meeting up with somebody?”Although the question seemed innocent enough, Tsuyu couldn’t help but blush a little. She didn’t look that special did she? She was only wearing a green pinafore dress that stopped mid thigh, a black long sleeve shirt underneath, sheer black tights, and black ankle strapped pumps. Shaking her head she turned her attention back to Bakugou. “Sorry for bumping into you Baku-chan,” she apologized. He shrugged his shoulders and kept looking straight ahead.“It’s whatever. Train’s crowded as hell today.”She ribbited in agreement. Nodding her head simultaneously with Kirishima. Who stopped for a second to ask her why she ignored his question earlier. Making puppy eyes in the process while she put a finger to her chin and tipped her head in an innocent manner. “Train doors are now closing. Please stand clear of the platform as we depart to our destination” the announcement echoed. The train started moving, shifting the passengers a little to the left, then picked up speed. Giving everybody the opportunity to stay stationary. The trio let out a sigh. Thankful that they could at least get a little breathing room.“Anyways Tsu, why are you going to U.A.?” Kirishima questioned.“I’m going to visit Aizawa-sensei. Midoriya-chan and Ochako-chan are already there with Iida. Kero. I just thought it would be worthwhile to say a final goodbye.”“Oh! So manly!” Kirishima exclaimed, clenching a fist in front of his heart.“She’s a girl, idiot.” Bakugou noted. Bending down to pick up Tsuyu’s phone.“Womanly! Feminine manliness!”“Ugh.” Bakugou held out the phone for Tsuyu to take. Accepting it with a quiet ‘thank you’ she put it inside the tote she carried. Turning to Kirishima, Bakugou lectured “Did you forget that you dragged me along to do the same thing?” Raising a fist to lightly knock Kirishima on the head.“You would only come because I offered to buy you somethin’ to eat afterwards!”“Only because you tried to hide the fact that the other idiots were coming.”This piqued Tsuyu’s interest. Did that mean the whole class planned to see Aizawa off today? She wanted to pry further. Ask who all was going to be there. But all she could let out was a surprised ribbit. A couple of boys who were playfully knocking each other around had bumped into her with full force. Making her let go of the pole she was holding onto and crash into Bakugou. He reacted quickly. He let go of the grab handle and took her by the shoulders. Pulling her close into his chest. “You fucking idiots! I should kick your asses!” He yelled at the boys, gripping her shoulders in anger.“Baku-chan, it hurts.”“Tch.” he loosened his grip immediately.“Playing in a place like this is bold of them,” Kirishima sighed. Crossing his arms in disappointment. One of the boys bowed down slightly in apology, hurriedly encouraging his other friends to stop their playing while giggling along with them. This action made Bakugou furious, as it looked like the boy wasn't serious about his apology at all. His hands started to sweat and Tsuyu noticed. She had to calm him down somehow. "Bakugou-chan, i'm fine kero." It was simple, but it should at least let him know it wasn't a big deal. He looked down at her. “Are you sure?" he asked her, his voice taking a serious tone."Yes. So can you not start a fight the day before school starts?" she answered truthfully. He huffed at her answer. Looking forward yet again. Eye twitching in annoyance. Tsuyu only giggled. Amused that he was trying to control his anger. The train swayed them a little. Bakugou softened his expression and looked back down at her. Why was he still holding her close?“Kero? What was that Baku-chan?” Tsuyu asked.Bakugou widened his eyes a little. Did he say that out loud? “No. I-”The train announcement came on. Telling them of their arrival at the station. Most of the passengers cheered. Excited about getting off and leaving the cramped space they were in.‘Dammit..’ Bakugou inwardly cursed. He let go of Tsuyu and stuffed one of his hands in his pocket. Looking annoyed again and ignoring whatever it was Kirishima was rambling  Tsuyu stared at him in confusion. Raising a finger to her chin. As the doors opened, everybody rushed out. The trio stepping off last. Walking together in the direction of the school. Cherry blossom petals dancing in the wind. Tsuyu still stared at Bakugou. Not in confusion, but in awe. He was holding her wrist, pulling her along so she could fall in step with him and Kirishima. A slight blush rose to her cheeks. Her heart beat faster. It was the closest thing to hand holding she ever did with a guy. She didn’t hate it. Didn’t mind that it was with Bakugou. The last person she would expect to hold hands with anybody. Smiling to herself, she hoped she would get to experience things like this with him more. It was nice. It was different. <<EOFANFIC>>

Chapter Text
     Izuku Midoriya relished the feeling of the cold-yet not unpleasant-breeze going through his air and brushing up against his skin. It had been so long since he left the village last-to long. Izuku had grown anxious and fidgety from the boring day-to-day life in his little town of Stonewall, and he was so glad to be adventuring again.     When it came to his home town, as much as he loved it, he just couldn't stay there all the time. He needed to be up and doing something. The town couldn't provide that. So he would go on all sorts of adventures and expeditions, and when he would return, everyone would flock to great him, the children receiving gifts he had gotten them, and the whole town would stay up late listening to the stories of his adventures.     He remembers still the story he had told the night before he left on this adventure;it was a story he had learned from one of the Native Tribes who lived in the trees along the bank of the Winekka Channel. It was a story of an old temple somewhere in the woods, one that was home to several gods and goddesses. It is said to have become old and dilapidated, but in it's day it was so beautiful. It's what Izuku was trying to-     "OH SHIT!"     Thud!     "Fuck, that hurt like a bitch,"he muttered as he sat up, looking around the forest as he processed the embarrassment of tripping over a fucking rock-Wait! A rock?     Izuku picked up an examined the awfully large offending piece of stone. It looked like rubble from, a temple! Excitedly, Izuku got up and looked around, and sure enough, the temple was right there. After gently setting down the rock he had been fortunate enough to trip on, he raced over to the temple, stopping only when he was about to go up the steps. It was rude to run in temples, and his mother didn't raise a rude kid.     "Whoa, it's beautiful," Izuku murmured as he looked around the inside of the ancient ruins. "I mean, it definitely is one major fixer-upper, but it's nothing I can't handle, right?"     Izuku began to clean(attempting to level the feeling of unease, as if someone was watching him), starting with the obscene amount of moss and overgrowth.     Then, about an hour into his cleaning, he saw them. The statues of the ancient gods and goddesses. The first statue he approached was the nearest one, and arguably the dirtiest. It-no, that doesn't feel right-They were covered in at least 2 inches of dirt and dust, as well as covered in vines. A moth or two seemed to have nested in part of the altar that Izuku believed was dedicated to this god, and parts of the stone seemed, cracked.     "I can't believe someone left you here to, be forgotten," he whispered as he reached out and brushed his hand against the statues cheek, getting a feeling as if the statue flinched from his touch.      "It's alright, I promise I won't ever harm you. I'm here to help you." Izuku reassured it, before going to gently remove the vines. There was a lot, but Izuku was able to remove them easily with his pocket knife, slicing into them before gently pulling them off and setting them in the pile of greenery he had made.      Next was the dust, which was more difficult. Izuku was able to make a makeshift feather duster using some moss and some twine, and while it didn't work to well, it certainly got a huge portion of the job done, sparing his handkerchief.      After finishing with the dusting, Izuku stood back to examine his work. They looked so much better, and seemed to have a bit of life to them! "You look so much better now," he told them. "There wasn't much I could do about the cracks, and I didn't want to get rid of the moths, in case you actually like them and are ok with them being there. But hey, maybe someday I'll be able to finish cleaning everything up! And after that, maybe we can get this temple back in buissness!"     Izuku wasn't exactly confident that he could actually fix everything, but hey, a guy could dream, right?     The boy with the green hair approached Keigo next, and Dabi felt a surge of protectiveness as he touched the stone that his husband had become. After seeing how that boy had treated Tomura, he knew that he should probably be calmer about this, but that boy touched his husband's wings. He felt that unforgivable.     "Wow, your wings are beautiful, even in this condition." He murmured as he lightly ran his hand over the rocky statue that Dabi's husband had become. Dabi was seething, and a few of the braziers lit up in flames for a few seconds before going out, causing the kid to flinch.     "Ok, the wings are off limits, got it."     If statues could laugh, Spinner would have when Dabi tried to incinerate the green-haired kid. It was clear that someone was a little overprotective. And if he knew Toga, there was no doubt that she was laughing as well.     After a long day of cleaning, Izuku had left some sacrifices and fallen asleep, and the next morning he woke up to a blonde girl with fangs and red eyes standing over him.     "Guys, he's awake!" She yelled.And Izuku screamed.
