completion: Whoever put Dabi in charge of recruiting was a dumba**.  Tomura worked hard to forget that he was that dumba**.Ever since Dabi had recruited Hawks, the League had become loud.  Somehow having Toga and Twice didn’t count as being loud – having Mister Compress performing and using his theatrics didn’t count as loud – even Tomura and Spinner’s game nights where they screamed and cursed didn’t count as loud.But Dabi and Hawks were loud.Whenever they were in the same room together, they were constantly antagonizing each other, throwing insults and trading snark, sneering and mocking as often as they were breathing.It was a wonder either of them managed to survive the recruiting process.As they had yet another petty argument only one couch over from Tomura, he really regretted that they’d both survived…“Oh my god,” Spinner groaned, slamming his controller onto the coffee table. “Just kiss already! I can’t take all this b***hing anymore!”Dabi and Hawks, sitting on opposite ends of the same couch, looked to the other with disdain and clear revulsion.“Ew,” they managed to say simultaneously. “Anybody but him!”  They made gagging noises and dramatically stretched as far away as possible.Spinner shook his head as he threw his hands in the air and left. “I can’t do this – I need a break,” he muttered as he stormed off, and Tomura watched him go with a betrayed ‘tch’.  There went their game night…He turned annoyed red eyes onto Dabi and Hawks who had both ‘miraculously’ recovered from Spinner’s suggestion.  They were watching him in turn, each calculating something in their minds, and it sent a shudder down Tomura’s spine.  A strange warmth that felt like anticipation coiled in his stomach, and as they assessed him, he found that he didn’t want to move.“I did say anybody,” Dabi announced like it made any sense.  He stood with a shrug, long legs carrying him in a smooth glide as he crossed to Tomura – and kissed him.“Yeah, anybody will do,” Hawks agreed, and before Tomura could process what just happened, he was being kissed by the hero.Each kiss was just a simple peck, a gentle touch of lips that came and went within a heartbeat, but they made Tomura’s head spin.  They’d been so quick and so soft, he wasn’t sure they’d even happened – until he blinked and realized that both Dabi and Hawks were still standing before him and smirking.Tomura blushed so fast that he dusted his gaming controller. -- It continued like that.  Dabi or Hawks (or both at times, and that always left Tomura dizzy from the attention) would just kiss him out of nowhere, or touch his hand, or move some hair behind his ear.  Really, it was any sort of interaction, but they would each have to do it, so Tomura experienced many sensations in stereo.It was so random that Tomura didn’t know how to bring it up, so he just didn’t.  And Dabi and Hawks, who couldn’t have a normal conversation if it saved their lives, certainly never explained it.  So, they all just… continued whatever this was.Tomura didn’t have the words, but he… didn’t hate it.  Receiving so much touch and attention from two people that he knew and trusted was… alright.  It made his skin tingle pleasantly, and it made his face warm, and it made his heart race with, dare he say, excitement.So, yes, it was certainly weird and unexpected, but it wasn’t bad. -- It wasn’t bad until they apparently turned it into a competition.Really, Tomura felt like he should’ve already realized, but both Dabi and Hawks were very passionate people.  They took things to the extreme, so this shouldn’t have been a surprise, but Tomura just hadn’t thought of it!What had started as a simple kiss from two of his party members quickly became… a bit more than that.“Hey,” Dabi narrowed his eyes as Hawks pulled away from a kiss that (short and sweet as it was) made Tomura a bit breathless. “Don’t go getting ideas,” he warned.Hawks raised an eyebrow, narrowing his own eyes in annoyance as he assessed Dabi. “What’re you talking about? I did the same thing you did.”“No,” Dabi growled. “You kissed him for two seconds instead of one.”“Bulls***!” Hawks argued, but Dabi ignored him.Electric blue eyes locked on Tomura, and before he could even get his breath back, he found Dabi’s lips on his again – only this time, Dabi also used his tongue.  It started as a wet swipe that startled Tomura into gasping, and then he was tasting Dabi.  Before he could identify the flavor, Hawks was forcing them apart with an irate screech.“You’re such a f**king b*****d,” Hawks growled, glaring at Dabi before those bright gold eyes locked onto Tomura.  He opened his mouth to say something and got a hero’s tongue in his mouth for his trouble.  Hawks kissed like he was trying to erase Dabi from Tomura’s memory, a memory that could really only identify that Hawks tasted faintly of canned coffee with a hint of the 11 secret spices in KFC’s mysterious blend.The look of hunger and delight that gazed down at Tomura had his heart racing and his mind stopping and his toes curling.It only got more intense from there.Dabi and Hawks never explained their competitions to Tomura, but he soon found himself to be the subject matter of several things.  Competitive kisses quickly progressed to “who can make Tomura blush the brightest” to “who can pull the most noises from him” to “who can get the loudest noises from him”.It was only as Tomura lay panting and blissed out that Dabi and Hawks would compare notes before watching him again.“You didn’t even touch along his side – he’s sensitive there.” Dabi scoffed and trailed his cold fingers below Tomura’s rib cage, making the skin twitch and quiver.  Tomura’s hitched breath pulled Dabi’s eyes back to him, and his mismatched lips relaxed from a smirk to something softer, almost fond.Hawks’ derisive laugh erased the warm look. “And? He’s louder if you caress him here,” Hawks trailed off as tan fingers petted along Tomura’s jawline, forcing his chin up until his neck was exposed.  A whine escaped his lungs, and Hawks’ eyes pinned as his wings trembled. “Hear that?” Hawks whispered in reverence while Dabi rolled his eyes.Regardless of how they tallied their own performances, Tomura couldn’t help but feel that he was the real winner here.  He was pretty sure he’d never received so much positive attention in his life, and he didn’t even have to earn it – they just kept coming back on their own!It wasn’t only kisses that they claimed from him.  They seemed to delight in simple gestures that would make him blush like wiping food from his mouth or touching his hand.  They would crowd him on the couch or in the kitchen, laying their heads on his shoulder or wrapping an arm around his waist.  They would gift him with his favorite snacks or let him eat extra during meals.Somehow, they never offered to cover his share of chores, but as Tomura washed dishes, he found he didn’t mind their constant arguing since it meant they still chose to stay around him even when they didn’t have to.He had become very comfortable around Dabi and Hawks to the point that sitting between them on the couch quickly became his favorite place to be.  Dabi would stretch his arms along the back of the couch and gently play with strands of Tomura’s hair, and Hawks would press against his other side and trail gentle touches on his arm or knee.  Tomura could sleep anywhere, even with his eyes open, but he found that dozing off surrounded by them was the most relaxing.“Hey,” Dabi whispered over Tomura’s head, and Hawks replied with an irritated though inquisitive hum. “You better not hurt him with this.”Tomura wasn’t sure what he was talking about, but Hawks scoffed, tone so insulted that Tomura could picture his sneer. “Speak for yourself,” the hero growled. “You’d better not be leading him on with this.”The conversation was short and made no sense in Tomura’s dozing mind, but he felt himself smile softly regardless.  When he woke up an hour later, they were still sitting with him and holding him gently.“Good morning, Sleeping Beauty,” they whispered, kissing his cheeks softly.He grunted, unaffected by their casual flirts since he heard them so often.  Instead, he looked between them both as he rubbed the sleep from his eyes.  Dabi with his loose t-shirt, cheap hair dye, and his determination to take on the world – Hawks with his model’s smile, hero guise, and his conviction to keep trying.“Yeah,” Tomura murmured before grasping them each by the chin.  Swiftly, he pressed a soft kiss to Dabi’s lips and then Hawks’ before he nodded and stood up. “It is a good morning~”He left the room with a smile on his face as both Dabi and Hawks remained on the couch, stunned into silence and blushing from the unexpected kisses.<<EOFANFIC>>

prompt: write a story about Haikyuu!!,  Not Rated Creator Chose Not To Use Archive Warnings Gen 僕のヒーローアカデミア | Boku no Hero Academia | My Hero Academia (Anime & Manga) Midoriya Izuku & Todoroki Shouto Dabi | Todoroki Touya & Midoriya Izuku Midoriya Izuku Todoroki Shouto Dabi | Todoroki Touya Kidnapping Kidnapped Midoriya Izuku Villain Todoroki Shouto Todoroki Family Drama (My Hero Academia)
completion:
“You continue following him, I'm going to flank!” Izuku shouted to Shouto before hopping into an alley and not waiting for Shouto’s acknowledgement. He hurried along ducking between buildings as he followed the blue light. 
 
Running into a league member had not been expected when patrolling this city. Dabi was someone highly noticeable with his scars so having spotted him was fairly easy. Izuku was semi worried that the other members of the league were lying in wait somewhere out of sight. Why was there just Dabi here? It made Izuku paranoid.
 
But he hopped onwards. Shouto should have already called for backup so if any more members appeared then it should be handled easier with Kacchan and Endeavor no doubt headed this way. Izuku looked to his left, keeping an eye between the buildings at the blue light indicating Dabi’s movement. He was using his fire as propulsion like Endeavor often did and it was a surprisingly quick way to travel.
 
Luckily they had entered the outer edges of the city where there wasn’t much population to worry about. It seemed Dabi was trying to make a quick exit. At least if this turned into a literal fire fight the danger of civilians getting caught in the crossfire had reduced. But he should probably stop Dabi before they reach the city’s limits.
 
Just as he had that thought, the next glimpse he got of the street he was flanking showed no blue light. Adjusting trajectory, Izuku shot out of the alley, worried Dabi had taken a turn somewhere. The moment he bolted onto the street however he just barely missed a fireball launched at him.
 
The unexpected attack had Izuku ducking and rolling across the asphalt in shock. He landed in a crouch and he looked up to see Dabi standing there with a single hand on fire and waiting for him. Gulping, Izuku stood with One for All crackling around him as he took a fighting stance.
 
His head immediately started running through his options. Dabi’s fire would make him a close to mid range fighter. If Izuku did go in to hit him, burns were a guarantee. He’d have to be careful about choosing how and when to hit him to avoid any critical injuries. Ideally he’d have to wait for Shouto or Endeavor to show up to restrain him with their much more heat resistant.
 
“Eh? A little hero, are you going to stop me all by yourself?” Dabi asked, looking mildly amused as he turned up the heat on the fire, even at the distance Izuku stood from him the heat was incredible. If he went in for a strike he’d definitely be burned. As long as he kept Dabi’s escape route cut off though, Shouto should be catching up soon.
 
“Where’s the rest of the league?” Izuku called more than happy to stall this engagement if there was no danger to citizens and back up was only a few moments away.
 
“The league? Far from here.” Dabi said before throwing a bit of fire at him. Izuku dodged to the side and then again as the man fired rapidly at him until Izuku was forced against a building. Another vortex of flames launched at him and Izuku jumped using the building as a backboard to get over the fire and avoid landing in any of the hot spots left in their engagement’s wake.
 
So much for stalling. As Izuku landed he realized their positions were now reversed. Dabi had maneuvered him around so that he was no longer blocking the way out of the city. It was likely going to be a chase again.
 
“Midoriya!” 
 
Izuku felt a weight lift from his shoulders at Shouto’s call to him. They could likely handle Dabi with Shouto’s fire and ice. Shouto could hold Dabi’s attention while he swept in into any openings in the fight to deliver blows. Hopefully with their combined effort they would be able to get him to surrender or Izuku could knock him out.
 
As long as he didn’t run, that is.
 
Izuku found it odd that Dabi was in fact standing his ground instead of running. Maybe he didn’t want them following him back to the league?
 
“Ah, back up finally arrived.” Dabi said, tilting his head and grinning. 
 
“Block his exit with an ice wall!” Izuku called as Shouto slid to a stop beside him. “I’ll try to reposition again to keep him pincered between us.” he said letting the sparks of One for All travel along his legs before launching himself to get around the villain. He could use the ice wall as a springboard to tackle Dabi if need be and it's a backdrop that will minimize structural damage if Dabi decided to keep fighting.
 
He was midway through the air when he felt the rush of cold signaling Shouto’s approaching ice. Perfect now they just needed to-
 
Dabi shot off a fireball right in front of Izuku, throwing off his intended course. With a gasp Izuku ended up with a foot caught in the ice he had been forced against. Another blue flame torrent shot at him forcing him to crouch against the cool surface. Caught between the extreme heat and cold as the flames washed overhead of him.
 
Once it stopped Izuku stood and pulled on his leg, intending to pull himself out and continue the offense. Except he suddenly found it very hard to do so. Confused, Izuku kicked at the ice before noticing that there were no sparks from One for All. His heart plummeted as he reached for the quirk. Only to find emptiness.
 
“Ha, that was quite a fun chase.” Dabi said, shaking his hand and extinguishing the flames before shoving his hands in his pockets. “I hope it was worth the trouble.”
 
“It will be.” Shouto spoke up, also loosening his stance and exhaling a frosty breath. Izuku stood, still in relative shock that One for All felt lost, and watching as Dabi went over to Shouto fairly casually and held out the arm he had his flames shooting from. Wordlessly Shouto tapped it, giving it a thin coating of frost that sizzled and evaporated. Dabi seemed to sigh in relief from it.
 
“T-Todoroki?” Izuku called, foot still lodged firmly in the ice as he tried to register what he was seeing. 
 
“Pft.” Dabi barely held in a laugh as he saw Izuku’s face. “Did you even feel that bullet? I thought it would be more painful considering it destroys quirks.”
 
Confused by those words Izuku finally noticed a pinching sensation in his side. Slowly he looked down to see a hauntingly familiar red bullet lodged there. A quirk erasing bullet. How? Why did Dabi have one? What was happening?
 
“Don’t laugh at him. He’s in shock.” Shouto said with a frown.
 
“Whatever. Let's finish this quickly before dear old Dad comes sniffing around.” Dabi said before rubbing the back of his neck and muttering, “The things I do for you little brother.”
 
Both of them had their full attention on Izuku now.
 
“Eh?” Izuku could only speak weakly. Brother? Dad? He shook his head to try and clear it as every alarm bell rang between his ears. He had no quirk. He had lost One for All. And Shouto…was working with a villain? Since when?





“He’s starting to snap out of it.” Dabi commented as he came towards Izuku. 
 
Izuku began to kick frantically at the ice. He needed to get out of here. Where was Endeavor and Kacchan? Oh wait. He had left it to Shouto to call them. They were never called were they? No backup was coming.
 
Izuku tried to discreetly reach for his phone only to have more ice cement him in place, trapping an arm and sealing off the pocket that held his phone. Izuku’s eyes flickered to Shouto wide with betrayal. 
 
“It’s okay, Izuku.” Shouto said his face was very calm for the situation before a small smile pulled at his lips. “We’re going to help you.”
 
It was the last thing he saw before Dabi hit the back of his neck and his consciousness faded.
 
-=-
 
“What a pain in the neck.” Toya snorted as he drove. 
 
“He reminds me of you.” Shouto said next to him, scrolling on the phone. Toya raised an eyebrow at that before sneaking a glance at said phone where Shouto was looking at the press conference. Their father certainly did look pathetic as he apologized to the public for failing to keep a student safe. That made all the trouble worth it if he was honest.
 
“I don’t see how.” Toya snorted, glancing at the back passenger seat where Izuku lay, bound tightly and gagged. Knocked out again as they transported him to a safer location. 
 
“He’s hurting himself for hero work. All Might and others keep pressuring him to go further. He’d end up dead if we didn’t do this.” Shouto glanced back to check on Izuku as he said it. Toya’s hands tightened on the steering wheel. Ah, so that's why Shouto that this kid should join their own little family. 
 
Now that he thought back on it, Shouto was constantly mentioning Izuku’s condition in their correspondence. The kid certainly took a beating more than once. He remembered seeing the teen at the summer camp invasion. Beat to hell and without working arms and yet he kept pushing himself. It wouldn’t surprise Toya if this kid had his own burning forest incident.
 
“Well, if Natsuo and Fuyumi approve of him, you all can dote on him.” Toya grunted looking away from the sleeping kid. Izuku would be welcomed into the fold, Fuyumi was already excited to have another little brother. “They’ll take care of him for now. Just focus on taking care of Dad with me.”






“Of course.” Shouto agreed, sitting back in his seat. They’d be dropping Izuku off with their two other siblings. Shouto and Toya couldn’t deviate from their roles to do it. Not yet at least. Not until Endeavor was torn from his pedestal and his image nothing but ash. 
 
Then they could be a proper family. And if all of his siblings insisted that they wanted Izuku to be a part of it. Then who was a big brother to say no to them?


“I hope he will like his new home.” Shouto murmured as he looked out the window. 






Toya kept his eyes on the road. Victims of hero society. That's what he and his siblings were. And based off of Shouto’s numerous tales of Izuku, that's what he was too. They’d have to make sure their new brother understood that.






“He will.”
<<EOFANFIC>>

completion: Todoroki and Yaoyorozu were about halfway into their exam when Yaoyorozu got caught up in a close quarters fight with her teacher, Aizawa. Or how they were now viewing him in the fight, Eraser Head. She was able to handle herself decently well, seeing as Todoroki was still hanging in the air by one of the street lights. Even with her quirk being erased at the moment, she was still capable in a hand to hand fight. That was until Aizawa managed to hook his capture weapon around her legs, causing her to fall backwards. They were fighting on one of the buildings rooftops so the moment she began to fall backwards she could feel her feel sliding down the tiles. Trying to save herself Momo tried to grab onto Aizawa's scarf, hoping to make him fall as well. In a quick moment of unfortunate luck, the moment Yaoyorozu reached for the back of the scarf was the same moment Aizawa shut off his quirk, which meant his hair fell back down. Yaoyorozu had no time to react and pull her hand back before it gripped onto, not Aizawa's scarf, but his hair. She expected some sort of noise to come from Aizawa but there was nothing. She managed to let go but she still pulled it quite hard. She was able to land on the balcony of the building and immediately looked up to see if Aizawa was okay. She knew that her goal was to get her and Todoroki out of the arena so they could pass their exam but something about the lack of noise that Aizawa had made after having his hair pulled was concerning. She only grew more concerned when she saw that Aizawa had fallen onto his knees. no reply. It’s silent.

He could remember being surprisingly docile during the first half of their little ‘talk.’ Stuttering and asking useless questions that were all to similar to any Deku would’ve asked, he would’ve hated to think he was rubbing off on him. He didn’t think about UA much, or more that he didn’t want to. Katsuki, that is. He didn’t want to think about the lost opportunities, the classes, the relationships. Life was boring enough as it was without mourning over a lost career with lost people.  So, for a year, after his little expulsion, he went travelling, well, not travelling, just looking. Looking for a life. He had just lost his own. But it didn’t go very well, he slept in a rented car that he had, technically, stolen and ate shit food that he didn’t need to refrigerate because the car was cold enough. He joined a fucking gang aswell at one point, did not last. So, with no money and nowhere to go, Katsuki returned home. Went to community college, got a degree and kickstarted his career the same way his dad did. At a desk. At a call centre. And then at a coffee shop which incidentally happened to be the one Deku favoured which caused for many awkward instances and wordless conversations. But. To his dismay. Katsuki had to land on going back to what Principal Nezu had advised, that he take a job at UA. To teach. And that’s how he ended up were he is, 21, sitting in front of the TV in a one bedroom apartment, kicking ass in Call Of Duty and  pretending to pay attention to what Aizawa had to say in the annual staff meeting. 
“Bakugou?”

 

“Are you listening?”

 

“Young Sensei Bakugou?”

 
 The words were distant and definitely there but Katsuki’s mind wasn’t. It was vivid and concentrated and far, far away. Will you do it?” He could practically touch the frustration oozing out of the question. Trying to figure out the answer to a question you don’t know is hard so he was gonna go with 50/50 chances before someone decided they wanted to play hero.   A private message slid quickly into the side of his screen. To: Bakugou Katsuki

From: Hayashi Kenji

 

He wants u to say something abt future careers at this big assembly coming up.

More often than not it was used to for calling his homeroom students to the Principals office, or saying that one of them had left their underwear strewn halfway hanging out of their locker.  Moving further down the hallway, another noise started to slowly override the high pitched buzz of a woman’s voice with loud crashing chaos. They had scrapped any files on him after he left, any documents, forms or records, they forced the world to forget he ever existed in that school, that world. The teachers didn’t forget though, they couldn’t if they were gonna allow him to take a job there. So, in short, his students thought he was useless. A useless, frustrated, angry bastard just there to tell them what to do. Some of them didn’t think like that, the ones that were like Izuku, they thought it was amazing that he didn’t let his lack of a quirk stop him, that he must be the best person to look for a mentor in because he had the properties of a ‘hero’ but not the life. That wasn’t true, and he hated letting them believe that it was because it wasn’t him who was like that, it was Deku. Except Deku did have the life of a hero but no one knew the true reason why. The true reason was Izuku.  But that didn’t matter right now, right now he was opening the door and taking a sluggish step, preparing himself for whatever mayhem was going on in classroom 1A.And he was glad he did. A couple student pulled at his sleeve, “Sir!”“Sensei, can you-““Hey! Did you hear?! Pro hero De-“Their were sentences left unfinished while they squabbled over his attention. Some of them sat at their desks leaning in when he sat down, which in itself had been made a tedious task, “Sensei, It’s on the news and all of the fan pages!” She was peering over phone with a look that said ‘I’m excited but still not totally sure how to feel about it.’ The girl next to her was squealing right into her ear, “Ahhh it’s so cute, I can’t express it I- I, hmmm oh it’s just so ahhhhhh!!,” None of that made any sense to Katsuki but god, teenage girls never had.The boy next to them just sat their growling insults and threats, Afuru, his quirk consisted of shooting short sharp jets of water from the tops of his fingers in order to slice through things with the effects of lasers. He also happened to have a personality that explained why Katsuki’s own professors hated him so much.  
“Sir, I th- Sir? Er. Sensei?”

What about him? Oh. He must be fucking engaged. Wonder what shit talker managed to get into his cocoon of a head. “Oh shut up!” A Stan of whatever was going on, clearly. “No, I’m serious, nobody’s really given them a proper, heartfelt congratulations, even there really close friends. Or Red Riot and he always makes a big deal when anything like this happens!” He could tell who this was, Kiwama, proper little Sherlock Holmes. “They could just be in shock! Maybe they didn’t know about their relationship either!” That’s a theory. “Yeah and it’s not like Pro Hero Shouto was very open in the interviews when they asked him how he proposed! Dabi leaned against the wall of the decaying building as his little sister slept, curled up under ragged blankets. She was shivering. He wanted to get into bed and cuddle with her, but if Touya woke up with their sister in his arms, he’d throw a fit and probably yell at her. Dabi knew if he shared some memories, Touya might change his tune. But that would destroy Touya. And Dabi knew it would be far worse of all of them if he let that happen. 

The eight year old pulled the blankets tighter around her small body. Dabi finally gave in, crawling under the blankets with her and pulling her trembling body against his. As she was enveloped in his heat, the shakes died down. Gods, she was small. She’d lost weight after he and Touya had agreed to kidnap her (for two vastly different reasons), since a diet of scraps didn’t provide all the protein their father gave her. It had been a month since Dabi had taken her. Since Touya had agreed to kidnap her to piss off their father. Dabi would let him believe it was revenge and revenge only. But he wasn’t going to let Shouto die. 

“It’s okay, sweetheart,” He murmured as Shouto pressed close, huddling against him for warmth, “Big brother’s gonna find you somewhere better to sleep tomorrow.”

“Dabi…?” Her voice was tired and small. Dabi held her closer.

“That’s right,” He said. She’d figured out the name thing quickly, though he could tell she was still confused as to why he was nice to her, while Touya brushed her aside, “I’ll hold you till you fall asleep, okay?”

“What if I wake up and you’re not here?” She asked.

“I’ll always be here. Touya… Doesn’t understand the world very well. He doesn’t know the things that I do. One day, he will understand and realize that you aren’t our enemy,” Dabi reached up and began to stroke her tangled, two-tone hair. He really needed to steal a brush for her one of these days, “Our father is. Always has been, always will be.”

“Why does Touya hate me?” 

“He doesn’t know what we’ve been through,” Dabi said, staring at a crack in the wall, “He’s not supposed to know. I’m here to protect him from that.” He pulled her closer. She’d always been a good secret keeper, not telling Touya anything that Dabi didn’t want her to, “He doesn’t understand. He’s not supposed to. But sooner or later, he might have to.” Gods, he hoped Touya didn’t have to. Maybe with enough time, Touya would just warm up to his sister and the three of them could live safely. Live without the fear that Touya would start abusing his sister out of resentment. Dabi knew Touya was not someone who wanted to hurt others. But his hatred was all directed at the innocent sister who just happened to inherit hell. A hell that Dabi remembered and Touya didn’t. 

Dabi’s hand stilled, his gaze still on the crack on the wall. He couldn’t let Touya go on not knowing who the real enemy was. The person who deserved to die was not Shouto. And their bastard father had Touya thinking that, not only was he undeserving of love, but that Shouto was the reason for it. But the trauma that would reveal the truth… It was Dabi’s burden to bear, and not Touya’s. Not something Touya should ever have to remember.


‘Why? Why keep her around?’

 Touya’s thoughts drifted through Dabi’s consciousness. Dabi, perhaps out of spite, perhaps out of a need to protect her, pulled Shouto closer to their body. 


‘Because she isn’t our enemy,’

 Dabi told him, 

‘Please. Trust me.’


Radio silence. Dabi tried a few more times to reach out, but it seemed Touya had gone back to sleep. He sighed and looked down at Shouto again. She was staring up at him, eyes wide and cautious.

“It’s okay. It’s Dabi,” He said, “You don’t need to worry, okay?”

“...” No response.

“Something happen, sweetheart?” He watched her, and loosened his hold in case she was being squeezed too tight. She just stared at him. Waiting. Dabi felt his stomach drop. 

“Who are you?” The frightened child before him asked in a small, hushed voice. He should’ve expected this. Looking back, he should’ve figured it out weeks ago. Should’ve figured it out when she kept spacing out (he’d thought she was just tired), should’ve figured it out from the way she sometimes looked at him like she wasn’t who he was (he’d assumed it was because of Touya), should’ve figured it out when she seemed to be putting on a front (he’d believed she was merely trying to hide how upset or sad or scared she really was). No. No he should’ve known the pain would be too much for one to bear for his successor too.

Dabi realized he’d frozen up. The child was still watching him. Still waiting.

“I’m Dabi,” He said, “I’m your big brother. What’s your name?”

“I…. I don’t have one,” The child said, lowering their gaze, “... Where am I?”

“Somewhere in Yamaoka,” Dabi said softly, “I can’t remember where, not exactly.”

“...” The child inched closer, trembling all over. Dabi carefully wrapped his arms around them. The child pressed their face against his chest. Dabi tightened his hold and began to stroke their hair. 

“It’s gonna be okay. This is all new, and scary, but it’ll be okay. I’m going to keep you safe, okay?” Dabi said. 

More silence.

Chapter Text
Sora was a fit, light-skinned girl, with long flowing black hair that fell to the small of her back when it was down but mainly kept it in a messy bun on top of her head. With piercing blue eyes, she was ranked in the top three of the entrance exam and was now in her final year at U.A. With Shouta Aizawa as her homeroom teacher, she worked hard and kept herself out of trouble. She was fairly popular and talented on the acoustic guitar. While she never felt her quirk, Shadow Dogs, was as powerful as the other students, she did extremely well in quirk assessment tests and practical quirk usage. With her quirk, she could touch the ground and summon two demon dogs who would attack, guard her, and use flash fire as a ranged attack. If a dog got taken out and was down for the count her stamina dropped for up to an hour. She could use the flames, but they would not be as effective as before.  For the past few months, she had been training and helping Shinso with fighting and other schoolwork. She wasn’t sure how much help he needed as he seemed to excel. Meet at Gym Gamma to take their aggression, she trained him more in hand-in-hand combat.     She headed over to Shinso’s to help him. She was a bit cranky as the training day was rough. The training had been more strenuous than most days, and Kaminari and she had been bickering about their quirks. It was a dreary day, misty rain was falling and cooling the air. The leaves fell from the trees, crunching under her boots as she walked. Pumpkins sitting on porches decorating front stoops.She knocked on the front door. As Shinso had yet to move into the dorms yet the plan was to have him move in with Shouta at the end of the month at the dorms, he was living with Shouta as he adopted him early into his start at U.A.“Hello, Mr. Aizawa, umm Shinso wanted me to come over?” She asked as she looked around, she fidgeted with the promise ring on her necklace. “Yes, come in, I’ll get him.”   She stepped inside and took her shoes off, gripping her bag tightly. She checked her phone and stepped further inside.Shinso met her at the entrance, and they went and sat down at the table, Shinso sat next to her when she took her book out.“You’re a year under me so I don’t know why you need my help,” she said suddenly,  “You are super smart.”“You’ve helped me a lot. I appreciate it.” He had been holding a secret over the time she’s been helping him.  She looked over at him and she felt him take her into a kiss, she was taken aback. And shoved him off of her, she gasped and smacked him across the face. With more force than she intended his nose started to bleed. “What the fuck! I HAVE A BOYFRIEND!!!” She yelled, “Fucking creep! Jesus! Wait until Kaminari hears about this. You’ll be sorry!” She jumped up from her seat, grabbed her things angrily, and stormed out of the room. She was putting her shoes on trying to balance against the wall. She heard Shouta go into the kitchen.Shouta went into the kitchen and looked at him, “What did you do?”“Leave me alone, I’m going to my room.” He said and stormed off."Bastard," She mumbled slamming the front door.When she got back to the dorms, she found Kaminari sitting and charging his phone. She shoved Kacchan out of the way. She pulled the charger out of his mouth and kissed him, she was shaking. “Everything okay?” Kaminari said, pulling from the kiss, and pulling her onto his lap. “Fucking Shinso tried to make a move on me. Fucking creep tried to ram his tongue down my throat. Jesus, I feel…Ugh…I’m going to take a shower and go to bed. Oh my god! Just…Oh my MY GOD!!!” She shuddered. -During the night she couldn’t sleep, so she snuck over to Kaminari’s room. She knocked on his door. He let her in, and she laid next to him, snuggling against him. His warmth soothed her, the sound of his heartbeat. “Can’t sleep?” He said kissing the top of her head.“No, I should have figured something was going on, but I didn’t and I feel stupid.”“It’s fine, it happens. Just try to get some rest, I’m here for you. Remember the first time you snuck into my room?” He asked laughing. “The first time we slept together,” She said laughing, “It was after we got our pro hero permits.”“You know I bragged to all the guys about it after too.” “Th-that explains a lot actually,” she said, yawning. She eventually dozed off.He woke her up early so she could sneak back to her dorm without getting caught. During class that day, she just sighed. Her work wasn’t as great as usual which considering she was an honors student, said a lot about her state of mind.  She saw Shouta throwing glances over at her and kept asking her questions. During lunch, Kaminari confronted Shinso. “What the fuck dude! You think it’s okay to make moves on other people's girlfriends!!” He yelled glaring at him. Kirishima stopped him before he could do anything, “This isn’t over!!”Shinso shifted his bag and left the lunch hall.Sora shoved her tray away. Kacchan looked at her.“Eat, you damn nerd.” He said, shoving the tray back at her. She glared at him, “Fine…”- After school ended that day, Kaminari found Shinso and was ready to take a swing at him. “She doesn’t deserve you, you are the class clown, you don’t take your work seriously. She could do so much better with someone who would help her excel at her work and turn her quirk into something amazing.” Shinso said, smirking, baiting him.“Who are you to tell me….” He stopped mid-sentence….he was brainwashed.“Now, give me your phone,” Shinso said, taking the phone from Kaminari. He unlocked it and sent a text. He handed the phone back, “Walk away.”Kaminari walked off, Kacchan saw him, “Hey where’s Sora?” Kaminari just stared off into space. “HEY, YOU DAMN LIGHTING BOLT I’M TALKING TO YOU!” He slapped Kaminari.“Hey Kacchan, when did you get here? Where am I?” He said looking around.“Where’s Sora? I’m supposed to help her with something.” “I don’t know.”-Back at the dorms, everyone was winding down for the day. Sora ran into the dorm. She had tears brimming, Kaminari went to smile at her when he saw the pure distress. She touched the ground, her shadow dogs stood waiting for a command.“YOU BASTARD! 3 YEARS AND YOU BREAK UP WITH ME OVER TEXT!” She screamed.“Oh shit!” Kirishima exclaimed and got up to hold her back.She was shaking. “I didn’t!! I didn’t send you a text I swear!” Kaminari said, “I swear! I promise you!”The dogs started snarling, feeding off her rage, Shouta came running into the tv area. He erased Sora’s quirk, and her dogs disappeared. “How could you do this to me, I fucking love you!!! You….I can’t….let me go…” She begged.“Sora, I swear!!! I did not!!!!” “Look at your phone, you damn idiot!!!!,” Kacchan said with a sigh. Kaminari took his phone out and saw the text. “I didn’t send this; I would have never, it doesn’t even sound like me.” He said, reading the text and shaking. ~ Sora, you’ve done nothing but hold me back, you can do so much better. Don’t ever talk to me again, stay away from me and my friends if you know what’s good for you. ~ “Come on you two, my office now,” Shouta said, grabbing them in binding cloth.  After he pulled them away. “That text didn’t sound like Kaminari, something’s weird,” Kirishima said. “It doesn’t concern us, drop it,” Kacchan said. “They are our friends!” He snapped, worried about his friends.-- They sat down in Shoutas office and Kaminari stared at the floor, tears brimming.  Shouta stared at them, red eyes narrowing at them.“Now, I am going to ignore one of you who was dumb enough to try and use their quirk in the dorm area…for now. But I will not have my students screaming at each other. You are almost adults, act like it. You both are under house arrest, and I expect an apology letter on my desk at the end of the week.  You got me?”“Yes, Mr. Aizawa,” They both said. They left his office, and started to walk back to the dorms.

Disclaimer: Boku No Hero Academia belongs to Horikoshi Kouhei. Persona 5 belongs to Atlus. The Ch-ch-changes series belongs to me, for whatever that’s worth. (Probably not that much.) This fanfic is rated PG by the Motion Picture Association for occasional language and adult themes.
For The Best
It was for the best. That was what Nana kept telling herself, anyway. She’d already lost her husband to her hero career; she couldn’t bear it if the same monsters took Kotarou too. He’d be safe, that was the important thing; safe from the villains and safe from… from All For One. Nana’s hand tightened on the phone as she tried to nerve herself up to make the call. It was for the best, for Kotarou’s safety. Only her own selfishness, the tiny voice inside her crying out against giving up her child, her baby, was holding her back. It would hurt him, she knew, to lose her so soon after losing his father, but… he would be alive to hurt. Beyond the reach of those who would harm him. It was for the best.Taking a deep breath, Nana lifted the phone, but as she moved to dial, something blue flashed past her eyes, too quickly to process. She spun to follow it, and knocked several books and folders from her work desk to the floor. For a second, she simply stood, eyes scanning the room for any hint of what she might have seen, but she could find nothing. Finally, with a slightly nervous laugh, she knelt down and began to gather up the scattered items.A piece of cardstock caught her eye– a card, from her mother’s funeral so many years ago. Something about it tugged at her memory, and she picked the card up as she cast her thoughts back. He’d called himself a cousin, she remembered, distant on her mother’s side. Tracking down family members, he’d sadly come too late. “But family’s important,” he’d told her softly, presenting the card. “If you need anything, ever, give us a call.”Kurusu Akira, the card said, in a precise calligraphy that would have made her teachers weep with joy. And under that, a phone number. It was probably no longer good, she’d had the card for years, but… it was certainly worth trying. Kotarou would be safer, happier, better off with family. If it failed, she could always call foster care next.Something scrabbled in the back of her head, warning of the dangers of connections that could be traced, but she pushed it away, buoyed up by a sudden wave of conviction.This truly was for the best.—Hearing the balcony door slide open, Akira looked back over his shoulder, unsurprised to see Gorou coming out to join him. For a second, the two of them simply stood side by side, looking out over the grounds of the Okumura mansion and the brilliant cityscape beyond. Finally, Gorou sighed.“Mother and son are currently settled in the Green Suite, with Morgana ensconced on the end of the bed and purring for all that he’s worth. Kotarou-kun is asleep; Nana-san should be following him shortly.”Akira nodded. “Think they’re going to stay?”“I do. You made a very compelling case for our ability to hide them both, and I like to think Haru and I both made a very compelling case for just how much Kotarou needs to know that his mother cared enough not to throw him away in favor of her career.”“You don’t believe that.” After three hundred years, Akira was more than confident enough in his ability to read his partners that he could state that without doubt. “No, and neither does Haru, but putting it that way managed to punch through the haze of panic and self-denial that was blinding her.”To say the least. Akira remembered the expression on his cousin’s face when Gorou had pointed out, voice never wavering from its usual pleasant mildness, that Kotarou would likely not understand her reasoning, seeing only that his mother had chosen to walk away and leave him truly alone. It would probably have been less hurtful to slap her. Leaning in, Akira brushed one shoulder against Gorou’s. “You okay?”“... Oddly enough, yes. My mother’s choice was a selfish one, but I’ve long since forgiven her for being young, desperate, and in far too much pain to continue on. Nana-san, though… I’d swear she’s very much the opposite– so focused on serving others that she’s lost sight of them as people, rather than as principles or ideals.”He chewed his lip for a moment, red-brown eyes distant. “When she realized that we could absolutely keep ‘Kurusu Nana’ and ‘Shimura Nana’ separate and distinct entities in the eyes of the world, including the Hero Commission, I thought she would cry. Have you ever seen anyone so terrified and fighting so hard against something they truly desire?”“You did,” Akira replied. “When we tracked you down, after the ship, after Yaldabaoth and Maruki’s fuckery. Haru told you to stop being a dumbass and come home. Seriously thought you’d gone into a coma for a second.”Gorou laughed softly. “So did I. I didn’t think I deserved forgiveness, and I’m still not sure why you gave it. Any of you.”“Shidou was a powerful fucker, Yaldabaoth was worse. You were trying to survive, made bad choices, and yes, fucked up, but people do fuck up. You stopped, tried to be better.” Akira shrugged. “Is all anyone can ask.”“Do you ever get tired of being ridiculously insightful and right?”Akira snickered. “Nope. Comes with bein’ thief of hearts, ne? Gotta know what you’re stealing.”“Are you two flirting again?” Morgana asked, coming out through one of the many cat flaps the mansion was equipped with. His ears weren’t turned back, though, so it wasn’t as though he was actually upset.“May not ever have stopped,” Akira commented. “They asleep?”“Yeah,” Morgana replied, hopping up to sit on the balcony railing alongside him. “And there is very definitely something cognitive on her. She couldn’t hear me talk, but she seemed to pick up at least some of the meaning anyway. Smells more like Sumire when Maruki was working on her than anything, though.”Akira and Gorou traded glances. Maruki’s third Wild Card hadn’t been caught up in whatever had affected the rest of the Kaitou-dan, instead living a long and full life before passing peacefully away long before the advent of Quirks. There were times Akira wondered if she’d gotten the better deal… but not that often.“Manipulated cognition, then?” Gorou asked.Morgana made a see-sawing motion with one paw. “Kind of? It’s more like what Maruki and Azathoth were doing, but it’s… more subtle. I don’t know what it is, but if they’re going to be living with us, I guess we’ll have time to find out, huh?”…. As it turned out? Not so much.Owari<<EOFANFIC>>

Chapter Text
“Is there really a God for everything?”Seven-year-old Katsuki blurted as his mother tucked him into bed.“Well, I don’t know about everything, but many things yes.”“How about the Sun and Moon?”“Ah, Apollo is the Sun God, though Helios, a Titan-God, came before him. The Moon Goddess is the lovely lady, Selene.”The little one groaned, dragging his hands down his face.“What’s the matter?”“We’re learning about the Gods at school and some kid dared to challenge me about knowing more about the Gods than I do,” Katsuki huffed, “Now I have to study and be better than everyone, but there are so many gods! This is going to take forever.”His mother laughed, combing her fingers through Katsuki’s hair. He always was competitive, his drive helped him become nothing but the best during his endeavors and his mother couldn’t be prouder.“Well then, you’ll need a good night’s sleep if you want to have enough energy to study tomorrow. Good night, Katsuki.”“G’night, mom.”——————————“Izuku? Izuku, honey, where are you?”The lady looked around for her son. Hearing chirps and little giggles, she peaked her head over the cloud she stood on.“Hello to you, too, Mr. Robin!” Seven-year-old Izuku was giggling under a legion of birds fluttering around his head.One-by-one, they left his side and flew to the bushes, each plucking a flower before returning and placing the flowers in his hair.Curiously, he ran to the nearby pond to look at his reflection, instantly beaming when he saw the fresh flower crown the birds had weaved through his hair.“Izuku.” His mother descended, greeting her son with a warm smile.“Mom! Look!” Izuku excitedly scrambled to Gaia, showing off his hair.“You look lovely my dear, have you been playing here all morning?”“Yeah! Look what I found out I could do!” Izuku excitedly looked around until he found a few dead, drooping, brown flowers in a bush. Gently, he blew on them and they came back to life.He whipped his head back to his mother, “See!” he smiled.Gaia returned the gesture, growing a little excited herself, “You’re powers are beginning to develop! Come! Let’s tell your father.”The two returned to the clouds and flew until they could see the peaks of Mount Olympus.At their tower, Gaia called for her husband and of course, he came immediately, a glass of wine in hand.With an arched brow, the long-black-haired man took a sip as his stared at his wife and son.“Oh don’t be like that Dionysus, Izuku has something to show you,” she cheered.“Great, what does the little rat need now?” he feigned annoyance, but Izuku and Gaia knew better, Dionysus has always been a softy.Gaia, The Goddess of Earth produced two dead flowers from her hand and brought it to the boy.Dionysus, The God of Fruit and Vegetation peered curiously.And Izuku, son of Gaia and Dionysus, God of Flora and Fauna, breathed life into them.——————————“Your Gods and Goddesses Unit Tests have all been graded and inputed into Canvas. Take the next ten minutes to look it over and check for any mistakes in your grades.”Katsuki opened his phone and scrolled to find his score, smirking when he found the perfect 50/50 points under the test.“Bakugo! What’d you get?” Neito Monoma approached.“A hundred percent,” Katsuki responded, a smug look of victory plastered across his face.“Dammit!”“Monoma, watch your tongue.” Mr. Aizawa scolded from his corner in the room.“I don’t know what you expected,” Mina Ashido commented, back turned in her seat to look between the two blonds, “Bakugo’s gotten ninety-percents on nearly every test we’ve taken since second grade!”“Nineties is not a hundred! I got a ninety-seven, I thought I had a chance!” Monoma argued.“Not to mention that the Gods and Goddesses happen to be his favorite and strongest subject.” Denki Kaminari pointed out.“I’m surprised you haven’t given up, yet, Monoma. You haven’t won any of your little disputes since we were seven; it’s been five years!.”Katsuki couldn’t help but preen at the recognition. It was true. He’s the absolute best in his class and probably the whole school if he does say so himself.——————————Viridian eyes welled with tears as he watched the kids stomp around the garden. His garden. His little private getaway that he’s been nurturing for five years; since he first earned his powers.“Stupid Izuku! You seriously are the most useless God ever!” One of the kids screamed after squashing his favorite Cattleya Orchids.“Yeah! Just a copycat nature God!”“For real! Why are you even here? ‘Flora and Fauna?’ What a ripoff!”“Exactly! God of plants? We already have Lady Demeter! And Lady Artemis of beasts and animals! Even your parents are already Gods of crops and earth!”“What are you even good for?”“Useless!”“Copycat!”“Worthless!”“No good!”
“Deku!”
 ——————————“No! Not like that you moron!” Katsuki marched up to Denki, “You’re right-handed, aren’t you? Use your left hand to hold the bow and draw with your right hand.”“Ohhh no wonder it felt wrong…” Denki mumbled under his breath, unfortunately not quiet enough for Katsuki to not hear as shown by the way he facepalmed.“Bakugo? We have a problem…” Tsuyu approached the blond, a very red-faced Eijiro in tow, “Kirishima accidentally shot an arrow into the forest.”Katsuki felt his face drop in disbelief. “You’re kidding, the forest is literally on the opposite side of the targets.”Eijiro blushed harder to the point where Katsuki could barely differentiate his face from where his hair began, “Sorry bro…”From the side, Denki and Mina cackled, “Don’t go too hard on him Blasty! Not everyone has been honing their archery skills since they were kids.”“And it’s not my problem that you all were just slackers!” Katsuki barked, pulling his quiver off and handing it to Tsuyu, “You’re in charge of the extras while I’m gone or until Mr. Aizawa comes back, you’re… okay with your bow so I trust that you can help them if they need it.”The green-haired girl smiled at the (half) compliment and nodded once before Katsuki took off towards the direction of tall trees and turning trails.
The forest was a pretty thing; Of deer and rabbits and squirrels and birds, or foxes and bears and leopards and bats. But other than the Woodland Creatures, there were also the common Little Folk and Mysticals; Nymphs, faeries, fae, griffins, hippogriffs, pegasi, and much more to count; all gifts and spawns from the Gods.But Katsuki wasn’t worried about that. Surely there wouldn’t be anything more dangerous than a rabbit this close to the edge of the forest.He ran to the general location Tsuyu had pointed him to, jumping over rocks and bushes, leaping over thin streams.He gave the location a once over, catching the blue-feathered end of the arrow in a blackberry bush and approached it, carefully tugging on the shaft and avoiding the bush’s thorns.Once he had it in his hand he swiftly turned around to make his way back to the village… before freezing in place.Two bear cubs were standing right in front of him with tilted heads, eyeing the blackberry bush now behind him.Shit. A bead of sweat rolled down his temple, If there are two cubs here, then that means—

SNAP

Katsuki whipped his head towards the cracking branch.“…the mother is not far behind…”
<<EOFANFIC>>

Chapter Text
"Why do we have to leave?!" one 6-year-old Bakugo Katsuki yells with his arms crossed stubbornly over his chest, his bottom lip jutted out adorably so, resembling a pout. Izuku internally coos at the child actually acting his age."It's not safe." The demon responds simply. Tsubasa, Katsuki's friend that he was previously playing with, was about to be attacked by a villain (his guardian angel, Lucian, will surely protect him). He didn't want Katsuki to get caught in the crossfire.Izuku unfolds his wings (pitch black with some dark green fathers placed in randomly. He still doesn't quite know where the green comes from, but he suspects it's from a past life of his) from their previous place on his back, gently nudging Katsuki along the sidewalk with the feathery limb."Once we get home, I'll make you some spicy Katsudon, ok?""Promise?" Katsuki asks, peaking up at Izuku through his bangs.Izuku grins, his sharp canines digging into his bottom lip, most likely drawing blood but he can't find it in himself to care. "Promise." he repeats, booping Katsuki on the nose with his pointer finger, smiling at the disgusted noise the child makes."And demons never break their promises, y'know. It's against the rules.""Really?" Katsuki asks curiously, his pout drooping into a curious frown."Mhm." Izuku nods. "We'd die if we broke it." he says, drawing his clawed thumb over his neck and lolling his tongue out to prove his point. Katsuki giggles in response, and Izuku swears it would warm his heart if he had one.He usually doesn't like kids (he thinks that their useless and sticky and gross and disgusting. He doesn't understand why people would willingly give birth to the nasty things), but somehow Katsuki has effortlessly wiggled himself into his heart (figuratively speaking since, once again, Izuku does not have a heart)."Hey 'Zuku, how come no one else talks to their demon? Are they stupid or something?"Izuku chuckles, ruffling Katsuki's fluffy locks, ignoring the child's grumbles at the action. "Not everyone can see or talk to their guardian. The fact that you can makes you very special, Katsuki." he explains, locking eyes with an angel from across the street. He nods his acknowledgement, and the angel does the same. They don't have to like each other to respect one another."Hell yeah!" Katsuki yells with a grin, pumping his hands in the air. Izuku refocuses his attention on the child, raising an eyebrow at the small explosions crackling in his palms, reflecting in his sharp red eyes. "That means I'm better than all of those other extras!"Izuku frowns. How can a 6-year-old have an ego larger than himself?"I didn't mean that it makes you better than anyone. I meant that It makes you unique, and unlike the other children your age." Izuku says, flicking the boys ear. "And stop calling everybody extras until you have the power to back it up.""What do you mean? I do have the power to back it up! I'm the strongest in my class!"Izuku shakes his head, "maybe so, but can you confidently say that if a villain were to cross your path that you would be able to defend yourself without my help?"Katsuki stays silent."Answer me, Katsuki.""No." the boy responds reluctantly, his eyes glued on the pavement below him.Guilt slowly swirls around Izuku's chest. Did he go too far? Was he too blunt? He never did know how to deal with children, often finding ways to make them cry. He had thought that Katsuki could take it, but maybe he misjudged? He is only 6."But that just means that I have to train harder! Noone will be able to defeat me when I'm the number one hero!" Katsuki exclaims, determination swimming in those red eyes of his.Izuku smiles fondly. Katsuki still has much to learn (like how almost everyone is defeatable, and has a weakness. How being physically strong doesn't mean shit if you don't have the smarts to win, and make strategies.), but he still has many years to figure it out. Izuku will be there every step of the way to help him."What's your hero name going to be?" Izuku asks as he steps onto the Bakugo's porch, fishing the keys out of his pocket and unlocking the front door, urging Katsuki into the house with a soft nudge."Great Explosion Murder God!""Ne, don't you think that's a bit long?" Izuku says exasperatedly, ducking into the house, and closing the door behind him. If he stands up straight, he'll bump his head on the ceiling and make yet another hole (and Mitsuki was not happy about the first, let it be known), so he shrinks himself to a more comfortable size. Now he stands at about 6'0 instead of his usual 8'5. Honestly, he prefers to be shorter, but it's an unnecessary waste of his power, so he usually just makes do with his normal height."What do you mean, 'Zuku? It's perfect!" Katsuki says with a frown, pulling his sneakers off.Izuku shrugs, rationalizing with himself that Katsuki is 6 years old. In 10 years, his thoughts on his hero name will surely change.Izuku steps into the kitchen and gathers the necessary ingredients for the spicy Katsudon, and places them on the counter, pulling on his apron that reads "Mr. Good Looking is Cooking!". The apron was a gag gift from his best friend Quin'rah, and he wears it just to spite him.Izuku is washing his hands in the sink when Katsuki bounces into the kitchen with a wide grin on his face, "can I help?" he asks, nearly jumping in place. Surprisingly, Katsuki enjoys helping with dinner, and is actually quite good at it."Sure, just wash your hands first." Izuku responds with a smile, stepping away from the sink and drying his hands on the hand towel.After Katsuki's hands are clean (not just rinsed off with cold water), he passes him the already pounded pork chops (Izuku doesn't quite trust the boy with a meat tenderizer just yet). "Season those with salt and pepper, and then coat them with flour." he orders, grabbing a pan from the cabinet and coating it with oil while Katsuki finished his first tasks. He turns the pan on medium heat, before turning back to Katsuki. "Good." Izuku nods in approval, "now dip the pork into the egg, and then into the Panko. Make sure you get both sides."Once Katsuki finishes the task, Izuku shoos him out of the kitchen while he fries the pork and steams the rice. Soon enough dinner is done, and Izuku calls Katsuki to the dinner table."Do you know when my folks are coming back?" Katsuki asks as he takes a seat at the table, taking a large spoonful of his katsudon. His cheeks resemble that of a squirrel's, and Izuku can't help but chuckle at the sight. "I'm not sure. Quin'rah said that they had to go to a fashion show, and those usually run late." he says as he tidies up the kitchen. He doesn't necessarily have to clean the kitchen, but he'd feel guilty just leaving the kitchen a mess after he's the one that dirtied it. His mother's taught him manners (And the Bakugo's would surely blame the mess on Katsuki, anyways).Katsuki grunts and continues to dig into his food.For only being 6 years old, his parents leave him alone most of the time. They work long shifts, and barely ever take days off to spend time with Katsuki. If anything, Izuku probably spends more time with the kid than his own parents do. And even when they are home, Mitsuki will spend the whole time yelling at Katsuki for any little thing, while Masaru stands and watches.Seeing the way that Katsuki is treated leaves a sour taste in Izuku's mouth, and he is already in the midst of creating a plan to get Katsuki into a better home. The only thing keeping him from going straight to Child Protective Services is his lack of evidence."Hey, 'Zuku?" Katsuki calls, and Izuku peaks his head out of the kitchen. "What's up, kid?""Where you come from, are you like, hot shit there?""First of all, language." Izuku scolds lightly, wiggling a finger at Katsuki with narrowed eyes. "And yeah, I guess you could say that I'm an important person over there. Why do you ask?" He doesn't bother to explain what he means by "Important person", because he just knows that it'll go to the boy's head. Izuku can already hear it now, "My guardian's a king! Take that, you shitty losers!".He really hopes that it's just a phase.Katsuki shrugs, sliding off of his seat with his empty bowl in hand. "'Rah always does that weird head tilt thing when you two are around each other. And every time another guardian sees you, they do it too." he says, trudging into the kitchen and dropping his bowl into the sink. "And they all act like a buncha pussies around you."Izuku hums, grabbing the bowl out of the sink and loading it into the dishwasher. "Where I come from, it's a show of respect." he explains, "You only bow to people who you acknowledge are superior to you, and stronger. Not doing it is basically asking for a fight."Katsuki grins sharply, and Izuku immediately knows that he's said the wrong thing. "So, you're like the king of all demons, or somethin'?""Isn't it past your bedtime? Go get ready for bed." He says in leu of a response, grabbing Katsuki by the shoulders and steering him in the direction of his bedroom. The boy huffs, but otherwise doesn't complain. Izuku's sure that Katsuki is the only child he's met that actually enjoys going to bed early. He even gets mad when kept up past his bedtime. Odd child, for sure, but Izuku's not necessarily complaining. "Night 'Zuku." Katsuki says, wrapping his arms around Izuku's knee, and the demon smiles at the sight. "Night, kid." he says, ruffling the boys spikey blond locs with nothing short of fondness. He's definitely gotten attached, hasn't he?

For a total of 35, just shy of the cut off. Thankfully, Izuku had also applied for General Education, which he had been accepted to, but…It didn’t make any sense…There was a handwritten letter in the envelope.DEAR IZUKU MIDORIYA:AM I A DOG, A BEAR, A MOUSE? WHO CARES! I’M THE PRINCIPAL OF U.A.!I MUST SINCERELY APOLOGIZE TO YOU FOR YOUR PLACEMENT IN THE ENTRANCE EXAM.YOU HAD INDEED EARNED MORE THEN ENOUGH POINTS TO ENTER U.A.’S PRESTIGIOUS HERO COURSE, UNFORTUNATELY, NOT EVERYONE AGREES WITH THIS ASSESSMENT.LEGALLY, I SHOULD NOT BE TELLING YOU THIS, BUT I FEEL YOU HAVE A RIGHT TO KNOW. FOR YOU SEE, THE ENTRANCE EXAM IS NOT THE ONLY WAY TO ENTER THE HERO COURSE! SHOULD YOU DO WELL ENOUGH IN THE SPORTS FESTIVAL, WE WILL BE ABLE TO TRANSFER YOU STRAIGHT INTO YOUR WELL EARNED SEAT IN THE HERO COURSE!TRAIN HARD, AND I HOPE TO BE ABLE TO TRANSFER YOU SOON! UNTIL THEN, YOU SHOULD FIND THE EDUCATION IN GENERAL STUDIES SHOULD SUFFICE! ESPECIALLY SINCE YOU HAVE THE HIGHEST SCORE ON THE GENERAL WRITTEN EXAM, BEATEN ONLY BY A LOVELY YOUNG LADY WHO TOOK THE RECOMMENDATION WRITTEN EXAM.SINCERELY: NEDZU, PRINCIPAL OF U.A.P.S. IN CASE YOU WERE WONDERING, YOU NEED NOT WORRY ABOUT THE COMMISSION FURTHER SABOTAGING YOUR ATTEMPTS TO ENTER THE HERO COURSE. Izuku had come to that conclusion a few years ago, when he realized that his brother in all but blood known as Kacchan had pretty much died that day at the creek all those years ago.Somehow, Bakugo had gotten into his head that Izuku was some creep who always stalked him and looked down on him.Izuku hadn’t bothered trying to follow Bakugo around for several years now.Instead, he devoted himself to training his body. If he was going to be Japan’s first Quirkless Hero, he would need to make sure he could stand toe to toe with his Quirked peers. FUCK!!” The Sludge Villain yelled as Izuku hurled his notebook into his eye. “You little shit! Now I’m gonna fucking enjoy- OW!! I AM HERE!!”Izuku leapt out of the way of a powerful blast of wind that splattered all over the place.All Might blinked as he spotted the young man.“Ah! My apologies young man! It’s far too dangerous. I cannot in good faith encourage this dream of yours. May I suggest being a police officer or even a firefighter?”Izuku stared at All Might, his respect for his idol pretty much dying in that moment.“No thanks.” Izuku said as he packed up his stuff and turned to leave.“Young man, were you even listening to me!?”“Of course! You’re entitled to your own opinion just as much as I’m entitled to ignore it.” Izuku said as he left.He sold all of his All Might merchandise the next day.XXXPRESENT DAY:He was frustrated that All Might was so insistent at screwing over his dream, but it was fine now. He had the encouragement of U.A.’s Principal, and had even managed to impress the apparently hard to impress 1-A Teacher and the rest of the staff.Granted, it wasn’t how he wanted to get into the Hero Course, but it would be okay. He’s train hard, and he would get in through the Sports Festival.He WOULD be a Hero.

Tensei sighed when he got accepted for the job of keeping account of the soon to be king he thought it would be easy. He's just a little kid after all, Tensei even thought it would give him extra time for training. Little did he know instead of improving his fighting skills he would be playing hide and seek.As soon as he ran upstairs he was caught with a little kid with green scruffy hair and covered in freckles looking at the floor like an upset puppy. “Izuku, what did I tell you about staying on the ground floor?” Tensei said, trying to sound sympathetic, Izuku wasn’t like any of the other kids his age. He was very fragile, he was adopted by the seven dwarfs when they found him in the river but ever since then he’s just been passed around each dwarf like an unwanted toy.“It was Kacchans’ idea.” Izuku sniffled. “I d-didn’t mean to break it.”
“Break what?” Tensei twitched he always knew the kids were a bit hyper but to actually break something, this could lose him his job.Izuku pointed at the door which led to the prince's room.
“Katsuki.” Tensei said.
“Katsuki, open the door.”
“No.” A stubborn little voice replied.
“Katsuki, I wont be mad, just open the door.” Tensie was starting to lose his patience
“NO.” Katsuki screamed.
“Don’t make me call your mother.” Tensei said
Silence….. Until Tensei heard the door unlock only to open it to find the Cinderella shoe broken into little pieces.“Shi- shoot, shoot, shoot.” Tensei started to panic
“Calm down four eyes, we’ll just buy a new one.” Katsuki said confidently
“That’s not how it works, Kacchan.” Izuku whispered.
“Shut it nerd, I know how it works, every family gets an heirloom and this heirloom ties them together for eternity blah blah blah.” Katsuki said.
“But you can’t replace it Kacchan!” Izuku shouted.As they bickered Tensei tried to figure out a way he could not get fired by this, Katsuki was right every ‘fairy tail family’ is given an heirloom to go with their story like snow white’s apple or the genie's lamp. This heirloom could never be replaced and if it did the family's story would disappear along with them. A wave of relief washed over Tensei when he realized that the other shoe was probably still intact but even then he would have no idea how to explain how the shoe was broken in the first place.“What’s with all of the screaming-.” said Rumi also known as the brave night Miriko
“Tensei! It’s your job to look after these brats how could you let them-”
“You think Iet them do this, they ran off and disobeyed me. How the hell would I know that they broke A HEIRLOOM.” Tensie shouted his rage had finally got to him
“STILL-” Rumi was interrupted when the sound of heels could be heard down the hall which only meant one thing. The queen.“Quick Katsuki, just give me the glass and I'll find a place to put it.” Rumi scurried

He accepted him as a dumb nerd who could take his place so he could be normal but before he had any time to think about it he heard a trumpet being blown in his face.“ Queen Rei, Prince Endeavor and prince Shoto have arriaved.”

completion: Xanxus knows his patience and control are hanging on by a fucking sliver of a thread during a windy day—have been for a long, long time. Which his right-hand man could attest to. Proof? He's just about ready to slaughter every stupid person in the whole building and then some,  especially those fuckers who came up and organized this shitty-ass meeting, Vongola core member or not. As the simpering fool stutters and sweats throughout his report on the Underground climate in Masutafu, Xanxus forces down a wild snarl, and his grip on the wine glass tightens until fractures can be seen the longer the trash speaks. He holds back from completely destroying the glass, wouldn’t want to waste a perfectly delectable 1947 Château Cheval Blanc. But, it’s a really close thing. Xanxus ignores the simultaneous sigh and gulps from Squalo standing to his side and from the pale as fuck speaker and his people. Well, he scoffs, Bel seems to be enjoying it, if the way he snickers to himself at the corner is any indication. Impatience curls tight in his chest, the Box Weapon on his waist giving a rattling growl, too low for other people to hear. Xanxus finishes the last sips of red wine in agreement.The reason—the  only  reason—Xanxus is not throwing his Wrath Flames around without any care is that Mini-Boss had flat-out  ordered  him to not cause a scene, his normally brown eyes glowing amber, pure Sky Flames flickering on his forehead.At the time, Xanxus had shrugged and agreed (but not without a Flame-coated bullet or two or five that led to an hour-long spar that shook the entire Iron Fort and left Xanxus baring his teeth in animalistic glee at the fact the smaller man had drawn first blood) because the meeting’s only short as fuck, right, Mini-Boss?Wrong. It’s fucking agonizingly repetitive bullshit. Xanxus might as well leave this to the shark trash.(Also, he's impressed that Tsunayoshi is considered Varia Quality after his rise to Neo Primo two years ago. With The World’s Strongest Hitman as a mentor and adviser, the kid had to learn fast or perish. Xanxus is often roped in as Tsunayoshi’s sparring partner, if Reborn is feeling particularly vindictive due to a forced ban away from his beloved coffee, which doesn’t last long cause Mini-Boss folds too fucking quickly whenever Reborn’s involved. Heh, it doesn’t hurt that there’s a chance Xanxus destroys the majority of the Iron Fortress for that slight.)A high-pitched whine disguised as a laugh finally tips the scales. And Xanxus isn’t even doing anything!“Fuck this.”The wine glass shatters which, Xanxus notes with a manic glee, is likened to a series of silencer-enhanced gunshots.Decision made, Xanxus flicks his hand to the side then forces his way onto his feet and bares his teeth in a feral smile when the trash speaker underling and his colleagues flinch. In a few short seconds, Xanxus is storming out of the meeting room and lowly snarling to his present Guardians to  fucking deal with this shit.  And that means don't follow him, dammit, shitty Leviathan!Xanxus ignores the outraged yells and shocked sputtering, strolling out of the meeting room with all the expected grace of a Varia Boss. Good fuckin’ riddance.Now. While he didn't have the revered and envied Vongola Hyper Intuition, Xanxus is pretty fucking proud of his instincts. Saved his neck more times than he can count, especially when he and his mother were out on the streets. In all accounts, his instincts had sharpened after he was taken in by the old fart. Xanxus growls, mind flashing to his sorry excuse of a 'father' and banishing the thought just as quickly.Fuck this to hell and back.Right now, his instincts are screaming for him to get out and walk around, a metallic taste that sets his teeth on edge, fingers twitching for his guns.He needs air and, when he gets back, he sure as fuck needs a big plate of Kobe beef A5 Wagyu Tomahawk steak and a whole bottle of vintage 1945 Domaine de la Romanée-Conti, none of that weak-ass shit the underlings call tea they had  almost  served him.Letting his feet lead him to the automatic doors, Xanxus leaves the skeleton company for the Vongola HQ and picks a random direction, face as stormy as his Secondary Flame.Sky and Storm Flames leak from him in droves, an invisible warning signal for civilians with no talent for Active Flames to keep the fuck away. Xanxus allows his Flames to increase, in both intensity and range.  Let’s see if anyone is suicidal enough to disturb me, he thinks, almost challenging the hypothetical person to pop into existence right in front of him.The farther he’s away from his starting point, the more at ease he feels (well, at ease as one could be while in another country, no matter how Xanxus considers the Land of the Rising Sun as a second home due to a meddling pipsqueak and the same pipsqueak’s oddly sharp mother). While he allows his mind to wander, Xanxus is alert enough to finally notice that he reached a children's park, with no one in sight.Here, he raises a brow.An expansive and high-end park, he notes. But, he tips his head up and scoffs, not as grand and elegant as Vongola’s clearly superior architecture. Xanxus lifts his head further, a refreshing gust of wind ruffling his hair, the familiar brush of a feather caressing his jaw. Breathes in, out. Explosions in the distance, which amuses him; the  heroes  and the  villains seem to be pulling each other’s braids again. Ridiculous, all of them should just fuck the tension out of their shitty little systems.Just as he's about to turn on his heel and go back the way he came, a searching tendril of foreign  Flames snags on his Wrath Flames.The instinctive growl and push cut short as something in him seems to slide into place with a resounding  click.  Xanxus inhales sharply. It's  freefreewarmpreciousprotect.  One thought streaks through his mind, more piercing and more pressing than the rest: mine.Xanxus freezes. Snarls in all-consuming fury writhing in his stomach.The Cloud Flames (tattered, beaten, and what the motherfuckin’ fuck, whoever the fuck did this better fucking beg for their pathetic little life—) flinch back. Hurthurthurtdespairlongingangerhurt, they tremble. Don't like me?Without missing a beat, Xanxus immediately sends strong feelings of unyielding protection, rusty warmth, and fumbling reassurance. When he feels the Cloud Flames settle down into a nervous hum instead of a scratch along a chalkboard and begin to hesitantly prod along his own, Xanxus walks to the bench by the side and sits down in front of the hideous hidey-hole every shitty park seems to have.Which, he hums, is right across from the presence. A pause, a terrified and questioning air from the other makes Xanxus snort.Soon, hesitant footsteps round the tube-thingy and Xanxus locks on the way the kid—of course, it’s a kid; in his experience, anyone older than 12 with a functioning danger radar as well as a healthy dose of mistrust would steer the fuck away—is favoring his left foot, though he tries to hide it behind defiant eyes and a clenched jaw.Xanxus places his hand on Bester's box as the box weapon rattles.Bester  purrs. "Hey, brat," Xanxus says, sends his Flames flaring in the air, satisfied when the white-haired boy relaxes. "Do you want to leave?"The kid’s expression crumbles, just slightly, but Xanxus catches it before  yesyesyes!angerhatelonging   relief  blares from his Flames. Then, actual blue flames lick along the kid’s forearms, higher and higher until they reach his shoulders. Clothing blackens and burns away, the skin underneath starting to pink and blister. "Yes."Xanxus bares his teeth into a resemblance of a smile but he knows it’s too sharp and vicious to be considered one. But, hey. The way the kid perked right up is enough for Xanxus. — “Another town saved by our Number One Hero—All Might! Onlookers and fans alike have expressed their gratitude—excuse me. H–huh? Oh, dear. Viewers, breaking news: a forest fire is ravaging a mountain at this moment. More of this grim story with the reporter on the scene. Yamato-san?” "Thank you, Hinata-san. We're here, live, near the mountains of Masutafu City. As you can see,  blue  flames have started a forest fire, nearly encompassing the entire mountain at this point. According to witnesses, the flames spontaneously appeared, originating near the center of the mountain. Rescue Heroes are on the scene." — "We’re back. After our Heroes worked tirelessly on the scene, the flames have completely been extinguished. The phenomenon of the origin is decided to be called Blue Flames, the name sticking after a few hours of circulation among the people. Meanwhile, ashes of what hopes to be animals remain." — “Upon further investigation… we, at the scene of the forest fire, say with heavy hearts that forensics have determined the–the ashes of what had remained. Along with the ashes of animals and flora, a—... a body of a child has been recovered. More to come soon.”  — Tsuna stares.Closes his eyes, takes a few deep breaths to steady himself, opens them.And stares some more. In all his years as the Vongola Neo Primo, he has seen and heard and done multiple things. After all, while Tsuna’s the Don of the Most Powerful Famiglia in the World, he’s also the glorified babysitter of deranged psychopaths. But, come on! This is too much even for Xanxus!   "Good morning, Xanxus. May I know who this is so I can greet him a good morning, as well?"‘This’ as in an honest-to-goodness child with a too-stubborn tilt of his chin and a challenging gleam in his eyes and that all-too-familiar-and-painful cloak of a kid who has been kicked and spitted on and looked down by someone bigger and badder than him. Tsuna  aches  at the shadows under the child’s eyes.In perfect unison, which Tsuna doesn't know whether he should laugh or cry at, Xanxus and the boy ("I'm Dabi!" he proclaims in Japanese, puffing his chest) lift their heads in defiance. The other Varia Officers grin and scowl and coo behind them. And float impassively, though Mammon is wrapped in Mist Flames, their face hidden under their hood. But Tsuna swears he can see a tiny upturn of their lips there…Anyway."My Cloud."Tsuna only sighs and lets his Varia Leader have his way, a headache already forming at the back of his head and along his temples.(Because he can see the way Dabi clutches at Xanxus' jacket like a lifeline, face filled with cautious hope.Because he can see the way Xanxus has angled his body forward, as if readying for a fight, the others suddenly fingering their weapons with a nonchalant air.Because he can feel the way his Hyper Intuition practically  screams  its approval.Dabi stays.)After catching and holding a crimson-hued gaze for a minute, Tsuna smiles and says, "Good morning to you, Dabi. Welcome to the Family." Here, Tsuna pauses. “I do hope you can handle the general craziness of everything here.”Dabi grins, “I can handle it, Mini-Boss.”“Xanxus,” Tsuna groans, head falling into his waiting hands. In response, Xanxus throws his head back and cackles.<<EOFANFIC>>
