"I'm your villain..."The hero, for his part, doesn't change. Doesn't move an inche. Holding such deadly hands still. "I'm here to save you, Tomura Shigaraki. You!" Tomura's mouth parted and Izuku continues. "You look like you want to be saved. How can I not save you? How can I not care?"Tomura looks too fragil. A man as powerful as him, a man who destroy half of Japan and level down completely. He looks so soft, so much like....Tenko Shimura."You are...the very first person after my sister to hold my hands" Tomura confessed in reverence. "I want to hold yours" Many would decline and would be in their right. Tomura Shigaraki is nothing more than a villain who caused a war for no reason. Izuku has no obligation to hold his hand.Izuku, however, does that. No fear in his face. He is holding the hands of Tenko Shimura. Tomura doesn't decay him, merely starts to cry."I knew, deep down, a hero would save me. I knew you....are different. Special" Tomura bables sobbing and Izuku never stop holding his hands.
His hands are so war and cozy...and...he is holding my hands.

Fill my heart with song 
Let me sing forevermore.
You are all I long for, all I worship and adore.
In another words, please be true.
In another words.
In another words. 
I love you.
Tomura is being hugged and the last person who really gave a warm hug was...unknow for Tenko.  No decay, no AFO or OFA. Just two souls who meet under a pointless war.Izuku ended up crying. Sensing his confusion adds. "If I see someone I care crying. I cry too"The word "caring" it's a novelty for Tomura (Tenko knew what it was)  it doesn't detain him to be bold, they are among destruction. A radio is playing an old song and what else Tomura has to lose?A part of him is demanding, barking comands for him to not do it. A voice as tiny as it's disgusted. A voice of his sensei...ordering him to not do it...to just take the OFA...Tomura moves his head closer to Izuku- the hero is tall, not as much but their foreheads csn touch easily- "I...wonder if I ask you out for a date...what would be your answer?"Izuku laughs. It's a malicious one. It's a new sound for Tomura Shigaraki, a new sound for Tenko. Izuku kisses him.The radio is on loop, maybe. They kiss under scrumbles, with a song "fly me to the moon" from American singer Frank Sinatra.  A reporter, in a helicopter, can only see from her view Izuku Midoriya carrying tje dreadful villain. A big smile opens on her face. "Ladies and gentlemen" her tears are dropping. "Our hero Dekiru saved the world"Meanwhile, the group of heroes see AFO melt into nothing and in his last breath cursing Izuku Midoriya. "It was supposed to be me!"The words of the reporter adding to such scene made everyone's mind. AFO is dead. Tomura is no more. "IZUKU MIDORIYA IS OUR HERO!" Cheers of celebration echoes of all nation. Of all places.Izuku Midoriya is not a confident man, but he can walk like one and demand a rehabilitation program and no one will say no to him. The program is not a "free card" for villains and not all heroes are ok with such idea, however, the program exists and some villains are getting a second chance...if they truly want.Izuku is famous, beyond limits, for having taking down a god. Tomura Shigaraki's power level was insane. Through no one takes that in consideration when he killed Katsuki Bakugou.One of inmates of such programa is Tenko Shimura. A man, Izuku visits every day. The nurses and doctors often gossip- when Midoriya and Shimura are away, of course- if they are a thing.
Are they really an item? Is Midoriya pulling some strings to help the lasr Shimura?
Where was the famous last Shimura?
Does Tenko Shimura knows how alike he is to Tomura Shigaraki?
All Might also visits him. Do you think they talk about how similar he is to Tomura Shigaraki?
3 years passed. The great Dekiru can be seen in your local arts supplies, awakardly talking to fans- shyness is still ingrained in him-until he has to apologise as he has to return home.The fangirls dreamily stare him walking away. "I wonder if he is single...I mean, he is the #1! He graduated first above all the class A1" "If he has a girlfriend or boyfriend...bet said person is such beauty! How envious" one them adds.Izuku walks home, trying to not blush too much when people call him "My Hero". He is shy, of course, but such line always seems more romantic coming from HIM.Izuku's house is not a villa. But is a far cry from a shackle some haters once imagined in a Reddit post. "Tenchan? I'm home" Izuku greets as Tenko, in his long white hair tied up like Rapunzel, waves his gloved hand. He is writing something on his notebook. "Welcome back! Brought the supplies?" Tenko asks as Izuku holds the bag. Tenko smiles. "Put in the studio, I'll paint...another work of art. A muse so inspiring, so full of beauty and love...and""It's another corgi?" Izuku asked as Tenko has a new hobby. Painting, his therapist recommended and it does wonders for him. Of  course, his muse is Corgis. "Should I be jealous of Corgis?""I love you Izuku!""More than Corgis?""...know your place"Izuku rolls his eyes in good humour and went to put the art supply in the studio. Once back, Tenko is still writing on his notebook too focused. Izuku sits next to him, wrapping his arms around him and resting his head on his shoulder. Tenko hummed softly. "How was the work, Dekiru?"Inhale and then answers. "Tiresome. Bakugou is still trying to gain money by selling a memoir of his life, which earned him a new lawsuit. He has to sell literal snake oil at this point"Tenko stops writing and looks at him. "How are you?" There's a hidden message here. Izuku can read the lines. "One day, I can forgive them. But I'm not forcing myself to do so...one day" Izuku answers as class A1 apologise for what they did, how Bakugou lead them stray, how Izuku was right about many things during the war. Which Izuku can understand their points, their views but...can't forgive them yet.Tenko is not good with words. All he can do is hold Izuku's hand. It's enough. Izuku takes the palm of his hand and gives a kiss, Tenko is red as a tomato."What are you writing? New fanfiction of video game?" Izuku asked so natural. Sometimes, it's unfair how Izuku can be so natural smooth.Still beet red, Tenko informs. "A book I'm writing..." and covers the title of the book. Sadly, Izuku already saw it."How to make your crush notices you" Izuku answers trying to not laugh. "Tenko....don't use our real names""...ok"<<EOFANFIC>>

prompt: write a story about Haikyuu!!,  General Audiences No Archive Warnings Apply F/F 僕のヒーローアカデミア | Boku no Hero Academia | My Hero Academia (Anime & Manga) Hagakure Tooru/Jirou Kyouka Hagakure Tooru Jirou Kyouka Class 1-A (My Hero Academia) Musician Jirou Kyouka Hagakure Tooru is a Good Friend Hagakure Tooru-centric Lesbian Hagakure Tooru Lesbian Jirou Kyouka Unseen Guitars Sharing Earbuds Cute Fluff and Angst Day At The Beach Pining Rarepair
completion: Sand crusted between Toru’s feet as she bounced before the net. A gust of wind whipped through her hair as waves crushed across the shore. A volleyball impacted hardened skin as Kirishima let out an enthusiastic belt. Bending her knees, Toru pressed her elbows together as the ball soared toward her. Yet before she had the chance to collide with the ball, a stream of Sero’s tape flung it toward the other side of the court. Breathless, Toru wiped the beads of sweat off the back of her neck. It was alright. Surely, Sero hadn’t meant to cut her off. He simply hadn’t seen her.Glancing at her shorts and t-shirt, Toru cursed herself for not choosing a flashier outfit. Yet she cast the thought aside amid the war flashbacks of a certain purple-haired boy drooling over her curvy figure. Despite Mineta’s expulsion, Toru wasn’t quite ready to wear a swimsuit in public for the foreseeable future. Steeling her stance, Toru put on her brightest smile – because she hoped even if her expression remained unseen she could at least exude brightness.The ball sped toward Toru’s team once again. Spinning in midair, Mina hit the ball – but in the process of her stunt, she sent her target flying away from the net. Dashing toward the ball, Toru braced her arms. Didn’t matter that her teammate hadn’t passed the ball in her direction – she couldn’t disappoint, she had to have her moment to shine. But just as her wrists were about to make contact with the ball, a body hurled into her.Strewn across the beach, Toru coughed up a mouthful of sand as an entanglement of wiry limbs surrounded her. Eyes wet with tears, she sent a silent prayer that no one could detect the red splotches forming on her cheeks. Two seconds later, the gratitude faded as the knots in her stomachs constricted. Was she really so invisible that her own teammates hadn’t noticed her? All her efforts to hit the ball, a bubbly persona – everything was in vain because at the end of the day she was nothing more than a drifting specter unnoticed by everyone.Kaminari crawled off Toru and held out a hand. She reemerged from her stupor as her classmate pulled her to her feet. He fidgeted with his index fingers as Toru dusted off her clothes, choking back a sob in a desperate attempt not to let on that she’s teared up.“I’m so sorry, Hagakure. I didn’t see you there.”Of course, he didn’t. No one did. Straightening her back, Toru layered her voice with cheeriness. “It’s okay! Don’t worry about it. Mistakes happen.”“Are you sure you aren’t hurt?”Do you mean physically or emotionally? Instead, Toru held two thumbs up, recalling too late that Kaminari wouldn’t be able to register the gesture. “Yeah, I’m right as rain. I’m just going to take a break from volleyball. Sports sure are tiring, haha.”“Okay,” Kaminari said. “And I’m so sorry for crashing into you.”“No hard feelings. I’ve been needing a walk anyways,” Toru said.Pity trailed behind Toru as she strolled across the strand. Each stare was a thousand knives thrust into her back. Because she wasn’t being seen – at least not as a person, only as a source of guilt. Sighing, she tuned in to the sound of waves and hummed to the sound of seagulls. The glow of the evening sun refracted off Toru’s skin. Toying with the kaleidoscope flickering on that sand, Toru wanted to pinch herself for being ungrateful – after all, her quirk gave her a shot at heroism. But it was so unfair. Why couldn’t invisibility have an off-switch? Like Kirishima or Sero’s quirks?Orange bled across the pastel sky as the sun ducked behind the edge of cliff. Wading into the water, Toru basked in the coolness splashing around her ankles and allowed the sea to wash her worries away. As she shut her eyes faint melodies harmonized with the waves. A soft alto pulled Toru in like the tide. A siren’s song of merfolk luring jolly sailors to their doom. Hypnotized, Toru chased after the tune.  Stepping across slippery stones, let the music become her lighthouse guiding her away from the tempest of insecurities swirling in her chest.Algae stuck to Toru’s legs as she scaled a small wall of rocks and entered a cove with water as clear as the sky. Strumming a guitar, a girl sat atop a length as her soft voice echoed with a mournful lullaby. Toru gawked at Kyouka with her mouth agape, admiring long graceful fingers gliding across the strings. The richness of purple hair only stood out more beneath the ember heavens.“Wow, Kyouka you’ve got such a pretty voice.”Mimicking a dear in headlights, Kyouka shot upright. As the guitar handle slipped out of her hands, Toru rushed forward, catching the instrument in the nick of time. Their fingers brushed when Toru passed the guitar back to Kyouka. Jolts of electricity sparked in Toru that were so instantaneous she remained convinced she’d simply imagined it. Clutching her guitar, Kyouka concealed her dark eyes behind her bangs.“No, it’s just a hobby. I’m an amateur at best.”Toru plopped down next to Kyouka, not caring how her shorts got soaked. “Well, I for one think you have a lot of talent.”“Maybe you’re just tone-death.”Noting the blush creeping upon Kyouka’s cheeks, Toru simply shook her head. A silken alto still rung loud and clear through her mind as she gentled elbowed Kyouka in the side. “And maybe you’re just being too hard on yourself.”Kyouka simply rolled her eyes in response. Silence dragged on between the two while the fading sun reflected the ripples of water onto stone. Toru reveled in the quiet whisper of the breeze and the distant warping of sails. Here in the cove, it was as if she and Kyouka were the only people in the world. For once, Toru wasn’t a shadow lost in the shuffle of a crowd.“Can you play any other instruments?” Toru asked.Flushing bright red, Kyouka pressed her thumbs together. “A few.”“Define a few?”“I also play the bass and drums.”“And you claim you’re not musically gifted?” Toru raised a brow and though Kyouka couldn’t see it she sure reacted as anyone else would to the sarcastic gesture.Kyouka ran her fingers along the handle of her guitar. “I mean I enjoy it but I’m not very good.”“I’d beg to differ,” Toru beamed. “But I suppose you don’t have to be good. It’s a passion, right? It’s just meant to be fun.”Nodding hesitantly, Kyouka leaned her guitar against a wall of stone. “I guess you have a point.”Not quite the response Toru wanted but it was definitely a start. She leaned in closer to Kyouka. “What do you say to playing another song for me?”“And embarrass myself even more? No thanks.”“Aww man,” Toru sighed in false defeat.A breeze sent goosebumps across her skin. Kyouka nervously glanced away as Toru pulled her knees close to her chest. From the corner of her eye, Toru watched her classmate rummage through her pocket an retrieved a set of earbuds. After untangling the wires, Kyouka held out an earbud to Toru.“But if you like music like that, there’s this one cover artist I really like.”Wordlessly, Toru accepted. Piano keys reverberated through the MP3 player. The singer’s voice lulled Toru into a daze – yet even as the whistle notes echoed, Toru still found Kyouka’s singing more enchanting. With the cord between the earbuds so short and the wind biting at their arms, the girls huddled closely for warmth. Kyouka didn’t protest as Toru rested her head on her shoulder – even as unseen tufts of air tickled her nose.As the sun bordered the horizon, a kaleidoscope shone across Toru, briefly making her skin visible in a flash of pink and green. Kyouka quirked a brow as she intertwined her fingers with Toru’s. Returning Kyouka grip, warmth spread through Toru’s chest over finally being seen. Not because of turning visible for a split second – but because invisible or not, Kyouka’s stern eyes had looked at Toru rather than right through her.<<EOFANFIC>>

completion: Basking in the sunlight, Toshinori could almost forget the constant ache in his side. Plastic bags filled with twinkies weighed down on skeletal hands. Toshinori knew that the cluster of preservatives and chemicals could hardly be good for the tattered remains of his stomach. But with how the air stung every time he breathed, Toshinori thought he at least deserved to revel in the intoxicating sweetness of his favorite treat from his time as an exchange student.A blinding flash of light cut through the street. Muffled cries reverberated from an alleyway, leaving Toshinori to set his snacks on the sidewalk. He gave his twinkies a gentle pat before wandering down the narrow-cobbled path. Still scrawny, Toshinori straightened in back and held out his forehead – prepared to summon his muscle form at any moment, even if it meant pushing well beyond his five-hour limit.Bang. A skull clattered against the side of a dumpster. Zip ties bulged around the plating of an exoskeleton. Wide pleading insectile eyes looked toward Toshinori. A blade sliced through the air, nipping the restrained man’s hardened exterior. Whipping his head around, Toshinori spotted a shrouded figure looming in the shadows. A crimson mask shrouded the silhouette as long obsidian hair behind them. A deathly aura rippled from the stranger – a sensation Toshinori had not felt since his battle with All For One. Yet this time Toshinori did not feel like he was being torn apart on the side. Rather the aura was weirdly exhilarating.An unsheathed katana darted toward the victim’s throat. Toshinori flexed his arms, only for the tension in his muscles to falter. No, not now One For All. Don’t fail me when there’s someone to save. Squeezing his eyelids shut he sprinted toward the victim and formed a wall before them. As he peeled his eyes open he glared at the assailant, awaiting the impact of the blade. Good God, Mirai was bound to skin Toshinori alive for his idiocy if the assailant didn’t beat him to it.“What the hell are you doing?” the stranger hissed.Toshinori said nothing and instead shifted his legs into a firm stance not wavering in the slightest – despite knowing how easy it was to get knocked off his feet in a more fragile form. The tip of the blade scratched against the asphalt, unleashing an ear-splitting screech.“Why are you protecting him? Do you have any idea what this bastard has done?” The tip of the sword gestured toward the victim’s shirt pocket. A photo of a child in a compromising position emerged from the fabric. Toshinori barely managed to swallow down his bile as he turned to face the stranger again.“But what about mercy?” he croaked.“Mercy? Why would someone like him deserve that?” the stranger belted, his mask shining bright as blood.“You’re right. He doesn’t.” Toshinori looked down at his weakening knees and willed them to remain locked in place. “But murder doesn’t fix anything, right? And if you think about it killing him would give him the easy way out.”An icy gaze flickered behind the mask, but the stranger soon relented, allowing his sword to clattered the ground. His chest shuddered with relief as the stranger instead reached for burner phone and dialed the police’s number. While the stranger bound his victim to a nearby lamppost a little too aggressively – not caring if head hit the metal, Toshinori strolled back toward his grocery bag. Maybe it was the years of standing before the camera yet even when faced with a would-be killer an invisible string tugged at Toshinori, willing him to force a smile upon the situation.“Would you like a twinkie?”The stranger stepped back from his in horror. “No, those look disgusting. Can they even be considered food?”“As someone missing half their stomach, I find them equally digestible compared to everything else.”“Seems like even true heroes have their issues. Determined to protect others but neglectful of their own well-being.” Sighing, the stranger slipped of their mask. The remnants of a nose lurked beneath the sunlight. A patchwork of scars littered his chin. It was not a pretty face – but that only made Toshinori like the stranger’s visage more. After all, he was well-acquainted with the toll righteousness could take on one’s body.“Let’s go get ramen or something. Anything that doesn’t have the potential to be slightly radioactive. My treat,” the stranger said as he waved Toshinori over to follow.“Okay.” Toshinori held his bag tightly as he left behind the alleyway. A faint thump consumed Toshinori’s chest as midnight hair swayed before him. The corners of his lips tugged upward at he couldn’t explain why. Especially it was a real smile – not the plastered one he presented in public.Five years later, the yellow wisps of All Might’s hair cling to the sides of his face as he soars toward a rooftop. Rain pouring down on him, he squints through the water at the streets below. No flashing swords. No face tucked behind a mask. All Might nearly slaps himself for way the tautness in his body dissipates. He shouldn’t be relieved over his failure to find him.With a deep sigh, All Might crouches down and launches himself into the air. Beneath a bright costume the coldness of a metal chain burned onto his neck. Blinking away the raindrops, he scans the alleyways flashing by. Shutting his eyes, All Might takes a deep breath – as if that will help him detect the familiar aroma of iron. To no avail.Part of him wants to leap back home, crawl under his bedcovers, stare at his wedding photos and set his godforsaken mission aside. But it doesn’t matter what Toshinori wants because he is the symbol of peace first. As he readjusts the comm in his ear from Tsugauchi, All Might desperately tries to ignore the weight of the ring on his necklace. But Toshinori’s memories keep pouring into his mind like rain.Lying on the couch with his head on Chizome’s lap, Toshinori swirled dark hair around his finger. Laughter bubble from his lips as Chizome huddled over his phone, glaring at the listing for an All Might poster. His finger hovered of the not yet available purchase button with as much intensity as he summoned for his vigilante activities.“Isn’t it kind of weird to buy a poster of your husband?” Toshinori asked.Chizome’s absent nostril’s flared as he flashed him a death glare. “It’s not like there are many other true heroes out there.”Toshinori rolled his eyes. “Besides, why are you going through the hassle of ordering the poster online. I could get one for you.”An elbow hit Toshinori in the side (his right of course – frustrated of not, Chizome wouldn’t go as far as irritating an old wound). “It wouldn’t be fair to your fans.”“If you say so,” Toshinori snickered as he perched his face atop his hands. “Anyway, speaking of false heroes… there is way to fix that problem instead of constantly lamenting.”A brow rose toward Chizome’s forehead. “By killing them?”“What no?” Toshinori gasped. Shaking his head, he fished a filled-out from his pocket and held it out toward Chizome. “It’s just that the license exam just got more accessible to adults and I was thinking that instead of remaining a vigilante, you could –”“No,” Chizome interrupted. He did not turn toward his phone even as the purchase button emerged. Instead, he stared directly at Toshinori. “Not with the Hero Commission as it is now. Japan doesn’t need more false heroes.”“But you could be different. You won’t succumb to financial motivations, right?”“Not everyone is All Might. Especially, not someone with sins that stretch as long as a river.” Chizome stared down at his hands as if they were drenched in blood. “Besides, Stendhal and I are different people. Without the mask, I’m... No, a license just wouldn’t work. Blurring the line of between my civilian identity and Stendhal – it’s sickening.”Toshinori opened his to protest yet no words came out. Disagreeing would make him a hypocrite. After all, All Might was a paragon, inhuman, an unachievable ideal – he wasn’t Toshinori. All Might wasn’t a corpse of a man with half a stomach. Not a man with a husband who didn’t perceive Toshinori as any less strong even though he looked like death.Back in the present, the storm howls as All Might chases screams and lands by a dead end. Cornered by a brick wall, unable to use her quirk – at least not with out crushing civilians, Mount Lady hopelessly attempts to scale the pipes on a side of a building. All Might speeds forward as her foot slips on a slick railing. Too late. A sword bursts through her thigh. With a flicker of madness, a long tongue licks the blood off a blade.Collapsing like a ragdoll, Mount Lady lets out a petrified cry as Stain aims a blade toward her chest. Zooming through the rain, All Might pulls back his fist – reeling for Delaware Smash. But then the image of Chizome’s brains spattered across the cement flashes before him. Veering of course, Toshinori’ fist impacts Chizome’s arm, knocking him against the wall.Snap out of it. He’s a killer. You have not stop him. Otherwise, how can you call yourself a symbol of peace? Letting One For All crackle through him like lightning, All Might makes a beeline for Stain. Tears sting at his eyes as he grabbles Stain to the ground. Fingers wrapping around Chizome’s esophagus, All Might tries to conjure the long list of obituaries Stain has left in his wake.        Deranged cackles ricochet. “Do it, All Might. Kill me. You are the only one who is worthy.”All Might, not Toshinori. A million fractures form across Toshinori’s heart. Within crazed pupils, he searches for the traces of the man who’d sit on the couch until noon in his pajamas with untamed dark hair sticking up in all directions. Only a manic gaze remains. Chizome is gone, hell, even Stendhal is dead. Stain’s neck slips between Toshinori’s fingers. Toshinori lifts his foot off of Stain’s chest as he grabs a fistful of blades and casts them into a dumpster. Draping an unconscious Mount Lady over his shoulder, he walks away from Stain.“Why aren’t you vanquishing me, All Might?! You’re the only true hero. You have to do it. You must be the one to kill me.”A weak smile flashes upon All Might’s face as he steps through the rows of puddles and he turns toward Stain one last time. “No, I think I’ll go with mercy. Murder doesn’t fix anything, right?”Stepping back onto the main road, All Might almost thinks that Mount Lady’s quirk had activated with how heavily guilt is weighing on him. He’d ruined everything. With Stain outside captivity, there’s no telling how many heroes would get injured. All because he can’t throw that damn ring away. All because he’d put Toshinori first. All because he stupidly doesn’t want Chizome locked away in the depths of Tartarus, surrounded by echoes over how villainous his quirk was. All Might cranes his neck. Toshinori gulps as the rain mixes with his tears – he knows that if he ever encounters Chizome again it is bound to be in the graveyard. A searing ache slices through Toshinori’s temple – after all, Chizome is already dead in every way that matters.<<EOFANFIC>>

completion:
Hope’s Peak was considered one of if not the best hero academies in Japan. Its only rival being U-A high, which had quickly risen to prominence in previous years. Many believed that Hope’s Peak’s scouting methods were outdated. That U-A’s entrance exam was the best way to find new young heroes. 
 
The two schools quickly formed a type of rivalry. The ultimates of Hope’s Peak and the ‘new generation’ of U-A continually going at each other, trying to prove themselves better. It had all acclimated in the broadcasting of a tournament between the two.
 
Present Mic’s voice boomed as he addressed the crowd, “Welcome all you listeners to this great event! The deciding match between Hope’s Peak and U-A!”
 
The crowd roared, the stadium doors opening to reveal the competitors of the finale match. One end of the arena held a boy with spiky hair, one prominent spike on the top, a baggy hoodie, and pants. In the other, a green-haired boy in the standard issue U-A gym uniform.
 
Mic spoke again, catching the audience's attention, “In one corner, we have Makoto Naegi, his quirk probability allowing him to change the odds of anything in his favor. But let's see if he can withstand the might of Izuku Midoriya and his quirk superpower, letting him enhance his speed and strength or condense it into one limb and deliver a devastating attack to him and his opponent. The rules are simple. The first one to push his opponent out of the ring wins!”
 
At that, a bell sounded. Izuku rushing forward, encased in green electricity, before dissipating. Jumping up and drawing his arm back, Makoto jumped to the side. The force of the greenette’s punch creating ripples in the air. 
 
Makoto crouched down, placing his hand on the ring before punching at Izuku’s midsection, colliding with the boy's stomach. The greenette stumbling back, the brunette taking the chance to try to sweep his legs. The U-A student jumping at the motion dodging while staying within the ring by a small margin.
 
Izuku threw up a kick, Makoto dodging by a hair. The sheer force pushing him back. The greenette drew his fist back again, readying another punch. As he fired the attack aiming for the ultimate’s head, the ground began to shake. 
 
A grin grew on Makoto's face as confusion covered Izuku’s. The brunette couldn’t help but laugh as he said, “Weird earthquake, huh?”
 
Makoto sent a series of rapid-fire punches to Izuku’s face. The greenette’s nose blooded as the ground steadied. He used full cowling again, grabbing Makoto’s fist as he punched again. 
 
Izuku threw Makoto’s hand away, sending the brunette flying. Makoto twisted and turned in the air, planting his feet back on solid ground and slowing himself enough to stay in the ring.
 
The brunette charged forward but stopped as the stadium shook. The two students looked around as the cheers turned to screams, and the wall started to crumble. As cement and rubble fell to the ground, a figure began to emerge.
 
They appeared to be a man with spiky black hair. Charred purple skin covered the lower half of his face, with it seemingly, running down his arms as it poked out from under the sleeves of his trench coat.
 
“WHAT!” Present Mic’s voice echoed across the now crumbling arena. His original showmanship dropped for anger and confusion as he said, “Everyone, evacuate now! Vilaillns have infiltrated the stadium! I repeat, Vilaillns are in the stadium, EVACUATE!”
 
The screams grew louder as the thud of shoes and the crash of bodies against each other began to mingle. Makoto looked over to Izuku, the greenette having regained his composure as he shot forward, his fist rocketing towards and through the man’s chest.
 
Makoto stood slack-jawed as the man seemed to explode outwards around Izuku’s fist. As the brunette looked on, he noticed their assailant smile, his body turning to a sludge-like mud. He raised his hand, blinding blue flames engulfing it before collapsing into a puddle of the same mud-like sludge. Izuku went flying back, forced by the sheer heat of the flare.
 
Before either could react, three more figures rushed into the open. Izuku, who had recovered his bearings, wrapped himself in his aura again. 
 
The man from before and a girl with a manic smile revealed themselves. The girl charged toward Izuku, two needle-like canisters in her hands. Makoto tried to get to Izuku’s side but soon felt himself fall as his leg flew out from under him.
 
Looking down, he saw bandages wrapping around him. He reached down to try and untangle himself, but before he could, he felt more wrapped around his arms and other leg. He felt his limbs as they tied together, becoming two useless appendages as someone walked towards him.
 
The wrappings twisted and tightened as they lifted Makoto off the ground allowing him to be eye level with his capture. As the bandages pulled him up, he began to really look at her, noticing her pink and white nurse's uniform, the bandages wrapped around her arms and legs, and her choppy but in-place hair.
 
His breath began to hitch, not from his tightening bindings but from the face he saw looking back at him. The greyish-purple eyes, the tiny smile playing at their features, and the nervous way she played with her hands.
 
There was no doubt in his mind as he said, his voice shaking, “Mi...Mikan?” She laughed, a small cute laugh as she said, “I-it’s me, yes. Are you happy to see me?” Her eyes widened as she frantically said, S-Sorry if I made you worry!”
 
Makoto was dumb-struck, struggling to make a coherent sentence as Mikan continued, “I didn’t mean to be gone so long, but it just happened, and I wanted it to be a surprise.” Makoto eyed her in confusion before seeing her reach into the pocket of her apron, pulling out a syringe filled with a see-through pink liquid. 
 
Mikan plunged it into Makoto’s neck. The world began to spin and darken as his vision began to fail him. But before he fell unconscious, he heard Mikan say, “Soon, my beloved, soon.”
<<EOFANFIC>>

Chapter Text
When Aizawa was heading out for his patrol that night he really didn't expect to end up in a place like the red light district. Going to the red light district really isn't customary in his line of work, considering that most heroes these days don't even step foot within at least a half mile radius because when you have a place like the red light, brimming with villains of all quirks, sizes and age. At some point heroes just started to deem the red light as ‘irredeemable’. which in retrospect, is most definitely nearer the truth than he would like to believe. Aizawa can't help but pity the people confined there. See, because of the overflowing amount of villains, a few years back the commission took it upon themselves to disconnect the red light from the rest of the world.Well, not entirely, as there is social media, so really they aren't that cut off from the world when you think about it. But when you start coming near the red light. You know.It starts to get darker, even on the days where you can't even fathom the cold, when you think there is no escaping the heat and sweat that summer brings. Even then, the red light stays, dank, polluted and grey. The alleyways the red light is filled with always seem to harbour an unmistakable depression that seeps into your person. Alleyways filled with women exhibited like cattle, needles and cigarette butts littered on the ground, and the undeniable stench of weed and bodily fluids, the putrid smell of piss and sewage every corner you take can make you feel light headed.So why did Aizawa find himself smack dot in the middle of the red light, in the middle of the night, or well he should say morning at this point. But really! Come on, what was he doing here? He had a class to teach in a couple hours and quite honestly he would much rather be in a room full of noisy maddening children than here… So why the fuck is every instinct in his body nagging at him to be here. He doesn't even know what he's looking for, or what he's supposed to be looking out for. Because at this point he's already passed two robberies and has had a handful of women feel him up while blindly speed walking through the abundance of streets just glaring at the floor and going wherever he felt needed. And now he had no idea where the fuck he was and the need to be somewhere had finally diminished into skittish and jumpy eyes just looking for anything that could possibly warrant his coming out here. And he swears if this was just a fluke and his legs had led him here on a whim.. He was going to lose his shit.Currently, standing in the most concealed position he could be on a rooftop with enough of a satisfactory viewpoint, Aizawa just stands and waits and observes. Most things happening in his viewpoint right now would warrant his attention but since he's in the red light right now with no other backup and no-one knowing where he is, he leaves it, because if his instincts are right then there are bigger fish to fry._____________ Aizawa had to have been standing there for about 40 minutes at this point, and he was just giving himself 10 more minutes until he was going to call it quits and head back home, as he's sure his husband has probably noticed he's not home yet.When he spots something out of the corner of his eye, in one of the three little alleys that are in his line of sight. Swiftly reprimanding himself for not noticing the lump before he immediately realises this must have been what his instincts have been nagging him about for the last 2 hours, and makes quick work of scaling down the building and down the damp alley across the street from where he was perched.Walking closer Aizawa could now definitely confirm this was what he was here for. Or rather who.There curled up in a heap of cardboard and newspapers, lying a child. Couldn't be older than 7 and all Aizawa had to say to himself was that it wasn't a fluke and this child would probably have died here tonight if he hadn't listened to his instincts.Crouching down to the shaking body, he slowly reached a hand out into their vision to not startle them, keeping his hands presented facing upwards, as he made his presence known."Kid?"The child violently whacks his head back, flinching. Aizawa can see his pupils dilate, the boy in front of him looks so out of it that aizawa doesn't even think that he can find his eyes to make contact, as the boy seems to just be darting his droopy eyes about, trying to discern any kind of facial feature aizawa guesses.“Hey kid, Can you hear me? Can you see me?” Aizawa pronounced slowly. Slowly holding his hand up to the left of his face to see if the kid would follow it. And surprisingly he did. But his eyes still seemed to be distant, he was blinking his eyes concerningly slow. He had finally pulled his face fully out from under the cardboard diy hurt he had tried to create but failed. The kid was shockingly pale, with dark misty grey eyes and messy black hair. He had several colourful bruises in his line of vision he could see now that the card the boy was using had slipped down.“What's your name?” he tries again. And this time he seems to get a better response whatever trance the boy was in, seems to start to wash over his eyes clearing and widening. But all he gets in response is a gargled, high pitched, “Eh?”. Almost as if he's expecting something else other than a question, which isn't too far strung considering his condition and where they are. This is probably the first time he's even seen a hero. The first time an adult has spoken to him without expecting something to get out of him. The boy just looks astounded that he's even looking at him right now, with his eyes now focused now its the first time Aizawa has made full fledged eye contact with him. Which is promising.“Can you walk?” Aizawa asks. And when the kid just starts to  attempt to stumble up with shaky arms, damn near falling right back on his ass, Aizawa has to catch the boy's shoulder to stop him from hurdling his head back into the wall again. “Woah, Woah, Easy now. You don't look like a good kid.” Aizawa says, searching the boy's face closely. Only to be met with confusion yet again.The boy tries to stand up again but this time Aizawa is gently holding his shoulder again which halts any attempts which is also quite concerning but if it stops the kid from bolting off then he's just going to have to take it for granted for now.“W…  Wa…” The boy's lips part for the second time, stumbling over his words before suddenly toppling forward into Aizawa's arms  and to say that Aizawa is concerned is the understatement of the year. One second he was alertly looking around and the next minute he lurched forward practically in his lap. And Aizawa doesn't even think about it before he's picking the boy up from under the armpits and wrapping his coat around the boy as he speed walks out of the alley holding the boy on his chest close with one arm as he pulls out his phone to call the first person who comes to his mind. “Hello?”

Chapter Text
The roof, my safe place, or at least, it used to be.Everything had started like normal today, mom left for work at the hospital before I woke up, I got dressed, ate breakfast, made my lunch, then left for school.When I got to school, it was also the same as it usually was. I’ve given up correcting them, they don’t believe me anyways so why try.As soon as the lunch bell rang, I bolted out of the classroom, trying to escape Kacchan’s torment for at least one day.I ran up the stairs to the roof, and sat down on the edge, listening to the hustle and bustle of the city.That was soon interrupted by a voice, one I didn’t recognize.My head turned in surprise, only to find a teenager about my age who looked basically homeless.Who the fuck is that? And why is he on the roof of a middle school building?I must have accidentally said my thoughts out loud, because the boy looked at me with an equal amount of surprise as I was giving him.“You can see me?” He asked, the words being forced out before he held his breath waiting for me to answer.“Yes?” My voice comes out high pitched and squeaky as I respond.“This isn’t possible,” the guy whispered to himself, completely baffled.“What about me seeing you isn’t possible?” I ask, tilting my head with a curious expression.He turns to look at me with the most serious look on his face, before uttering two words, “I’m dead.”The look I give him at his confession confuses him even more.“So?”“‘So?’ How the hell are you reacting so calmly after hearing that I am dead!?” As he speaks, his eye starts to twitch.“Because that’s my quirk? Seeing dead people, even if no one believes me,” The end comes out in more of a mutter, but still audible to the ghost beside him.“Therefore they believe that you are quirkless,” He said, knowing looking in his eyes.“How’d you know?” I ask in surprise at his words.“I went through a similar situation when I was your age, only I was the one telling people I was quirkless, not the other way around.”“Why would you do that?” The question slipped out before I could stop it.The teenager looked into the distance with a far off look on his face, but answered, “My quirk was seen as villainous, and I was bullied because of it. But when I got older, I went to UA for Heroics. It didn’t end well, as you can see, I’m now dead,”Before I can respond, I hear someone shout the nickname Kacchan gave me.“OH DEKU!”I instantly jump at the voice, Definitely Kacchans, I think as the unknown teenager beside me blinks in surprise.The door to the roof opens, and Kacchan storms towards me, his friends in tow.“You thought you could hide from me?! YOU DAMN NERD!” Kacchan yells, making me flinch.One of Kacchans friends grabs a hold of me and I tense out of instinct, waiting for the punch. I think we are going to be great friends!” I say, a sadistic smile growing on my face, to which Shota Matches with one of his own.***And just like that, a friendship was formed between a ghost, and the only kid who could see him.This duo can’t possibly cause that much drama, could it?……………. completion: Plot: Shortly after Izuku gets labeled quirkless his Dad tells Inko they are going to go on a camping trip to cheer Izuku up. Izuku is so excited and spends days reading about how to camp and stuff, even gets a library book about it to take with him. His dad helps set up a camp in a little cave for the coming rain and gets sticks for a fire to keep dry, he tells Izuku he has to get his stuff from the car, he only brought Izuku's, but he never comes back. Izuku waits for a long time and gets bored so he checks his bag to set up his bed when he finds a letter from his dad saying he left him there and not coming back. Izuku is too little to find his way home and it starts storming so he can't even try to track his way back to the main road. He ends up lost in those woods with just his camping book, some notebooks he was going to fill out for Inko to read about the 'fun trip’, and his limited supplies. The missing report goes cold for a long time until a search and rescue mission for a different missing kid gets solved and the kid tells a hero on the search team that 'the quiet green haired boy' saved them. Notes: Aizawa calls Izuku ‘Banī’ because he doesn't know his name until he gets to see the RV ‘den’. He picked Banī because bunnies stand on their hind legs with little bendy front paws when they look around. That's how Izuku acts so the name stuck. Inko didn’t know about what happened, she was told the storm took Izuku like it did the campsite the RV came from. She mourned the loss of her son after the case went cold and went to America with her husband. She wasn’t a bad mom.  I had actually written a small part of this before I got distracted by other things: [Aizawa follows Banī like he has any other time they want to show him something, giving them little nods whenever they look back to make sure they didn't lose him. The path this time is a new one, far  far  away from the roads, and around where the old campsite used to be before a flood washed it away. Aizawa leaves the tree line to find himself in a small clearing with some old cars and other things around the main attraction, a rusted RV tilted a little from where it's wedged between some tree trunks. Banī is true to his name as he stands with his hands in front of his chest and on the balls of his feet like a bunny would to look at Aizawa, curious what he thinks about the allusive den. Thankfully the years of being an underground hero has trained Aizawa to not show too much emotion beyond a small smile ( not  showing teeth) and a nod to show Banī it's okay. After  months  of work they are finally at a point they could learn who Banī was, if there is any place to find parts of his past it's his den. It takes some careful steps to see if the RV can take his heavier weight compared to Banī's lighter (  too light ) weight and he's inside. Aizawa looks around and takes it all in; a layer of dirt over the whole inside from the past flood except where Banī is most active, curved sticks, cushions likely from the broken cars outside, and a surprising amount of fur and feathers making up a nest of sorts at the back of the RV where the bed goes, a path to the sink where there isn't any water but where a small part of Banī seems to remember dishes go to wash, door-less cabinets full of things Banī needs to survive, etc. It all shows survival and a small understanding of how a home works but nothing to help find who Banī was, so Aizawa follows Banī when he goes further back into the nest room. Gently pushing the door fully open already gives Aizawa hope he will find something when he sees a collection of things not from the woods on the shelves around the room.Banī hops into his nest and settles down, seemingly fine with letting Aizawa look around freely. He picks up and cuddles an old and worn plush that Aizawa thinks might be one of the limited Build-A-Bear bunnies of Present Mic, the washed out colors and missing bits make it hard to tell but the still there glasses and jacket are a dead give away. (Part of Aizawa is happy Banī can find comfort in a hero even feral). Taking the open invitation to look, Aizawa starts with the closest shelf and walks over. It starts simple, with some pretty rocks and glass, but soon he can see bits of Banī's past and he almost wishes he didn't. The first hint are little red shoes, much  much  too small for Banī as he is and not for the plush as Mic wears boots. The shoes are worn to hell and back from constant use, used up until the soles fell off and the shoe laces were used to keep them together. Aizawa is glad Banī can't see his face as his training breaks at the sight. He isn't a religious man but he is almost praying that those don't belong to Banī, they are so,  so  small compared to the feral teen behind him. Aizawa takes a steadying breath and moves on to the next thing, a broken pair of sunglasses (again,  far too small ) that resemble his own gear. These have a faint name on the side, 'Iz-ku', could that be Banī's name?Making a mental note of that and the possibility they helped gain trust, Aizawa moves onto what looks like books. One is a very well used camping guild from a library, a elementary library as the tag says on the spine, and the rest look like notebooks. Aizawa picks one up and sees 'Izuku' on these as well, the last name is scratched off roughly.]<<EOFANFIC>>

prompt: write a story about Haikyuu!!,  Not Rated Creator Chose Not To Use Archive Warnings Gen 僕のヒーローアカデミア | Boku no Hero Academia | My Hero Academia (Anime & Manga) Midoriya Izuku Midoriya Izuku Has All for One Quirk Tartarus High-Security Prison (My Hero Academia) Human Experimentation Angst Midoriya Izuku Has Multiple Quirks
completion:
I felt the wind rushing past me as the helicopter hovered over the square box building in the middle of the ocean. The handcuffs felt tight on my wrists as I gazed at the building below. "Captain, we're approaching the Pandora now. Requesting access to enter," the person next to me spoke into the communication device. I looked over at the man, trying to gauge his intentions. He seemed professional, but his demeanor made me uneasy. "Password?" came the voice on the other end of the line. The man next to me leaned in closer to the device, "Crimson Tide." There was a pause before the voice replied, "Access granted." The upper side of the square building slowly opened, revealing a helipad. The helicopter descended slowly, the blades beating the air as we landed on the pad. I looked around the interior of the building as the door opened and I was escorted inside. It was dark and cramped, and I could hear the sounds of machinery whirring in the background. "Where are we?" I asked, trying to keep my voice steady. The man next to me ignored my question and led me down a corridor to a large metal door. He punched in a code and the door swung open.
Inside the room was a man with a stern expression on his face. He looked up as we entered, eyeing me with suspicion. "Who is this?" he asked, his voice cold and clipped. "This is the one you requested, sir," the man next to me replied. The man behind the desk looked at me for a moment before nodding. "Very well. You may leave us." As the door closed behind the other man, I turned to face the man behind the desk. "What is this place?" I asked, my voice shaking slightly. "Pandora" I felt a chill run down my spine as the man behind the desk answered my question. I watched as he scrolled through the information on his communication device, and soon enough, a lady appeared with a file in her hand. As she left, the man began to read out loud from the file. I was stunned as I heard the list of crimes that had been attributed to me. My mind raced as I tried to remember what had happened, but it was all a blur. The only thing that stood out in my mind was the mention of my quirk, hydrokinesis. Suddenly, the man stopped reading and looked up at me with an irritated expression. "So, another person who will lose his quirk," he muttered under his breath. I couldn't believe what I was hearing. Lose my quirk? Was that even possible? I tried to protest, but before I could say anything, I was cut off by a wave of panic. My heart started pounding in my chest as I imagined losing a part of myself.
I shouted at the man, demanding answers. "You're joking, right? You can't just take away my quirk! It's a part of who I am!"
The man didn't reply. Instead, he moved so quickly that I barely had time to react. Before I knew it, my head was slamming into the ground, and I felt a sharp pain in my temple. I cried out in pain, and as I lifted my head, the man whispered in my ear, "If you want to leave this place alive, you'll stay quiet." I felt a sense of dread wash over me as I realized the severity of the situation. I had to find a way out of here before it was too late. But before I could make a move, the man had already picked up his communication device and began to speak.
"Start the procedure," he said, his voice cold and detached.
I didn't know what he meant by that, but it didn't sound good. Within minutes, a group of people entered the room, and before I knew it, I was being dragged away.
As we moved down the hallways, I struggled against the hands that held me, but it was no use. I was trapped. I looked around, trying to find a way out, but all I saw were blank walls and steel doors.
As I was led into the cell, my heart raced with fear and confusion. The room was small and dank, with dim lighting casting eerie shadows on the walls. The only furniture was a single metal bed bolted to the ground, with a thin and stained mattress on top. I shuddered at the thought of being trapped in such a miserable place for who knows how long.

Days or maybe weeks went by, and I lost all sense of time. I was fed only minimal rations of bread and water, with no human contact whatsoever. I felt like I was going insane, with my thoughts and fears swirling around in my head, and the constant silence driving me to the brink of madness.
Then one day, the same people who dragged me into the cell came to take me away. My legs felt wobbly as they led me through the door, and I stumbled as the blinding light of the outside world hit me. I was taken into a massive room, with two seats facing each other in the center. One of the seats had a boy tied to it, with multiple wires attached to his body. He looked like a lifeless puppet, with dull eyes and a skinny frame. His dark-green hair was fluffy and unkempt, casting deep shadows on his face.
I tried to look around the room, hoping to spot an escape route, but there was no way out. The right side of the room was made of thick glass, and I could see people in white lab coats watching from the other side. They seemed to be observing something, taking notes, and analyzing data.
Soon, I was strapped to the other chair, with thick leather belts holding me in place. The people who dragged me here left the room, and the entrance was sealed shut. Suddenly, a voice echoed in the room, saying "Izuku, start the process". I felt a growing attraction force towards the boy named Izuku, but it wasn't me feeling it - it was my quirk.
I felt something break inside me, leaving my body. I started to scream and kick the chair with the straps on, realizing that I had lost my quirk. I couldn't believe it. I had always relied on my powers, and now they were gone. The scientists were taking some input, and then the previous people came in and dragged me away.
I was too confused and disoriented to understand what was happening, but before I knew it, I was in a helicopter, leaving the facility behind. The full weight of the situation hit me then, and I realized what had happened to me in that place called Pandora. I didn't know what was in store for me now, but I knew that my life would never be the same.<<EOFANFIC>>

completion: Heavily flushed, Hizashi whisper-yells to his husband "You can't just say that while we're on patrol-!" The gruff, handsome man smirked. "Why not? Am I.. taking your mind off your duty?" Shouta responded in a way that was both cool and hot simultaneously. Shouta and Hizashi continued their flirtations while walking down the street, their faces illuminated by the streetlamps. The two were almost finished their night patrol, and both were eagerly awaiting the start of their date night. Suddenly, Shouta heard what sounded like Zashi singing one of their favorite songs, so he turned to him, curious. However, Zashi wasn't singing, but rather also looking for the spurce of the sound. They both looked up to the sky and Zashi grabed Shouta's arm.In the dark, silhouetted by the moon, is a child. And they're on the roof of one of the tallest apartment buildings in the city."Stay down here. Be prepared to.. catch." Said Shouta, reacting immediately and running towards the the metal stairs on the side of the building. 17 flights. Shit. Almost before he moved his hand, his Capture Weapon was in the air. As always, it found its target with frightening accuracy. As soon as it wrapped around the top railing of the stairs, Shouta started his quick assent. Within a minute (Zashi was impressed, although petrified), Shouta was on the roof, frantically looking around for the child, praying that they hadn't jumped yet. I haven't heard Zashi yell.. and I haven't heard a-... a thud.Just when he started to panic, he saw them sitting next to the edge. They were.. a lot smaller than he was expecting. Not wanting to scare the child, Shouta made sure his normally quiet footsteps made a but of noise against the gravel. The child was singing again and didn't seem to hear him. "And now, the end is near. And so I face the final curtain...""Ahem" The child startled at the noise and looked up at the hero. It was at this point that Shouta noticed the child's green, curly locks. Their wide, green eyes shining in the moonlight. Holy. Fucking. Shit. It was Midoriya. Izuku. His Problem Child. "O-ohmyg-god Aizawa-s-sensei oh god oh fuck-" And he starts to stammer and hyperventilate, as per usual. And as per usual, his teacher is quick to try and calm him down. "Kid, kid! Hey hey hey hey you gotta breathe, please. Come on, Midoriya. Izuku. In and out. In.. and out. Shhh..." Aizwa tried to breathe with his student to give him something to follow, and eventually it seemed to work, if only somewhat. The poor kid couldn't stop shaking and saying "Oh god sensei I'm so sorry."When he seemed at least partially stable, Aizawa made an effort. "Izuku, will you move away from the edge? Please? I'd like to sit beside you, but I need you to move." As much as he wanted to yell and ask the kid what the hell he was doing, he knew that was the last thing the boy needed. Finally, Izuku nodded and moved, and in an instant, he was being held as close as could be in Aizawa's embrace. After a moment, they were both crying. "Izuku, dear God.. just let me hold you..." And he did. And they simply sat together on the roof. After a long while, it was Aizawa that broke the teary silence, backing up slightly so he could see the kid- his kid. He still kept his Capture Weapon wound tightly in his hand.. just in case."Izuku, you know I have to ask you why you were going to-" He swallowed, but before he could finish his grave inquirey, the Problem Child spoke up. "I just, I can't take it anymore-! Those stupid voices whichIknowarereallyjustmebutstill they keep telling me to 'just try it' and it's not like there's a reason for me to keep being a-alive anyway-" He took a breath. "Sensei-" "Aizawa. Call me Aizawa." "A-aizawa, please.. I can't keep going on, I can't keep ignoring it.. it's calling me. Please, just let me fly. I need to fly..." He cast a sideways glance at the edge, then back at the pro hero. Aizawa tensed. Just as quickly as Izuku tore himself away from the man, he found the Capture Weapon wrapped tightly around his torso.Aizawa watched on as Izuku struggled for a moment (he was ashamed he hadn't realized how much strength the boy had lost lately.. he made a mental note to check on the boy's diet later) before he gave up, collapsing to the ground in exhaustion while still wound in the cloth. With a sad look on his face, Aizawa walked over to him and scooped him up into his arms. He looked down into the tear-stained face of the boy he had practically raised since he came to UA. Izuku was more than a student to him; he was a son. And Aizawa would be there for him. No matter what. As he stood there in the damp night air, he realized that his husband was still at his post at the foot of the building. Looking back down, he saw that Izuku was asleep, worn out from the mental and physical exhaustion. Aizawa gave a sad, tired smile, the smile of a worried but loving father, and began to make his way down the stairs. He moved very slowly as to not wake his Problem Child.When he finally arrived at ground level, Hizashi came running. He quickly recognized his student and seeing the child lying limp in his husband's arms, he immediately assumed the worst. "Is he-?!" "Shh... no. No, he's fine. Relatively speaking..." Aizawa hurriedly quieted the man out of fear that his voice quirk would activate. "He's just asleep," he said In a hushed voice. "He's had a long night. I'll tell you about it once we get home. I still need to find out more from him, but.. he needs help. And we're going to get it for him." Understanding that Izuku would be staying with them, Hizashi nodded. The couple walked through the quiet street toward their apartment, the only sound in the air being their footfalls and the slow, steady breathing of the sleeping child unknowingly on the way to his new home.<<EOFANFIC>>

completion: We´d always known eachother. When we were little we planned on becoming heroes together. We were closer than brothers.We loved eachother.And I kept on loving him through out everything.Even though it hurt.Even though we were never the same.Even though he hates me.Even though I was different.Even though he was different.Even though we were worlds apart.Even though I knew we would never happen.It was nice to think about life if we´d just stayed the same.The same little kids.The Number One Hero and his sidekick.The kids who planned their hero agency together in the dirt.Now that I think about it we didn´t really change that much.We still want to be heroes.He´s still the best at everything.He is still the leader.He is still my world.My thoughts.And I am still that little boy.That little boy who talks too much.That little boy who thinks too much.That boy who is just so easy to pick on.The boy who seems to follow him everywhere.But now I am the only one that cares.Now I am the one who is alone.The one he picks on.He became the one who figuratively and literally burned my dreams to the ground.The one I became afraid of.Who enjoys seeing me cry.Who enjoys embarassing me infront of his friends.The one who breaks my heart over and over again.The one who I can´t stop loving despite everything he´s done.Despite every insult, every yell, every hit, every punch, every kick.Every new bruise or wound I had explain to Mom. He´s always been like this.He´s never treated his things with much care or love.Maybe I am his afterall.  "Are you finally going to jump?"I spin around almost already falling off.I desperately cling to the railing looking at him.He looks... amused."So you don´t want to die afterall, huh Deku? I had put it down next to the door.I just dropped it on the floor with my shoes.I didn´t need it anymore afterall.He starts digging through it stopping and smirking at me when he has found what he was looking for.My Notebook.I flinch."Kacchan, please don´t!"My voice is pleading.My eyes are burning with tears.They threaten to fall but I yell at them not to.Not now."Why? Or is it disgust?I probably deserve that."Don´t just look at me! Give your fucking hands, you maniac!"he screams gripping my arm tighter.I nod swinging my other arm up for him to pull me up.He did.We are in our empty classroom.Suddenly he slaps me across the face.The sound echoes in the empty halls.Tears are pricking the corners of my widened eyes.I look at him again rubbing my pounding cheek.He didn´t use his quirk.How nice."What the fuck? What the fuck do you think your Mom would think? You think she´d be okay with you dieing? I think the fuck not! So don´t be stupid!"He throws my backpack in my face and I fumble to catch it.His hands in his pockets he turns to leave."You read my note, didn´t you?"He stops but doesn´t turn around."Kacchan. You read my note, didn´t you?"Silence.Oppressive silence.The air is heavy and nobody says a word.I can hear his breathing.I can feel my heart in my throat and I wish I could puke it out here and now.Maybe then this nightmare would be over.But I don´t.And he doesn´t speak or move."You have no right to be mad at me!"Am I yelling?"You are not the one in the wrong here!"Yes I am."Stupid? STUPID?! ARE YOU FUCKING KIDDING ME; YOU PIECE OF SHIT?!"Holy shit!"AM I STUPID FOR BEARING WITH EVERYTHING UNTIL NOW? AM I STUPID FOR GETTING UP EVERYDAY TO GO TO THIS HELL HOLE? AM I?"I am starting to cry."OH AND AS WE´RE ON THE TOPIC OF MY MOM. WHY DO YOU THINK SHE HASN´T APPEARED AT SCHOOL YET, HUH? ITS BECAUSE I TELL HER EVERYTHING IS FINE.WE ARE STILL BEST FRIENDS BECAUSE WE HAVE TO BE. DO YOU REALLY THINK I WANNA BREAK HER HEART?! IF I WANTED TO DO THAT ID SHOW HER THE SCARS YOU GAVE ME.YOU WERE THE ONE THAT SUGGESTED ID KILL MYSELF IN THE FIRST PLACE, REMEBER? YOU ARE THE ONE WHO MADE MY LIFE A LIVING HELL SINCE ELEMENTARY!"He doesn´t say anything.I chuckle. A bitter chuckle.I have never laughed like that."Because I´m useless, right? Because I´m worthless? Because I am dirt under your feet? Rubble in your shoes? A bolder in your path? A quirkless loser"Tears are falling."Do you know what you are to me? What you were to me?"I am no longer yelling but my voice is agonized.Breathing hurts.He doesn´t look at me."You...you were the best part of my day. You were my joy. You were my inspiration. My sun. The air I breathe. My hero."I sigh."You were the one I wanted to spend every second of my day with.Even later on when we only hung out because our Moms did and I knew you didn´t really want to. I really liked it because I was desperate for your attention.Getting to speak with you like we were friends again even if I knew we weren´t. Hell it was painful to know.I accepted when you started picking on me.I took everything you threw at me.I thought it was better than being ignored because at least you looked at me.I was still a part of your life. I still meant something.You were my world, Katsuki."I am choking on my tears at this point.They are streaming down my face and staining my uniform."I loved you. I was incredibly in love with you, Kacchan. Your eyes were like roses and I couldn´t handle looking at them because they would prick me. They would never look at me the same.I dreamed about you so much i was going crazy! You were my every thought.No matter what you did to me.No matter what you said to me.I couldn´t get over you. It just became more painful to love you everyday. Because everything about you just became more beautiful to me.But I just seemed to disgust you more evreyday.Your hair.Your lips.Your skin.They made me cry. Because I knew I would never be close to you again."I wipe my face sniffling."Maybe I am still in love with you, who knows? But that doesn´t matter."I smile. Tears and snot running down my face.I must look so disgusting.He is looking at me.Straight at me.It isn´t disgust.It isn´t anger.Is it...regret?No.Kacchan? Never.His pained expression hurts.It´s like a dagger is being pushed into my heart.Worse.I can´t breathe.He runs a hand through his hair.His Hair.His stupid perfect hairWith his hand still in his hair he looks at me again.Crimson eyes somehow cold as ice."That´s fucking pathetic. Get over yourself, will you?"My throat is being sealed shut and new tears are forming.I grab my backpack and move to walk way.He suddenly grabs my hand.Harshly.It hurts."Ow, Kacchan let go!"I yelp looking at him pleading."Why today?" He asks."What do you-""You know exactly, what I´m talking about, Deku.""I-I met someone. I asked them an important question and I didn´t exactly get the answer I was looking for.""Tsk" He lets go and waves me away."I won´t tell if you won´t."I say smiling as if we are children again.As if we just broke a vase at his house.Drew on Miss Bakugous wedding dress again.Cut up his dads clothes into hero costumes.But we are not.We will never be these children again.We´ll just move on with our lifes as if this day had never happend.As If I never confessed or attempted.It was just a normal day.         <<EOFANFIC>>
