completion:
Chapter Text

“We haven’t really talked about it,” his mother said suddenly, her wistful tone made him glance up from his food in time to see how bone-white her grip around her chopsticks was. Her other hand was hidden from sight beneath the table, clasped upon her knee and pulling the fabric taut.

“About what mom?”

She placed her bowl down and leaned back, her smile fractured as she wavered for a moment between looking apologetic and mortified. Somehow, despite knowing his mother to be emotionally spontaneous, the sudden shift threw his appetite out the window and Izuku found himself focusing on her directly.

“W-well,” she said at her son’s attention, “I didn't want to bring the mood down at all, it's just that I don't speak to you anymore… no, I don't mean it like that! I know we speak, I'm not saying you don't text enough - though you could certainly message more - it’s just that I was thinking…”

She tapered off and looked awkwardly anywhere but his eyes. Now alert and convinced she was trying to dislodge something other than misgivings about his career choice, Izuku gave her his full attention, his bowl too was placed down on the table and he sat forward a little more to hear what she wanted to say.

“What were you thinking about?” He asked.

“Oh, well, it’s just that I’m so proud of you,” her warm words made him chuckle with nervous energy. He was worried it was something other than her motherly issues troubling her. Until she continued, “getting your provisional license and saving that little girl… it’s too much sometimes for me to think about. You’ve accomplished a lot. It sometimes feels like you've grown up suddenly and I don't know how or when.”

“Mom,” Izuku murmured and she rubbed a straying tear from her dusty green eyes.

“I feel like, I can calm down a little you know?” she admitted softly, “because for a moment… no, for a long time, I was so scared for you Izuku.”

He blinked at her and leaned back, not fully comprehending her words but when she turned to look at him there was a bitter fear stewing in her gaze, he found his mouth dry out but didn't have the ability to reach for his drink, it felt like if he was not careful this honest moment would be gone and she’d go back to being closed-mouthed again.

“Don't get me wrong,” she chided lightly, “I'm still worried out of my mind and sometimes when you tell me about these things that you get up to at that school… it makes me want to come to hide you from the world… it's so scary.”

“But it’s also so much better,” she almost whispered the words, her son watched the uncertainty ooze from her lips as she stared back at her hands and the table in front of her.

“W-what do you mean?” Izuku asked, his heart began to thump in his throat and he wished he hadn't asked because he felt like he already knew, why did he have to ask?

“I was scared about what you’d do,” she muttered and cleared her throat with an uncertain hum, “you were so obsessed with heroes and you'd come home late covered in bruises… you stopped admitting it but I knew you were still getting bullied.”

“Oh.”

“I feel like it crushed you when you were diagnosed. I wanted to lift some of that weight off of you but it was so… it was so much. I couldn’t d-do anything for you,” she whimpered. Izuku stared back at her glassily.

She drew in a heavy breath and confessed, “I went to see councillors about it. I was scared and I was worried about what would happen to you because I couldn’t turn your head away from such high hopes and how could I? Wouldn’t it be the worst thing in the world if your own mother didn’t believe in you?”

“Y-yeah,” Izuku choked out, he looked down too, his crooked hands winding over each other as he focused on the aches and pains that wormed - always- up his arms.

“No one had any good ideas, I thought I was running in circles and I didn’t… I couldn’t see a way this would turn out well. You changed a lot… you were such a happy child and you became so… so…”

“You don’t have to say it,” He heard himself mewl, he wanted to beg her to stop, his heart was stalling painfully in his chest. He’d left all of this far behind him. He was no longer that deku anymore but Deku, the hero. So why was this hurting and why did it need to be said? Everything was fine.

“I need to say it,” she said almost firmly but lacking the conviction, “you 

were 

a happy child and you withdrew. I was such a failure… So when it turned out you weren’t… well,

 when you got your quirk, I was so relieved

.”

When did he stop breathing? He blinked several times and nodded. He heard her mumble nervously before she scooted closer across the matt, around the table and pulled him tightly against her. It was the most unpleasant embrace Izuku’d ever been part of. 






“I’m so sorry,” she said, stabbing his heart, “I’m so sorry I didn’t believe in you but I just… I couldn’t lie to you either.”

“I know,” Izuku said and leaned away awkwardly, his mother fell back from the embrace, she looked hurt that he had pulled away. Her mouth wobbled at his closed-off expression. 






“I w-wondered,” she said softly, “because it does feel sometimes like that closeness we had… ended that day.”

He wasn’t sure when.

“I wondered if you blamed me at the time that you didn’t have a quirk. When it turned out you did, I thought maybe it would help with all that… but you still seem distant sometimes, I feel like I’m always reaching out to you.”

“I’m sorry,” he said back hollowly. He hadn’t ever meant for his mother to feel so hurt, but he couldn’t imagine now after all this revelation that he could feel good about being here. Maybe after a breather but not right now. He had come home for the weekend and had pushed aside his studious training regiment because he worried he’d been neglecting her but something ugly twisted inside him and he realised miserably that he’d rather be at U.A. now than beside his own mother. At least in U.A., he could pretend none of that misery had happened and he could also pretend that it didn’t matter that he was ever quirkless. Maybe that was still the case. Because he only ever mattered when he did receive One for All. He felt sick. 

“No, I’m sorry,” Inko sniffed before patting his knee, “I know you came back to relax and I hope you had a nice weekend… I just, some of this has been on my mind a while and I feel like it’s been so long since we’ve had a heart-to-heart.”

She began to stand, halfway through the motion she leaned forward and kissed his brow before picking up their forgotten bowls and some of the condiments and disappearing through the archway into their little kitchen area. 






“You want to dry while I wash up?” She called through like everything was back to its own version of normal. He swallowed and called back an affirmation before picking up a few of the smaller dishes that she’d left behind and following her trail into the kitchen before pausing at the archway. 






“Mom,” he said softly, looking down at the laminate beneath his toes.




“Mhm?” she hummed and it sounded tired and weightless at the same time, her back was to him and she was already elbow deep in suds. 






“Do you think I could have become a hero… if I was quirkless?”

“You were already my hero,” she said softly but then paused and looked back at him, frowning at his sullen face, “I’m sorry Izuku.”





<<EOFANFIC>>

completion: Days had passed since Denki met the dragons of the Fat Gum Clan, he had strummed countless melodies since his departure. He already missed the warmth the kits gave him with their cuddles, especially since autumn was fastly approaching. He would have to buy winter clothing and supplies when he finally came upon a city. Right now though, Denki was content with the warm summer breeze and the bright sun.Denki loved to go off the beaten pathway, he found it more adventurous that way. He had already come across many adorable animals and some unknown plants (he picked them in hopes of selling them when he got to the city). He had gone off the beaten path once more and stumbled across a field of wildflowers. It was a rainbow of colors with so many blooms to admire, Denki felt like this would be paradise for a mage or an herbalist.Denki skipped down the hill and wandered into the field, laughing as he rolled in the flowers. He made sure to pick a few he knew about, wildflowers to press in his journal and herbs for tea he could steep. A particularly pretty blossom caught his eye, it was a vibrant silver color and glittered like stars, it was a rarity for sure! Denki skipped over and knelt down, admiring the flower before going to pick it.That is when it began to glow and Denki found himself blinded by the light. A sound akin to bee wings sounded by his ears, and Denki (who had a deathly allergy to bees), quickly shooed it away. When his hand came in contact with something not quite a bee, he looked and saw a small blonde with purple eyes, huffing at him. His skin was luminous and he glittered just like the flower. He had a red cape draped around his shoulders and his arms were crossed around his lean chest.“How dare you almost take my home!” he shouted with a weird accent, “I am aware of its beauty! It is MY home after all! But, I will not flutter idly while allowing some scummy handed thief to make away with it! Now, back!” Denki shot up and stuck his arms up in defense.“I’m so sorry! I didn’t know it was your house! I just thought it was a wildflower! I’m sorry! Now, please chill out!” That's when a ball of light fluttered by, staying right to this small fairy’s side.“Aoyama, he is just a traveler! You don’t need to get your wings in a tizzy!” The light then came right in front of Denki, resting on his nose, “I’m sorry for him, he tends to be rather protective of anything shiny! He likes things that twinkle like him!” The light giggles, “I’m Hagakure! I’m a light fairy! Aoyama is a shimmer fairy!” Denki smiled as he held out his finger, the bundle of light resting on it.“Wow! Hi! I’m Denki Kaminari! I didn’t know there were many types of fairy!” Hagakure laughed loudly at the statement. Denki turned around and his face fell a bit, “I didn’t squish anybody right? I didn’t steal any homes?”“Nope! You did just barely miss our communal nest, though,” Denki felt bad and looked to the ground.“I’m sorry! Where is it, so I know how to avoid it!” Hagakure was about to show him when something thick splattered onto Denki’s head. It startled him, causing him to yelp loudly and shake the liquid from his head.“Mina! He’s friendly! Why did you do that?!” Denki looked up to see a pink fairy with dragonfly wings that had an iridescent shine to them, “Mina here is a slime fairy, she’s responsible for creating different slimes for the environment. She also has the ability to create acids! So she can meld things together or destroy things completely!”“Acid?! Do I have a bald spot now?!” Denki felt the spot vigorously. Mina then fluttered down and sat in the spot, giggling.“Nope, it’s still all fluffy!” She crawled down and touched his forehead, looking him in the eyes, “wow, your eyes are so pretty! They’re like little suns!” She fluttered off his head and hovered in front of his face, “I’m sorry, I thought you were attacking. I was sleeping and heard Aoyama yelling, and I kinda got carried away,”“Don’t worry, you’re justified!” Denki smiled brightly and waved his hand dismissively. All the fairies stilled as a twinkling noise made its way into their ears. They all seemed to straighten into a line and bowed, making Denki still and turn around. A fairy with long blue hair and bluish violet swallowtail wings flapped gracefully over, her poise and regality was clear.“Now, now, my sweet subjects. No need to bow, we have a guest after all!” She turned her body to face Denki, who meekly bowed his head. She smiled softly at the blonde and cupped his chin with both her tiny hands, raising his head, “I am Queen Midnight, leader of this small family. What is your name, young traveler?” Her blue eyes shined with enthusiasm and curiosity. She obviously was a kind person who did not mean any harm.“Denki Kaminari, your majesty,” he answered softly. Midnight nodded and stood straight, clapping her hands together.“Well, Mr. Kaminari, in honor of your visit, I will be holding a feast! So, please, relax in the flowers while I conjure up some good grub!” She rubbed her hands together and dashed off towards a barren plain. Mina giggled and sat on Denki’s shoulder.“Her lady loves an excuse to throw a party! She’ll be busy the whole afternoon, so why don’t we show you the field! We can even help you identify the flowers you’ve already picked!”“That sounds like fun, Mina!” Denki exclaimed as his sleeve was tugged away. A few hours passed and Denki, who was now sporting a vibrant flower crown instead of his feathered cap, was basking in the shade of a huge tree. He was nearly asleep when Midnight tapped his cheek.“Hey there, young traveler! The feast is ready! Come on!” Midnight pulled his sleeve and guided him to the field that was filled with sparkles as lighting and copious amounts of food. Denki’s eyes sparkled at the many dishes steaming up the air, licking his lips as Midnight sat him on a pillow. The other fairies gathered around, and with a snap of their fingers, grew to a human size. Denki nearly choked when he saw the previous spot of light turn into a beautiful girl with vibrant green and pink hair with spots of light covering her privates. Denki blushed as she sat to his left, Mina cuddled up to his right, and Aoyama sat across from him. Midnight had sat herself on the hill to watch over them, a smile on her face as they ate all and laughed. When Denki was finished eating his share, she took out his lute and began to pluck.“Queen Midnight, allow me to repay your hospitality with a song!” he bowed. Midnight pretended to think before nodding, making Denki giggle as he strummed a tune, “Upon a field of blooms, with many a rarity! A family of fairies you may find, gracefully flying free! They are mothered oh so sweetly, by Midnight their queen! Whose violet wings blow in the breeze like nothing you’ve ever seen! Aoyama gives things a shimmery hue and Hagakure, who gives things light! And Mina, whose spunky, may drench you funky, in her freshly made slime!” he noticed how the fairies began to dance to his music, “ohhh! The Midnight Family! The Midnight Family! Fairies who dance and cheer, oh so merrily! They played and planted, fluttered and stuttered, well into the night! Dancing with such grace, under the starlight! Soooo! If you ever wander, upon a field of blooms! Keep an eye for spots of sparkles, for Midnight protects her brood!” he struck a final pose, getting claps from the fairies.Denki sang songs well into the night, merry with fine juices and a full belly. When he finally crashed under a tree, Midnight manifested a blanket and watched as her children shrank and laid on different parts of him. When they had awoken, Denki decided it was best to be off. He received hugs from each fairy, they all kissed his cheek as well. When Midnight approached, she embraced Denki the tightest. She noticed his pendant and smiled, grazing it gently.“Kaminari, you will always have friends here. If you ever find yourself in trouble, please, just think of us,” her hand flashed pink quickly before she stepped back. With some extra food packed for him and a final round of hugs, Denki made his way out of the field. He skipped up the hill and looked back as all the fairies were waving goodbye. completion: Kirishima Eijirou was a hopeless romantic. He never showed it, though. He would just close the door of his room and spent his free time reading romance stories after training. Still, he would never dare to admit it. Was romance even manly? He'd feel embarrassed to show that side of his to his friends. To him. Denki. Eijirou never had an actual love life, just a few crushes here and there. He was used to those unrequited romances, it was alright, he didn't need to be reciprocated, it was enough to see the person happy. Those fuzzy feelings on his heart every time his eyes lit up at the sight of his beloved proved that he was alive. Love was his reason to be alive, a secret he could never tell. He saw his parents since he was little, being so sweet and romantic to each other, it was only natural for him to want to live something like that. But he never imagined himself with a girl. He tried to have crushes on them since he was a kid, but it would never happen.“Mom, all my boy classmates have crushes on girls, but why can't I have a crush on them?”, he asked his mom one day, with a sad expression.“What do you mean, sweetie?”, she asks confused.“I don't know what love feels like”, he admitted.“Love is that fuzzy feeling you have on your heart that tells you that you want to be closer to your special person. 1. creation.
Todoroki Mika was signed on her birth certificate.The 5th child of the Todoroki family was brought into the world on a snowy December 11th. Brought home on the 17th, came into awareness on the 22nd, and her quirk torched her nursery on the 29th.Carried in her father's arms, her boiling body was sleepy, the accident ripping out all her energy.Yet, he still marvelled, the tiny red hairs upon her head were lit aflame.The calm atmosphere that Shoto’s birth created 11 months ago was gone, and quirk accidents became the norm.The infant would sneeze smoke, and clap with tiny flames in her hands, and when she was happy, her rapidly growing hair would spark, sizzle and burn on any wooden surface. Her clothes would melt from the cascading lava coming from her head.Rei would have to deal with a dangerous, waling baby while he fetched one of the house's many fire extinguishers.Mika was an enigma.No child awakens their quirk when barely weeks old, not in such a powerful way — but that was his Mika.He would focus on Touya, get him to give up on being a hero lest he died from his quirk like a fool — and when the sun kissed the horizon, he would put his little flame to bed, content with the masterpiece he sired.
2. upbringing.
The earliest possible quirk examination could be performed when the child was at most; 17 months old.The wide gap was mostly for health reasons. Any baby is most susceptible to illness in the first months of life, Enji knew this. He’s not new to this — it was a disappointment all the same.He won’t do anything during this time either.
The support agency that makes his battle wear already agreed to a hushed agreement for clothes within the oncoming months. His first request was a no-brainer.
Hats, hair ties and many gloves and mittens.They made multiple, in so many designs Shoto could pick some for himself. He tested the durability, picking up a hat and trying his best to burn it to cinders.Nothing but a smell, he nodded in approval.But it couldn’t be that easy, his little firecracker had to be difficult, refusing to wear the (expensive) clothes. She adored the hair ties, so he ordered more, some bows, some little flower clips that Rei found cute, and his wallet slowly drained from the massive collection.He wouldn’t buy any more for a long time, (he wished) until his second-born Fuyumi and a sheepish Natsuo brought their observations to his study one Saturday afternoon.“Don’t you think she needs a toy she can actually hold, you know, without gloves?”Enji thought about it for two days, watching Shoto’s figurines and stuffed animals dissolve to ashes and (hesitantly bringing out his credit card) made a phone call.He started slow, requesting a stuffed cat in her favourite colour. When the package was delivered by a blushing mailman, Enji tested the animal, (proving the flexibility of his support company) and presented it before her crib.In return, she gifted him a gummy smile, biting the ear and toying with it until sleep succumbed to her.
3. distance
Enji would delve further into heroics that year, focusing less on building his family, and more on his career. He would beat every record a former pro set, and rise the ranks all with his fiery fist. And yet, it wasn’t enough.He was still second best, still overshadowed by All Might’s blinding shadow.He would see his family less, and stay at work more. Rei would have trouble handling their youngest daughter. She would have fiery fits but thank the heavens, her ice quirk was suitable enough so she wouldn’t danger the kids.Enji would get calls when he wasn’t patrolling. Some good, some bad, and it wasn’t ideal but — nobody would expect this. The hats, the gloves and the slight separation of the Irish twins.It was acceptable until— and Mika loved being difficult— it wasn’t.The urgent phone call rang in his office on an unsuspecting January 4th, snow covering the ground.And it would not be cowardice to admit the tingling in his hand when Rei answered sobbing, crying children in the background. Nor the way his head lit aflame, or how quick he was to the hospital where most of his son's chest was an ugly, rotting purple.His Touya, how easily his dreams were crushed, how easily his skin melts. The villain who dared—But there was no villain to pummel, to defeat. He was too late, he failed.Instead of gut-wrenching guilt, (which there was plenty) the amalgamation of disgust, fear and hatred burned within him, all for his little girl who caused this.In the hospital room, she was cuddling with Shoto in the size too big stroller bought for the two of them. With the use of the never used stroller for one, Enji could tell Rei hadn’t thought of safety, or practicality, shoving the toddlers and a blanket, covering Touya with a sheet of ice and breaking every red light on the way to the hospital.She preferred using their many double strollers for walks…Mika was sucking on her thumb, little snores escaping her nose.Maybe before— before this disaster, he would feel his heart swoon, let his lip quirk at the sound, but his heart was empty. He didn’t feel a thing.Something so small, causing so much damage… That damn quirk exam needed to happen now. This madness needs to stop.It starts with training that child.

completion: The light coming through the window would normally be blinding. With it shining through the glass into my glasses. It isn’t today though it frames their face in just the right way. The light shining onto their back makes their face stand out even more. It makes the shine in their eyes pop out even more than normal. The brown of his eyes looks like it shines, like bits of gold are sticking out. The small bits of gold make their eyes seem perfect, like I could stare at them forever.However, that’s not even the thing that caught my attention. It’s the way that they were excitedly rambling about one of their favorite games. Slowly over the number of times they have talked about it.  I started to pick up some small things about it. It wasn’t just the way that the light framed them, or how their eyes were shining. I was looking more at the way that it makes them happy. The way it makes a small smile come on to their face. Not spreading far but just enough for me to notice.I had put my elbow down against the round table, there was a chill that spreads up my arm. From the cold of the table, even though it is not terribly cold outside. I could feel the softness of the palm of my hand pressed against the side of my face. I could feel the small areas that calluses were building slowly. I felt a small smile spread across my face. It had barely reached my eyes. It wasn’t the biggest smile ever, but it was genuine. With my hand pressed up against the corner of my lip. I could feel the dryness of my lips. The way that my lips desperately needed some Chapstick. I didn’t care though, just sitting there listening to their soft voice made me happier.There was a warmth that spread through my body. I couldn’t tell what it was at first, but I knew that I felt safe. The warmth stayed even as the bell rang, and we had to pack up to get walking to our next class. I listened as closely to them as I could. It was easy for me; their voice had stuck out in the crowd. Not because it was loud or harsh, but because it was soft and gentle. A contrast with my voice, my voice echos but they spoke loudly enough for just me to hear. Even with everything else, the yelling in the background, the harsh sounds of 6th graders running to their next class. I could hear themThey stood out, not because of how they looked but because of their presence next to me. The feeling of them made me able to tell if they were no longer next to me. The body heat that they had and the soft way that they walked stood out. It was amazing being able to watch them be happy. Even if I couldn’t pick up everything they were saying I tried. I was listening intensely to be able pick up what was going on, but I had little to no context. So, as my feet hit the rough concrete, I tried to avoid the people walking the other way on the sidewalk. However, I kept looking back at them, I felt like I couldn’t stop. No matter what.As we walked against the concrete and the rough fabric of my clothes were rubbing against me. The feeling of my jeans rubbing against my legs, the fact that my sock had started to ball up in the bottom of my boot. I would still look over at them. In the end I had to stop myself from trying to reach out and offer them to hold my hand. I wanted to reach out, out of wanting to feel how soft their hands were. I had managed to stop myself right as we were walking into our next class. So, as they walked ahead of me a little bit, I slowly put my hand back against my side and in the pocket of my olive-green jacket. While we were sitting there, at our table in the back of the class, they were still softly rambling. I tuned out all the other loud noises in my class and listened to them. I only listened to them as class hadn’t started yet. I didn’t pay attention to the shouting that was coming from the desk next to us. I loved listening to them talk however, after like a minute or so they finished their soft ramble about their game. I had realized once again that I was leaning my head against the palm of my hand with my elbow against the table. I felt my wrist start to ache with the feeling of putting the entire weight of my head on my hand. Slowly, I decided to move my arm and saw a bright red spot on my elbow from the pressure.I sit there thinking for a moment, a moment in the silence. I think about how happy I am right now before it hits me. It hits me like a truck. The fact that my feelings for them have come back. The fact that I liked them once again, it was the third time. After I had finished processing It wasn’t that big of a shock anymore. However, I realized I could never tell them that I had liked them again. I did it once before, the first time I liked them. I wouldn’t tell them this time. I didn’t want to see the small glimmer from their eyes fade. To make our friendship awkward again. So, I’ll just hide it, hopefully I will do a good enough job. That they won’t be able to tell how my face lights up when I see them.Hopefully, I will never have to see that. I don’t want to see all the bright colors in their brown eyes go dull again. Until then I will bask in the warmth that spreads through my body when I talk to them. The small smile that spreads across my face as I listen to them talk. I will resist the urge to hold my hand out for them to grab. I will sit here and just try to enjoy their presence, because no matter what they will never like me back. So, I will just have to wait to feel their soft hand in mine once again even if it isn’t the way I want. Because seeing them light up talking about something they love, their hands moving about when he gets excited is worth it. It will always be worth it.I don’t think there will ever be a happily ever after this time. Real life doesn’t work like that, it doesn’t just give me what I want whenever I want. So, until these feeling go away, I'll just wait it out. Wait till they go away and come back once again like they always have.<<EOFANFIC>>

10 seconds

.

It’s been 10 seconds since Gran Torino raced away to be “Eraser’s legs.” Hizashi feels like maybe he should have been counting from the moment the first wave of Decay ended, but his life was still busy flashing before his eyes.

The trip out from the hospital was a blur for many reasons: he’d lost his glasses, he’d been traveling at lightning speed and he’d just looked death in the face. But he knows Shouta had been grabbed, then had gotten free, carried away by Ryukyu.

That leaves a worrying leeway to how injured he could be.


20 seconds.


The doctor is raving beside him, and Hizashi keeps exactly as much attention on him as necessary to make sure he’s not getting away before the police arrive to apprehend him. No matter how worried he is about Shouta, no way is he letting that guy escape after what he did to Oboro. To Shouta.


30 seconds.


The comms are a rush of babble. Without his glasses it’s hard to make out much of anything, but he’s close enough to see the rush of flames from Endeavor.

Shigaraki is just a speck in comparison. They’re moving fast, rushing across the wreckage of Decay. Radio waves ricochet through the ruins, their comms fizzling out. Hizashi still hasn’t heard anything of Shouta. Shigaraki is still clearly using his Quirks, meaning that… but no. Hizashi had seen him get out, had seen him holding onto his capture weapon.

He prays to anything that might be listening that that means Shouta was logical and hid before activating his Quirk on Shigaraki.


40 seconds.


Shigaraki hasn’t used any Quirks for a beat. 

Is that Erasure?

Hizashi doesn’t know if he hopes it is or isn’t.


50 seconds.


A peal of flame, and Shigaraki’s blur darting aside.

The Doctor is explaining something about Shigaraki’s new body.

So it is Erasure.

Hizashi swallows. 

Please be well hidden, Shouta.



60 seconds.


From this distance, Hizashi can only see flares and hear the distant impacts.


70 seconds.


The battle rages on.


80 seconds.


And on.


90 seconds.


And on.


100 seconds.


And on.

He loses count. All he focuses on is that Decay hasn’t activated yet. He doesn’t know how Shouta can go so long without blinking, how he is, but he has to be alive.

He’s alive.

He has to be alive.

And then the battle shifts.

With a powerful Quirk like his, Hizashi hasn’t had to be nearly as aware of the battlefield as Shouta, but even from a distance, he can see when it changes. When the plane of the fight shifts upwards, starts keeping Shigaraki away from the ground.

He knows.

He knows Erasure is gone.


Please.



Please,

 he pleads, though he doesn’t know who he’s pleading with. 

Don’t let him be gone with it.


He barely even registers the rest of the fight. Just begs them to land. To 

land,

 to show that Erasure is back up, that Shouta just needed a moment to blink, to regroup, to hide somewhere safer, 

please…


**

By the time the doctor is in custody and he can run back to the battlefield, he’s informed by relief crew moving in that Aizawa was taken to the hospital already.

He stumbles around, trying to find anyone still standing to fill him in.

Eventually, Rock Lock finds him. He’s soaked in blood, but he doesn’t seem to be bandaged anywhere. Hizashi’s stomach flips.

“If you’re looking for Eraser, he was taken to the hospital in the first wave,” Rock Lock says.

Hizashi numbly points at his stained suit. “Is… Is that…” he manages.

Rock Lock looks at him grimly. “His students… they went above and beyond for him. I know it’s a small consolation, but I can promise we did everything we could to get him help in time.”

It’s so much time.

“You should go to the hospital,” Rock Lock says. “They should let you stay with him, as another UA teacher.”

Hizashi looks around at the swathes of injuries and wreckage. It seems selfish, and yet…


To be in the first wave of heroes taken to the hospital… how bad…


Rock Lock puts a hand on his shoulder. “It’s alright. Go. It’s only thanks to Eraser that we didn’t have to content with a second wave of Decay. He should have his friend with him.”

Hizashi manages to nod. With that logic, he can almost forgive himself for it.

**

It takes hours for Shouta to get out of surgery.

Hizashi finds out about Kayama being dead before he hears anything about Shouta.

He jiggles his leg frantically. Grief can wait. For now all he can focus on is 

not Shouta too.

 It’s not any less painful, but at least it won’t break him before the dust has even settled.

What feels like 100 hours later, the doctor finally emerges.

“You’re here for Aizawa-san?” he asks.

“I’m with UA,” he says as explanation. The doctor nods, like those aren’t the cursed words Hizashi always thinks of when he’s lying awake at night, watching Shouta rolled into his blanket next to him, wondering if he could get Aizawa to bang out a marriage license out of practicality. 
What if one of us is seriously injured? Wouldn’t you want to be able to be first to find out how the other is doing? imaginary Hizashi will say. As UA teachers, we’d be able to do that anyway, imaginary Shouta says, blase and bored. And imaginary Hizashi, the ever strategic little negotiator, will not say, But how will I feel about it? Shouta, I wouldn’t be there because of UA. Don’t you know that?
Because Shouta wouldn’t know what to say to that, and that’s something Hizashi likes to do to his friend. More than friend.

And yet, now he has his answer.

It feels terrible.

Fortunately, he supposes, it’s overshadowed by the sickness of the response. “The bloodloss he suffered was immense. We’ll be keeping him sedated for a few days while he recovers, but so far the transfusion has been without complications. The leg was surprisingly cleanly severed, so there shouldn’t be any nerve damage and he should be able to transition to a prosthetic limb.”

Hizashi meant to stand up, but now that’s absolutely not an option.

“Unfortunately, the same cannot be said about his eye,” the doctor says, and there is a swell of unshed tears so fierce behind Hizashi’s eyes that he couldn’t cry if he wanted to, a traffic jam behind the lids that hurts and sears through his face. “There was some damage to the browbones, extensive damage to the lids, eye and ocular nerve from the impact. We had to remove it completely.” 


Remove it completely.


Hizashi thinks back to the few times Shouta was tired enough to let Hizashi put in his eye drops for him, more intimate than any times Hizashi has had his mouth on him, has murmured 

‘I love you’

s into Shouta’s skin while inside him because he knows Shouta won’t overthink it if it’s in the heat of the moment, even if he knows it’s true.

The way he’d stayed unaffected as ever and not even winced when Hizashi put his fingers on the edges of the lids to steady his hands, and yet through some sort of vibration under his skin Hizashi knew how fragile this moment was, how vulnerable Shouta must have felt to have Hizashi’s hands around his eyes, the little medicated bottle almost touching.

How that was Shouta’s own way of saying 

I love you too

 without overthinking it, without frightening himself, even though this might have been far scarier.

There is something so sickeningly perverse about imagining a stranger’s scalpel carving into that eye, under the lid, scooping it out, and that eye being gone, never to be cared for so tenderly again…

“Present Mic,”  the doctor says, interrupting his grief.


No sense grieving for an eye, 

Shouta would say. 

I’m alive, aren’t I?


Hizashi can’t guess right now if he’d mean it. 

“Can I see him?” Hizashi manages, his throat hoarse. It’s been so long since he went this long without speaking. Even when he really should, even when Shouta reminds him that he needs to rest his throat, and Hizashi whines and protests until Shouta uses his Quirk to silence him…


Can he even do that anymore?


“Right this way,” the doctor says, and leads him inwards.

**

Shouta is laid out on his back, cold white sheets spread neatly over his body. He never sleeps like that. Always cocoons himself, curled fully onto his side, back to Hizashi. Hizashi doesn’t mind that, knows it means Shouta trusts him with his back.

It feels so weird to see him sleeping on his back, limp and lifeless. The bandages over his missing eye, flattening his messy hair.

Hizashi sits beside him, takes his hand. He knows Shouta will let him even if he wakes, but for the time being he’s still sedated.

**

It’s a two days before they give him the seal of approval to be woken from the sedation. It takes a while after they wean him off, and he wakes with a quick twitch of the hand that Hizashi has cupped in his own, up towards his face.

“It’s gone,” Hizashi says. “They had to remove the eye completely.”

It’s not often that Hizashi guesses Shouta’s reactions wrong. He knows Shouta like the back of his hand, maybe better. 

All Shouta says is, “Oh,” but Hizashi knows. Can hear the little quiver in his voice, the same grief he’d felt.

He pulls Shouta’s hand back into his own, resting Shouta’s knuckles against his forehead.

“Nevermind,” Hizashi says. “You’re alive.”

“Mm,” Shouta says, voice thick.

Hizashi cradles his hand to his chest and pulls the rest of him into his arms as carefully as he can. “It’s alright,” he says. “It’s alright, I’ve got you.”

Shouta slumps against him, letting him.

Hizashi just wishes he knew how to make it true.

PrologueIt is near the end of the day. The television is on, barely audible in the background while they are eating miso soup, all three cats reunited at their feet under the table. Their silence doesn’t seem uncomfortable since they are both lost in their own train of thoughts, too exhausted to even let out a single word.The blond finishes his bowl first, getting up to put it in the dishwasher. Only two of the cats follow him in the kitchen, the black one deciding to jump on the other man’s lap. He then slowly makes his way back at the dinner table, almost tripping on Pumpkin, the orange cat that always manages to get in the way somehow.The other man directs his attention towards the blond long enough to make sure he’s okay, glaring back down at his still-completely-full bowl when he has his confirmation. He’s twiddling with his chopsticks with his right hand while his left softly pats Moka that’s laying on his lap. He doesn’t feel like eating at all.“Shota…” the blond whispers, sitting next to the raven-haired man. “I know today is not a good day, sweetheart,” and at that, the man stops fidgeting with his chopsticks and looks up at his husband “but you must eat a bit. You haven’t eaten a single thing since last night.” Shota looks down at his lap — or more at Moka dozing off — and doesn’t say anything.The blond lets out a sigh. “Look, I won’t force you to finish that bowl. It's just... We both know it's not healthy. Even if you are not hungry, you should eat a little bit. Not even all of it, just a bit. Okay?”Shota quickly glances at the blond again before looking back down at his bowl. He really, really doesn't feel like eating, but he also desperately needs to eat. It just makes his stomach churn at the thought of taking some."I'll try." is all the black-haired man manages to say. It's a short answer, but his husband seems satisfied with it. After that, the blond gets up and slowly starts to make his way towards the living room. "Oh and Hizashi…"The man turns around, surprised that the raven-haired man still has something to say. He tilts his head to the side, waiting for the man to spill the tea."Thank you."He stands there for a moment, not knowing what to answer. The blond's not sure what the other man is thanking him for, doesn't know whether it's for the food or not, but he still offers him a soft smile before sitting in the sofa.Pumpkin joins him, followed by Mochi, the youngest of all three. The orange cat finds his own spot next to Hizashi while the white one lays on the man's lap, needing more attention.The two men usually watch tv together in the evening since Hizashi always asks for it. It's pretty rare that the blond goes in the living room all alone after eating. Not that the living room isn't visible from the kitchen, just that, normally, the blond waits for his husband before sitting in the sofa to watch tv. Shota guesses it has to do with the fact that this day is already messed up.Nothing normal happened since they both woke up. First, Hitomi — Shota's sister — and her pathetic husband, Kiyoshi, had a car accident. It happened a bit before noon.Luckily, their 7-year-old son, Hitoshi, was at his grandmother’s house when it happened.The man was drunk without his wife knowing it and drove way past the speed limit. Hitomi was so scared that she called the police while she was silently fighting for her life in the passenger seat. Unfortunately, it was already too late when the police arrived. The car had crashed.Not only had he drove under the influence of alcohol, but the accident also caused major injuries to his wife. The worst part of all that is that he wasn't as injured as Hitomi due to the alcohol, his body being more relaxed on the moment of the impact. Still, they were both sent to the hospital afterwards.When Kiyoshi will be in a better state, he'll have to pay for collateral damage. Plus, with all what he did, there’s no doubt he’ll go in jail.All that, Shota knows it because the police and nurses told him directly since his sister is in no state to talk.She is in a coma and nobody knows for how long. They said it could be between two and four weeks, but it's also possible that she wakes up in months, depending on the situation.The dark-haired man still stayed by Hitomi’s side while she was resting in her hospital bed, head and arms wrapped in bandages. He knows she is strong. She is going to be fine. She has to.Only a few hours after Shota came back from the hospital, as if the accident was not enough already, Hizashi's parents called to inform him that they were divorcing. The blond was shocked, not to say the least. Being an overly emotional person, he balled his eyes out in his husband's shoulder for an hour straight — which he felt bad for doing so since Shota had dealt with worse earlier in the day — before they both fell asleep on the sofa.When they woke up near 5 pm, they both felt sick and even more tired. They were not actually sick, simply mentally affected by everything that had happened, but still. It wasn't very pleasant.Since then, they haven't talked a lot.Shota just hopes things would go back to normal. He wants his sister to wake up and actually be okay. He also wishes that his husband's parents would still be a happy married couple. It kills him to see Hizashi like that. He just wants that day to end."Shota, you might wanna see this" the blond's quivering voice breaks Shota's train of thoughts. There is something off about the way he said it and he doesn't like it. Apparently, this day is not coming to an end just yet. "Come over here. Fast."The black-haired man doesn’t question it. He gets up and rushes into the living room. Hizashi turns up the volume as he sits up in his seat. Shota doesn’t even sit in the sofa, just stands there, too stubborn to even move. What — or more who — appeared on the screen is far from what he had expected.
Believe it or not, we just found three villains' corpses you may all know really well. We don't know their names nor what they call themselves, but they are pretty well known for what they did near a decade ago. 

As you may see it on the screen, those were the same villains that attacked a whole city it now has been eight years, ending the life of two very young heroes that sacrificed themselves to protect us that day: Oboro Shirakumo and Nozomi Honekansei. The boy and the girl had been in a fight with one of the three villains, whose quirk is to disintegrate by sight. He caused their body to disappear into ashes, from what we concluded, because not much had been found from them after the attack.
Shota couldn't tear his eyes away from the picture of his dead friends that were on the screen. Eight years. It had been eight years since...
Lots of civilians died under the same circumstances that day. Unfortunately, not all of their bodies had been found, the cause being similar to the previous explanation.

The remaining heroes had saved other civilians and had also tried to capture the villains, but the three of them still managed to escape. We've never found them since then.

Until today.
The villains' mysterious death is quite perplexing. We've been told the bodies were found all distorted, bones broken, killed a matter of seconds before an underground explosion. There's a theory that their base was below the surface too. The explosion probably came from down there, destroying everything left.
But if the villains were killed before the explosion, who or what killed them, exactly?
We don't have the answer to that question just yet, that's all we have for the moment. Hopefully, this week, we will come back to you with more information. Stay tuned!
And with that, eight years of intense searching is now over. Oboro and Nozomi will forever be forgotten and nobody will talk about them ever again. What an unfair world. In that story, they've talked more about the villains than about the heroes. Where are their priorities...<<EOFANFIC>>

He screwed up. He knows he did, but it doesn’t make it any easier to accept.But Denki knows the rules. He knows what has to happen when he steps out of line, when he doesn’t adhere to the regulations laid out in front of him, plain as day.He wonders if he could ever stay out of trouble now, even if he tried.There’s a sharp ache in his knees, from where they have been pressed into the rough carpet for what feels like an eternity. He tries to crane his neck ever so slightly upwards, to ease the pain at the base of his neck.A gloved hand, soft but insistent, pushes him back down. The leather is cool against the clamminess of his hair and for a moment, he tries to lean into it.There’s a tutting noise and then the crop comes down on his back again, wrenching a groan from the back of his throat.“Now, now,” comes Jiro’s voice, tantalisingly close to his ear. “That’s what bad boys deserve.” It comes around in the strangest of circumstances – after they fight The Big 3’s Mirio, of all things.The fight is a one-sided rout, of course, Class 1A wildly outgunned against a third-year whose quirk seems to practically batter everyone off the park, even their own heavy hitters. As they troop out of the gymnasium, several headed for Recovery Girl’s office, Bakugo’s audible rage can be heard from a distance.For Denki however, he is fixed with the more pressing issue of attempting to untangle himself from Jiro’s jacks.He has no recollection how the hell he ended up trussed by them, forced back-to-back with her, but they nevertheless are causing something of an impediment to him being able to stand up and follow the rest of his classmates.From the door, Aizawa casts the pair a deadpan look, and then simply vanishes with his sleeping bag, leaving them to their own devices.Denki grumbles under his breath, and struggles to unwrap the earlobes around him. He has not seen much movement from Jiro since he woke up, and assumes she is still in a state of unconsciousness.To his confusion however, any attempt to break free has the opposite effect; instead, the jacks encircle him more firmly and pull him back flush against her.He swears under his breath and tries to twist his head, only for one of the jacks to thwack him across the side of the face.“Ow!” he exclaims, and suddenly he is released at once, the vice-like grip on his body slackened and the presence at his back promptly torn away.“What the – Kaminari?”He twists his neck and finds Jiro staring at him, mouth agape, blush furiously rising up her neck from underneath her gym uniform.“What did you do?” she states, eyes blazing, and she takes a step forward. He scrambles to his feet, his own indignation fired up.“Dude, you’re the one who wrapped me up!” he counters, earning a snort in return.“Like hell I would have done, “ she snaps back, and her jacks come up threateningly again. He throws up his arms in frustration.“Well, you did! The last thing I remember is being blinded by that guy from The Big 3, and then…”He trails off as Jiro blinks, and then seems to collapse in upon herself. It is as if the fire of her anger has been extinguished with the metaphorical flip of a switch.“Crap,” she murmurs, and her jacks retract back up towards her earlobes.“Yeah, crap,” he echoes. “What I want to know is why you were so determined to keep me captive, huh?”“What?” she says. “What do you mean, keep you captive?”“Your jacks didn’t want to let me go! And you slapped me with one!”If Denki had not thought Jiro was flushing before, then he surely would be now. The pink tinge that had dusted her cheeks rose to a furious red, and he suddenly wondered if he had pressed a button he did not realise she had.He is too slow to dodge her left jack again, and receives another sharp thwack to the face. It stings, but to his surprise, not in a bad way. The dull throb it leaves behind is an ache that sends a strange feeling down the static channels in his body; a shiver not of fear, but of anticipation.Jiro turns to storm out of the gymnasium, face still flushed, and on instinct he reaches out and grabs her wrist. She twists in his grip, then spins back towards him, the fire back in her eyes.“Dude, let go of me,” she says. “I won’t ask again.”“Why wouldn’t you let me go?” he asks, and she growls and thwacks him again, attempting to wrestle free. He loosens his hold on her and she wrenches her arm free, but strangely does not continue towards the exit.Instead, she stands opposite him, a few feet between them, and continues to smart. He presses again.“Why?” He takes a step towards her.
Thwack.
“Why?” Another step.
Thwack.
“I said why?” The gap between them now is merely a few inches. He can see the specks of gold around her irises.
Thwack.

Thwack.

Thwack.
Again, and again, and again, she slaps him across the face, and he bites the inside of his lip to stop the moan that is trying to escape from the back of his throat.
Oh yeah. This is doing it for him in ways he totally did not expect.
Jiro is panting, the exertion of her rage and the realisation of her actions – for all of the physical contact they share, this type of pain is something markedly different, and not wholly in line with UA policy outside of the classroom – working in combination to stagger her. He reaches out, past her outstretched jack, and grabs her wrist again.The look of shocked confusion when he brings her palm up to the side of his face and uses it to slap himself firmly across the jaw stirs something very strange down below.“Kaminari, what the hell?” she exclaims, wrenching her hand away from his grasp once more. He cannot keep his voice down and lets out a quiet groan. She moves to snatch her hand away, but his own shoots up again and pins hers there.“Please,” he half-asks, half-pleads, and a strange understanding passes across her features. The set of her mouth relaxes, her brow drops and an unexpected tenderness lights up her eyes. Denki thinks he could get lost in it forever. When they have finished, they lie together fully clothed on his bunk, Jiro behind him in the big spoon position. Izuku’s eyes fret over the jumping vitals displayed across multiple monitors, scratching down observations on his worn down clipboard, mumbling to himself as he annotated and walked mindlessly to the observation tank at the other end of the room.  It was pitch black inside of the large tank, all light seemingly sucked into a vacuum—but Izuku knew of what lurked in those shadows. Every light from this half of the lab was turned off, all for the comfort of the creature lurking inside. He brought over a chair from the desk at his right, opting to place it in front of the tank as he sat down, heart beating wildly in his chest as he looked up at the tank and back down at his notes. The bell rang after a few more classes, so Izuku’s mood was back to being down, he hated the way it changed so often; when he was 8 he had the same problem, it was sad because he would pray to all might for him to stop being like that. *Sigh* “Deku!” A jumping bubbly girl came, “oh, hey uraraka, what’s up?”; he used to have a crush on uraraka but stoped when  Iida told Izuku he liked her, it was alright he didn’t mind that much since he had just started getting to know uraraka; “Do you wanna come over to a party, it’s gonna be at momo’s house, it’s nothing big really, we’re probably just gonna watch a movie and play board games, but good news! everyone is coming!” He was stunned, not because she was inviting him but because everyone was coming, it’s really hard to convince Shoto and Bakugo; huh, weird. “AH, uh, yeah sure! Text me the information about it” He replied when he realized he had been mumbling this whole time about pros and cons about it, Uraraka  chuckled and waved goodbye. 


Izuku smiled and since classes were over, he just went over to the dorms. Izuku got near his uncomfortable  bed, but a bit more relaxed, bakugo had cheered his day up by just looking pretty, it’s ironic because he knew that if he had stared at bakugo liked that before his faces would’ve been blown if in seconds, he liked not being in bad terms, plus being near him wasn’t so bad, it was almost sweet. *DING* Oh, right the info.

-Uraraka                🟢Online
-Uraraka: HEYYYYY! 🤭
-Izuku: Hi.
-Uraraka: OH, RIGHT THE INFO 😋
  Adress :***********
  Hour: Today/10:00pm to 10:00am
  No pets! But you can brings snacks ☺️
-Izuku: Thank you! See you there :)
-Uraraka: BYEEE 😊

(Fun fact: Izuku didn’t like to make small chat in text.)

Izuku started getting ready, if he didn’t start changing he wouldn’t be able to get there on time, he checked them time once he finished changing “9:38”, Great he was one time. Izuku was about to go out when he realized it started raining  again, “ah shit.” He forgot an umbrella, a tall shadow with an already wet umbrella walked op to him, as he looked up to him he realized it was bakugo “take this nerd, I have another one” bakugo said being quite hesitant while giving it to him, Izuku was flustered be he thanked him for it and realized he in fact didn’t have one. Bakugo was stubborn since he always said he “didn’t get sick” that was a lie, buts it’s alright he hold the umbrella so it would cover both of them and even tho it wasn’t an amazing walk, it wasn’t bad. After all momo’s house wasn’t so far away so it would be a short walk. “Fuck you D- Izuku.. if your not gonna use the umbrella right give it to me.” He said while grabbing his umbrella and putting it up to izuku head.

completion:
"This is so fucking stupid." I huffed. I watched as my group of friends continued to drink bottles of sake from across the club that I, unfortunately, found myself in. Adrinette picked this stupid club for her bachelorette party. It was in a rural area of Okinawa, close to Malcolm's Air Force base. From what Adrinette told me, Malcolm thought it would be easier to have the ceremony in Japan so that he could be closer to his base and so they could travel to Japan together. I remember how excited Hattie was when she first got the news.
"Oh, my GOD! Imagine how pretty the cherry blossoms will be!"
And now she and our other friends are getting blackout drunk across the club. I shook my head slightly at my friends. They wouldn't shut up about this trip for months, talking about what they would do. I even remember going over the wedding plans a lot; I technically did help with most of it. From the colors to the decorations to almost the damn dress Adrinette would be wearing. She had been planning this since we were kids; I remember the kinky-haired girl with braces and glasses dreaming and freaking out about her "forever prince charming." But me? Vexica? I never really cared to be with someone forever. Ever since I was little, I only knew one thing; people are always replaceable, and nothing is forever. So, in summary, I think relationships are a waste of my time. I mean, I rarely even go out and party."C'mon, Vex, come dance with us!" Adrinette yelled from halfway across the club. I jolted out of my thoughts, slightly shaking my head to my over-eager friend. I hated the idea of a grown strange man grinding on my ass. "Your loooosss!" She yelled, disappearing into the crowd once again. I sighed, ignoring my friend, and turned to my phone. It had buzzed for the past 15 minutes, mostly stupid notifications from our bridesmaid's group chat.

Hat Cat Hattie 


: OMG, I just saw the HOTTEST chick :0



Adrinette Knows Best 


: bitch SPILL



That's so Raven 


: Bet money it's a masc



Hat Cat Hattie 


: shut UP, RAVEn



That's so Raven  


: Not my problem that you're a pillow princess



Hat Cat Hattie 


: you ace bitch



That's so Raven 


: Suck it



Deja Vu 


: Hey, now it's not Hattie's fault that she can't top anyone because she is 4'11



Shine Bright Like A Diamond 


: LMAO



Bashia Asia 


: LMAO



Princess Jasmine 


: LMAO



Hat Cat Hattie 


: WHAT THE FUCK YALL



Adrinette Knows Best 


: You hella quiet Vex



Shine Bright Like A Diamond 


: No deadass



Bashia Asia 


: Oh my god, did she finally catch a dick



Princess Jasmine 


: Or a coochie



Hex Vex 


: Im just reading you morons going back and forth



Hat Cat Hattie 


: MORONS????



Adrinette Knows Best 


: HATTIE, FOCUS ON HOT CHICK



Hat Cat Hattie 


: OH SHIT, MY B

I slightly chuckled at my phone as my friends continued to banter back and forth. But it didn't take long for my smile to fade as another notification popped up on my phone slowly.

Junior


: I got another one for you, Boss. Please call me as soon as possible.

I let a slight tsk fall from my lips as I pushed my way out of the club. Why is he texting me? He should have known I told everyone I was going on vacation. "Bullshit." I mumble to myself. "Hey, hey, where are you going?" I heard a familiar voice say. I turn to see Hattie, one of the fellow bridesmaids. Her curly light brown shimmered in the club roaming lights, clearly a mess from her probably dancing too hard. "Hey, Hattie. Just some work stuff. I'll be right back.""Ugh, you and your stupid government job. You're not even in the country, and they're still bothering you?" Hattie said, rolling her brown eyes. I slightly chuckled at the pouting girl and turned back around. "I'll be back, promise," I replied. As I pushed through the club, I took my phone and dialed Junior's number."Hello?""Spill it, Junior. What's going on? Why did you need to call me on vacation.""Huh? I can barely hear you." I smack my lips and push past the bouncer. "Excuse me, ill be right back." I say to the towering bouncer. He nods in agreement, and I pull out my phone again."Okay, can you hear me now?""Yea, now what did you say?""Yea, so um, why in the fuck did you call me Junior? You know I'm on vacation for Adrinette's wedding.""I know, I know, im sorry. But it's important.""It fucking better be.""Peter Johnson. Age 34. He's an advocate against same-sex marriages and also a raging racist. He's just moved into the office.""Office?""Not like the White House office, but close. 'Parently, he just became a senate and promised to go through with his rants. Suppose he does; this country is going to go into shit. Im sorry, but this was important." I sighed. " I understand; thank you for telling me. How long ago was he put into office.""Yesterday evening, it was announced all over the news. But official records say two days prior.""Give it two weeks. It would be too suspicious if we do anything now. You know what to do. And get it done. Whatever's necessary.""Roger that, Boss." He hung up, and I stared back at my black screen. Boss. Junior's been calling me that since I joined the business. My alias name for short.  I work for the American Government during the day, but I keep my people and community safe during the night. The media calls me a villain, killing "innocent" people, but I prefer the title anti-hero. I don't kill anyone genuinely innocent, only the scum of the earth who didn't deserve to be alive in the first place. I turned my heel, heading back to the club. This job is hard, living a double life essentially, which is another reason why I don't even bother with relationships. Just a massive waste of- "Oof!" I feel my body collapse into what feels like a brick wall. "Shit!""Oh god, I'm so sorry!" A sweet voice says. I opened my eyes to see a tall, muscular guy with green and black curly hair. He had cute freckles painting his cheeks down to his arms. I let my eyes wander down his figure, and his face was turning damn near beet red. "Im so so sorry, god, I wasn't paying attention!""The fuck are you crying about now, Deku?" A another older guy says, approaching us. He was almost the same height as the green-haired man, nearly the same build. He was blonde with an undercut and red gages in his ear. He had red piercing eyes and a scowl on his face. "What the fuck did you do?""I bumped into this girl. I thought I was going to topple over her." The green-haired man chuckle. The blonde man looked at me, scanning my figure. "She looks fine to me. Im going inside. Puffball said she's waiting for me." And with that, he walked away. The green-haired man sighed heavily, turning back to me. "Sorry about that. My name is Midoriya. What's yours?""Vex. You don't keep apologizing, by the way. Im fine; I can handle myself.""I know, but it's impolite. Plus, I could have seriously hurt you!" I chuckled; he was oblivious. Cute as hell but clueless. "What do you think I am? A delicate little flower?" I laughed. "Well...Can I at least buy you a drink? As an apology?" I looked into his eyes for the first time in the entire conversation. His green eyes seemed so similar to emeralds; they were beautiful."You know what? Why not. Let's see how well you can handle shots." <<EOFANFIC>>

completion: Tomura always knew Dabi was going to die. Dabi had always planned on dying, dragging Endeavor to the grave alongside him. Knowing that it was eventually going to happen didn't stop the pain that came when it did happen. Dabi's death caused a pain that time would never heal.Tomura visited Dabi's grave often as it was the only place he felt safe enough to let out how he was truly feeling. He could talk to Dabi as much as he wanted there and no one would call him crazy for it. It was probably the only healthy coping mechanism Tomura was using to help process his grief.It was late at night when Tomura made the walk to Dabi's grave. He never told anyone where he was going, wanting to be alone with him. There were things he wanted to say, to do, and he couldn't do that with someone else with him."Hey Dabi.." Tomura said as he sat down next to the grave. Though Dabi would never answer back it felt good to talk to him."I brought something for you.." Tomura smiled, pulling out a single black rose resting it on Dabi's grave. "I know you always loved them."Tomura had always made a note to bring Dabi black roses. When Dabi was alive, Tomura would give them to him on special occasions. They always seemed to bring a smile to his face, a smile that Tomura longed to see just one more time.He could still remember the first time he gave flowers to Dabi.~ ~ ~"What are these for?" Dabi asked, looking down at the flowers Tomura had handed him."It's Valentine's day." Tomura muttered. "Toga suggested them."Dabi sat the flowers to the side, he'd have Kurogiri put them in a vase when he got back."Awe Mophead, are you asking me to be your Valentine?" Dabi teased a smirk being plastered across his face."If you don't want them then burn them." Tomura shot back at him, annoyed. It took him a lot of courage to pull something like this, he wouldn't be taken as a joke."Now that's not any way to treat your Valentine." Dabi said as he pulled Tomura onto his lap. "For future reference I like black roses, but red ones like these certainly remind me of you and those eyes of yours."Tomura leaned into the heat radiating from Dabi. It made sense that Dabi preferred black roses. He liked everything black."I got you something too." Dabi admitted reaching into his jacket.Tomura hadn't been expecting to receive anything in return so it surprised him when Dabi pulled out a new game controller. Tomura had dusted his last one after losing to the final boss in the game he was playing. He had been meaning to get another one not having a spare."Thanks Dabi." Tomura said with a smile."Hope you'll spend tonight looking more at me rather than at the game." Dabi teased further. Tomura was certain he would if Dabi kept going.~ ~ ~"We haven't forgotten about you. I'm here Dabi, I only wish you were here with me."  Tomura said. His voice was shaky and he could feel the tears threatening to spill from his eyes.Touya had been forgotten but Dabi would never be as long as Tomura was alive. Tomura would never forget the man who showed him what love truly was. Dabi would forever hold a place within his heart, a place that could never be filled by another.~ ~ ~"Love you.." Dabi panted, holding Tomura on his chest after a very eventful night. He looked down, feeling Tomura tense up in his arms as the words left his mouth."What?"  Tomura whispered in disbelief of what Dabi just said. Maybe he misspoke? yeah that's gotta be it he must have misspoke. No one loved him."I said, I love you." Dabi repeated, looking down at Tomura in his arms."You love me?" Tomura asked, looking back at Dabi. This had to be some sort of joke. Tomura was sure of it."You sound surprised for a guy that had his dick down my throat not even 10 minutes ago." Dabi laughed slightly, seeing Tomura's shock."Didn't think that counted." Tomura muttered, moving his face back into Dabi's chest. He loved how warm Dabi felt."I'm just going to ignore the fact you indirectly called me a whore." Dabi said. "Yes I love you Mophead. All of you."Tomura could feel Dabi trace over the scars on his face. Tomura always thought they were repulsive but Dabi seemed to love them.Tomura reached over to find one of his hands to cover it, to help hide how red his face was."I know I said I had a thing for hands but this isn't what I meant."  Dabi responded, taking the hand away from his face."Father-" Tomura gasped, feeling Dabi remove the hand."I really wished you'd stop calling them that.." Dabi said in disgust, sitting the hand to the side.Dabi really didn't want to think about Tomura's "family" being in the room while they fucked. Dabi certainly had his issues but that was a bit much, even for him.With that Dabi pulled Tomura closer in his arms."You going to say it back?" Dabi asked after a few moments of silence.Tomura smiled, "Yeah.""Then say it." Dabi challenged."I love you." Tomura responded, face completely flushed. He could see the smile that formed onto Dabi's face. It was perfect.After a few more moments of silence Tomura spoke again."Hey Dabi?""Hm?" Dabi answered, looking down at him once more."Why do you love me?" Tomura asked."I just do. Love doesn't need a reason." Dabi whispered, running his fingers through Tomura's tangled hair.Tomura knew Dabi was right. He didn't have a reason why he loved Dabi either, he just did and that was okay. They didn't need a reason to love each other.~ ~ ~"I know I promised not to cry.." Tomura muttered as he felt the tears slip down his cheeks."..but it's so hard without you."He could still remember the night he made that promise. The warm embrace of Dabi's arms wrapped tightly around him, the smell of smoke and Dabi's cologne, the words of love spoken between them, and the promises they made to each other all lingered within the memory.~ ~ ~"Stop moving.." Tomura commanded, worried as he stapled Dabi back together after a fight."Calm down. Certainly isn't the worst I've been." Dabi smiled trying to reassure Tomura.This battle had been especially rough, almost killing them all. Dabi had lost quite a bit of staples causing him to fall apart at the seams. It looked as if he was going to die."You could have gotten killed!" Tomura snapped. He wasn't mad at Dabi but damnit he needed to be more careful."We all could have but I don't see you yelling at anyone else." Dabi acknowledged. They all almost died."No one else matters this much." Tomura muttered as he added another staple to Dabi's already damaged body."You know I'm gonna die one day right?" Dabi said, looking at Tomura. He could see Tomura was trying to push the thought from his mind. "It's going to happen sooner or later, it's non-avoidable. I don't want to cry when it does."Tomura stapled the next more harshly making Dabi wince slightly. He wouldn't let Dabi die. He could already feel tears welling in his eyes at the thought."Tomura.." Dabi said, pulling him into his arms. He could tell that this was a difficult topic but it was one they needed to talk about."We both knew this.. one day we are going to die." Dabi continued, rubbing Tomura's back as he tried to comfort him, feeling the tears spilling onto his chest."You're not.." Tomura sobbed in denial, causing Dabi only to hold him tighter."It's a fact of life that everyone dies. Every story must come to an end." Dabi continued. "But that doesn't mean our story is done yet."Tomura nodded. There was still so much to do. So many more chapters to write. Their story was far from over."Let's make sure ours has a happy ending." Tomura smiled softly. If a story must end it should at least end happily."Yeah.." Dabi laughed slightly."Love you Dabi.." Tomura said, leaning in for a kiss to seal the deal."Love you too Mophead."  Dabi smiled, meeting him halfway.~ ~ ~"I'd do anything just to see you one last time." Tomura said in just above a whisper. "There was so much more I wanted to say.. to do.."Tomura wiped his face, resisting the urge to scratch his neck till it bled. The scars had only worsened after Dabi's passing. Dabi was no longer there to stop him, to kiss him till he forgot the reason why he was scratching, to save him from himself.As Tomura sat in silence the night only seemed to grow colder. Tomura pulled the hood of his hoodie up trying to stay warm. The hoodie had formerly belonged to Dabi. The sleeves were singed from Dabi's flames, it was littered with holes created by cigarettes, the color had faded, the zipper had long since melted, and best of all it still smelled like Dabi. Tomura loved that hoodie. He could still remember when Dabi gave it to him.~ ~ ~Dabi couldn't help but notice the way Tomura shivered as they made their way to their next meeting. Unlike Dabi, Tomura had never been able to handle the cold well. The cold winter breeze only seemed to blow right through him."We should be there soon." Dabi stated as he looked at his phone for directions."Not if I die from hypothermia first." Tomura complained as his teeth chattered. It had been snowing which made it take longer than usual to get to their meeting spot."You're not gonna die." Dabi assured him knowing how dramatic Tomura could be when it came to the cold."You don't know that!" Tomura retorted, wrapping his arms around himself, shivering even more than before."Here." Dabi sighed, pulling off his hoodie and tossing it at Tomura. "This should keep you warm."Tomura wasted no time slipping it on. Due to Dabi's intense body heat it felt as if it just came out of the dryer. That's when Tomura remembered, he has his own personal heater. Why not use it?"Are you really going to cling to me for the rest of the way there?" Dabi asked, feeling Tomura's arms wrapped tightly around him."You belong to me." Tomura responded in defense. Dabi certainly didn't complain as he felt Tomura bury his face into his neck.~ ~ ~"Sometimes I wish we would have both died.." Tomura continued breaking the silence. "At least then we would be together."If Tomura could use his quirk on himself, in that moment, there's no doubt he would have. He was desperate to be with Dabi again and if that meant dying then so be it. He'd end his own life if that's what it took.Looking up, Tomura swore he was hallucinating. With the amount of drugs he had been taking to cope he wouldn't be surprised if he was."It can't be.." Tomura muttered, eyes wide. "Dabi."The figure only smiled before fading away once more. Maybe it was just a hallucination but for a moment the pain that Tomura had felt seemed to ease a bit."I love you Dabi." Tomura smiled.~ ~ ~"I'll be with you soon."~ ~ ~<<EOFANFIC>>
