“Nerd – You and me are going on a date when you get out of this stupid hospital,” Bakugo abruptly said, breaking the silence the two of them had going. Izuku smiled and continued shifting his cards around.
“That sounds great Kacchan.”
Bakugo grumbled. “Stop being so cheerful and focus on your cards. I don’t want to win because you keep messing up. I’ll do all the planning so you just sit and focus on healing up, stupid.”
“Yeah, yeah.” That was weeks ago. Izuku had been allowed to leave the hospital two days later, but their first date had yet to happen. Date attempt 1 – interrupted by a villain smashing through the restaurant
Date attempt 2 – Izuku got called in for an emergency rescue situation
Date attempt 3 – Bakugo ate bad food for lunch and was sick by the evening
Date attempt 4 – Swarmed by reporters
Date attempt 5 – Izuku was the sick one
Date attempts 6 through 9 – More villains
Date attempt 10 – Swarmed by fans
Date attempts 11 through 14 – Canceled before they could even begin due to an overwhelming amount of hero work Bakugo was furious. He had planned yet another nice evening for him and Izuku. A high-end restaurant, one that would keep both the press and fans from bothering them, a perfect route for an after dinner walk, and an ice cream shop that named all their flavors after heroes. He even had a florist on stand by so he could bring Deku flowers. Everything had been planned down to the last second in order to create the perfect first date.
“DIE!!!” he screamed as released the trigger on one of his gauntlets. Red Riot had called him asking for help and despite wanting to say no, he couldn’t let Shitty Hair down. So, here he was, six hours away, in a different city, calling to cancel his reservations in between blasting these stupid villains. Back in Musutafu, Izuku paced the grounds of UA. Suddenly, a hand on his shoulder jolted him from his thoughts, making him jump.
“Oh! Eraserhead, sir,” he said sheepishly. “I, uh, didn’t see you there.”
“Obviously. What are you doing here? It’s almost ten.”
Izuku sighed and began pacing again. “Well, it’s just that. I was going to tell principal Nezu that I wouldn’t be able to guest lecture this week because I’ve already got so much going on, but then when I got here I started thinking about how that’s not a good thing to do as the number one hero and how I would be letting down all the students here that were really excited to see me and how as a hero it’s my job to help new heroes. But I’m overworked and tired and I haven’t had a break in weeks and all I want to do is go on a date with Kacchan, but every single time we try to have our first date it gets ruined by something, which I get because we’re both heroes and that’s important, but it just really sucks that we’ve been trying for so long, like since I got out of the hospital a few months ago, and we were supposed to have a date tonight but Red Riot called so Kacchan is gone. And anyways that’s pretty much what’s going on I guess, sorry for dumping all this information on you. I’m just going to leave now. Goodnight.”
Aizawa grabbed his arm before he could walk away. “Slow down there, problem child. Take a breath or two. You ramble just as much now as you did when you were my student. Breathing again? Good. Now follow me.” Before Izuku could protest, Aizawa started to lead him towards one of the buildings. Once they were inside, Aizawa pointed to a couch and said “Sleep.”
“What?”
“I don’t like to repeat myself.”
“I know. It’s just I have so much to do today still, I’ll sleep later.”
Aizawa smacked him on the top of the head. “Don’t argue with me! Lay down now and sleep. Everything else can wait until morning.”
“Yes, sir,” Izuku said reluctantly. He sank into the soft couch and was asleep within moments. Aizawa looked at him fondly for a second before shaking his head in irritation and grumbling as he walked away. When Deku woke, the sun was shining. He felt more rested now than he had in months.
“Good, you’re awake.”
“Yes, sir. Sorry for sleeping in so late.”
Aizawa put a plate of food on the table in front of him. “No worries. Eat. I cleared your schedule for the next four days. I have a special mission I need you to take care of. I know the timing sucks, but it’s time sensitive and important.”
Izuku nodded. “That’s okay. I’m a hero, aren’t I? It’s my duty to help where I can.”
“Good. Here’s the tickets you need and your bag. I had one of your sidekicks pack it. Here’s the location you need to go to. Once there, you’ll receive more information about the mission ahead.”
“Yes, sir. Thank you. I won’t let you down.”
Aizawa ruffled his hair affectionately. “You never have. Now, eat and get going.” Izuku double-checked the address Aizawa gave him. It matched his location. But this was a private resort? Maybe the resort was having trouble? Maybe the person he was supposed to meet was someone really important? Shrugging, he walked inside and followed the rest of the directions Aizawa left him. He was sitting at a table waiting, when he heard a familiar voice behind him.
“Deku? What are you doing here?”
“Kacchan? What are you doing here?” he asked as he jumped up to give Bakugo a hug.
“I was sent here on a mission.”
“Oh, me too. I wonder if it’s the same mission…must be pretty important if they have both the number one and number two heroes here.”
A man in a suit walked over to them both. “Ah good, you are both here. I was instructed to give you this when you both arrived.” He hand over an envelope before bowing and walking away.Opening the envelope, the note inside read:
This is a private resort for heroes, no press and no fans. You have four days here. No hero work, only relaxing. Or else. Enjoy your time off.  - Eraserhead
p.s. Don’t worry about your agency or anything else. Your problem class has got it all covered. After reading it, Izuku gave Bakugo a wide grin. “Let’s go explore and see what they have here!”
Bakugo smiled back; four days off from everything sounded wonderful. For the rest of the day, they wandered around together seeing what the resort, town, and island had to offer. By the end of the day, they were more relaxed than they had been in a long time.
“Hey Kacchan?”
“Yeah, nerd?”
“I’m glad we’re here.”
“Me too.” Izuku was violently shook awake. “Kacchan! What the hell! The sun’s not even up yet!”
“I know what time it is. Now get up or we’re going to be late for our first date!” Bakugo yanked him out of bed. Izuku rushed to get dressed as Bakugo impatiently paced by the door.
“Good, let’s go.” Following Kacchan, they walked for about 20 minutes until they arrived at a sandy beach. There was already a picnic set up, complete with a blanket, basket, and some lanterns.
Together they sat and watched the sun rise as they ate breakfast.
Next, Bakugo led him on a hike throughout the island, pointing out animals, fun facts about the various locations, and sharing any other information he could think of (Izuku is a nerd after all).
For lunch they grabbed some food from a local vendor and the afternoon they spent at the beach swimming, play games, and relaxing in the sun.
When they got back to the resort in the late afternoon, they parted ways with Bakugo giving Izuku strict instructions on how to dress and where to be in one hour. When they met up again, both were dressed in well-tailored suits. Izuku admired Bakugo from behind as he was led to a high-end restaurant within the resort. A table was waiting for them, with wine and appetizers already there. The two of them sat across from each other, but both were silent. The silence stretched out until it became awkward. Izuku started fidgeting and Bakugo began tapping his foot. Finally Izuku couldn’t take it any longer and blurted out “this is so awkward.”
Bakugo huffed, but then smiled. Together they let out small laughs.
“Yeah, that was uncomfortable,” Bakugo agreed. “I’ve just been waiting for this date for so long that I think the pressure got to me just now and I just want it today to be perfect.”
Izuku leaned across the table and gave Bakugo a quick kiss. “Idiot. It doesn’t have to be perfect. It just has to be with you.”<<EOFANFIC>>

 Antiseptic.

Was much too focused on the here and now and  war.  He knows if he said it aloud, Shouto would give him one of those painfully blank looks. Wise beyond his years.And so Endeavor waits. Hulking form hunched over in a stiff metal hospital chair.White walls. Antiseptic .It’s awfully routine. Nurses paying him no mind other than a hiss to extinguish himself, or a moody point toward a chair half heartedly shielded from the press.He thinks of Touya, for lack of anything else to occupy his mind. Thinks of Touya for the first time in an incredibly long while. Small. A boy. A child. But sweating, nose bleeding, chest heaving and fists clenched like a man. Towers to full height and blinks away. The temptation to ignite. A nurse, clipboard in hand and eyes peering sternly over a medical mask. “Endeavor.” A one word sentence.  “Ah…” 
She breathes. Let’s him revel in the silence a bit, seemingly keen to frustrate. “I’m required to inform you about the severity of his injuries,” she coughs and glances at her clipboard, though Enji suspects it's more so for something to do than any professional reason. Just to present him with his apparent rival.The nurse gestures awkwardly and Enji follows.Enji expects the area to be heavily guarded. Chapter Text
Nezu principal of UA wasn't a stranger to weird things occurring in the morning, but this had to top the strangest things to happen to him. He thought back to the phone call had obtained this morning. 
"Hello?"
 
"Chimera," a female voice said through the other end.
 
"How the hell did you get that code!?!" he asked, hearing a code that only 4 heroes in training knew.
 
"Doesn't matter what does matter is that I need your help," she said weakly as the sound of clothing moving could be heard.
 
"Who are you?"
 "Come to the east bay at 11:45 AM with two heroes once I arrive don't make any assumptions just let me explain, No more than two from the UA.  Got it? Alright see you" she said, hanging up. Looking at his watch he noticed that it was 5 minutes till the supposed appointment was happening realizing that this might be the one and only opportunity he rushed out of his office picking pro heroine Midnight and Eraserhead. "Who are we meeting Nezu?" Eraserhead asked, looking around keeping his guard up. "I don't know" the Chimera replied. "Are you sure we are on time?" Midnight asked, looking for anybody. "You are time," a stranger said, hiding in the shadows. "Show yourself" Eraserhead screamed. A person slowly walked out of the shadows she was around 5' 11" wearing grey jeans with revolvers on each thigh, a black undershirt that looked like a bulletproof vest was underneath, a light blue trench coat with a sword on the back, a blue fedora, and a faceless mask that showed no emotions. There were bullet holes through her arms and what looked like a sword slash on her left side. "Question, you better have a good reason to have called me," Nezu said, intrigued about what would cause Japan's number one vigilante to ask for a hero's help. "Trust me it is a damn good one" the vigilante growled, holding her fracture sword in front of her. 
POV Izuki
 "So why are you he-" "Three" I corrected, looking back to make sure Eri and Kyle were still behind me. "Three, why do you have two children?" The rat demon asked. "I have been working undercover in a certain Yakuza trying to bring it down from the inside. My job was to watch these kids and keep them safe. I have been doing this job for the last 2 months. As long they weren't being hurt, experimented on, forced, or sold I kept my mouth shut. However, I decided to free them when I discovered they were experimented on behind my back. So when I found out I grabbed these them and bailed not before having a little run-in with mister rock" I explained showing my stub of an arm I have previously. "What was the name of the Yakuza you were working for?" Eraserhead asked. "Shie Hassaikai"  "What is your plan?" Midnight asked. "Go back and burn that place to hell," I said, struggling to keep myself from passing out. "We all know you won't survive, even with your skills and arsenal you are still wounded plus missing a hand we could use someone like you on the hero's side.""What are you implying?" I questioned, with an eyebrow raised underneath the mask. "How about you join UA as a staff member?" "Sorry I can't" "Why?" "Because I am only 16 and I do-" "Don't have a quirk" Rat god said. "H-H-How do you know?" I questioned, trying to regain my composure. "You only appeared after the quirk law saying the quirkless couldn't join hero schools... You didn't apply I asked so I am not breaking any laws" Rat demon said with a smile. " I will only if these two can come with me," I said, pointing to Kyle and Eri. "Yes, those can come with you, but you might wanna tell midnight to stop," Nezu said, pointing to midnight who was playing rock, paper, scissors with Eri. "She is fine," I said, with a red blush covering my entire face. "Can we goooooo?" I said before blacking out. "Nemuri get her to recovery girl!!!" I heard rat god scream as I slowly fell into the pit of endless darkness. 
POV NOBODY
 "You want her as a student?" Eraserhead asked Nezu. "Yeah, she could prove that quirkless people aren't worthless," Nezu exclaimed while trying to pull off her mask. "Interesting she has no data on her no medical records at all" Recovery Girl said, walking into the room. "So, what does that mean?" Eraserhead asked. "Her parents must've abandoned her due to her being quirkless," Nezu said with pure rage. "Awwww. Why would anyone leave such a cutie?" Midnight asked, licking her lips. "Is she going to join UA?" Midnight asked. "Yes, and she will be put in Aizawa's class," Nezu said as he jumped off to head to his office. "Later cutie" Midnight said, giving one last look at the passed-out girl.

Bakugo stared at the ceiling contemplating life and wondering how the fuck he ended up here. Around the beginning of their second year the class had found out about Bakugo's bullying and while most of them gave him the cold shoulder some of them would make snide remarks when they were sure he would hear, Aizawa did nothing about it and the staff and general public didn't help but he decided he's not going to wait for help anymore he would take actions into his own hands. What really hurt though was that even Kirishima was ignoring him. Kirishima who knew full well what Bakugo did was still ignoring him. It hurt, that even though he knew he still decided he wasn't worth.Despite contrary belief Bakugo Katsuki was quite patient and he held on for as long as he could but it was draining and also contrary to belief Bakugo Katsuki could give up. It was unexpected and the number of times he did were even fewer than the number of times he's been told sorry. But at this point in his life where people in and out of the school were calling him a villain and constantly blaming him for everything that goes wrong, he decided it wasn't worth it. He wasn't going to be No.1 even if he graduated so what's the point. He was currently thinking if this was the best course of action though, he was beginning to doubt himself but quickly snapped out of it, Bakugo doesn't doubt himself he's the surest person ever but right now he couldn't help it even though it was an annoying feeling. He'd do though, because he's not a wuss, and he'd do it tomorrow too, tommorow during the sport festival.











There were several things off about the sports festival this year. For example here'd be no opening speech from the students, but there will be closing speeches from the 1st place winner. Turns out that this wasn't new it just wasn't possible last year since they were too busy sedating and muzzling the winner. A really new thing though was that the top three studenta that weren't part of the hero course will be transferred there and replace the lowest three from the hero course, the ones with the highest and lowest points respectively will also be tasked with a speech. (So that's basically three student speeches)The sports festival was unnerving to the UA staff, it went of as usual with screaming every ten seconds but the lack of screaming from a certain 1A member was wierd but no one said anything. Better to leave the ticking time bomb alone than risk anything. And so the sport festival carried on.In the end Bakugo won, because he might be giving up but he's nothing if not the best, with deku coming second and Kirishima in third place. He was getting ready to give his speech when some of his classmates barged in and started saying how he shouldn't be be winning and that he clearly resulted to villainous ways to win. He just ignored them and he guesses they finally decided to leave because it was suddenly quite, he didn't look up though because there was no need he won't be seeing them for a while.Right before he could step on the podium he heard some random teacher ask if he isn't missing his leash and everywhere went quiet. Now just because he was giving up didn't mean he couldn't fight, he squared his shoulders and started stomping over to the teacher when he felt something wrap around him. He looked to the side where Aizawa was and he got an eyebrow raise as if to say "Are we going to have another problem with you". He couldn't believe this bullshit. Right here in front of Aizawa 's own eyes he was basically called a dog and he was the one in the wrong? Amazing. Fucking fantastic. He glared once and turned around to head on the podium, "the quicker we get this over with the better".The Stadium looked as big as it always did, with crowds of people booing him and insulting him as always but he looked passed it, looked on to the man the shoved a medal down his throat and smiled like he just gave Katsuki the best gift of his life. He was going to be sick. But he was also determined to do this and he was going to do it. They gave Deku and Kirishima their medals first and then it was time for Bakugo to give his speech before accepting his medal. He took a deep breath and stepped up the podium with his head help up, he opened his mouth and started his speech 


"UA appealed to a guy like me,

Told me every blessing is a scar and,

Love is present in the masses,

Heroes exist between people not me.

Humans fuck up more than anyone else, 

And we shouldn't be scared to want less.
He then turned to stare straight at all might 
But you're a hero to all people and you say,

Humans fuck up, humans fuck up and it fucking sucks cause depressions a scar and all that I know is,

I just thought anywhere that you are, is the coolest place in the world, the coolest place in the world,

I just thought anywhere that you are, is the coolest place in the world, coolest place in the world.
He looked at Kirishima now
Promised me we will be,

Frankincense got me high,

You used to tell me bought school,

How your trauma blew up into ours, 

You said "humans fuck up, humans fuck up" and I'll fuck this up cause this place is a scar and all that I know is,

I just thought anywhere that you are, is the coolest place in the world, coolest place in the world,

I just thought anywhere that you are, is the coolest place in the world, coolest place in the world. 
He then turned to face the UA staff and heroes
I just thought anywhere that you are, is the coolest place in the world, coolest place in the world,
I just thought anywhere that you are. He looked down defeated 
You used to appeal to a guy like me "
"They say all publicity is good but I'd rather not be treated like a villain my whole life for not wanting a medal so I quit the hero course and you can keep your stupid medal, give it to someone who isn't villainous" The whole stadium was silent not a single person said anything and that was wierd to Katsuki as they never seemed to shut up online."Well?! You have nothing to say?! After calling me a villain and asking me to leave I'm finally leaving, fucking dance or something. Why is that not a tag already??
completion: Despite general public perception, Present Mic- or Hizashi Yamada as known outside of uniform- is much more than the aloof, ditzy caricature he presents himself as on his radio show. When it comes to hero work he's quick to let his facade crumble, content to let whatever villains he's up against face the raw rage that simmers just beneath his skin. He is however, careful to keep that part of himself hidden from all but his colleagues and those who don't deserve to be spared of his anger, which is why, despite being a relatively popular public figure, he only accepts undercover or underground work.The overly destructive nature of his quirk means that the commission is more than happy to keep most of his work away from the public if it means less complaints about casualties. They aren't quite nice enough to leave him to just his nighttime work though- he regularly finds himself placed on small investigative cases that don't require the use of his quirk. That's not to say that Hizashi minds, he became a hero to help people in whatever ways he can after all- but sometimes being given extra missions on top of his night patrols, shifts at the radio station and teaching at UA gets to be more than a little tiring.He's glad that the investigation he's been sent to work on today is minor, nothing more than a routine inspection of a local middle school- Aldera, he notes as he goes over the file he was given. He isn't actually there for any particular reason other than the fact that an inspection is due and the hero commission loves to keep his hands full, so he's not expecting anything of note to happen.Upon his entrance he's greeted by a nervous looking secretary before being lead to the principals office. The principle herself is nothing special, but something about her demeanour sets Hizashi on edge. She seems just slightly too relaxed to be normal- as though she's hidden something and thinks she's gotten away with it. He doesn't like it all.He brushes off her offer to guide him around the school, placating her with the fact that 'a pro-hero such as himself will have no problem finding his way around a school'. She seems unhappy with his solo departure, but she doesn't outwardly express it, so Hizashi's content to flash her one of his perfectly crafted smiles before simply leaving her office. Despite only really having interacted with the principal so far, Hizashi's already pretty sure that this inspection won't be quite as routine as he originally thought. He's expecting something along the lines of behind the scenes drug dealing or perhaps some less than legal terms of employment, so he stops off at the nearest storage closet, hoping to either find a janitor that could possibly confirm or deny his suspicions or at least clear the room as not being used as drug storage.The handle won't turn when he reaches for it, but luckily (or unluckily if someone really does have something to hide) Hizashi is quite well versed in the art of lock-picking. His fine-tuned Present Mic mask almost shatters when the lock finally clicks and he manages to tug the door open. But his anger isn't directed at what he's looking at, so he reigns himself in in favour of making himself seem softer, more approachable.It's difficult to do when curled up in the corner of the closet is a child. A child who is very clearly shaking where he's folded in on himself. Hizashi can't see his face, but he has no doubts that he's crying. He can't blame him.He hums quietly in an attempt to grab the child's attention without startling him. The first thing he see's when the boy looks up are wide green eyes, predictably shining with tears- but the second thing freezes his breath in his lungs and forces him to consciously push himself not to fall into a flashback in front of an already suffering child.The boy has a muzzle strapped onto his face. The all-too-familiar contraption is clearly too tight, digging into his cheeks hard enough that Hizashi thinks he can see blood. He wants to get it off as soon as possible, but he's also wary of getting too close for fear of scaring the child more than he already is.Breathing deeply in order to stave off the panic he can feel buzzing beneath his skin, he speaks aloud, "Hey kiddo, I don't know if you recognise me but it's Present Mic! I want to take that thing off of you, but I need you to let me know if that would be okay? Just nod if it is.".The poor kid is clearly unsure, but Hizashi took notice of the way his shoulder's lost some of their tension when he'd announced his hero name.Obviously the child can't respond verbally, not with the literal fucking torture device strapped to his face (and wow Hizashi is definitely going to have to book an emergency appointment with his therapist after this!) but the boy turns further towards the hero, and it's all the confirmation he needs before slowly inching forwards.He makes sure to verbalize exactly what he's doing as he works, and in no time Hizashi manages to unbuckle the clasps holding the muzzle in place. He immediately finds himself with an armful of small shaking child and he can't help but begin running his hands through matted verdant curls as he whispers what he hopes are soothing affirmations into the kids ear as he rocks him back and forth.Back-up in the form of Tsukauchi and Sansa should be arriving any time now- it has to have been at least 20 minutes since Hizashi first opened the closet and sent off an emergency support alert directly to the detective- but he can't bring himself to stand up and leave the cramped space, too caught up in comforting the child.Upon realising that the kids tears have slowed into sniffles and he still doesn't know his name Hizashi finally forces himself to sit up. He doesn't pull away completely, both for his own sake and the kids, but the hero's at least able to look the boy in the eyes as he speaks to him."Hey little man, you have a name I can call you instead of just sticking to 'kiddo'?".His phrasing pulls a wet giggle out of the boy before he offers up a meek 'Izuku'. He doesn't give Hizashi a family name, setting off another alarm bell blaring in his mind alongside the at least 5 others already ringing. There are too many bruises on this child's- Izuku's- skin for his parents not to know about his mistreatment and Hizashi has a sinking feeling that Izuku's home life is far too similar to what his own had been like.He really wishes that the only common trait he and Izuku shared were their green eyes- but he stopped believing that wishes worked when he was 6 and his birthday present was getting locked in a soundproofed basement with duct-tape covering his mouth.He finds himself pulling Izuku closer to himself, once again running slender fingers through tangled hair as he mumbles promises he isn't entirely sure how to keep, and at this point he's not completely sure if he's trying to comfort the kid or himself. It's probably both.It's only when Tsukauchi finally enters the dingy storeroom and Izuku mutters a desperate "please don't leave" in his direction as the detective tries to lead him away that Hizashi truly realises that he cannot let this child go.He practically has to carry Izuku down to the ambulance, the way that the boy is clinging on to him at least letting him know that the (probably unhealthy) attachment is mutual. And when the kids response to being asked about his parents is a full-body flinch- well Hizashi isn't going to allow anyone to judge him for the way he immediately lets Tsukauchi know to have temporary (for now) guardianship papers ready for him to sign.Aldera is going to burn in hell, and if Hizashi's allowed to play any part in the eventual investigation, so will Izuku's parents- but as he's sat in a speeding ambulance with a tiny, freckled hand desperately grasping at his own, he manages to push his thoughts of vengeance aside. Izuku comes first and he always will. That's a promise he can and will keep, right up until the moment that he takes his very last breath.Years later, as he watches his son take the country by storm as the first quirkless pro, standing up for those so often silenced in society, Hizashi is glad that he played a part in picking up the boy that was once so violently pushed down.Izuku Yamada will change the world, scars and all, and Hizashi will support him every step of the way.<<EOFANFIC>>

prompt: write a story about Haikyuu!!,  Teen And Up Audiences Creator Chose Not To Use Archive Warnings No Archive Warnings Apply F/F M/M 僕のヒーローアカデミア | Boku no Hero Academia | My Hero Academia (Anime & Manga) Sero Hanta/Todoroki Shouto Kaminari Denki/Shinsou Hitoshi Jirou Kyouka/Yaoyorozu Momo Bakugou Katsuki/Kirishima Eijirou Asui Tsuyu/Uraraka Ochako Todoroki Shouto Dabi | Todoroki Touya Todoroki Fuyumi Sero Hanta Bakugou Katsuki Ashido Mina Kaminari Denki Shinsou Hitoshi Ojiro Mashirao Shouji Mezou Aizawa Shouta | Eraserhead Fluff Happy Ending Sad Sad with a Happy Ending Therapy Love Confessions Love Falling In Love Bakugou Katsuki is a Good Friend Bakugou Katsuki Being Less of an Asshole
completion:
It was well into his ownership of the soba shop that it happened. 
 
Friday nights were the times when class 2-A would all make their way down to the Todoroki family soba shop for some time to just relax and be teenagers. 
 
It was nearly midnight, and some people were flagging already, courtesy of stressful hero course activities from Aizawa. 
 
Asui and Uraraka were curled up in a booth together, facing Momo and Jirou, who were discreetly glancing at each other every so often. It was cute, in Shouto’s opinion. 
 
Shinsou and Kaminari had brought their switches, and they had been holding a smash brothers tournament all night. 
 
As expected, Bakugou had scoffed and said he didn’t need video games to prove he was the best. Shockingly though, he stayed and watched, courtesy of his newly gained people skills. 
 
Shouto still watched him closely, waiting for the day he would lapse back into calling everyone horrible names and shouting about his superiority. It hadn’t happened yet, so Shouto assumed his therapy was going well. 
 Actually, most of them were in some form of therapy or another. It had điện  them all good, and some people had taken it further.  
Ojiro and Shoji front-lined a club at the school for people with mutation quirks. They had easily forty members, and often did community outreach. That had started because Ojiro and Shoji were on patrol one day and saw a little girl with eight furry legs being bullied by a group of older kids. 
 
They had taken it into their own hands to change the world, one outreach at a time. It was great. They gave out pamphlets about mutation quirks, and even volunteered at a local soup kitchen that fed a large population of homeless people, many of whom had mutation quirks. 
 
Some of the upperclassmen had a project going where they would help people with mutation quirks get jobs. Nobody would believe it when they heard a guy with a shark head belting out opera for the first time.
 
Guess you can’t really judge a book by its cover. Huh. 
 
He was employed in the theater district shortly after that. 
 
Other than that, people like Shinsou, Hagakure, and shockingly, Bakugou were actively campaigning for Quirkless Rights. 
 
They had seminars set up where they would give correct, unbiased informational talks about the true statistics of quirklessness. For many of the adults who were forced to attend them by their company’s HR department, it was the first time they had ever heard of quirkless people as anything more than “un-evolved and fragile”. 
 
There were other people who held the seminars too, since high schoolers couldn’t do all of the heavy lifting themselves. 
 
But Bakugou in particular made sure that he was at every monthly in-school seminar. Having the hero student Ground Zero there was a huge help in keeping the kids in line for the staff, but Shouto knew it was more than that. 
 
He had attended one of them, and watched Bakugou shout at a bunch of kids for twenty minutes. Just when he was about to give up all hope and leave, Bakugou called for quiet. 
 
“I know you guys think this is a joke. I get that. But listen, I lost a great friend, and an amazing hero because I didn’t watch my damn mouth.” 

There were teachers looking more and more distraught every time Ground Zero cussed at kids, but they let him continue. Shouto couldn’t take his eyes off of the contrite look that Bakugou had on his face. 
 
“Nobody was there to tell me that what I was doing was wrong. That’s why I’m here. Because I learned my lesson, even though it was too late. I’m here to teach you guys so that you don’t lose someone too, because of your own actions.”
 
Shouto felt a tear roll down his face and discreetly wiped it away. 
 
“Now… WHO WANTS TO TOUCH MY GAUNTLETS?!” He was back to screaming, keeping the mic tactfully away from his mouth to avoid feedback. 
 
“And look!” He grinned, sharper than the devils horns, “THERES PRO HERO FIVE WEENIES! GET ‘IM!” 
 
Shouto was lost in a tidal wave of seven year olds. 
 
.

.

.
 
Okay so Bakugou was a bastard, but Shouto was slowly forgiving him. 
 
.

.

.
 
Never for the five weenies comment though. 
 
—————————————————————
 At nearly 1AM, Shouto’s eyes were drooping, and Futuna walked over to the ongoing Smash Brothers Tournament ™️  to talk to him.  
“Hey Sho, why don’t you head up to bed. I’ll clean the rest up and lock the doors after everyone’s gone.” 
 
“No, it’s okay Yumi, you head up.” He smiled serenely. “I’ve got this.”
 
Sero looked up from where he was beating Mina’s ass as Dark Link and grinned, “Don’t worry Fuyumi, I’ll take care of him! He’s got therapy tomorrow with Touya, right?”
 
There wasn’t even a pause in conversation anymore, that’s how used to the topic of Touya Todoroki everyone was. 
 
“Oh I totally forgot!” That was Fuyumi, hand to her cheek. “Shoot, I scheduled a soba delivery for tomorrow morning. Will you be okay taking the train, Shouto?”
 
The bi-colored teen hesitated. He still tended to have panic attacks when he got into crowded areas. Especially since he wasn’t very inconspicuous, what with the hair and the scar. 
 
“I can ask my mom to drive you.” Sero offered, “She’s always free on Saturdays.” 
 
Todoroki smiled softly at Sero, “Yes please, Hanta.”
 
Sero’s face went bright red and his character died to Mina’s. 
 
Then he covered his bashfulness quickly, “You better be careful, Shouto, or I might just fall in love with you.”
 
Shouto considered for a moment, “Would you like to?”
 
“Hm?!” Sero choked. He was oblivious to the fact that the gaming sounds had stopped. 
 
Shouto blinked, “Would you like to fall in love with me? You can, if you want to. I would let you.” 
 
“O-oh I…” he looked around at everyone watching with wide eyes. “I don’t know… maybe… would you accept a maybe?”
 
“HAH?!” Bakugou erupted, jumping up from his couch and waving an accusatory finger at the two of them. “MAYBE?!” 
 
Mina pulled him down and shoved his face into a pillow. Everyone could still hear his muffled voice as he shouted, “JUST KISS ALREADY YA DAMN IDIOTS!” 
 
Shouto’s face free so red that his scar started to blend in, and his eyes were saucers. 
 
Sero wrung his hands together for an unsure moment before he steeled his nerves. He sprung up from his chair and crossed the gap between there in three quick strides, handing his switch back to Shinsou first. 
 
Hanta paused there, conscious of Shouto’s personal space, and waited for permission. 
 
Shouto was still, assessing the situation. Both of the teens were bright red, too. He stood up, a little shorter than Sero Hanta, and nodded his head once, jerkily. 
 
Hanta leaned down and pressed his lips to Shouto’s. Other people started wolf whistling around them, and Bakugou was pouting while Mina scolded him halfheartedly for getting into other peoples business. 
 
Hanta was the first to pull away, and he looked down at Shouto, watching his face, “Was that okay?” 
 
The bi-colored teen assessed his feelings, and then nodded once again, “I think I’ll accept a maybe.” 
  <<EOFANFIC>>

completion: ─────────── ⋆⋅☆⋅⋆ ──── Little Midoriya Izuku was tangled in ropes and sticks, wiggling his way through a hefty forest after being abandoned by his class for the second time that day. The little boy couldn’t catch a break it seems since this wasn’t the first time it had even happened! His class went as far as letting the child wander off by himself in a heavily forested area – and they say they’ll keep an eye on him – what liars! They’ll end up in ditches! Or get stitches! Izuku’s little legs waddled till he was out of the forested area – he was near a park – oh crap... He even taught the boy how to fight. Nothing was showing still. He started to open up about the bullying, the loneliness, the abandonment. And maybe looking at it from an outside perspective. It was stupid. Stupid to think that a Pro Hero would ever care. Those thoughts were too late by the time he opened up about his childhood dreams- of being a hero.Maybe it's because no one had ever said it before...Maybe it's because he just wanted to believe that someone- anyone could think that... that he could be a hero.By the time it did show, it was already too late. He was sitting in handcuffs in an interrogation room. Over the past year, he had become one of Japan's best vigilante. His life as he knows it had been ruined within an hour. 60 minutes it had taken for everything he had built to crumble. He sat silently in the room, he knew what was going to happen now.The door opened and in walked a detective, EraserHead followed behind. They asked him question after question. He never responded. Then they left. Alone once again but not for long.When the door opened again, he was surprised to see a stoat standing in the door way. EraserHead entered again. He let the stoat talk and talk he did. He rambled really about this plan he had made to 'help'. Which only meant they still didn't know.It made him angry to be hit with blatant hypocrisy. He felt dizzy as a manic laugh escaped him. He couldn't help it, it was the first thing he had spoken. Thinking about the words...'Due to such heroism...''I would be a fool not to offer...''You would train with EraserHead and...''Would you like to start your hero academia?'it made him see red."You don't know why yet but I cant accept your deal." He spoke with a strained voice."Cant or wont?" That had him angry, "You think you know better? Because you're an adult and I'm a child? Or because you're a hero and I'm not." He spat the words at the two of them, unhinged laughter breaking out of him."What's funny?" EraserHead asked as he looked at the boy, those had been his first words too."It's just so funny how much of a fool you are, Principle Nezu." He offered a kind smile, he wasn't trying to be rude. It was just so rage inducing how they are all so stupid."How am I a fool, Deku?" He asked confused."Because..." He clenched his fists on the table and looked at the small creature. "I'm not welcome at your school. I'm not good enough for your school, Principle Nezu. Before either of you try to disagree- wait until you have my papers. Then you will see how stupid that whole speech was- how stupid you look stood here trying to recruit me. How angry it's making me. Then when you see so will the police and then officers will be in here to arrest me for whatever they can. So, save anymore speeches, god please just stop speaking." Tears threatened his eyes, little pricks that almost hurt. The boy cried easily, it's no surprise he'd cry angrily.The adults didn't say a thing other then leaving, to try and change their approach when they find out who he is.But there's nothing to change, it's been done.EraserHead had handed him his death sentence the moment he brought him in.People like Izuku... they don't last in prison. Not healthily.So he sat as he tried to calm down, to enjoy this peace. Fully convinced, in the next 24 hours that he will die.The adults were all together when they found out his identity. All shocked and Eraserhead was sad. Understanding crossed his face as he looked at Nezu. The stoat understood too.An hour later officers walked into Izuku's room, reading him his rights they took him by the arms and began to walk him out."Thank you." He said as he passed the hero, the hero he learnt to love being around. To love jumping across buildings with and make fun of. "Even if it was fake, I think this has been the happiest year of my life. It's always good to end a story on a good note.." He whispered as they made him walk away. A bitter part of him wanted to thank the hero for ruining his life. For showing him what he already knew. A darker part wanted to thank the hero for killing him.EraserHead stood paralyzed. He wanted to say so much but no words would come out of his mouth.48 hours later was a press conference that was held about the vigilante. Most people had been obsessed with the vigilante, couldn't wait to get a story on him."Three days ago, Vigilante Deku was apprehended by a Pro hero." A man spoke, he was plain and wasn't interested but he was also sad. A picture of Izuku showed on the screen, cameras flashed immediately.A mother sat crying as she watched her TV live.A group of teenagers sat around their common room as they watched, a blonde nearly dropping his phone.A hero sat on the floor as he put his head in his hands.'Where is he now?''What's going to happen?''What was the name of the hero?'"Is he going to go into a hero program now that he's caught, he's obviously young." A woman stood up as she asked, pointing her recording device towards the man.He took a small breath before talking. "48 hour ago, Izuku Midoriya was arrested and sent to xxx prison." That caused multiple people to complain as they started to demand more.'Why prison?''Why that prison in particular?''Especially for a child! That place is ruthless!'"Why wasn't he admitted into a hero course?!" Was shouted louder than any."No hero school accepts quirkless students." Uproar was heard once more. Disbelief, shock or amazement. There were shouts and screams. Everyone watched live as they took in the information. Hope for some and others regret. Guilt.After 5 minutes, Izuku Midoriya was announced dead to the world live.<<EOFANFIC>>

completion:
Shota hobbled down the hospital corridor on his new temporary prosthetic. It wasn’t that he wasn’t grateful to Power Loader and Hatsume Mei for crafting him a new one, but it just felt so… off. He had barely gotten used to walking with the old prosthetic before it was damaged beyond repair in the war. And Hatsume was known for having ‘mishaps’ with her many inventions so it was better to play it safe and get a new one made ASAP. Hizashi had offered to cart him around the hospital in a wheelchair, but Shota quickly declined.
He’d been going back and forth between rooms for the past few days. Most of his kids had been discharged and sent home to heal with their families, but some of the more severely injured still resided in the hospital; the three problem children, to name a few. 

Midoriya was being catered to by his doting mother. Shota honestly didn’t know how the woman survived raising that accident-prone boy with how worried she was all the time. The two blond-haired Bakugo’s had been arguing about this, that, and everything while the father tried to no avail to calm the pair. Again, Shota didn’t know how he coped. 

Todoroki, now that was a complicated family if he’d ever seen one. Shota had always suspected Endeavor wasn’t the ‘father of the year’ type, but when Dabi’s strong accusations were released to the public, the puzzle pieces Shota didn’t even realise he’d been trying to solve had all slotted into place and he couldn’t help but feel a twinge of guilt. He should’ve seen the signs sooner than this. 

A white-haired woman stood outside Todoroki’s hospital room, just off to the side so she couldn’t be seen through the window. Shota had never met Todoroki’s mother, head about her of course—it was hard not to with who she had been married to. Shota very rarely found himself lost for words; he had spoken to many parents before over the years, but never like this. What was he supposed to say to the recently widowed, grieving mother of one of the country’s biggest criminals? 

‘Eraserhead-san?’ a quiet, petite voice said. 

‘Todoroki-san.’ He put on his best ‘teacher’ voice, trying to make himself sound less exhausted. ‘It’s nice to finally meet you. I wish it was under better circumstances.’ 

Rei gave him a sad smile that reminded Shota painfully of her youngest son. ‘Likewise. You’re Shoto’s homeroom teacher, right? He’s spoken a lot about you.’ 

‘All good things I hope.’ He stood beside her and looked through the window into the teen’s room. He was sat up—well, leaning heavily against the cushions he’d been propped up on at least—and blinked sluggishly at a news broadcast on the small TV that he probably shouldn’t be watching. Bandages covered most of his skin; from what Shota could remember from the doctors, over seventy percent of his body was covered in burns that would probably scar him for the rest of his life. Multiple wires protruded from hospital gown and machines beeped in rhythm with his heartbeat. If he was awake, then why wasn’t she…? 

‘You’ve left quite the impression on him, Eraserhead-san.’ 

‘Please just call me Aizawa. Eraserhead is virtually retired now.’ His eyes remained glued to his student. 

‘Of course.’ 

Shota hadn’t had much time to talk with his students before they’d all been deployed into a war zone, but he had caught a glimpse of Shoto moments before he was to clash with his brother. He held a kind of deep-rooted exhaustion that would look worrying on any hero, even Shota. A look that would only be found on long retired pros that had seen far too much in their lifetime. A look that definitely did 

not 

belong on the face of a sixteen-year-old child. That seemed to be a fact that most of society had forgotten. Shoto was a child, and the people were treating him like some public figure that had been caught committing tax fraud or something. 

‘If you don’t mind me saying, Todoroki-san, but why are you stood out here? Shoto’s been through a lot, he could do with his mother by his side.’ 

She chuckled and the sad smile returned. ‘I lost the right to call myself that a long time ago.’ She pulled the fabric of her dress tighter around her chest. ‘You must have watched the video, Aizawa-san, seen all the things being said about my family.’ 

Of course, Shota had seen it. One of the first things he’d done when waking up from the first war was analyse Dabi’s broadcast in detail, right before Hizashi had to all but restrain him from hopping out of his hospital room to check on his student. He turned back to the boy in question. Todoroki looked so small and vulnerable; it was almost hard to believe this was the same kid that forged a giant glacier in a matter of seconds during the sports festival. He’d had a sad look about him back then too. Shota mentally kicked himself that he hadn’t done something about it sooner. 

‘I’ve hardly been a part of his life,’ she continued, ‘and when I have been I’ve only ever brought him more pain. ‘Family’ has never been a comforting word for him. He’s far better off without us complicating his life.’ 

Shota saw a thin, cold tear trickle down her cheek, but elected not to say anything. He understood where Todoroki Rei was coming from; when Shirakumo had died, he’d tried to distance himself from Hizashi and Kamaya as much as possible, blaming himself for his best friend’s untimely death (learning more recently that it was actually Shota that had been targeted certainly didn’t help the crushing guilt) but the pair had gone Plus Ultra in their stubbornness and forced their way back into his life whether he liked it or not. He was sure that if Shoto had the energy and willpower, he’d be dragging himself out of that hospital bed and make his mother realise what’s fool she was being. But he knew the look of a broken hero when he saw one. Shoto had been forced to be strong and keep it together for so long, he probably didn’t have any fight left on him. Shota had seen the kid falter before, and it was times like this that Midoriya—usually followed by Iida—pulled him up and helped him bare the weight crushing him down. Shota saw the way he looked at his friends; he knew how grateful the kid was to have them around even if he didn’t quite know how to tell them. But they weren’t here now. 

‘You know,’ he began, ‘when Shoto started at UA he mostly kept to himself. He was quiet, never raised his hand in class unless spoken to directly. And I was worried at first. Thought he was gonna be another pompous child of a hero who’s only talent was their surname. But the more he warmed up to the class and started to make friends, I realised he was just lonely and didn’t know how to reach out. He’s lucky there’s a lot of stubborn idiots in his class or else they may not have gotten through to him.’ He turned to face Rei, a solemn look on his face. ‘His friends can’t be there for him right now. He needs someone to make that first step because he doesn’t know how to.’ 

Rei looked down at her hands and sniffled. ‘I don’t want to mess this up again. I 

can’t 

mess this up again.’ 

Shota could read the subtext. 

I don’t want to hurt him again. 

In all the families he’d met over the years, none had left him with the same gut-wrenching feeling that the Todoroki family had in the past few months. If Shota wanted to be brutally honest, he wanted to take Shoto as far away from this messed up family as possible. Take him in and give him the childhood he deserved. He thought back to Eri; the young girl he’d fought so hard to rescue from a torturous situation, all the while one of his own students was suffering with no rescue in sight until it was far too late. The selfish part of him wanted to say all this to Rei, but that wasn’t what she or her son needed right now. 

He steeled himself. ‘You still have to try, for Shoto’s sake.’ 

Rei sucked in a deep, stuttered breath and reached a shaky hand towards the door. It slowly slid open. ‘Shoto.’ 

The door slid shut once more and Rei approached the bedridden boy. Shota kept a keen eye on them through the window.

completion:
The barbarians have come to the village so their King can choose someone to get married to, or at least that's what everyone's talking about those days. Izuku is not sure what to think of it, he knows it's important for his village to form an alliance with them because they have protected them countless of times, but he truly hopes both the King and his future bride are happy with the decision.


He doesn't have the time to see what's going to happen though because he needs to start traveling again; he's gathered so much information on his notebook about magical creatures (especially dragons) although it is not enough in Izuku's opinion.


However, his attention is drawn towards one of the barbarians; it's a tall and well built blond boy with a constant scowl on his face whose back is completely inked. He has a huge dragon painted on his back. Izuku has heard the ink stays permanently on the barbarians bodies so it's very fortunate that the person who inked him was very talented.


The ink is completely dark and yet Izuku recognizes the type of dragon immediately.


He gets excited and forgets is not safe to approach a grumpy stranger with many weapons on him like they have known each other their whole lives.


"Is that a red dragon, right?" Izuku can't stop himself at that point. "I can tell by looking at the shape of his wings!"


"Hah?" The initial irritation disappears from the barbarian's face as soon as he turns around to look at Izuku. "How do you know?"

"I've seen them!" Izuku beams. "Never too close, but at least enough to draw a couple on my journal... They're very powerful, one of the most powerful dragon species... Oh, I'm sorry, sometimes I can't stop myself from rambling..."

"It's alright," the barbarian smirks, grabbing his face with one hand, squeezing his cheeks. "I suppose it's normal for a nerd like you. What's your name?"

"Midoriya Izuku," he says, finally stepping back.

"Deku?"

"No, Izuku! Besides, we just met, you have to call me Midoriya!"

"I'll call you however I want, Deku!" The barbarian doesn't look irritated though, he almost seems amused.

"What's your name?"

"Katsuki."

"That's your given name, what about your family name?" Izuku asks, rolling his eyes as he notices the huge grin on Katsuki's face.

"I won't tell you."

"Then how am I supposed to call you?"

"Katsuki," he says like it's obvious, then he leans closer to Izuku only to cup his face with both hands again.

It seems barbarians know nothing about personal space.

"I can't, we just met!"

"I don't care!"

"Then I'll have to call you Kacchan," Izuku says, trying not to chuckle as Katsuki narrows his eyes at him. "It's only fair since you call me Deku!"

"Tch! Fine!" Katsuki huffs, surprising Izuku by agreeing way too fast...

"Are you one of the King's guards?"

For a moment it seems he offended Katsuki somehow, but his expression changes quickly and the blond nods.

"Yes, that's exactly what I am... A guard."

"That's amazing! So you'll probably be with him when he chooses his bride!"

"Exactly," Katsuki grins, pinching one of Izuku's cheeks, making the green haired boy pout. "I know I'm supposed... I mean he has to choose someone from all the people they'll present to him, but actually anyone from the village will do."

"I just hope they both agree to this," Izuku comments, a little bit worried as he rubs his cheek.

"So... You like to travel, right, Izuku?"

"Yes!" The green haired boy nods enthusiastically. "The world has a lot of interesting things I can't wait to see!"

"We barbarians travel a lot too, you know? You can come with me if you want..."

"Really?" Izuku grins. It'll be interesting traveling with them, at least for a while. "Yes, thank you! I'd love to!"

"Great!" Katsuki smiles from ear to ear like it's the best day of his of his life. "Now come with me to the selection."

Izuku doesn't have much of a choice actually, since the barbarian has grabbed one of his hands and is using it to pull him next to him.

They get to the heart of the village where the curious people have gathered around a line of boys and girls with the most expensive and beautiful clothes he's ever seen. Izuku knows the elders would never present someone like him as potential bride for a King. At least he feels relieved when he realizes everyone in line looks very excited about the whole thing.

They're standing in front of a strong barbarian woman who actually looks a lot like Katsuki. They call her Queen mother... She must be Bakugo Mitsuki... But it doesn't make any–

"Old hag!" Katsuki says, prompting Izuku to look in shock at the rude way he speaks to the Queen... Why is he doing that? "There's no need for this, I've already chosen someone!"

"I can see that, brat," she smirks, eyes finally meeting Izuku's. "He's too pretty for you though..."

Oh, no. Katsuki is not... He can't be–

"But my King," one of the villagers protests. It seems one of his daughters is in line. "Midoriya is a nobody..."

Katsuki growls, startling the man.

"Don't you dare say that about my future bride again!"

The people in line sigh in disappointment before quietly leaving the place, the man shivers, but nods before bowing in front of Katsuki, Izuku and the Queen.

The green haired boy is too confused and shocked to react. He's not... The crowned King cannot be Katsuki and he didn't just call him his future bride.

That didn't happen.

"Are you the King?"

"Of course, Deku!" Katsuki turns around with a grin on his face, he leans closer to nuzzle against the shocked boy's cheek. "And you'll be Queen consort soon."

"But..."

"Don't worry, cutie, I'll teach you everything you need to know first," Bakugo Mitsuki assures him. "There'll be plenty of time for that since my son has to win your heart first."

"I never lose anything, Deku," Katsuki grins with confidence before pulling the flustered boy against his bare chest.

"Please do ignore my son," she says, ruffling Izuku's hair affectionately, prompting Katsuki to growl at her. "You can say no at the end of the courtship, but at least give him a chance."

"O-Okay," he stammers, still having no idea what he got himself into this time. Although he can't say he's not attracted to Katsuki already.

"Great!" The blond smiles triumphantly scooping him up before walking towards one of the red tents in the middle of the village. "We have a lot to talk about, Deku!"

"Oi, brat! He won't be sleeping in your tent! So don't get any ideas! You haven't even given him his first courting gift yet!"

Katsuki purposely ignores her, although he puts one of his own necklaces around Izuku's neck once they're alone.

"Are you sure about this, Kacchan?"

"Of course I am," the barbarian says, almost outraged at the question. "I'll win your heart, Deku! You'll be mine!"

Izuku's face turns bright red and he wonders what kind of trouble he's in right before Katsuki pulls him closer and kisses him on the lips until all his worries disappear.

He can definitely get used to that.
<<EOFANFIC>>

Oh, god! They're such a-! "Ahh....good boy 'Toshi. You got rid of those pesky teenage 'heroes'." Said Izuku. He dismisses Shinso and gets something out from a duffel bag. He chuckles quietly to himself. "Hello, Kacchan. Hehe. Or maybe Katsuki Bakugo? It doesn't matter what your name is, all that matters in the end is that you're dead." Izuku sticks his fingers into Katsuki's skull, flesh rotting and flies and maggots infest the skull, making it their own territory. He ignores the foul griping stench, and brings the rotting skull closer to his face. "So.....Bakugo. How does it feel to finally lose? How does it feel being helpless in my grasp? Even in death, I surpass you!" He glares down at the decapitated head. He sticks his fingers in the skull's 'throat' (or where the throat used to be) and pushes his eyes out of the sockets. Izuku stares at them as if they were precious gem stones. He licks an eye and pops it into his mouth and swishes it around. It doesn't taste as good like the rest of him did... Izuku thinks. He spits the eye out. He decides to keep his childhood bully's eyes, one around his neck, the other preserved and put in a jar.He retrieves his hand from the slimy opening and opens Bakugo's mouth and inspects his teeth. Very sharp. He notices layers of plaque buildup, as if he hasn't seen the dentist in a while.Izuku examines the head of his deceased bully for hours.(I wonder where Shinso is?) Shinso Hitoshi greets the villains in the League of Villains hideout and drags corpses of two nosy high school students behind him. Shigaraki starts to scratch the back of his neck furiously, "Who the fuck are you? What makes you think you can just bring some corpses in here?" Shinso stares at him blankly. Not saying a word, and instead hands him a letter followed by a glass vial. Shigaraki reads the letter, and his eyes widen in shock and terror. The-the fucker got rid of the top heroes?? H-how?! He was d-dead..... Shigaraki turns towards Shinso in horror. He never liked Izuku Midoriya, or as the insane bitch liked to call himself 'The Doctor'. Shigaraki remembers the exact day he arrived in the League of Villain's hideout. It was a hot summer day in Japan. The League just got their ac working again until he stumbled in. Shigaraki remembers the look on the young man's face. It....it was strange and unsettled him. The man's eyes were focused and glared at everyone, not in a way that looked down on people nor in a way that resembled resentment, but.....strangely in a way that resembled sadness and insanity. Not to mention when the man's eyes landed on him, he immediately ordered to see All for One. Needless to say it made the entire hideout quiet. He of course laughed at him, such a ridiculous demand! Why would the most feared villain want to meet a worthless no one? The young man continued to stare, his eyes looked.....dead.....vacant......if looks could kill, then this young man kamikazed and took everyone with him. He took a step forward, no hesitation, no second thought, he was an arms reach away from Shigaraki. He remembers the feeling of dread and a looming sense of fear washing over him at that moment. He remembers distinctly how much it scared him. He's never been that scared before or ever since. Shigaraki remembers how the league's hideout stunk of fear that day. He caved in, and  brought him to All for One, the #1 villain, his teacher. Shigaraki snapped out of his daze and re-read the last bit of the letter again. He'll leave the League alone after this? Really? It sounded too good to be true.......it feels like a trap. Get rid of the bodies, and get one last quirk from All for One.....that's all. They're simple requests yet, he can't help but feel as though something was wrong. Shigaraki hesitantly orders some rando in the League to get rid of the bodies and hands the vial to Kurogiri. Within five minutes both tasks are done. He hands the vial back to the strange man in the body suit, the man exchanges an sd card with Shigaraki and leaves. Shigaraki stares at it. He feels.....gross. He may be a villain but even someone like him draws the line somewhere. It just so happens to be the very thing that he's holding in his hand right now....snuff films. They make him feel like he needs to take a shower to wash off the disgusting feeling. He hates how he got wrapped into this. He quickly hands the sd card to Kurogiri and wipes his hands on his jeans. He'll......have to watch it later.....he silently prays to whatever god is out there and hopes that it's not actually a snuff film and just something else. Izuku is having the time of his fucking life. He loved playing with Katsuki Bakugo's rotting, decaying head. He loved getting rid of the leathery, and rubbery skin, he loved hearing the tears of veins snapping, he loved ripping the muscles out like a feral animal. He loved preserving the eyes and stringing one around his neck. He loved playing with the bloody skull. He loved getting back at Katsuki Bakugo. He hears a door open and his attention is dragged away from the lifeless skull. Shinso walks towards his master and hands Izuku the vial. Izuku scratches Shinso's head and coos at him like a dog. "'Toshi? Is it that quirk?" Shinso nods his head. Izuku coos at Shinso some more before abruptly stopping and placing the vial on one of his work tables. Izuku quickly reviews his plan in his head and decides that it can wait til tomorrow. For now, he'll give Shinso his reward. Kurogiri inserts the sd card into an old camcorder and hands it to Shigaraki. Shigaraki hesitantly presses the play button and watches silently. He sees Himiko Toga, a girl who used to be with the League, but eventually decided to work for....The Doctor. She's tied up, head lolled to the side, and a giant gash in her torso extending from her neck to her belly button. Shigaraki feels like he's going to be sick.  There's so much blood, caked in her hair, splotches and puddles on the floor. Shigaraki hastily pauses the video for his mental health. After recuperating himself he presses play again. The camera comes closer towards the dead girl, bringing the camera closer to her gash. All Shigaraki can see are dark reds, blacks, pinks, purples and blues. And outlines of shapes. Shigaraki closes his eyes so he doesn't have to see the macabre sight anymore.He opens his eyes again and it showed someone else. A man, Mr. Compress. His mask was broken and shattered across his face. His entire lower body gone, and his hands cut off. A horrified look on his face. The body twitches a few times, a result of cadaveric spasms. The skin is pale and he can see parts starting to decay. Overall, not a pretty sight.The camera glitches to show a picture of Dabi. He can hear The Doctor telling him something. "Bring him to me, or more people in your precious League will die. Then we can make recompense, and make our separate ways. Shigaraki Tomura, I know your bartender Nomu teleported Dabi somewhere else. You have 5 years to find him, if you fail to find him in that amount of time, then I'm sure your head will look splendid on my mantle."The video abruptly ends. Shigaraki drops the camera and lies down in the fetal position gripping his neck, the words reverberating in his head. 5 years.... He thinks. He'll ask Kurogiri tomorrow where he teleported Dabi, for now he needs a nap, for his mental health. Hopefully he can settle this soon.<<EOFANFIC>>

completion: It was a strange feeling. Hawks would have dared to say that it was almost disturbing. It had been a week now, he woke up in the middle of the night drenched in sweat, his t-shirt clinging to him like a second skin. He hated it.  His few hours of sleep each day were no longer restful, and there was also a nervousness in the background that prevented him from being his usual self, always smiling Hero Number Two. It was not a question of bad mood, he could be polite to other people, but there was just no way he could keep still. He ate his meals standing up or even in the air. He was certain that if he were forced to sit for more than ten minutes, for example during a Commission meeting, he would go mad. And then there was heat, so much heat. It was as if his body was on fire in a way that had nothing to do with the outside temperatures. The cherry trees were full of flowers, yes, but it was hardly spring.  By nature, Hawks always tended to be warmer than other people, but he got sick like everyone else. That was not the case. He had no symptoms of flu, nor the weakness it brought.  On the contrary, he was so full of energy that he did not know what to do with it. He had a fire inside, a driving force that almost made him suspect he was being given drugs on the sly, perhaps when Mera offered him coffee under the pretext of having to talk about work. Then evening fell. Hawks tried to combat the heat by sitting on the balcony and calling Touya. At that point, the delirium reached a whole other level. The young Todoroki's voice was enough to take his breath away, to accelerate the beating of his heart to the point that Hawks doubted he was about to have a heart attack - at the age of twenty-four, without heart disease. He stood there in agony, his trousers getting tighter and tighter at the crotch, while Touya made decidedly unerotic talks such as: “He is 50 years old and can't even do laundry, the great Number One!” And, in the distance, Endeavor replied: "I am forty-seven years old!" Nothing on the opposite end of the line could justify that unexpected hormonal storm on Hawks' part. He and Touya had a stable relationship and frequent intimate relations. They had not seen each other for a few days - the Hero had to return to Fukuoka frequently for work and the former Villain still didn't have much freedom of movement - but no one went crazy from abstaining from sex for a week or so! “Touya, I have to call you back.” It was the conclusion of every phone call. So Hawks ran to the shower, moved the mixer in the direction of the cold water and tried to make up for the discomfort in a way that even at the age of fifteen he had never had to do. It didn't work. Never. Then he tried to please himself with his own hand and a half-naked photo of Touya. But it did not satisfy him.  An insight into what was happening to him came to him one morning as the first news bulletin of the day was being aired. One of the closing reports was dedicated to the early spring that had hit Japan that year. “Early spring..." He repeated, with his coffee cup suspended in midair. Suddenly, everything made sense. And the solution to the problem was Touya. It was Shouto who opened the door of the Todoroki’s house for him. "Dad's not here." That was the first thing he said to him, letting him in. "Touya is in the laundry room." Hawks loved that kid: half a minute and he had given him the only two pieces of information he needed. He crossed the dining room and kitchen almost jumping, and when he looked out into the small laundry room, he found Touya kneeling on the floor, he was busy emptying the basket of dirty laundry into the washing machine. Touya, clearly in a bad mood, had not yet realised that the Hero was there. Hawks licked his lips: he was so desirable in that domestic setting. "It's like the beginning of a porn movie..." Hawks realized he really said it when the turquoise eyes met his own. Touya's pouty lips immediately blossomed into a smile. "Keigo..." His name uttered by the Todoroki's voice was enough to cause him a shiver that made all the hairs on his body stand - and not only those. "I didn't know you were coming back tod-" Touya wrinkled his forehead. "What's wrong with you?" Hawks was in a very miserable state. He hadn't slept well for ten days and he was on a high for just as long. He was also sweating shamefully and something in the way Touya was looking at him suggested he must have had the expression of a maniac. The Hero ran a hand through his blond hair because, in the flight to get there, his fringe had fallen in front of his eyes in a disheveled manner.  "I confess I am embarrassed." Despite the outsized exhilaration that made his body weight shift from one foot to the other, he really was. "This has never happened to me before." A nervous laugh escaped his lips. "But you were the first to call me repressed and you were right. I think that's one of the effects of letting go." Touya stood up and closed the washing machine's porthole, although the laundry basket was still half-full. "Are you drunk?" He asked, amused. No, but Hawks felt his head spinning as if he was. "I'm on fire..." He retorted. Touya arched his pale eyebrows. "Keigo, seriously, what have you done?" He wasn't so amused anymore. “Listen to me, please, I feel ridiculous enough as it is." Hawks stepped in front of him. "There's a fire going on in here.” The Hero added, pointing to his entire body, head to toe. "I need you to help me put it out." As was to be expected, Touya laughed. "I think you are asking to the wrong Todoroki. I am the eldest son, the one who hangs fires." "Indeed it is your fault." "I beg your pardon?" "It's spring," Hawks managed to say, looking him straight in the eye. "I am a bird and it is spring." Touya was intuitive, and it only took an instant for his mouth to draw a perfect O, his turquoise eyes shining with astonishment and delight. Hawks blushed like a fledgling boy. "It's never happened to me before," he said for the second time. "But you are the first lover with whom I have a stable, sentimental relationship and-" “You want to fuck so badly that you would fuck the whole world, but do you love me enough to be faithful to me?” Touya crossed his arms against his chest, leaning against the washing machine. "You're not following me." Hawks placed both his hands on the appliance, on either side of the other's body, so as to block any escape route for him. "I want to make love until I am completely drunk on you. You, only you. Birds of prey are monogamous, you know? I don't know when our official coupling took place, in the way the animal kingdom means it, but your voice is enough to sweep me off my feet and if I don't kiss you now, maybe it will happ-" It was with a kiss that Touya silenced him, then grabbed the hem of his sweat-damp T-shirt and pulled it off. Hawks was immediately on him, pushing him onto the washing machine as he devoured the Todoroki’s lips fiercely. Between kisses, he reached for the button on his lover’s jeans and slipped them off but when he returned to him, Touya pressed a hand against his chest. "Wait..." If he had set fire to his wings again, it would have done less harm. Hawks stepped back, Touya stepped off of the washing machine and slipped the Hero’s wallet out of the back pocket of his trousers, without asking permission. "What are you doing?" Asked the confused Hero, completely dazed by his raging hormones. Touya smiled at him, then took a generous - perhaps a little too much - amount of money and handed him back his wallet. "Shouto!" He called, walking out of the laundry room. Hawks stayed where he was. Shouto's voice reached him from a distance, perhaps from the living room. He laughed. "Stop being a little shit!" Touya scolded him. "Take these, call Izuku and the jerk, go to the cinema, get something to eat, get a room in a hotel... Whatever, but don't come back before dad finishes his shift!" "And you're asking me it without your jeans on and while Hawks is still in the laundry room?" "I'm not asking you, I'm ordering you. Out!" Yes, Hawks loved that little boy. He left the house without making a fuss or any further jokes. When he returned to him, Touya no longer had his underwear on. "Let's take care of this fire before those pretty wings turn to ashes." <>

completion:
It was late at night and Katsuki couldn’t sleep. The dorms were quiet, he was not used to it, as it usually is filled up with noise from the bastards. It was chilly, too. The usual ever-present warmth had also long since fallen asleep. Katsuki shrugged it off, why the hell is he thinking about that? How fucking sappy. He reached for an orange in the fruit bowl that sat on the marble countertop. An orange sounded good right now, despite knowing that he might wake up with a sour stomach later given the fact that his stomach sat empty. Eh, fuck that. He’ll let his future self deal with it. He started peeling the orange, the citrusy aroma mixing in with the air. “Orange?” He almost jumps, quickly turning at the direction of the sudden voice. “Ponytail,” he breathes. He’s relieved. “What the fuck?” “Oh — I didn’t mean to scare you,” Momo gave an apologetic smile, her shoulders slightly rising. “Why the hell are you awake?”  “I should be asking you that, Bakugo-san,” she retorts, a brow arching. Okay, fair. “I couldn’t sleep,” he says, voice soft and void of its usual roughness. Momo hummed thoughtfully. “Me too.” Silence engulfs them as they stood in the dimly lit kitchen.  Ah, fuck. This is awkward.  Katsuki tried to look anywhere but his raven-haired classmate. He looked at the cabinets, the sink, the floor, but his eyes betray him and now he was gazing at damn Ponytail. He notices her onyx eyes on the half-peeled orange in his hands. Wordlessly, Katsuki resumes peeling the orange, removing the pith, splitting it in half. “Here,” he says, giving her half of his orange. Momo accepts it happily, tears a piece, and pops it in her mouth. She looks at him and her smile reaches her eyes. “Thank you, Bakugo-san.” He only grunts as he eats his shared half. The orange's citrus aroma permeates the air between them, but it also seems strangely cozy. Silently, Katsuki wishes he could savor that moment for a little bit longer.  Katsuki sat on the edge of the building, watching as the darkness slowly began to fade and be replaced with the bright pastels that the sun has brought. The birds chirped, singing melodies to one another, and the air was becoming warm brought by the early morning. It was nice. “Overtime?” A voice said, breaking his train of thought. But Katsuki didn’t need to turn around to see who it was, he would recognize that voice anywhere. Another body joins him, scarlet flooding his peripheries. Katsuki looks to his left, and there she was, a view much more stunning than the sunrise. Than any sunrise. Ebony hair flew in the breeze, creating an illusion of ocean waves. There, sat his lover, and the soft pastels had made the color in her cheeks more vibrant. “Your shift ended an hour ago,” he points out. “I was looking for you,” she replies. His gaze drops down to her hands, and a brow arches at the fruit she was holding. “Where the fuck did you get an orange?” “Oh, this?” she lifts the orange, inspecting it, before placing it in his palm. “Mrs. Nakamura gave it to me because I helped open her shop.”

“That old lady adores you,” he says, a ghost of a smile on his lips. “She likes me a normal amount,” she shrugged. Katsuki snorts as if he doesn’t believe her. He peels the orange, she watches him. The sections come apart neatly, cleanly, perfectly, in his hands. He passes a piece to Momo, more than his shared section, a little extra for her to enjoy. “How come you peel oranges so perfectly?” she asks, he can practically hear the pout in her voice. “I don’t know how you do it!” When Momo peels an orange, or at least attempts to, she tears holes in it, and juice would squirt in all directions. Once, it hit his eye and he couldn't open his eye for about an hour. Katsuki found it hilarious. Her hands were the opposite of his. Soft, dainty, gentle, whereas his are rough and calloused. Yet why was it that he could peel oranges better? “Just shows how I’m better than you,” he shrugs, the edges of his mouth curling into a cocky grin. She rolls her eyes at him and he laughs. Katsuki hopes she never learns how to peel oranges.  “You are shit at taking care of yourself.” “I am no—” She is cut off by a sneeze and Katsuki sighs heavily. “Even shittier when you’re sick,” he added, giving a piece of tissue to her. He never understood it. Momo was so good at taking care of him, of others. Back in high school, their classmates would call her the “class mom” because, well, she acted like one and looked out for everyone any chance she had. So why is it that when it comes to taking care of herself, she’s so bad at it? “Shut up,” she pouts, admitting defeat as she snuggles close to the warm blanket that he had draped on her earlier. “My, my, is that how princesses talk?” he asked, amused, head inclining as he sat on the edge of her bed. “If they want to, yes,” her eyes close, which gives Katsuki the opportunity to gaze at her fully, see her in her entirety. He smiled at the way her ivory cheeks were dusted a red hue, the very tip of her nose the same color. And he frowned at the dark bags beneath her eyes. Katsuki grabs the orange from the tray he brought in earlier, peels it in his hands, then gives it to Momo. “Eat up,” he said. Her eyes open again and she takes the now-peeled orange. She splits it in half. But instead of splitting it in even smaller sections, she gives the other half to him. “You too.” Katsuki stares at the half of an orange in her hand, blinking, unmoving. But then he takes it, and they both eat their shared halves. The air around them is citrusy and takes him back to when they first shared an orange together. They were mere teenagers, with so many dreams and hopes. Look at them now. They had achieved their dreams, and they even achieved them together. Katsuki sneaks a glance towards Momo and watches as she happily bit into an orange slice, a little bit of juice dribbles down her chin, he smiles and wipes it away. “You take care of me so well, Katsuki,” she smiles. “‘Course I do. Who else would be there to take care of your stubborn ass?” They both laugh because it’s true. And as they did, his chest felt lighter, and so did the ring box kept secured in his pocket. Katsuki looks forward to sharing more dreams with her, achieving them with her, and sharing more oranges with her. Hopefully, for the rest of their lives.<<EOFANFIC>>

“Take it! You’re the only one I can trust with it!”

Katsuki Bakugou looks at the boy before him in horror. “Hell no! It’s yours! I’m not taking it! We’re going to make it out of here. Both of us. We have to.”
