He frantically looks around for something, anyone, anything that can help. No one is there, no one will be able to get to them fast enough. Tears spill down both of their faces. He looks back to the boy beside him.

“I can’t!”

“Yes, you can. It has to be you. I trust you.”

A trembling hand holds out a single green hair. Katsuki takes it with his own shaking hand. 

Katsuki tastes blood for weeks afterwards.

–

Katsuki wakes with a start to his alarm, a shrill beep cutting through the haze of sleep. He takes a deep breath and prepares himself for the day before getting up and mechanically going through his morning routine. Brush teeth, morning run, shower, dress, leave for class. Proceed as normal.

He doesn’t look at the date on his phone. He won’t listen to the date on the announcements in class. He won’t look at the date on the board at his internship. He already knows what day it is, but he won’t look.

–

Classes proceed as normal, although the teachers and students of 3-A are notably quieter than they would be on a typical day. No one mentions it, everyone knows that class 3-A has been more than anyone should ever have to go through in one lifetime. Katsuki avoids conversation with his classmates, only engaging with them when necessary for class or training. 

During lunch, All Might pulls Katsuki aside, talking about how he needs to briefly talk to him in private. In the conference room, without anyone else to bear witness, he pulls Katsuki into a hug, long and tight. Normally, Katsuki would push him away, but not today. No, today he hugs back, allowing the older man to draw comfort from him. Secretly, Katsuki is also comforted by the hug. 

After classes, Katsuki grabs his hero uniform and catches the train to his internship. He arrives right on time and changes into his hero uniform, reporting to Mirko as normal. She looks at him knowingly but doesn’t comment, which Katsuki is grateful for. She sends him out on patrol early, telling him that he ‘looks like he could use some hands-on training’ today.

A villain attack occurs a little over halfway into patrol. Grateful for the distraction and eager to blow off steam, he jumps into action quickly, arriving at the scene in less than a minute.

Lightning flashes across his skin, intertwining and dancing with his explosions as he takes down the villain. Each punch, each kick, each takedown is performed in homage to the one who came before him, the one who trusted him enough to leave his greatest possession with Katsuki. His legacy weighs heavily on Katsuki’s shoulders, and lives on within him. Katsuki does his best to honor him, but knows it will never be enough. How could it be, when he should be here himself?

As he uses his quirk (

his 

quirk), he feels the ghost of a presence by his side. Conflicting emotions run through him, the presence comforting yet painful, because he should be more than just a presence. He should be full of life, by Katsuki’s side.

But he’s not, and life goes on.

–

Katsuki arrives back to the dorms from his internship and finds all of 3-A in the common room, sitting together around a cake. 18 candles stick out of the top. All heads turn towards him as he steps through the door.

Kirishima is the one to speak up. “Bakubro! Hey man, we were just waiting on you! We’re celebrating his birthday, come join us! Sato made a cake and everything.”

Katsuki looks at his classmates gathered around the table and simply shakes his head, turning to head for the stairs. Kirishima hops up from his place at the table and jogs over to him, grabbing his shoulder.

“Bakugou, bro, come sit with us. It’s his first birthday since… it happened, and we want to honor and remember him together. You haven’t been the same since he’s been gone, I think it would do you some good to do this with us.”

“Shitty hair, leave me alone. I’m fine, and I remember him just fine on my own.”

“Bakugou, don’t be like that, we just want to help and be there for each other.”

Katsuki roughly shrugs Kirishima’s hand off of his shoulder. “No! Just leave me alone.”


“Look man, I get that you miss him. I do too. We all do. But you gotta stop shutting us out, bro. We’re trying to be happy for his sake and stick together, remembering all of the good times we had with him before he died. Just hang out with us for a little-”

“I’m going to bed,” Katsuki cuts him off, turning back towards the stairs. 

“Bakugou! Wait! We just want to talk to you!”

Katsuki doesn’t listen, briskly walking up the stairs, uncaring that multiple people were calling after him. Shutting the door, he leans on the door, reveling in the silence of the empty room. After a few moments, he methodically gets ready for bed, despite it still being early in the night. 

He falls asleep.

–

Katsuki opens his eyes to an expansive plane in the midst of a never ending void, his body covered in mist. Nine figures stand before him. One steps forward eagerly to greet him, a radiant smile growing larger on his freckled face.

“Kacchan!”

Katsuki smiles and steps forward to meet him. He pulls him into his arms with a sigh of relief, melting into the embrace of the one he so dearly misses during his waking hours.

“Hey, nerd. Happy birthday.”
<<EOFANFIC>>

prompt: write a story about Haikyuu!!,  General Audiences No Archive Warnings Apply F/M 僕のヒーローアカデミア | Boku no Hero Academia | My Hero Academia (Anime & Manga) Jirou Kyouka/Kaminari Denki Kaminari Denki Jirou Kyouka Aizawa Shouta | Eraserhead Mineta Minoru Kirishima Eijirou Ashido Mina Fluff School Dances Dresses
completion:
“OK, settle down, settle down,” Aizawa groans, and Denki turns from where he is attempting to land a paper aeroplane into Mineta’s head. So far, he had grazed the boy three times without managing to get it to stick, to his frustration and his friend’s smug glee.“We all know you’ve been burning the candle at both ends recently,” he continues, very much in the voice of a man who still seems to believe they can burn it a little bit harder. “So we’re doing something a little different to wrap up the weekend.”Outside, a flurry of snow flickers past the bay windows of their classroom. Their teacher is right. They have been going hell for leather, ever since Hawks fed the information back that something big was going to go down with the former League of Villains and their new buddies in the Meta Liberation Army. Ever since they had returned from the bulk of their work studies, Denki felt they had not had time to turn around.Aizawa scratches at the bags under his eyes. “I hope you all still have your formalwear,” he starts up again, and there’s a definite twitch to him, as if he feels this is a monumentally wasteful use of faculty time. “We’re having a winter formal on Friday night.”A murmur of chatter rises from the class group. Denki feels the static around him fluctuate, a pleasant buzz that rises with each new voice added to the chorus, until their teacher silences all of them again with another look. Despite that, he can feel Mina positively vibrating from across the room just by the energy that percolates.“We’ll be holding it in the school gymnasium,” Aizawa droned on. “Smart clothes over casual, and a date is not necessarily.” He fixes Mineta with a look. “Any inappropriate behaviour will result in extended detention and non-attendance with me.”His friend has the intelligence to at the very least affect a look of contrition. Denki wonders if his hormones can be kept in check, given Mineta’s tendencies as a wannabe sex maniac are now legendary enough that pupils from other classes have taken to carrying boxing gloves around, hanging off their bags, in case he tries to get too handsy.Denki’s own reputation as a would-be Casanova is something he hasn’t had time to cultivate further in recent months, but nor does he find himself as particularly interested in the girls anymore.Well, except one.His eyes flick over to where Jiro is, as Aizawa drones through the continued ground rules for such an event. She catches his gaze after a moment, smirks, and gives him the middle finger.He’s not sure when he found out that being flipped off by her made his heart pound faster, but he’s not sure he’ll ever get used to it either.  “C’mon, man, stop fiddling with that,” Kirishima tells him, and Denki grimaces. His shirt collar feels too tight around the curve of his neck, even with the top button undone. It fits him everywhere else but there just fine.“I can’t help it!” he half-whisper shouts, earning an uncharacteristic pout in response.“Here, let me –” And before he can realise it, Midoriya is into his personal space, fiddling with the fibres. Suddenly, something loosens and he feels like he can breathe again.“Wow, dude, thanks!” he says gratefully, and Midoriya scratches the back of his hair nervously as he waves him off.“Eh, not big deal,” he says, and then his eyes light up. “I’ve got to go, somebody’s calling my name.”Denki turns to watch him as he departs, his classmate heading towards the doors of the gymnasium, where The Big 3’s Mirio Togata has just entered with Eri at his side, petite in her small black-and-red dress. As he turns back to Kirishima, he sees her crack a smile.“Drink?” comes another voice at his elbow, and suddenly he finds a tumbler of something cold and tropical in colour has been pushed into his hands. He looks up to say thank you to whoever it is and stops dead in his tracks, his mouth gone dry.“What,” Jiro says flatly. “Do I have something on my face, Jamming-Whey?”Denki desperately wished he wasn’t a hormone-addled teenage boy right now, that he was a grown man capable of stringing words together, but at the same time, he thinks it doesn’t matter how mature he could be, because his throat would still turn to sandpaper with the image in front of him.She’s wearing an A-line dress, cut closer to the collarbone than normal, with the material fanning out to just below her knee. He doesn’t need a trained eye to tell that it fits like a glove, tailored with a deft touch; he imagines Yaoyorozu likely had a hand in it.But it is the colour that catches him off-guard most of all. He feels like he only ever sees Jiro decked out in shades of purple, black and yellow, maybe a little red and blue. He cannot remember, for the life of him, ever seeing her in green.It’s deep too, a shade off viridian, before it fades fully to black at the hemline and the fringes. The effect – and he’s not sure there can be another word for it – is magical.“Kaminari?” Jiro repeats. “Earth to Kaminari?”“No,” Denki hears himself say “You just look beautiful.”It is like an out-of-body experience. The hustle-and-bustle of the rest of the gymnasium falls away entirely and he feels he can see himself from a distance, a lone voyeur to the moment between him and the girl – woman – opposite him.Jiro opens her mouth, then closes it, then opens it again. She repeats the motion, akin to an extraordinarily pretty kind of gaping fish, as a fierce blush rises up her neck towards her cheeks. Denki himself is feeling particularly hot under the collar too, as belated panic floods him.
Why on earth did he have to go and open his big mouth?
Before he can add any further fuel to the fire, even before Jiro can give a response, the moment is shattered as he is bowled into by Mina, talking at a hundred miles a minute.“Oh my gosh, Kaminari, you look so good! Like, damn, son, I didn’t know you could clean up like this! How did you get your hair to go that way, it looks like the frickin’ waves, dude –”Jiro vanishes somewhere into the growing throng and despite his best efforts, he doesn’t get a chance to talk to her alone across the rest of the evening. He doesn’t even get a chance to really hang with her.He sees her once, across the room again, as Yaoyorozu tries to get Todoroki to do the twist and Mei Hatsume attempts to corral Bakugo into a limbo contest with Midoriya and Uraraka biting their firsts to stop the laughter at his indignant response. She’s talking with Koda by the punch table, and his gaze lingers on her again.She catches it for a moment, over the shoulder, and a myriad of different expressions – confusion, curiosity, hurt, elation – all seem to flash together in a beat before she settles on a nervous little smile that feels like it is the biggest thing in the room.Denki’s on cloud nine when he goes to bed that night. And if he wakes up to find a note pushed under his door in the morning – You clean up pretty good too x – with no signature, well, that’s his business and just somebody else’s too.<<EOFANFIC>>

prompt: write a story about Haikyuu!!,  General Audiences Major Character Death M/M 僕のヒーローアカデミア | Boku no Hero Academia | My Hero Academia (Anime & Manga) Bakugou Katsuki/Midoriya Izuku Bakugou Katsuki Midoriya Izuku Kirishima Eijirou Hurt No Comfort Bakugou Katsuki is Bad at Feelings Sad Bakugou Katsuki Pro Hero Bakugou Katsuki Bakugou Katsuki Needs a Hug
completion:
A white tombstone stood in front of a very tall blonde boy. The young man was bent down in front of it as he felt the name on the slab of concrete. His face had tear streaks and he didn't care. Bakugou Katsuki stood in front of the tombstone for somebody he held dear in his heart. Midoriya Izuku meant the world to him. he never let the world know that. Even the nerd himself didn't know how much he truly meant to the blonde. Bakugou never got the chance to tell him.It had been exactly a year from the day he had decided to come. There was flowers and incense in front of Midoriya's tombstone. It almost brought a smile to Bakugou's face how much people cared for the other. It almost made him jealous. They showed appreciation for Midoriya and all Bakugou could do was stand there and cry silently to himself."Nerd, it's been a year since you left us," Bakugou let himself talk. Even if he was talking to a slab of concrete, it still felt like he was talking to Deku. "Shitty hair, Round face, four eyes and Icy hot miss you," the blonde let himself fall silent.The day was a nice one compared to how it was a year ago. It had rained the day Midoriya had died on the battlefield. Bakugou still blamed himself for not protecting the nerd long enough to tell him how he truly felt. Even to this day, Bakugou can't even look at Deku's friends like he used to. The blonde truly felt like he didn't have a right to even speak to them. It was his personal job to protect the nerd with every last breath. Bakugou had failed so bad in protecting him. Everybody could see the pain in Bakugou's eyes every time somebody mentioned the nerd's name. The hero course wasn't the same without Midoriya, that what Bakugou thought. He had always anticipated that this was a dream, and that the green-haired boy would rush into class saying he was late. The blonde was extremely quiet and barely said any vulgar comments like he always did. Bakugou wasn't himself anymore. His friend group watched over him for an entire year making sure he didn't do anything 'stupid' in their eyes. "I never did get to tell you one thing, Midoriya" the blond spoke to the tombstone in front of him. "I always wanted to tell you the truth. You got a taste of the truth but not the full truth." Bakugou shifted so he was sitting on the cold hard ground.The blonde boy looked around making sure that there was nobody around. He did not want anybody to hear what he was about to say. He was never good with feelings and emotions, and he didn't want to get judged for being difficult. When he looked at the white slab once more, he could feel tears burning his eyes, as if they were waiting to fall. He didn't try to blink and wish them to go away. The explosive boy let them fall. He sat silently crying to himself and finally letting the pain show. It felt like he was about to tell the nerd himself about all of this and it was hitting him hard. "I wish I was telling this to your stupid face, Deku. but knowing me, I probably wouldn't do it without hurting you or somebody else." Bakugou went to wipe the tears from his eyes smiling slightly as the tombstone before he looked up at the bright blue sky as if his confidence left him. Bakugou flinched a few seconds later. He could have sworn he felt a hand on his shoulder. the blonde never experienced this before, so he felt kind of scared thinking he was being messed with by a ghost or something. He looked to the side where he had felt it and he swore he saw Midoriya beside him. Bakugou could feel himself smile through his tears. The one-time Bakugou let him break after Midoriya's death was this very moment. He couldn't afford the others to laugh at him if they see him like this. He really wished he was telling the nerd when he was alive and not a year after his death."Midoriya, after losing you I thought to myself." the blonde sniffled. This was really hitting him, but he needed to do this. Suddenly Kirishima had popped into his head. 

~~~Flashback~~~

Kirishima was somebody Bakugou went to often and he told him about how he felt. The red-haired boy helped Bakugou work up the courage to do exactly what he was doing. For Bakugou to get help, that was one thing that was strange to the other boy. But what surprised Kirishima was that it was about untold business about Midoriya. Bakugou remembered how hard it was to tell Kirishima this very thing.The other boy had caught the home screen of Bakugou's phone being Midoriya smiling. He knew that the blonde was missing the other, but he didn't dare speak of it. It would have ended up as an explosion to the face or something. Kirishima knew something was bothering Bakugou when he slowly cut himself off from everybody else and no longer had his normal comments thrown at people. Kirishima could read him like a book and for once he was grateful, he didn't say anything. He knew Bakugou would tell him when he was ready if the boy needed a shoulder to lean on."Shitty hair, can we talk?" Bakugou remembered asking the other back then. He also remembered almost dragging the other towards his dorm without letting him object. "Bakugou, are you alright?" Kirishima had asked after they were in Bakugou's dorm with the door shut tightly and locked to prevent getting bothered. "I don't fucking know anymore," Bakugou huffed out. This was going to be hard to explain to the redhead. "Tell me what is troubling you, Bakubro," Kirishima insisted. The other boy sighed."I think...I like Deku," Bakugou almost whispered. Kirishima looked at the blonde with shock evident in his eyes. 

~~~Flashback End~~~

The thought of telling Kirishima that day made Bakugou's tears fall more. He had told the red-haired boy that he swore he was never going to tell Midoriya about his feelings. He didn't even know how to express his feelings. He was given so many chances to tell the nerd how he felt but then he ignored every single one of them. and now, the blonde regretted it. he had regretted everything."I should have told you before this, Deku," Bakugou spoke between sobs. he had wished he told the other before he threw himself in front of the blonde and took the fatal blow for him. the nerd died in Bakugou's arms before he could tell Midoriya the truth.Silence filled the air once more. Bakugou knew he was talking to himself, and he also knew if he was caught by anybody that he would look weak. He was the one now holding one for all after Midoriya had pleaded for him to keep it with him and not 'let it die with him' like an idiot."I-I'm sorry I am just telling you this now, nerd," Bakugou started once more. "I didn't know how to tell you. even shitty hair tried to get me to tell you, but I didn't. I fucking regret it." Bakugou tried to make his voice sound normal, but he couldn't get it to do it. "I loved you so much and now that you are dead, I feel empty, you are gone and it hurts a lot. You should have never jumped in front of me, the world needs you, not me." Bakugou sat in front of the tombstone crying for who knows how long after basically telling the concrete slab that he loved the person whose name was on it. Bakugou let every little emotion he had held up for an entire year out in the form of sobs and tears. He pictured the day Midoriya did that stunt in his head as he cried even harder. It should have been him that died, not his Deku. The blonde couldn't do this without the other pushing him forward. Nobody could even replace the nerd in Bakugou's eyes. The feeling he felt earlier had returned, it was like Midoriya was with him. Might have been because of one for all that held parts of the boy with him. Bakugou felt like he was being hugged and then suddenly he felt something touch his forehead. Maybe it was ghost Deku returning the feelings which made the blonde break down harder.After what seemed like hours, the blonde finally stood up with his face full of tear streaks. it was starting to get dark out and he needed to get home. even if there was no Midoriya waiting for him, he could at least be with the other boy in his dreams. that was what Bakugou hoped. he couldn't lie about how much he missed Midoriya. even his friends could tell just by how he locked himself in his apartment after a patrol or how he acted after seeing a therapist after Kirishima had managed to beg him to see one.  Losing Midoriya drove the blonde mad. Bakugou started making his way towards his car after he had wiped his face. The tears drying stung his face. He walked in silence catching glimpses of other people seeing their loved ones' tombs just like he did. He knew his puffy eyes were noticeable, he had just poured his heart out to the one that had the love of his life's name on it. As he walked nobody bothered him for autographs or anything even though he was now the number one hero with Deku's quirk added onto his own explosions. He was Dynamight after all. Who wouldn't want his autograph, but he was glad nobody bothered him. He couldn't hide his feelings that he was spent the past hours letting lose for the first time in a whole year. The blonde had finally made it to his car with no interruptions. He hurriedly got into the vehicle so he could hide from the world. With one last look towards where he came from, he put the key in the ignition and the vehicle roared to life. He had technically done what he wanted to do. It might have been late but at lead he finally 'told' the other his feelings. Even if it wasn't the full extent of what he felt. It was a start of the process of living without the other. Bakugou never tried letting Midoriya go and move on. He could never look at anybody else the same way.  When Bakugou pulled out of the parking lot, he looked in the rearview mirror with more tears threatening to spill. it always hurt watching him leave Midoriya's tombstone. He couldn't help how much pain it brought him. He truly did miss him, and there was nothing he could do anymore.<<EOFANFIC>>

completion:
Izuku decided that Bakugou Katsuki is naïve.Naïve enough to not have the judgment to think for himself, to not have the power to realize that life wasn't all about him, that Midoriya Izuku, was a human being.Izuku also decided that Bakugou Katsuki was the best. The best in academics, had the best quirk, had the best parents.Bakugou Katsuki was also the best at ignoring, ignoring “a loser like Deku”, ignoring his pleas for the bullying to stop. Ignoring the way his “friends” just used him for popularity. Bakugou Katsuki ignores a lot.One thing that Izuku couldn’t quite figure out though, was why he was so attached.Of course maybe it was because Izuku knew that if he let go of Bakugou… then there was nothing left of his childhood. He would be left utterly alone.Sure, his mother, Midoriya Inko, tried.She was there for him, worried about him, and loved him, but she wouldn’t be there forever.So maybe Izuku did know why he was so attached.But he would ignore it.Just like Bakugou but instead, Izuku is ignoring the taunts, the jeers and baiting. He ignored the pull of the roof, the gleam of a razor.Instead Izuku would disappear, blocking out the naïve Bakugou Katsuski, into his mind.He would stare, nod, flinch even, at the right times, but he didn’t really care.Midoriya Izuku may be a pebble at the bottom of everyone else's shoe, but he would still be a hero.Now, Izuku looks at Bakugou, the one bound to be the number one hero, the one who is going to make the charts and become a symbol.Izuku can laugh at the thought, “Number one hero! Kacchan (That was always Bakugou’s hero name in Izuku's head, a lost wish really.) exploding yet another villain!” Izuku would be proud of him.Now, Izuku didn’t really care to be number one as long as he was a hero. Save at least one person. That was his motto.
See, Izuku wasn’t naïve, that had been beaten out of him ever since the age of 4, he knows that not everyone is created equal, and he can’t say he wouldn’t die being a hero, but that really didn’t matter.  As long as he saved someone. But right now, that is a dream, and he is blocking out another rant by, you guessed it, Bakugou Katsuki. “-ber one! Stop dreaming Deku and give up already!”Izuku looks at Bakugou, “Sorry Kacchan.” He plays the part, bends his head, quivers his lip and shakes.Bakugou wouldn’t actually do anything, he couldn’t have anything tarnishing his perfect record. Not that he would get in trouble for anything done at this school anyway but the boy was still cautious. Ah. Another thing Izuku thinks about a lot. “A boy”.Bakugou Katsuki is a mere 14 year old boy. Yet he is treated as a god.Another mental laugh, “Lord Explosion!” his mind helpfully supplies.This was a mistake.Sparking hands land on the wood in front of him, this time Izuku is not acting in a play.His face flushed after his rather undignified squeak, not that anything about him was dignified but let him have this.“What’re you smiling about stupid DEKU!”“K-Kacchan! S-sorry!I was just-” thinking about a Pomeranian god? Ah no, he’d rather stay alive thank you very much, “distracted?” was the meek reply. Okay maybe that wasn’t the best answer either. Considering that was yet another notebook thrown out the window after school.#13, Izuku quite liked that one too! He sighs in dismay but it comes out as more of a whimper, his shoulder kind of hurt.Oh well, it was enough to get Bakugou to leave with his goons.-- Izuku takes it all back, Bakugou Katsuki was not only naïve, but an idiotic blond haired oaf!Ah… okay maybe that was too harsh.Izuku reprimands himself, no, no it was not. Who goes around telling people to kill themselves and expect to keep their record clean!He guesses that Bakugou would be right considering Izuku never planned to go to somebody about this and would probably take those words to his grave.Still Izuku feels bad. The other probably hadn’t meant it… Right? It was said in a fit of rage, targeting a reaction out of a weaker victim.He internally sighs, Izuku really was a lost cause huh?Always lost in his thoughts yet speaking them aloud as if he means for the world to hear, speaking as though he is not lost, yet free.Izuku hates his muttering, it tends to lead him to danger, middle schoolers were harsh, especially if the muttering loser in the corner was quirkless.It also tends to lead him down dark tunnels, into the chest of green slime…and onto the leg of the current number one hero.Huh.-- All Might sucks.For the third time that day, Izuku laughs, although this time out loud.To his ears it sounds less cheerful and more maniacal.“Can’t be a hero!” He muses, smiles too wide to be comfortable.See, Izuku loves All Might, the persona, the symbol. He has however come to hate the man behind the media masks.He was quite- how should Izuku say it… dumb.Although he supposes many adults are. To be blinded so by the fact that they are “decades wiser” than the average 14 year old that they tend to forget the simplest of rules.Okay, Izuku supposes it's not a rule really, and more so just the morally correct thing to do.He thinks that shouldn’t there have been a voice somewhere underneath all of those blonde strands saying, “Hey! So let's not leave a quirkless kid, that you just told off by the way, who's most likely been bullied his entire life, on top of a roof, with the door locked, and no other way down!?”That's what Izuku had assumed… But maybe the other man had sold his brain cells for more power… Kind of like selling your soul to the devil, but this time you just get dumber every time you use your strength to make it rain! -or something.Izuku's thoughts were still kind of a work in progress. Sporadic, all over the place. Can you blame him though? He was technically three steps away from an easy suicide.Sigh.Yes, his mind is a place where he is allowed to say the word sigh and get away with it. --Izuku may have lied. He was not in fact strong enough to ignore the small piece of metal tucked away in his desks drawer. Izuku swears that yesterday he would have been, but by some turn of events, he had been attacked twice by the same villain in one day, gotten his dreams shattered by his number one idol, and been told to kill himself, not in that order.So grant him this release.Because of course, he couldn’t bother his easily worried mother, who was downstairs cooking delicious katsudon for dinner, and he most definitely did not have any friends to go to, and sadly, his family (if you could call it such with only two people) was too poor to afford a decent therapist.So, Izuku did the only thing he knew how to do.Izuku needs to stop lying, of course he knows other coping skills, but this one worked the fastest so lay off it.--Izuku quite enjoyed the feel of the rectangular metal in his hands, thin and sharp, easy to fiddle with.He had needed to break a pencil sharpener for the blade, but it was a small sacrifice for a second of emotional stability.See Izuku knows he has problems, it becomes especially clear when he has to scramble to the bathroom to clean the dripping blood from his arms.He knows he has problems when he’s sitting there, realizing that one should not be numb to the sound of grenades and bombs, that the feeling of being degraded is just another word in his head, Izuku knows that something is wrong. completion:
For being a river of hatred, The Styx was an awfully calming place to reside. Though, perhaps not for those doomed to wander its shores for the next centennial, unable to pay the toll Charon stipulates.
 
So perhaps it is only Izuku who holds such an opinion.
 
He likes to wander, at times. Upon which, his steps will trace the lines of the bank until Syx gives way to Acheron and the rushing rapids morph to dour currents.
 
His mind is calm, here upon the rock, and Charon greets him each time their paths cross, the time of strangers long since passed. It has been many years since they first met, after all.
 
Izuku does not always receive a chaperone when he comes here. He does not mind. Sometimes he prefers as much. But oftentimes, the welcome face of a chthonic companion greets him but minutes after his arrival.
 
It always brings a smile to his face.
 
Even now, a bright smile greets Thanatos as the deity comes to stand before him. “Hello, Thanatos!”
 
“Hello, Little Bird.”
 
A hand comes to run through his curls and Izuku finds himself leaning into the touch. It was warmer than one would think. Gentle. “What troubles you so, Izuku?”
 
A small frown decorates his face and he feels his shoulders slump as he recalls the events of the day that caused him to seek solace in the depths of Hades once again. Izuku isn’t quite sure how to begin. But he knows Thanatos will wait. His patience knows no bounds, especially where Izuku is concerned.
 
“I… almost died today, Thanatos…” His voice is oddly soft at the admission. 
 
Let it be known that Izuku does not fear death, he never has, even before his visits to Hades. Nor does he long for it.
 
Home, for Izuku, is here in Hades. His family is born of ichor and they feast upon ambrosia.
 
And he knows, has been told many a time, that he will forever be welcome here and that, upon his departure from the clutches of life, he will finally be able to cross the Styx upon Charon’s boat and take up his residence in the fields of Elysium.
 
Yet, for all the times the deities offer to take him, that Thanatos offers to cut him free of his bindings, he has always refused. He always will.
 
Today marked the closest he’s been to death and Izuku knows that, if it had happened that he had died then, he would have welcomed Thanatos with open arms and held himself still for the deities sword to cut a lock of his hair.
 
However, he does not despair that he lived. Because it means he will continue to learn. Will continue to grieve. To hurt. To love. To experience everything and anything. Izuku will live in spite of Pandora and her box. In honour of it.
 
Yes, Izuku welcomes death, but he does not yearn for it.
 
It is this knowledge that means Thanatos simply hums at his admission, lowering the both of them to sit upon the stone.
 
“Tell me your tale, Sweet Child.”
 
The words do not quite flow, despite the proximity to the river, the swirl of emotions from the day rising back up and causing his words to halt and stutter, tumbling over themselves in a desperation to be heard. But Thanatos is happy to listen regardless. He always is.
 
Katsuki’s words. The laughter and jeers of his classmates. The averted gazes of his teachers. How it felt, to drown above water and the way his skin still crawls with the feel of sludge. All Might and his secrets. Katsuki and his rescue. The weight of the world soon to fall upon the shoulders of a boy not yet 15. 
 
There is no point hiding anything, and there is no need to do so. Thanatos will not judge, and Izuku wants to tell. To speak and be heard. It is a joyful experience, one Thanatos is happy to indulge. 
 
He is offered no words of sympathy or pity, no reassurances or platitudes. There is no scorn or anger. For his actions or that of others. It’s exactly what he needs. But then, his family always knows what he needs.
 
They sit there in the silence, broken only by the Styx and the stranded souls, for a while longer, simply soaking in the presence of the other.
 
“Tell me a tale, Thanatos?”
 
And the deity does. There are many to tell and be heard, after all. 
 
It is to the story of Leto that Izuku finds himself drifting away, head pillowed on Thanatos’ shoulder and a wing wrapped around him, soft feathers chasing away the feeling of slime clinging to him. 
 
When his eyes open in the first rays of dawn, they open to the sight of a poppy resting on his pillow beside his head, reminiscent of the first poppy he was gifted, and he feels his heart swell in fondness. 
 
In a moment, Izuku will place it in his desk drawer alongside all of the other gifts, but for now he is content to lay there, the remnants of Thanatos’ touch a ghost upon his skin, soothing his pains he carries as a balm for his aching heart.
 
(Yesterday was the first time Izuku almost died. It will be far from the last in the coming years. A war is coming. He will sacrifice and lose and win and hope and despair. His fate, then and now and always and forever, untouched by the Moirae, obscured from Kassandra’s ilk. He just hopes that, when it is time, it is Thanatos who claims him. Regardless, Izuku will always have a home in which to return to.
 
For there is a place in Elysium that his family has set aside where he will rest. They will be there, to pick up the pieces of himself that he has lost and will lose along the way. They will be there to sew him back together again and nurse the seams of his suffering until pain no longer cradles him and he lies, forever out of its grasp. 
 
And then he shall finally lay eyes upon the sights his family do so love to tell stories of. The Asphodel Meadows and their insubstantial souls, the River Lethe, Sisyphus’ hill and Hades’ castle.
 
He will laugh and smile and play in the depths of Hades until the end of time.
 
And he will rest easy, knowing that he is no longer alone. That he is safe here.) 
<<EOFANFIC>>

I’m pretty sure our new neighbor is a ghost. That’s the only thing that explains it.

His clock is always at zero. I’ve never seen anything like it. I caught just a glimpse of it as they moved in and assumed I was mistaken, but I wasn’t. His time has run out but he’s still here.

The guy he moved in with still has a good 50 years on his, which is what I’d expect for a man his age, probably mid 30s. I’m not sure how old the timeless guy is. Couldn’t really tell behind his hair.

He’s got thick black hair past his shoulders and an eyepatch. Seems like he has mobility issues, mostly uses a wheelchair or a prosthetic leg, which I guess is why he moved in to the accessible unit next to us. The man with him, the blonde, I don’t know what their relation is. Maybe he’s the caretaker. Maybe he knows something.

I don’t know.

I know you can’t read this, so I don’t know what I’m expecting, but you couldn’t do anything about it anyway.

I don’t really want you to know about my quirk in the first place. My therapist just thought it would be good for me to write out my feelings.

That’s all, I guess.

Love, your son, Ryou.

take my big sister away!

Chapter Text
Welcome to Death Drip Radio. I’m your host and resident himbo, Mimir.     I thought of the name “Death Drip Radio” back in 2019 or so, as a sort of personal nominator for the talks I have with myself during the quiet hours of night. It's something close and private, where the “viewers” are nothing more than the ghosts of my past and an unsuspecting partner lying next to me.      I won’t introduce myself to you, at least not now dear viewer. You’ll get to know me if you tune in when these chapters air, The same way we all got to know Cecil in the strange city of Nightvale. I’m half as lovable and my voice is all but soothing, but I do hope you’ll tune in here and there.     For now I suppose, since you are here, I will tell you a story. Make yourself a glass of hot cocoa, curl up into your bed. Dim your screen just a bit. Take a deep breath. Another.      Another.     There was once a person that existed in the world. They breathed air and walked with their legs. They tasted food; they went to work. They let the shower wash the dirt away. They met people and went outside.      This person repeated the same routine daily, more or less. It's really all they could do, to survive. However, this way of life caused something to bloom in their soul. A desperate cry. Not knowing better, they skimmed a website, coming upon this page, reading these words.The screen acknowledged this person, a dearly beloved viewer. And the screen spoke to the viewer with deep compassion.‘You are loved,’ the screen said.‘You are safe,’ it continues.‘Your struggle is seen. You can put down your sword and shield. It is alright, dear viewer,You breathed today. I’m proud of you. You opened your eyes, they are a lovely color. You should open them tomorrow too. You are here now, and you are safe in these pages, dear viewer.'’You are allowed to rest now, okay?’ ‘You are allowed to take up space and rest. Your weapons will be there tomorrow. You did fantastic today. Let’s try again tomorrow, alright?’

completion:
Izuku took a few deep breaths in preparation. Why was he so scared? Bakugo is his best friend. Wait. That’s it. Bakugo is his best friend. His best friend of ten years, who he cherished dearly, who he would do anything for.

Bakugo is his best friend. He may not act like it, but he’s always be willing to help!

The green-haired boy sighed as his hand came up to rap at the blonde’s dorm room door. “Hey, Kacchan? It’s me.”

Low grumblings were heard from the other side of the door, and it opened shortly after. “What is it, nerd?”

“I need a favor.”

The explosive boy sighed harshly. “Come on in.”

Just like he had done many times in the past, Izuku smiled as he took a seat on Bakugo’s bed. “So I need your help with this. All-Might said that I haven’t been myself lately, and I can’t deny what he’s saying.”

The One-For-All user sucked in an anxious breath as he handed his best friend a piece of paper. The blonde took it in confusion and scanned over the contents of the page.

“He told me to set twenty goals for myself. Some things that I’ve always wanted to do, things that always make me happy, things I haven’t done in a while. I was hoping that you would help me complete them.”

Bakugo’s gaze lingered on the final item on the list, but he nonetheless couldn’t help the gentle, upward quirk of his lips. “Sure thing, let’s get to work.”

    The two boys set off to complete the list. The first thing they decided to do was learn how to play chess. Izuku had never picked up on how to properly play, so they consulted Sero.

“It’s actually pretty easy. These tiny pieces here…” the brown-haired male chimed, toying the tiny pawn between his thumb and forefinger, “are called the pawns. You have lots of these little guys, but they can’t do much movement.”

The explosive hero-in-training picked up rather quickly, but it took Izuku a bit to catch on.

Bakugo was uncharacteristically quiet and peaceful, explaining each piece in a gentle-toned voice. “This one here is called the rook. It’s like the Hawks of chess pieces, only the queen is stronger.”

“Number Five: learn to play chess.”

Izuku listened intently, but couldn’t help the tears that sprang to his eyes suddenly. He hastily gasped and brought his arms up to wipe his leaking eyes.

“This one here is called the- Deku?” Bakugo furrowed his brows, “What’s on your mind?”

“Mm! N-Nothing. Sorry, I don’t know where that came from.” The green-haired boy chirped in reply as he sniffled a little bit, “I think I’m just really glad that I’m feeling better.”

“Well, good. I can’t beat you if you aren’t at your best.” The blonde replied with a menacing grin.

“Yep! I’ll feel better soon, and then we can race to be number one!” The boy chimed, re-engrossing himself in the chess game.

    The day went by without a hitch, with each item easily being crossed off. As the tasks were complete, Izuku’s mood did seem to be improving, but it also seemed to be dropping at the same time.

They were down to the last three items on the list. The first task to tackle was meeting Izuku’s hero. He had already met All-Might, so he opted to meet the hero that saved him and his best friend just a mere year ago.

Kamui Woods.

The two young heroes found a meet and greet that was being held at a nearby bookstore. It would mean standing in line for quite a while, but the two were training heroes, it was nothing that they couldn’t handle.

The two were near the front of the line when Izuku suddenly started coughing harshly. The greenette fell to his knees, clutching his chest as he wheezed for a decent breath.

Bakugo gasped and immediately knelt down. “Deku? What the hell is wrong? Are you okay?”

“N-Nothing! I just need a hug. That’s all, just a hug please.” Tears once again flowed into the choking boy’s eyes, “Please, Kacchan. Just give me a hug, please, please, please.”

The explosive hero obliged without hesitation, wrapping his arms around the One-For-All user. The green-haired boy clawed desperately at his best friend’s back to hug him tightly, coughing painfully into his hand shortly after.
    Kamui Woods looked up from his table to see the crumbling heroes. He recognized them instantly: they’re Aizawa’s boys. He rushed to their sides, holding his phone up to his ear to call the aforementioned teacher.

“Eraser, it’s me- Yes I’m fine, it’s one of your kids- Yes, one of yours- I’m taking him to the hospital- yes, him- I’m not sure of his name, he has green hair- Midoriya?” The hero looked at the panicking blonde, who nodded quickly, “Yes, that’s his name- Yes, please bring All-Might- see you soon.”

“Deku? Are you still with me? Hey!” Bakugo yelped, shaking the boy in his arms.

“I’m fine just… just please don’t let go… just hold onto me a little while longer…” the One-For-All user slurred sleepily. Within the next moment, he was out cold on Bakugo’s shoulder.

“Number Twenty: Get a big hug from Kacchan.” 

“We need to go. Come with me.” The pro hero demanded, taking off toward the hospital.

—

    Three pro heroes and two training heroes sat cramped in the tiny hospital room. There was an uncomfortable silence between them, tension thick enough to cut.

“You wanna tell me what’s going on here, problem child?” Aizawa’s voice was stern, his gaze deadly.

“Number Nineteen: See Mister Aizawa again.”

“I’m not sure. I was just in line to meet Kamui Woods and-“ the boy stopped dead in his tracks, noticing that his hero was in his room, “Oh! Um… hi, sir. Im Izuku, a big fan of yours.”

The hero smiled, “it’s great to meet you, Izuku. You gave me and your friend quite a scare back there.”

“Number Eighteen: Meet my hero.”

“Right, yeah… sorry about that, everyone.”

“Stupid Deku, nearly gave me a freaking heart attack.” Bakugo grumbled, standing up to flick the greenette’s forehead, “You must really love being in this damn hospital, huh?”

Izuku chuckled. “I guess so. Hey, on the bright side, we completed the list!”

    Bakugo smiled as he turned to All-Might. “I guess this list idea of yours wasn’t so bad after all. We actually had a lot of fun.”

“What do you mean?” All-Might’s brows were furrowed, “I never-“

“Kacchan.” Izuku called, “Come here. I need another favor.”

Before he could question the older man, the blonde turned his attention to a smiling Deku, who was holding up his thumb.

“Do what I do.” The boy bit the skin on this thumb, drawing a tad bit of blood. He held his thumb up in the air. “Just trust me.”

Bakugo mirrored the action, and stood confused as his friend pushed their bleeding thumbs together.

“Katsuki Bakugo… You are strong enough to inherit my quirk. My power is called One-For-All, and I am passing it down to continue with you. Use it responsibly for the greater good.”

“What are you-” The explosive blonde jumped back as the power began to course through his veins.

“Young Midoriya!-“

“Midoriya!-“

“Izuku!-“

The greenette began to grow paler and colder by the second, feeling the absence of power hit harder than expected. “Kacchan…” the boy trailed off with a sleepy smile, “It’s going to be okay.”

All-Might turned away from the scene, not being able to bear the sight of his most beloved pupil suffering. Aizawa rested a hand on his coworker’s shoulder to show his solidarity.

“Why did you do that?! What the hell is wrong with you?!” Bakugo cried. “I don’t understand- what are you hiding from me?!”

“Kacchan… I’m dying.”

    There it was. The cat had been let out of the bag, and all Izuku could do was wait to see his lifelong best friend’s reaction.

“What…? No you’re not.” The blonde shook his head as his features grew angry, “Stop lying, this shit isn’t funny.”

“Do you remember when I told you about how if I overused my quirk too much…” the boy trailed off. “I’ve over-exerted myself… There’s nothing I can do about it, it’s too late to go back… I’m going to die today, I‘ve had a feeling since this morning.”

“But we made sure that you were being more careful! This can’t be happening…” Bakugo couldn’t begin to process the news. “D-Dammit, Deku. Why? Why didn’t you tell anyone? Tell me?” The blonde asked in exasperation, gripping one of the handles on the side of the bed.

“All-Might is the only one who understands. I didn’t want to scare you or make you try to find a cure. I made sure to pass on my quirk to someone important to me. I’m not scared of dying anymore, I’ve come to terms with it.”

“You knew?” Bakugo hissed, whipping his body around to lunge at the ex hero. He couldn’t believe what he had just heard. “After all this time, and you two kept another secret from me? What the hell?!”

Kamui Woods stopped the boy before he could attack his teacher. “Stop. Now is not the time to hold grudges. Go be with your friend, he needs you.”

The explosive blonde retreated to the bed where his best friend took his hands. “I won’t really be leaving, you know that. All of the spirits of the past wielders will come to you.”

“Izuku!” The blonde yelled, voice breaking. “Don’t talk like that! If you knew you were going to die, why would you have us do that stupid list?! It doesn’t make any-”

“Kacchan… “Izuku sighed, dropping Bakugo’s hands, “that was my bucket list.”

    Bakugo staggered backwards, breath catching in his throat. The tears he had been trying so desperately to hide came rolling down his cheeks, pattering onto the floor below. He stood dumbfounded, not daring to move or breathe. He stuttered out a few words, his voice exiting his lips in a cracking whisper.

“A-Are you damn serious…? Y-You mean to- to tell me T-that we just spent the entire day-“

“Kacchan…” Izuku’s face fell into a sympathetic look. He patted his lap as a beckon to his childhood friend. He held the boy in his arms to try and comfort him.

“This can’t be real…” Bakugo whimpered.

“You’re going to be a great hero, Kacchan. It’s going to be hard at first, but you’re super strong. Don’t work yourself too hard… please. More importantly, don’t ever give up. I promise I’ll be back by your side very soon.” The green-haired boy murmured as he carded his fingers through his friend’s hair.

The explosive blonde was uncharacteristically quiet, albeit his constant sniffling. The three pro heroes quietly chatted amongst themselves, leaving the room just quiet enough for only Bakugo hear one more uttered gratitude.

“Thank you, Katsuki.”

The explosive hero gasped, shooting upward. “No, no, no, no, no- Izuku! This isn’t- this isn’t goodbye! Please!”

“Take care of him for me… okay?” Izuku’s voice was mousy and strained.

The monitor flatlined.

Bakugo screamed.
<<EOFANFIC>>

Today mother and I had gotten up early in order to go to a meet and greet with the teachers of UA, as Nezu had said in the letter 'it's to get students familiar with the teachers and ensure the parents that they are in great hands.' We pulled up into a small parking lot with a big cabin in front of it, the doors were huge and decorated with little streamers and a banner saying, "Welcome UA students and Parents." Sweet. "Mommmmm." You complained.

Like this morning when she made you recheck everything in your bags and somehow you ended up with two extra bags with who knows what in them. You made a so, so sign with your hand and she squealed in excitement. Honestly you wouldn't be surprised if people mistaken 

you

 for the mom and mom to be the over excited teenager. Just where had all your energy gone? Mom had noticed since you had gotten your quirk at the age of 5 (you were a late bloomer) that your energy had depleted. Now you're more laid back and chillaxed, as your friend in America called it. 

 

"So, you're the famous Ami I have heard so much about? You have quite the rare quirk," Recovery Girl says as she gets up and walks around you. Uhm... okay... weird? Does she do this with everyone? She's so short. Maybe it's just because her back is hunched. A hand is extended to you, and you pause, mind blanking out. "Mind if I see it in action deary?" Action? Oh. It clicks but takes a minuet more for you to make your decision, mom is always good at picking out the bad people and sticking with them, but this is Recovery Girl we're talking about. The country's best doctor and respected all around Japan.
 
 You take her hand, and a ringing sound forms in your ear. 

Good.

"Sorry, that happens every time I shake a hand." Recovery girl nods and pats your hand. 

 

"Well, deary go on in and have fun, your mom and I have a lot of catching up to do since middle school." She says, taking her seat back on the bench with mom. 

 

"Have fun baby!" Mom cheered and you walked inside. 

 
 
The moment you stepped into the cabin you were greeted by 3 things:

The smell of cupcakes (your favorite)

Music is something you had always loved- especially foreign music from America. The one Present Mic was singing right now was called TikTok by Kesha and you knew every word in English! Don’t stop



Make it pop



Dj blow my speakers up

Tonight imma fight till we see the sunlight

He gives you the solo this time and you would like to say you knocked that ball out of the park very easily, if you could do this every night- sing in front of who you admire or even sing with friends well- things would be A-okay in your book. The song comes to an end and the DJ shuts down the mic immediately after, thank goodness, he must have known the loud hero would have yelled into it and cause everyone's ears to bleed.

You nod and smile. “I liked to practice in my own time after I heard Kesha’s song for the first time. Guess it paid off!”

You two wave goodbye to each other and the woman with black hair walks away with him. Feeling a little parched after your singing fest you make your way to the back area and spot All Might getting a drink. 

A sudden strike of anxiety rushes through you but you shove it down. If you can get up on a stage and sing with the hero you idolize you can talk to the number one hero without sweat.

He must have noticed you approaching because he gives you one of his famous grins and takes a sip of his drink. 


Stay away.

 You stopped and looked around confused, what was that? That wasn’t your normal inner voice. . The voice is heard again and a flash of green is seen beside All Might before it disappears. “Not to worry young one.” All Might says before you have a chance to dwell on the strange flash. “Turns out I’m going to be a teacher here!” He poses and you laugh a little.

He’s not a good person? How? He’s the number one hero!

It was Eraserhead himself. 

"Sorry!" You apologized. "Oh, I know you. The underground hero Eraserhead correct?" He nods.



"Nice to meet you. I'll be in your home room." You latched onto the distraction immediately, needing something to calm your racing heart. The last thing you needed was a panic attack in front of your teachers- your home room teacher at that. 
"Are you okay? You looked stressed talking to All Might. He wasn't too much for you was he? He can be overwhelming at times."You looked surprised that he caught on so quickly. Hush. He’s watching. So much for a distraction. You could feel his eyes boring into your skull without even looking at him. Instead of scratching your cheek, which you hadn't realized you were doing, you decided to place your hands in front of you while still maintaining a slight smile. "Oh yeah, haha. I just uh…” You paused, trying to think of a plausible explanation. "I'm just nervous to say something wrong. You all are heroes and my future teachers, so I want to make a good impression." He stared at you for a moment before nodding. 
"Just no more tripping alright?" You laugh and nod. 

“No promises.”

“Ami! It’s time to go baby!” Mom called.

"Have a goodnight, sir!" You smile, shaking his hand. 

Good.

 He waves you off and you join your mother at the door, thankful to be out of the cabin and finally have some time to think. Climbing into the car you sigh and look out the window and at the sunny sky. Why was the number one hero bad? Even though your quirk has never steered you wrong you decided to brush it off this time. He's the number one hero. He was loved by everyone. It was just your anxiety. That's it.

Chapter Text
Bakugou Katsuki had always known that something was off about him. As a child, he had never felt comfortable in his own skin, never felt complete. It wasn't until he stumbled upon an online forum that he began to understand what was going on. He was transgender - he was male.At first, Bakugou didn't know what to do with this information. He couldn't talk to anyone about it, not his parents, not his classmates - especially not his classmates. He had a reputation to uphold, after all. The last thing he needed was for people to think he was weak, or worse, different.So Bakugou tried to ignore his feelings, tried to push them away, but they always found a way to come back. He found himself spending hours online, reading about other transgender people and their experiences. Eventually, he figured out that he needed a binder. Without it, he felt exposed and vulnerable.Bakugou ordered a binder online and started wearing it every day. It made him feel more like himself, more comfortable in his own skin. But there were times when it was too tight, too constraining. Like today.Bakugou was in the middle of class, trying to pay attention to the lecture, when a wave of dizziness overtook him. He felt his vision blur, felt his heart pounding in his chest. And then everything went black.When Bakugou came to, he was lying on the ground with his classmates gathered around him. He felt like he was suffocating, like there was a weight on his chest that he couldn't shake. He tried to sit up, but a sharp pain shot through his ribcage, forcing him back down."Hey, hey, take it easy," someone was saying, a hand on his shoulder. "You fainted, Bakugou. Are you okay?"Bakugou tried to answer, but his throat felt dry and scratchy. He nodded weakly instead, his gaze flickering over the worried faces of his classmates. He felt a flicker of panic - had they seen something? Had they noticed? But then he realized that they were all too focused on making sure he was okay.It wasn't until he was in the nurse's office, shirt off and gasping for air, that he realized how foolish he had been. He had been so afraid of being seen as weak or different that he had pushed himself too far, risked his own health.The nurse was gentle as she cut away the binder, her face sympathetic as she saw the bruises and welts that had formed on his skin. Bakugou felt a sudden surge of shame - she knew, she had seen, and he was exposed.But to his surprise, the nurse didn't say a word. She simply helped him into a looser shirt, gave him a glass of water, and sent him on his way. For the first time, Bakugou wondered if maybe, just maybe, there were people in the world who wouldn't judge him for who he was.As he made his way back to class, Bakugou felt a sense of relief wash over him. He had been hiding his true self for so long that he thought no one would ever accept him. But the nurse's kindness gave him hope.When he walked into the classroom, he felt everyone's eyes on him. They all seemed concerned, but no one said anything. Bakugou took his seat, feeling self-conscious about his new, looser shirt.But then something unexpected happened. Midoriya turns his attention back to Shigaraki, watching him look smug at the scene in front of him, Midoriya almost rolls his eyes, knowing that he was the one to create the plan but knowing that Shigaraki is their Sensei’s favorite so he will get the credit. “You! From the day of the sludge villain.” Midoriya smiles darkly. 
 
“Deku!” Midoriya freezes, eyes slowly following the voice to make contact with the person who yelled his name. Midoriya and Kacchan make eye contact. Almost in sync, the two start stalking each other.

, I am so weak that 
I masterminded
 this entire plan. I am the reason the villains are winning right now. I am the reason your teacher is incapacitated and

Bakugou screams out in pain, kneeling over. Midoriya smiles icily before kicking him in the head. The hero student knocked out on the ground. Turning back, Midoriya checks to see how Nomu is doing at defeating All Might. He only has minimal hope of it actually defeating him. 
 
At that exact moment, All Might punches Nomu through the roof of the USJ. Disappointing but expected. He studiously ignore the start of Shigaraki’s temper tantrum, stalking back over to the main fight and sneaking behind All Might frighteningly easily. He stabs him right in the old injury. Chapter Text

My name is Bakugo Katsuki. 
 
I’m 14 years old, a normal middle school student attending Aldera Junior High. In terms of grades, I’m number three in class. 
 
I don’t bully, don’t fight, don't smoke, but even though I’m popular in class, I don’t have many friends. 
 
Everyday I go home straight after school ends. I like to listen to my favorite rock band while doing homework. 
 
No matter what, I make sure I’m in bed by 11 PM to get eight hours of sleep. After having a glass of warm milk and doing about 20 minutes of stretches before going to bed, I usually have no problems sleeping until morning. Just like a baby, I wake up without any fatigue or stress in the morning.
 
I was born with the quirk: Explosion. In this world where nearly 80 percent of the population have an inborn quirk, I’m very average. 
 
People in this world like to use their quirk to become heroes and fight villains. 
 
However I’m not that kind of person. 
 
I, Bakugo Katsuki, am a person who wishes to live a very quiet life.

completion: Katsuki's humor had  always been quite sour, but for a few years now, his moodiness had increased. Specifically, since he had succeeded his parents as God of the underworld. When he took the job, he knew it would be hard, but so much?The souls of the dead hovered around him constantly, lamenting, asking him for a second chance that he could NOT give them. Was it so difficult to understand? Death was irreversible, and when the time came, you had to assume it with fortitude. But no. Every damn day, when he entered his home, those crybabies walked behind him crying and pleading. And he was fucking tired.He became more and more irritated by the situation. Every day it was harder and harder for him to continue with his duties. And then... he came.It was something sudden. He was in the woods, fleeing from everything that tormented him. He had sat in the shade of a tree by the river when flowers fell on his legs. He looked up and found a young man with curly hair, green eyes and a sweet smile who was looking at him lying on a branch that seemed to cradle him. His curls and arms were decorated with flowers and he wore a soft white robe."They're Freesias", was the first thing he said. "They symbolize tranquility. You seem angry."Katsuki frowned. He put aside the flowers and stood up to go to the entrance of the Underworld. He heard a few footsteps behind him and found that the young man was following him with the flowers in his hand."My name is Izuku", he said animatedly. "What about yours?""Leave me alone, kid", he snapped rudely before entering the Underworld."But you forget the flowers!" The boy exclaimed from outside.Katsuki thought that was everything, but from that day on, Izuku began to follow him back and forth. He always carried flowers that he offered him friendly, and each of them had a different meaning: Golden Rods, which symbolized encouragement and good fortune, tulips signified hope, heliotropes that showed a desire for friendship...Katsuki rejected them again and again, but that brat kept trying. The time came when not even the gates of the Underworld could stop him. The boy followed him inside with his bare feet, growing flowers and plants wherever he went. Once he even tried to bully him with Cerberus, his three-headed dog, but THEY BECAME FRIENDS. That fuking mutt had betrayed him.Katsuki was embarrassed to see that monster pulling on the ground frantically moving his paw while Izuku scratched his belly. Was that the guardian of the world of the dead?"I'm going to give you up for adoption," he threatened.Izuku seemed enthusiastic every time he entered his home. He looked at everything with a charming curiosity, always with his stupid and also lovely smile on his face.Little by little, Katsuki got used to his presence, even admitting that he found it pleasurable. That boy talked and talked nonstop, and that distracted him from the souls around him to torment him. Of course, he would never recognize it in front of him. Even if he wanted to, he couldn't. It was the first time he get his heart racing when he saw someone.He felt like smiling when he heard his restless footsteps following him through the woods, and he had to make a great effort not to softening his expression when he greeted him with his sweet voice.For a moment, he thought that all the souls who had been chasing him, had get tired of him ignoring them, but apparently, his indifference had caused them to rage with him and one day, they returned with much more force.He went out into the woods for a walk. Normally, souls did not usually accompany him when he left the Underworld, but they had been emboldened and did not leave him alone for a single second."You don't understand. As a God, you can never understand what it's like to leave your family and friends behind.""We just want a second chance.""My life was very short!""We won't leave you alone until you listen to us."Katsuki couldn't take it anymore. They were going to drive him crazy. His head hurt. His temples throbbed. He was about to explode."Listen to us, Katsuki.""Katsuki.""Katsuki.""KATSUKI!""ENOUGH, GET THE FUCK OUT OF HERE!" He shouted in all his fury, turning around.Suddenly, those shadows evaporated and his eyes collided directly with green irises that had been tinged with fear and sadness. On the ground, lay a bouquet of red roses that Izuku had dropped because of the fright. The boy slowly backed up and ran out before Katsuki could stop him."Wait!"Katsuki ran after him.  Izuku, with his small body, was faster than him, but he was able to catch up with him once they reached the river.  Izuku got into the water with the intention of crossing to the other side, but Katsuki was able to grab his arm before the water reached his knee. Her green eyes were bathed in tears."I'm sorry!" The young man exclaimed."I won't do it again! I won't go in there again! I just wanted to... make you smile. You're always so serious... You seem so sad...""I know," Katsuki said. "I know. I didn't want to yell at you. I wasn't yelling at you.""I won't follow you again," he insisted between sobs."I want you to keep coming.""No. You've been telling me to leave for months. It's all been my fault for bothering you and forcing you to accept my company. You have been very patient with me.""Oi, I like your company."Izuku smiled through tears."Don't lie.""I don't lie," Katsuki said, wiping away his tears with the palm of his hand. "I want you to keep bothering me."Izuku laughed."You haven't even wanted to tell me your name in all this time.""Katsuki. My name is Katsuki.""Katsuki," he repeated. "Sounds great.""It's just a name, nerd.""No, it's your name. That makes it special," he said, his cheeks flushed.Katsuki smiled for the first time, and Izuku's eyes  flashed. Katsuki's heart  widened as he gazed at those eyes so closely.He took him by the waist and brought him a little closer to himself."Will you keep coming?" he asked."Only if you want me to go."Katsuki took one of the strands of hair falling down his angelic face and played with it."Don't play difficult. Today you have brought red roses. Even I know what they mean."Izuku lowered his gaze shyly."Is it crazy?" He asked. "Feeling something like that for someone who doesn't even want to tell you their name...""No, if that person secretly feels the same way," he replied.Izuku bit his lips and leaned his face against Katsuki's chest. The god of the Underworld took his cheeks and kissed his lips slowly.He felt Izuku tremble in his arms because of nerves, and wondered if he had rushed by kissing him on the same day he had told his name. But when he separated from him and saw the young man's smile, he couldn't help but rejoin their lips once again.<<EOFANFIC>>

How come it that every time I see you again you've become even manlier?""Shut up Shitty Hair, Round Face should keep her opinions to herself."Without another word Bakugou marched towards his room all the while dragging Kirishima along.The other eighth year boys were very grateful they had finally gotten their own rooms, a luxury they hadn't the last seven years of aggressive flirting.But Kirishima would make sure that Bakugou would be very compliant by morning and if no one, read Midoriya, Monoma or Mineta, managed to piss him of would stay like that for at least a day.
<<EOFANFIC>>
