Gentle criminal. Himiko Toga Shoto Todoroki Ochako Uraraka eraserhead - Character Stain - Character Mr. Compress Itsuka Kendo gunhead - Character Setsuna Tokage Neito Monoma Kurogiri and Hitsoshi Shinsou All For One - Character OC - Character AU new to tagging Crack Taken Seriously Death Dystopian Future
completion: "H-how did you survive that? That attack would have even killed All might in his prime!" All for One says, shell shocked at the turn of events. He had just used his ultimate combo of quirks on this mere hero student. Someone supposed to be quirkless. Weak. Useless.The kid smirked and looked at All for One with the most shit-eating grin the man had ever seen. The glint in his eyes was... for lack of a better term: worrying, " I have plot armor," Those four simple words made All for one. The Demon King. The Pinnacle of Quirks. The supposed new god of the world. Gulp.All for one was no stranger to plot armor. It was how the hero always survived in the comics he read as a young boy. But he never thought it could become a quirk, "Your quirk... is plot armor?! Your supposed to be quirkless!" The horror in the man's voice was shocking to everyone else there.The boy's grin widened somehow, "Yep. Face it All for One. You lose. I am the hero and you are the villain. You know what that means and so do I," The boy drew a simple revolver. The demon king knew it was loaded with one bullet, "This is revenge for nearly crippling my girlfriend, Destroying society, and trying to kidnap Eri," He pointed the revolver at the shadow lord, "Make this easier on the both of us," All for one couldn't believe it. This upstart had the quirk needed to beat him. He couldn't even take it.He grit his teeth. He was All for One. The demon king. The man who made All might look like a baby whilst he couldn't even see. He stole the body of Tomura Shigaraki, He for fucks sake stole one for all He couldn't give up. He channeled all the power of All for one and one for all into one arm, "I'm afraid I cannot give up now. I am too close to fail. Soon hero society will be completely destroyed," Before he could punch a hand touched him. He felt power drain from him. He looked to his last opponent in fear, "You took my quirks?!"The revolver in his hand clicked and he nodded, "I did. All for one can be copied remember? The good doctor's work didn't go to waste.," He placed his finger on the trigger, "It's been a pleasure asshole. But for all the crimes against humanity you have committed you need to die," All for one knew he couldn't make it out of this situation alive. He couldn't even kill his enemy. Or anyone else. Gentle criminal was using his quirk to keep a wall between All for one, the boy, and the rest of the resistance. The man just had to awaken his quirk. All for One also cursed Garaki for not wiping his files before his capture. He'd see the man in hell and he'd haunt him there.All for one decided he needed one last jab in, "You may kill me today. But my quirk will live on. My followers shall carry on my legacy. The name of All for One will never die out," All for One expected horror on the face of the young man in front of him. But no. His greatest enemy just laughed.He pulled back the revolver for a second due to his laughter, "You think we hadn't thought about it? You are dumber than I thought All for One. My followers are taking care of yours. The name All for One dies tonight and society will finally be free of the shitstain known as the "Demon King" Face it. Your empire is dead, All because of plot armor," His grin faltered for a second, "Though you left us a lot of cleanup to do. Prick," That was his last jab at least, "Any last words?"The resistance leader pointed the revolver toward the Demon King's head, "How does it feel to take the life of a creature such as I? How does it feel to know that to save the very people you love you needed to stain your hands red?" Mind games were his specialty. He might have a chance of hesitation he can use. A moment that he can use to use to escape. He found none.The young man with all of All for One's most powerful quirks with him looked at the man himself, " I feel great. I don't feel good about killing. What kind of person does? But I am happy that of all the people I needed to kill. It had to be you. The worst man this earth had ever created," He then sighed, "Lets be honest here. You had everything going right. You had an empire, power, loyalty, and the ability to nearly kill All might. But it wasn't enough. I had nothing. I was deemed quirkless. But I had one thing on my side the whole time it turns out," His grin turned into a smile, "Plot armor. Now see you in hell!" He pulled the trigger and the sound of a gunshot was heard and the smell of gunpowder radiated the air.The boy looked to his comrades. The people who had stuck with him and survived. The people he had chosen so his path to the symbol of evil would be cleared. Villains, Heroes, Vigilantes. There were thirteen people that came with him on his mission to kill All for One that day. Gentle criminal. Himiko Toga, Shoto Todoroki, Ochako Uraraka, Eraserhead, Stain, Mr. Compress, Itsuka Kendo, Gunhead, Setsuna Tokage, Neito Monoma, Kurogiri, and Hitsoshi Shinsou. All of them bravely volunteered to come with him(Although they had to anyways) There were better picks for a team but these were the people available. People without a post or position at that moment.He dropped the revolver, "We did it everyone... All for One is dead," the well-dressed boy kicked All for One's body for good measure, "For real this time,"Toga grinned. Knowing her former boss was dead was great, "Woohoo! The old prick's finally dead. Oi Captain-kun ho-" She was cut off by Gentle criminal deactivating his quirk and Todoroki beginning to talk.The wall was dropped between him and his team, "Really? Its over that easily?" Todoroki asked. He wasn't convinced that the shadow lord is dead.Shinsou grinned, "Yeah he is. Even if he somehow survived the gunshot to the head; the captain took his quirks. We have nothing to fear," Shinsou had complete trust in his leaders ability to put the man down for good. He had to believe.Uraraka nodded, "That means we've finally won! We can rest easily now knowing that man is dead," She spat the word "man" out with venom that shouldn't have been possible from a girl as sweet as her. Her leader hated seeing that.Everyone heard a bell ring and saw it was their leader who had rung it, "One of his quirks," He shrugged, "Anyways. As Uraraka said we can finally rest. Sadly only for a bit. We have a society to rebuild," Everyone deflated at that, "But. I will be giving everyone three days off. It's time to party!" His smile grew as wide as possible. It was brightening. It gave everyone reassurance, "Also I kinda want to do something special for someone... And I need the days off," It was a mystery of who their boss was dating. But it was his love life so nobody pried into it.The boy looked toward the dead body of all for One, one last time before using a fire quirk on it. All for One was dead. Never to come back. The world could rest in peace knowing that the man who had killed so many was finally in hell where he belonged, "Rot in hell where you belong. I'll see you there one day. I hope not though. Hell's too good for you," He looked toward Kurogiri, "Please open a portal back to base. I have a few quirks to give back to their rightful owners and some quirkless to make happy,"Kurogiri nodded, "Right away sir,"He walked to his... friends. Yes, friends, and soon Kurogiri opened a portal and they left. It was time to go home. They deserved it.<<EOFANFIC>>

prompt: write a story about Haikyuu!!,  General Audiences No Archive Warnings Apply M/M 僕のヒーローアカデミア | Boku no Hero Academia | My Hero Academia (Anime & Manga) Midoriya Izuku & Todoroki Shouto Midoriya Izuku Todoroki Shouto Uraraka Ochako Asui Tsuyu Kirishima Eijirou Kaminari Denki Bakugou Katsuki Todoroki Family (My Hero Academia) Midoriya Inko Alternate Universe - No Quirks (My Hero Academia) Fluff Manga & Anime I Wrote This Instead of Sleeping Class 1-A Shenanigans (My Hero Academia) Musutafu City (My Hero Academia) i just like writing about cities i guess Romance Winter Based on a song bnha - Freeform mha - Freeform tododeku - Freeform
completion: There was no new snow in January. The pavements were smothered in grey sludge. People tripped and stumbled and cursed their way into the new year.January was dreary and it was bleak. The sky never seemed to cheer up, instead unleashing tantrums upon unsuspecting people, lining the streets with silent fury.When the U.A. pupils returned back to school, they were thrown into a lurch of exam prep. After school cram classes were the new norm. For Class 3-A, the rush to get the best seats in small rooms with blindingly bright overhead lights was a comfort. They grew accustomed to vibrant squabbles and the scratches of scrawling and scribbling on paper, which meant that the days started to snowball into each other. Five times a week Izuku Midoriya and Shoto Todoroki found themselves walking home together with their classmates under skies patchworked with midnight blues and inky blacks, sewn at the seams with threads of small stars. They first immersed themselves into the fragments of scattered duos and trios taking up the entire sidewalk and merging with the other groups of students racing to get home, but eventually the crowds would dwindle and it would only be the two of them left as they started to approach their street.Ochaco Uraraka was the first to depart the group. She lived less than five minutes from the cram centre, and would join the group, hand intertwined with Tsuyu Asui's, as they all banded towards the convenience store across the street. The owner, an elderly man with a bald head and contrastingly large beard, was used to the U.A. pupils entering in large waves through his door by now, and never failed to greet them with a beam as they filled the aisles, heads bent low as they reached for the last pack of potato chips, shaking the packs of candies to try and buy ones with the most inside.Ochaco, arms laden with sweet treats and the occasional grocery item, would be the last one out, and soon rush towards the apartment complex she lived in after making them promise to get home safely and comfortably, her bobbed hair flouncing around her shoulders as she vanished into the dimly lit building. Tsuyu would turn into the road with her before pausing at the bus stop at the end of Ochaco's street, waiting to head towards the more rural area of Musutafu.Eijirou Kirishima had the furthest distance to walk, and lived ten minutes away from Izuku and Shoto. The evenings grew darker and his temperament grew silenter, as he walked steadily and smiling through the greying slush, his rare solemness showing his exhaustion from the rushed scribing of notes and equations he still had faint inky imprints on his hands of. His arms were always crossed over his crimson coat, fingers curled around the strap of his satchel. It was hard for him to be invisible even on the darkest nights, with his spiked up red hair brighter than the street lamps above their heads.Eijirou would separate from them with Denki Kaminari and Katsuki Bakugo in tow, both of whom took the bus from the city centre further into town. Katsuki's headphones were never not plugged in, blocking out the music of early nightlife rising up around him. He would speed walk the entirety of the journey, waiting for Denki and Eijirou to catch up to him on the corner of the streets they passed. Katsuki's pace was quickfire and his gait explosive with heavy footsteps: partly due to his ridiculously heavy backpack, and partly due to his annoyance with the unpredictable nature of the movement around him.The students had only just finished their long days of studies, but the rest of Musutafu were in the middle of their journeys. Office workers holding briefcases and hats bundled off to the pubs. Gaggles of young adults caroused and formed disorderly lines at the entrance of the city's only club.  Katsuki had no hesitation in navigating his way through these bustling crowds because he simply pushed past them regardless (though rather gently, because he wasn't all that interested in hearing anyone's voice address him after the toiling hours of cram school). He left his classmates behind him, as they avoided being swallowed whole by bursts of rushing adults and barging youths.Someone who wouldn't walk with them was Mina Ashido. Granted, they did all leave the sessions together, with Mina more than often being the one hurrying them out of the cram centre and into the midst of the city. However, a distraction in the form of an old middle school friend, or a large poster in the window of a fluorescently decorated department store would have her wandering away from her friends, ready to shake off the remnants of crammed schoolwork still lingering in her mind. Behind her would be Kyoka Jirou and Momo Yaoyorozu, who called after the pink-haired girl to watch where she was heading as she dissolved into the night.Izuku and Shoto had fifteen minutes to themselves after everyone had gone their separate ways. Izuku would wave - and Shoto would nod - goodbye to Eijirou and Denki (and Katsuki, if he remembered that they were still in proximity of him and turned around) before crossing into a sideroad, trekking through the worst of the sludge. The streets were well lit and it was rare to go though a month of January in Musutafu without seeing at least three snow ploughs trundling down the roads in the morning, but the two would stay close, cautious of skidding across the street on an unnoticed sheet of frozen over puddles, or sinking into an untouched blanket of fresh, white snow.How they spent their sole fifteen minutes together varied, but it never felt wasted. Sometimes they listened to music together, Izuku's earbuds and faux-confused glares shared between them when one would skip past a song that the other had queued up. They weren't opposed to being in complete silence, as they liked listening to the raucous symphony of Musutafu's nightlife awakening fade away the closer they came to their street. Often, Shoto would ask one singular question, perhaps about a headline he had been sent by Fuyumi, or about a part of the schoolwork that he had noticed Izuku light up at the mention of in class. The question was purposefully vague, to allow Izuku to spill out every possible detail he had in his mind, the only interruption to his streams of individual debate being the wavering engine of a single car coarsing through the empty road every so often.What never changed was the closeness of their bodies. Their arms were linked and the layers of Shoto's soft, velvety blue coat and Izuku's bottle-green puffed one squashed together, keeping them blanketed in a shared warmth as they trudged through the muddied snow.When they had reached their street, Shoto would always pause on the sidewalk and watch Izuku enter his house before turning to reach his own front yard. Izuku lived five doors before the Todoroki household. The Midoriyas' door was the only green one on the whole street, the exact same shade of his hair. Izuku had been told by his mother that it was purely coincidental and that she had fallen for the house because of the rich, elegance of the door's colour. Izuku secretly counted it towards the surplus of evidence towards believing in fate.The porch light was always left on until Izuku came home, as his mother waited for him to greet him before going to bed. Izuku would turn his key in the lock, one strap of his bag hanging off his shoulder and turn to give Shoto a smile before he pushed open the green door and disappeared behind it. It was only after that smile that Shoto could allow himself to make his way five doors up to his own porch, the silence of the street allowing the *click* of the Midoriyas' porch light switching off float away with the whistling winter wind.Shoto would unlock the gate - which creaked no matter how many times his brother Natsu had oiled it - and walk past the flower bed that his mother has been growing since her release from hospital, before dashing up the steps to his front door. He rang the doorbell and stood outside, waiting to be let in. It wasn't unusual for him to have to ring twice, letting out a sigh that appeared as a faint, frosty cloud in front of his face, before the door unlocked from the inside and he was allowed to slip into his equally icy home.Only Fuyumi would be awake, sipping from a mug in the dining room and tapping away at her laptop. Shoto would raise a hand at her white-and-red highlighted head peeking over the screen before heading into the kitchen and down the stairs towards his bedroom on the basement floor.Shoto would slide his satchel onto his desk chair, unbutton his school blazer and hang it on the back, leaving it to spin gently. The thumping was an audible invitation for his dog to hurtle down the stairs and leap onto his bed, lying on her stomach and leaning on her paws. She was a Dalmatian, with an especially large black patch over her left eye, mirroring his own scar. She would wait patiently for him to get ready for bed, watching him washing his face and combing his hair before joining her and scratching her behind her perked-up ear. Then he would pull out his phone and swipe to the camera.Five doors away, Izuku would be in his living room, legs stretched out onto the coffee table and his mother beside him on the couch with two mugs of hot cocao, asking about his day. She never understood that he was distracted and not paying attention to her, mistaking it for exhauation.Shoto was the one to wait for him to be okay outside, but Izuku would hold out for a certain notification to light up his phone before he could truly feel at peace. It would often come late, but recently they would come within two minutes of checking his phone; this time it was a picture of a Dalmatian's face cupped lovingly in a hand. His heartbeat slowed in relief and the chilled sensation on his skin warmed. Izuku leant his head back onto the couch and smiled at his mother.Half an hour later Izuku would clamber up the stairs, a loud "goodnight" resounding through the house, as Shoto switched off the lamp on his bedside table and rearranged himself to lie comfortably with a heavy dog slumped over his legs. The glare of Shoto's phone screen would make him blink profusely for longer than it would for others, before lowering the brightness with his thumb. Both of them would both settle into their individual beds five doors apart, still enveloped in the warmth they had created together in the chilled darkness of the January night, ready to start it all up again on the phone.<<EOFANFIC>>

prompt: write a story about Haikyuu!!,  Teen And Up Audiences No Archive Warnings Apply F/M 僕のヒーローアカデミア | Boku no Hero Academia | My Hero Academia (Anime & Manga) Jirou Kyouka/Kaminari Denki Jirou Kyouka Kaminari Denki Tokoyami Fumikage Yaoyorozu Momo Fluff Alternate Universe - Rock Band Record Shop AU
completion:
It was after they had soundchecked, with a couple of hours before doors, when Kyoka went to the inside pocket of her guitar case and came up empty.She could feel the start of a headache brewing behind her eyes. It had been a difficult journey, through hellish traffic on the outskirts of Kamino, resulting in them rocking up three hours after they had intended to. With the venue wanting to do final checks of their own, they had been forced to truncate a full rehearsal into a ten-minute blast.In the rush, she hadn’t bothered to pick out her plectrums, but now, with the clock ticking, she realised they weren’t in the place she normally stored them.“Hey, Tokoyami,” she called over her shoulder, and was rewarded with a distant grunt somewhere down the corridor outside of her dressing room. “You haven’t got my plectrums, have you?”Silence, and then another grunt, which Kyoka had learned to interpret over the years on the road together. Black Rattlesnake’s one and only axeman was a fellow of few words and fewer sounds, though at least he never spiked her blood pressure like their surely drummer.She bit her lip, then snapped the case lid down. She thought she’d seen a small music shop a couple of streets away when they had finally driven in. A glance at the clock hanging on the wall told her she had enough time to likely make it before closing.“Hey Momo, I’m just popping out to get plectrums,” she said as she passed her keyboardist’s door. A muffled response that sounded vaguely affirmative rung out and she wound her way down the corridor to the fire exit door.The shop was less flashy than the ones she typically frequented, honed with a sort of oddly rustic charm. Stacks of old records lined one wall, while a slew of stringed instruments hung above them. It was small, possibly even pokey – a sense not helped by the fact it felt as if it was overflowing with gear.There was nobody behind the counter, but a slightly dented bell sat next to the register. Kyoka eyed it speculatively before tapping it once.A loud thud, followed by a muffled swear word followed immediately and suddenly a yellow-haired man with a curiously jagged fringe popped up from behind like a jack-in-the-box, rubbing his forehead.“Ah, yes, sorry, hello?” he babbled and she bit back the urge to chuckle at what very well could be a mild concussion.“Dude, you alright?” she asked and his eyes focused upon her, before they widened.“Wait, holy shit,” he exclaimed. “You’re Kyoka Jiro!”This was not an uncommon phrase to hear, and after a decade in this business, she had gotten fairly used to it by now. “That’s my name, don’t wear it out,” she quipped.The cashier continued to gape ever so slightly like a fish, but to his credit, picked his jaw up faster than most people did when confronted with a Grammy-winning rockstar. Idly, Kyoka flashed her eyes to the slightly crumpled nametag on his black polo shirt: Denki.“Holy shit,” he repeated, and then seemed to realise she would not have walked into a small music shop without a reason. “Um, sorry, I bet you get that all the time.”“You’d be right,” she dryly responds, and he cringes ever so slightly. There’s a pink tinge creeping up the side of his neck, a slowly percolating shade that’s almost adorable with his embarrassment.Almost.“Right, yeah, of course, sorry,” he babbles again, and then straightens himself up. Kyoka belatedly realises he is tall – she isn’t exactly statuesque herself, but this guy must be clearing six foot without any problems – and finds herself unexpectedly craning her neck ever so slightly.“Erm, how can I help you today?” he asks, and she refocuses.“Do you have any plectrums?” she asks. “Preferably Death Arms in brand.”He blinks, and then drops below the counter. A moment later, he springs up once again and drops a fairly dusty leather box, like the kind you might keep your sewing kit secured inside, onto the woodgrain in front of her.“Take your pick,” he says. “How many are you wanting?”Kyoka blinks. That was faster than she had expected. “Probably seven or eight?”He cracks his neck, and moves to the register. “No problem, I’ll get that rung up for you. Just take what you want from there.”She blinks again and refocuses on the box. There must be a good two-hundred plectrums haphazardly arranged in front of her. She had expected just to be able to buy a six-pack in pre-packaged form.There’s silence as she trawls her fingers, ghost-like, across the plastic nubs in front of her, only punctured by the quiet whirr of an overhead fan. It’s stuffy in here, not that she had originally noticed given the humidity outdoors, and the neckline of her t-shirt is sticking to her skin.“Band or solo?”The question catches her off-guard, and she looks at the cashier again. He’s focused on the till, but casts a fleeting glance towards her before returning his gaze to the screen in front of him.“Erm, band,” she says. The tour they’re on is a run of warm-up shows, before they hit arenas again over the new year. They’d only announced them a week ago at short notice, but even then, she’s surprised that this guy doesn’t know that, given he works in a music shop practically on the venue’s doorstep.“Ah, that’s a shame,” he says, without looking up. “Your solo stuff rocks.”There’s a beat before the cashier – Denki – seems to realise he has committed a social faux-pas, and suddenly he’s babbling a hundred apologies at a mile a minute towards her.Except, instead of the usual sense of irritation that arises when somebody criticises her band’s work, there’s a peculiarly warm tendril curled near the base of Kyoka’s spine. Her one and only solo record, put out five years ago, had been a flop, and an almighty one at that. She’d loved the material, but apparently nobody else was in the market for a hard rock frontwoman to try her luck at indie piano songs.“You actually listened to that?” she hears herself say, cutting off his latest word-vomit of contrition, and he blinks.“Um, yeah,” he says, and the tips of his ears are tinged a curiously attractive shade of salmon pink. “I, erm, really liked it. It’s the only album I have on cassette, it’s that good.”Kyoka blinks, and feels her own blush slowly creeping up from somewhere around her breast. She keeps her expression as neutral as she can.“Huh,” is all she says. A glint of something catches her eye and she turns away from the cashier, towards the stacks and stacks of vinyl that line the rooms.“Ah, um, is there anything you’re looking for?” he asks from over her shoulder, his voice still a little hesitant.She needs no help finding what she’s after, and she isn’t too surprised when she finds what she’s looking for. A monochrome snapshot of her face, half-cloaked in her hair, peers back up at her from the sleeve she has in her hands.Kyoka pivots to the cashier once more and holds it up. “How much for this?”He blinks. “You want to buy your own record?” he queries, obvious befuddlement in his tone.She shrugs. “Humour me, mister…”He catches her drift as she trails off. “Oh, erm, Kaminari. Denki Kaminari. And, I guess, three-thousand yen?”“I’ll take it,” she says. “Add eight plectrums to that too.”He does so, polite confusion still lingering on his expression. As he rings up the order, the sound of a telephone somewhere through the door behind him trills, and he gives a pained expression.“Ah, um, can you wait a –”She nods, rooting around in her back pocket for her wallet and the small marker pen she carries around when she needs to make alterations to the setlist on the fly. “Yeah, no worries dude.”He shoots her a grateful expression and vanishes behind another stack of records and some haphazardly arranged band tees. The phone rings twice more before she hears him pick it up and the murmured voices of a one-sided conversation.She finally finds what she is looking for, and drops five-thousand yen in notes on the counter, weighing it down with a coffee mug sporting the cover of The Dark Side of the Moon. With her free hand, she brings the marker up to her mouth and pulls the lid off with her teeth.The shoot for the cover had been one of the more stranger days of her career. It had been just her, the photographer and Momo, doubling as her stylist. There had been a freedom to the process that let her normally constrained inhibitions lean into the vulnerability more than she liked to do otherwise.The back cover was her sprawled out in a dress – high-neck, the colour of blistered bell peppers and paired with almost gothic eyeliner – in a bath filled to the brim. There was something strikingly sensual about it, so at odds with the persona she worked to project both professionally and personally.It had been liberating.Across the bottom-right corner, she scrawls:
To Denki,

Thanks for the memories.

From, Kyoka xx
She leaves it atop the counter, takes her plectrums and moves as silently as she can out of the shop front. Later on that night, she’ll catch a flash of yellow beaming up at her from the back of the dive bar, illuminated for a moment as the spotlight scans the room.“Hey, Momo,” she says, over the holler and din. “Fancy letting me on the keys for a while? I feel something a little different.”<<EOFANFIC>>

completion: All of A class had been hit with some wolf mutation quirk, there were some like Tokoyami and Tsu that hadn't been affected because of their already animal-related quirks but everyone else was struggling, and struggling badly. Except for Katsuki, he was treating it as just yet another school day, however, the ears and tail seemed to be more of a nuisance than he would rather deal with. The heroes were trying to find the villain who had cursed the students with this but there were no records of this kind of quirk anywhere and valentine's day was coming up, now as everyone had wolf-like tendencies nobody was going to bother with chocolate.Though it seemed like no one was going to bother with anything as no one was going to leave their room, for a perfectly good reason... Mating season had started and no one besides Mineta was stupid enough to try and bother anyone. I also happen to be stupid. Katsuki didn't have any problem with it before so maybe he would have some tips on how to combat the urges. I quietly knocked on the door, knowing everyone would be able to hear it anyway as everyone's hearing was now heightened. "Go the fuck away" Katsuki huffed from the other side of the door "Come on, don't be a prick" I whined and I could almost feel his eyes glaring at me through the door."I'll be whatever the fuck I want to" Katsuki said but the door opened anyway, he always made an angered face at seeing me but a disgusted one was definitely new "Well then, guess you like being a wolf then" I said with a laugh as I walked into his room "Shut it and just tell me why you're here" he said with a glare as he shut his door "You're good at this, how have you managed" I said with a slight pout, trying to ignore the fire inside me that burned brighter each time of looked at him. "You think I'm managing? I locked myself away just like the rest of you idiots" Katsuki said, crossing his arms and looking past me as his dresser, obviously trying to make it look like he was actually looking at me while also avoiding it at all costs."That makes me feel better" I said as I found myself slowly inching toward him. He lets out a sigh, asking, "Where is it?""Under the couch," The explosive all but whispers. Izuku causally lifts the couch and holds it for a second before reaching a hand under and scooping something off of the floor. Though, he assumed that his boss, Kai Chisaki, more often referred to as Overhaul, was doing the same as he was and was just starting the day.Kai was, in fact, just starting his day. He had basically followed the same routine as Hari had; wake up, shower, wash face, brush teeth. After doing that he got dressed in his usual attire, a black dress shirt and matching pants and his pale gray tie. As well as the bomber jacket with a purple fur collar. He put on his gloves and a surgical mask. Though the surgical mask soon was covered by his red and gold plague mask. He put on his shoes before double checking that he wasn’t forgetting anything and leaving his own room.As Hari walked, he checked his phone, while he didn’t think there were any meetings or any other important events to be at that day, it never hurt to check. Suddenly, he stopped walking, hearing footsteps somewhere in the same hallway. He looked around, but assumed it was someone from the eight bullets. Either way, he put his guard up, or at least he did to the best of his ability considering that he was still a bit tired.
When he did finally see who it was, he was relieved to see that it was just Kai. He waited in place, not wanting to walk in front of his boss. “Overhaul” he said. He never sounded nearly as cold saying his name compared to everyone else’s names. Kai looked at Hari, not seeming to have noticed him until he had heard his name. “Good morning” Hari then said. Kai gave a nod in acknowledgement “Morning, Chrono” he said in reply. Hari let Kai walk ahead of him so he was soon walking behind him. “Are we doing anything special today?” he asked, knowing that it was probably just working with Eri. “There are no meetings today” Kai said “So the only thing there is really planned for today would be continuing to work on the quirk-destroying drug” he then said. As the two walked, Kai found himself occasionally glancing over at Hari. Though Hari had just given a nod in response to Kai, he had expected that answer.By now they were getting closer to a common room where the Eight Bullets already seemed to be arriving “I think we are getting close to finishing another one today” Hari said, to which Kai now gave a nod “Yes, I think so too.” Not only could they see and hear the morning back and forth between the Eight Bullets, but Hari was already able to smell Sakaki’s drinking habits. This early? Sometimes it was hard to believe that those guys were some of the most powerful in the yakuza. Kai frowned a bit, seemingly noticing the smell of whatever Sakaki seemed to be drinking. Though the frown wasn’t visible through his mask.Hari walked over to the others, glancing around a little bit. While Kai didn’t really go over to the others. But both men seemed to have their guard up. Though they still needed to take care of Eri, who was most likely awake by now, as there was someone assigned to her that should be taking care of her at the moment. Eventually, Hari retreated back to Kai, standing a couple inches behind him. After some time, everyone had arrived, though Nemoto was the last to arrive. When Nemoto had arrived, Irinaka was quick to scold him. When Kai took notice of Hari returning to his side, his attention was on him but only briefly.Nemoto simply sighed and apologized. He explained that his alarm had failed to go off. Hari then spoke up, picking up the conversation “Actually, now that I think about it, mine didn’t either” he said “My internal clock got me here” he said. Kai remained quiet, not seeming to have anything to add to the current conversation so for the time being, the dark haired male just listened to the others. It was a little odd that only Hari and Nemoto’s alarms failed them. Setsuno had jokingly suggested that maybe someone had gone into their rooms and turned them off. “It was probably you” Hari said, but it was most likely just caused by bad luck.Kai looked away from the group but continued to listen as he glanced at his phone to check the time. By now it was only about 8:30. Hari rolled his shoulders a little bit, occasionally stealing glances at Kai while hoping that the other didn’t feel his gaze on him. Luckily, Kai didn’t seem to notice. Though Kai did wonder what time they should probably go to work on the quirk-destroying drug.Hari let out a deep breath as he readjusted his hood to rest more comfortably against his sensitive hair. But both Kai and Hari looked towards the door upon hearing a quiet knock on the door. The one who had knocked was one of the members who had been taking care of Eri. The member stood in the doorway, waiting for the okay for him to come in and speak. “Come in” was all Kai said. The man bowed in respect, smiling a little bit underneath his surgical mask. He went over to Kai and Hari before he spoke “She’s in her room ready for the day” He said, not wanting to keep them waiting any longer. Kai gave a nod in response “Alright” he said “Thank you” he added. He was glad that they’d be able to start on the work for the day soon.Hari had recognized the male, he had been doing the job of being Eri’s caretaker for the past couple of weeks. He glanced at Kai before back at the gang member. This time, Kai noticed that Hari had glanced at him, but didn’t say anything about it. Instead, he dismissed Eri’s current caretaker. When Hari had seen Kai look back at him, he felt his heart skip a beat as he quickly looked away. He turned his attention to the caretaker as he said his goodbyes and left.After a few moments, Kai looked at Hari again “Should we go get started with today’s work?” he asked. Hearing his boss speaking to him, Hari’s attention shifted back to Kai. He gave a nod. He liked it when the other asked, even if he knew by now that Hari wouldn’t say no. “We should” he said “And we have all day to get it done” he commented but waited for Kai to be the one to lead them out of the room. Kai nodded a little bit before he began to leave the room, checking to make sure Hari was following even though the action was unnecessary as Hari soon began to follow. Though Hari had been a little confused by Kai looking back towards him.Kai had stopped looking back when he had actually seen Hari following him. Once he was facing forwards again, he began to actually walk towards Eri’s room so they could go get her. It didn’t take too long for the pair to get to Eri’s room, but Kai had stopped outside of the door, looking towards Hari, who already understood what the other wanted him to do. Carefully, Hari opened the door to meet the small child who had been fed and bathed, her toys completely untouched. When it came to Eri, Hari didn’t really have any strong opinions about her, nor did he really care. Not anymore at least. The male picked her up without any issue, soon meeting Kai back outside of the room since Kai had completely refused to go inside the room and had instead been waiting for Hari to return with Eri.Once Kai acknowledged that Hari had Eri, he began walking towards another room. He hadn’t even looked directly at Eri. Hari followed Kai, though he glanced down at Eri. Her damp hair was brushing against his white coat. At least they know that she was clean. “Did you sleep well, Overhaul?” Hari asked suddenly, not being fond of the silence between them. Kai was quiet for a few moments before replying to Hari “Yes, I did” he said “What about you, Chrono?” he asked. Hari had patiently waited for a response from Kai “I’m glad to hear that” he hummed before adding “Oh, I slept okay” Hari saw Kai nod a little bit before speaking again “That’s good” he saidThey soon got to the room that they were heading to. Hari liked the little interactions they had with one another, he couldn’t help but wonder if Kai felt the same. Going into the dimly lit room, Hari set the young girl down and began to undo the bandages on her arms. Kai watched Hari a little bit but soon looked away, not wanting to be caught staring. But he patiently waited for Hari to remove Eri’s bandages. After some time, Hari got the bandages completely off. He tended to take his time with taking them off to avoid freaking her out and causing her to try and run since it would just be her making things difficult. Hari strapped her in before taking a few steps back. Taking notice of this, Kai looked at Hari “Should we get started?” Hari nodded “We should” he said, agreeing.Hari grabbed the things that they would need, though he briefly glanced at Eri, who shook her head. But the girl hadn’t said anything. When was the last time she had even said something? Kai had seen the movement of Eri shaking her head, and he had finally looked at her, but it was only for a brief moment before his gaze shifted away again “Alright” he said to Hari.
<<EOFANFIC>>

completion:
Small whispers of assurance, light embraces, and delicate touches. Notes written in green and purple ink pens. The soft teasing pokes and ruffles of hair. Their lives seemed to revolve around each other. One was bitter - spiteful at the world. One was gentle - he held on to the other as if he would break with just a touch. Both condemned and lost in the cruel world. Shinsou Hitoshi wasn't someone who fell in love. But when he did, it was slow, syrupy and gentle. It started with bright conversations with the other. The soft mumblings that lured him to sleep, The soft dimples that turned his way (ever so different from the scornful and fearful looks that were meant to be shot his way), the soft scratches of a pencil on paper as they discussed anything that came to mind. Midoriya Izuku fell in love easily. To each person he met, he easily parted with a fragment of his heart and his love to gently place it in their hands, showcasing the never-ending adoration within his eyes. He loved and loved.  But not many appreciated the love. They broke the fragments given to them and instead tore into his skin, seeping words of poison and hate into his veins. Yet, despite everything, he continued to love. And for the first time, he found the return of his love in the soft scent of lavender, the gentle touches in his hair, the soft rumbling voice of the other, the way he rubbed his neck sheepishly (which he'd recently found himself copying), the way he liked to mimic interesting sounds.  He'd even caught Shinsou muttering to himself more than once. It'd sent them both into a fit of panicked splutters, each flushing an astonishing amount of red. They'd whisper about their plans for their future, their lives as heroes, and the giggles of agreement to get a cat once they'd settled. Their lives began to revolve around each other. The lingering touches set both on fire, a voracious hunger for the soft gentle touches the other offered them. Izuku adored to mess with shinsou's hair, softly brushing his hand through the purple locks, fingertips gently brushing the top of his scalp; in the background, Shinsou would hum. Each held pure adoration for the other. Their classmates snickered in the background at their obvious puppy love, happy they didn't have to deal with the hopeless pinning of the two ever since Shinsou joined the hero course. And then they'd been sent away. For work studies, Class 1A as a whole had gathered for an important mission; for what, nobody was informed. With little experience, the teachers decided that Shinsou would stay behind. For safety, they reasoned to him.  He thinks, if he'd ever had one regret, it was not begging to join the mission.


...


Shinsou stares at the white  white white  room, his eyes unnaturally blank. "Midoriya-kun’s shown no signs of waking up. You might want to prepare yourself for the worst." The doctor had simply stated and brushed past him to check on the other heroes. As if he hadn't shattered Shinsou's whole world. He knew he should've expected this. The world of heroes was cruel and devastating but that didn't mean that it pained him to feel his sun, his other half, ripped painfully away from him. He watched as the light of his life lay cast in bandages and IV’s slept on the white bedsheets, the only indication he had yet to pass was the slow beep of the machine indicating his heartbeat. His vision blurred. A single lone tear dripped onto the white  white grey  bedsheets. He fell asleep gripping the hand of the boy he loved. Of the boy that muttered and blushed. That ruffled his purple hair and whispered sweet nothings. That understood his pain.


...


When he woke, he was alone. His head was cushioned with a pillow, the last remains of the scent of minty dew surrounding his being. He startled, straightening upwards to look at the now empty white bed. A single folded ripped note lay beside him embroidered with the messy handwriting of his lover. He immediately flipped it open with desperation, reading, reading and reading. The letter crinkled and his hands shook. Splatters of grey soaked and blurred the ink. He left the room to desperately latch on to his mentor's husband and pleaded. Hizashi tried to console him. It didn't work. He could almost hear the desperate whispers of a hoarse voice that used to entwine pages of analysis and sweet nothings, pleading for him not to follow him, pleading his messages of love, pleading for him to stay safe. Shinsou wouldn't cry. He wouldn't. 
 (It didn't work) 
  (Shinsou didn't love easily. He didn't   couldn’t   let go easily either.) 


...


Dejectedly, he'd trailed along with class 1A's attempts to bring Midoriya back. 
 (He knew it wouldn't work. The Midoriya that never gave up his dream of being a hero wouldn't be swayed so easily. Physically or mentally. He knew that desire to protect would only grow stronger.) 
 So he'd aided in the background. It didn't work. 
 (Shinsou tried not to remember the sinking feeling in his stomach) 



...


He remembered the bright lights and blood that sprayed across the battlefield. The way that gentle voice of his lover his world turned pained and desperate. It screamed instead of whispered. It cried instead of giggling. It--  He was coughing desperately, blood seeping out his parted lips as he panted for air. "...Izuku?" Shigaraki had fallen unconscious as heroes rushed to subdue him. But Izuku had crashed to the ground in front of him. Shinsou's voice cracked and his eyes wobbled as he stared at the blood that stained his once vibrant green hero suit. The last remains of the yellow of the deceased hero Gran Torino, now blackened with dirt and blood. The people began to celebrate the fall of the symbol of fear. Yet Shinsou's world dulled and painful ringing surrounded him. He fell to his knees, scrambling to support his lover’s head and gently brush away the lingering blood. "Hey... Izuku." The hero  (boy, the little boy)  in front of him coughed and choked on his own blood, and slowly began to form words. "Hito... Hitoshi." shinsou's world dulled further, colour draining from the broken landscape in front of him. he could only see the vibrant forest green eyes of his lover and the violently red blood that drained the colour from him. black and white swarmed every other feature. He gently moved forward to brush his lips against his temple. "...Can't you stay a little longer?" “I want... to.  I really..." Midoriya hiccuped and small droplets of tears streamed down his face. "Shhh...." Shinsou whispered, but his own tears had begun to flow as well. "I wanted to.... stay with you... more. I wanted to become.... heroes together. I wanted to... “ Shinsou choked down the lump in his throat. "We will." "We will...?" "Someday. someday we will." "Oh... okay." Midoriya sniffled and a small smile slid on his face. "Pinky promise...?" Shinsou sniffled. "Yeah. Pinky promise."  Shinsou reached for his sunshine's (cold cold   cold   ) hand and softly intertwined their loosely dangling pinkies. "....Hey, Toshi." "Yeah, Izu...?" "...I’m sorry." "Don't be." Midoriya sniffled, the last of his tears clearing. "Hey, Izuku." Shinsou gently caressed the side of his lover’s face. "Fly free alright? You belong... you belong in the stars." "...Okay." Shinsou pressed his forehead against the other. "Toshi." "Yes, Izuku?" "....I love you." Shinsou let out a pained sob. "I love you too, Izu." Izuku shakily lifted his hand up to shinsou's purple hair, gently brushing the ends of his hair and revelling in the familiar scent of lavender, as fragile as always. And so Shinsou hums. He hums a forgotten broken tune from his lonely childhood. Slowly, he feels Midoriya relax into him, sweet and gentle, lingering with minty dew. When he finally opens his eyes, it is to silence. Heartbreakingly cold silence. Shinsou Hitoshi never liked silence. 
 (neither did Midoriya Izuku) 
 "Sweet dreams... my dove." He brushes his lips against cold and bloodied ones; a final parting gift for his lover to take to the stars before sweeping his hand downwards, gently closing his eyes. “Goodnight, my world.”<<EOFANFIC>>

prompt: write a story about Haikyuu!!,  Teen And Up Audiences No Archive Warnings Apply Gen 僕のヒーローアカデミア | Boku no Hero Academia | My Hero Academia (Anime & Manga) Midoriya Izuku Yamada Hizashi | Present Mic Middle School Student Midoriya Izuku Neglectful Midoriya Inko Child Neglect Child Abandonment Midoriya Inko's Bad Parenting Quirkless Midoriya Izuku Quirkless Discrimination (My Hero Academia) Quirkless People with Extra Toe Joints Wear Custom Sneakers | Red Shoe Theory (My Hero Academia) Bully Bakugou Katsuki Bullying Starvation food insecurity dumpster diving Hurt No Comfort
completion: Izuku knows he needs to eat. He knows the trembling in his hands is a warning of bad things to come, a sign that his body needs fuel ever so desperately — he wants to eat, too. He’s always so hungry these days; all his dreams are of food, of katsudon with extra pork cutlet and dripping with sauce, of beautiful strawberry cakes with cream that oozes out the sides when he cuts into it with his fork, of simple bowls of white rice, ever so filling and reliable. He dreams of bowls of tonkatsu ramen, warm and rich with that tasty oozing egg, of the shrimp onigiri and egg salad sandwiches he used to get after school before his budget became so tight and he had to learn to rely solely on what he could cook out of what was on sale at the grocery stores.Despite this, he no longer feels hunger pangs — he knows it’s not a good thing, that it means he’s gone too long without eating. He does his best to keep it at bay with water, but his body knows. Water is no replacement at all, not really.He opens his banking app and looks at his budget as though he doesn’t know already that he only has sixteen yen left budgeted for his weekly food and it’s Thursday. His mother acts like she’s been so generous to send him some money and keep paying the rent and utilities, but she doesn’t send him enough money to pay for all his needs.No matter how much he scrimps and saves, he can’t afford to pay for internet, his phone and food, even having put himself on one of those minute card plans with minimal minutes — after all, no one wants to talk to him. Really, he’d disconnect it if the school didn’t require a number to have, and just worry about the internet and food. Without the phone he could have another 1200ish yen a week for food if he split it equally, and that’d be a whole bag of rice, which would feed him easily, plus vegetables. Even maybe a small pack of sausages or tofu if he wanted to splurge and cut back on the vegetables. He loved to dream about what he could do with that.But that, like his old dreams about his mother, were only fantasies.He couldn’t let his phone go, no matter how much he might like to, no matter how much it would be better for him. He needed the stupid phone number, so his school would be happy that they could pretend to care and leave a message if he was hurt enough to go to the hospital — the only thing they’d ever waste effort calling his mother for; they certainly couldn’t care if he got hurt otherwise, and if they called every time they decided to blame him for something and give him detention or some other punishment, they’d be constantly calling, and he was hardly worth the effort.In any case, the phone stayed, and Izuku stayed hungry and tired all the time, missing meals and cutting back on things he shouldn’t — he ate a lot of rice and whatever vegetable was on sale and sometimes tofu, not much of a meal, really. Usually, though it was pitiful at best and he never got breakfast and the servings were always too small to fill his belly, it was at least enough to make it through the week.He just ignored the way he was always, always a bit hungry — after all, it could have been worse; right now it was worse.But this week, his uniform had been burnt too badly to be patched up, and the replacement money had to come from somewhere, and it came from his food budget for the month. For all four weeks. This is what he had to look forward to for the rest of the month. He’d already cut things like laundry detergent and shampoo and soap out of the budget; he didn’t have enough money to get enough food for half the week even with that, and those were essentials he knew he’d be miserable without very quickly, but what else could he do?He knew he was going to be forced to resort to desperate measures.None of the food banks and soup kitchens in walking distances would serve him once they saw Quirkless on his ID. He didn’t have train money to reach the ones that would service him. His options were shoplifting, which he couldn’t resort to — he was going to be a hero, despite all the obstacles in his path, because otherwise, what was all this for? What had he suffered through everything for? The idea of that was unbearable. No, he was going to be a hero, and so theft was simply not a choice he could entertain — or digging through the trash.It was a humiliating thought.But his hunger is enough to override the humiliation, and he drags himself out of bed, ignoring the way he sways when he first stands and thinks of places that would be good to search as he stumbles for the door — the konbini, maybe? It’s close by, and throws out food every few hours. There’s a bakery close by too… He doesn’t want to go far. He doesn’t think he can.He pulls on a dark colored hoodie and pants, and wishes he could wear dark shoes too, but his meager savings hadn’t even been enough to pay for a quarter of his uniform, obviously, let alone custom shoes — custom shoes for the Quirkless have to be ordered from United States and cost a minimum of $500 USD; Izuku knows they’re just a pipe dream for him at best with the way he goes through uniforms. He finds a dark shopping bag and shoves it in his pocket. He just wants to pack up as much as he can and get it home. Eating outside in trash cans seems like a good way to get caught, however hungry he is, however tempting that hunger makes it.He feels himself sway with every step he takes, but desperation pushes him through. He knows he should take back-alleys and try to avoid attention but he doesn’t have the energy. He takes the most direct route to the konbini, hood pulled over greasy curls (He might have water, but does he have the energy to wash? When he does, does he have the money for soap?) to hide his distinctive hair.Behind the konbini, he’s looking for wrapped food, and there’s plenty to be found. He starts gathering up onigiri after onigiri, bento after bento, some dented cans. He can sort through it all at home, and see what’s okay. Maybe stop at a bench somewhere on the way home and find something he can eat on the way.There’s spots growing in his vision, so… maybe… definitely he… should? It was hard to think. Maybe just one onigiri wouldn’t be so bad. He forgot all about being quiet as he shoved a lid off another trash can, and it fell to the ground with a clatter.The world sways with every move, or maybe it’s just his body that sways. It hardly matters, does it? He bends over, digging through the trash to find something that won’t be bad. He’s not experienced at this; he doesn’t know what’s good or bad. Bending makes it all so much worse — he thinks he’d throw up if he had anything in his stomach to throw up, but of course, he hasn’t eaten in over twenty eight hours now, and even when he had last eaten (not that it mattered, it was long digested), it was only half a bowl of rice, for that was all that had been left in the cabinets.He decides it’s just easier to lean his full weight on the trash can, let it hold him up. He doesn’t admit he can’t hold himself up anymore. The smell isn’t pleasant, and it’s humiliating. He’s half buried in trash, half conscious, prepared to eat out of the trash he’s buried in. He feels so low. There’s not much that could make this worse.And then there’s the sound of footsteps at the end of the alleyway, and then it’s so much worse. He doesn’t want anyone to see his shame, and worse still, he’s not sure if this is a crime. What if he’s going to go to jail? He can’t run away right now — he can’t even do more than look up from the trash can.“Hello?” There’s a blond man with hair pulled halfway up, wearing a dark jacket and maybe track pants and a t-shirt? It’s hard to be certain from distance, especially with the way Izuku’s vision swims, with the spots that dance before his eyes. The blond man spots Izuku and starts to come over. “Hey, are you okay?”Izuku instinctively pulls away from the trash can, stepping a few steps back. He’s too unsteady on his too heavy feet, and topples over, falling right on to his side. He thinks about trying to get up. The very idea is overwhelming, exhausting, and more than that — he knows he can’t. He’s given everything just to get here, and now he’s done. And so he just lays there.“Hey, hey, stay with me,” the blond man runs right over, hands hovering over Izuku’s sprawled body.Izuku groans, raising his head to catch a hazy glimpse of vaguely familiar red and lime green eyes before the spots among his vision grow worse and it all goes dark and he knows no more.<<EOFANFIC>>

completion: Shouto should've taken the dinner offer earlier.He wanted to, but the range of textures and colors on the dining table made his stomach turn. After all, this was his first time eating someone else's home cooked food; it's not something he was accustomed to. A new environment with unfamiliar faces and unfamiliar cooking was far too overstimulating for Shouto, so he gracefully excused himself, stating he had eaten before arriving. Bakugo's mother seemed to understand and told him he was always welcome to dish out some leftovers if he changed his mind. If she was disappointed, it wasn't evident on her face. Instead, she smiled at him, soothing his nerves.Before he could thank her, Katsuki was already dragging him to his room. They spent the whole evening playing games and watching TV together, until Shouto noticed how late it was getting. Katsuki suggested that Shouto stay over since it was already so dark out. Shouto hesitated before quickly agreeing.And Shouto should've said something before Katsuki fell asleep, he really should have, but he didn't want to be selfish. So, when his stomach starts to hurt from desperate hunger, he apologizes in advance to the boy lying next to him. Shouto reaches his hand out and lightly taps the exposed muscular back in front of him. The figure shifts a bit, before settling again. Shouto sighs and makes another attempt."Katsuki?" He calls gently, so that he wouldn't accidentally wake up Bakugo's parents. He hears a quiet groan, followed by the sound of sheets moving, as the figure seems to turn and face him. The moonlight from the window hit Katsuki's face in a way that made his red eyes glow, and Shouto was so distracted by them, he didn't even notice Katsuki talking to him."You know," Katsuki says gruffly, sleepiness still evident in his voice. He reaches his hand up and flicks Shouto's forehead, eliciting a pout from the boy in front of him. "It's rude to ignore someone when they ask you a question.""Sorry," Shouto mumbles quietly. A moment passes where he finds himself staring at the details of Katsuki's face. He clears his throat before looking away, suddenly nervous under the gaze of bright red eyes."I'm hungry," Shouto mumbles. There is a beat of silence that follows, making Shouto glance back at Katsuki. The blond's eyes are closed again and Shouto huffs in frustration. He reaches his hand out to poke Katsuki's nose gently. "Katsuki?""If you're hungry, there's leftovers in the fridge. Just go out there and warm it up; my mom won't care."Shouto frowns as he pulls his hand back from Katsuki's face. He turns in bed, making his body face the empty wall instead of the boy next to him. A sigh falls past his lips and he begins to wring his hands anxiously. His stomach nips lightly at him, reminding him that he cannot sleep well on an empty stomach. Ignoring the ache of his abdomen, Shouto closes his eyes in hopes to fall asleep, so that he could wake up and head home quickly for breakfast. Despite his attempts, the emptiness at the pit of his stomach nags at him, forcing his eyes open again. He shifts in bed again to face Katsuki, hoping his restlessness would alert the other boy. Almost as if he was cued, Katsuki sighs heavily and opens his eyes again."I thought you were hungry?" He questions."Yes, but, I was wondering…" Shouto starts, but pauses again. He bites his lip, beginning to think over his request. Katsuki must've noticed his apprehension because Shouto feels a tap on his nose, causing him to focus on the blond."You're doing that thing again," Katsuki gently scolds. He tucks hair behind Shouto's ear, and the boy looks as if he has forgotten how to breathe properly. "Just tell me what it is. What do you want?""Could you make me some cold soba? Please?" He asks quietly. It gets very quiet and Shouto closes his eyes, suddenly feeling very small. He curls his legs closer to his chest as if to protect himself from Katsuki's possible answer. The bed creaks and Shouto hesitantly opens his eyes, watching as the blond moves to the bedroom door."Are you coming or not?" Katsuki asks, holding his hand out for Shouto to take. Shouto lets out a small squeak-like noise as he scrambles to take the boy's hand and follow him out to the kitchen. He's sure to walk with light feet in an effort to be courteous towards the sleeping adults in the house, unlike Katsuki who walked on the kitchen tiles with heavy feet. Shouto finds himself pushing his body to sit up on the countertop and watching the blond move from cabinet to cabinet with various ingredients in his arms."Got me up at two in the fucking morning for some cold noodles," Katsuki grumbles as he heats up the pot."Sorry," Shouto says sheepishly, looking away from the blond. He'd forgotten exactly how late it actually is."What for? I'm your boyfriend, aren't I?" Katsuki says, dismissing any anxious thoughts creeping up in Shouto's mind. Instead, he just smiles at his legs, letting his feet swing gently in front of him. He patiently waits for Katsuki to finish cooking and set the dish onto the small, round dining table in the corner of the kitchen. Shouto reaches his arms out to the blond, who rolls his eyes and moves to pick the other off the counter."Spoiled brat," Katsuki whispers. Shouto feels as Katsuki places him down in a chair at the table and offers a small smile when the blond takes the seat next to him. Shouto leans over to place a couple kisses on Katsuki's cheek and a peck on the lips to show his gratitude. The blond hums in acknowledgement as he rests his head on his arm, and just as Shouto begins to eat, he sees as his boyfriend's eyes flutter shut.Shouto doesn't take long to finish eating and cleaning up the used dishes. He ruffles Katsuki's hair, effectively waking up the light sleeper who tiredly groans. Shouto takes his hand and pulls him along back to the bedroom, where he situates both of them under the covers. He sighs in content, his own arm covering Katsuki's, which lies firmly around his waist."Shou?" Katsuki says lowly, his breath tickling Shouto's ear."Yeah?""This is a one time thing, yeah?"And Shouto lets out a quiet breath, a smile ghosting over his lips. He knows that Katsuki knows this will not be the last time. But, he agrees anyway."Yeah, promise."<<EOFANFIC>>
