completion:
Chapter Text
It had all started, innocently enough, with Dark Shadow acting just a bit unusual. At least as unusual as a sentient shadow quirk could act. Materializing at random times, just to look around in confusion, almost as if they were looking for something. And yet, whenever Tokoyami would ask his shadowy friend what was wrong, they would just shake their head and disappear again. Not thinking much of this the hero in training had believed that to be the end of the others' strange behavior. But soon the sentient quirk started to call out, seemingly to nothing, while they were searching for whatever it was that had grabbed their attention.It was almost heartbreaking to see his quirk rushing around, searching for something that no one seemed to understand. Calling out to nothingness and deflating whenever they were left without a response. And it hurt Tokoyami that he couldn't help his quirk, but if Dark Shadow won't tell him what was wrong, there was just nothing he could do.At first it wasn't an issue, seeing as it wasn't really interfering with the young hero's day so he didn't try to stop the other. That is, at least, Until it became an issue. It happened during an English exam, as Dark Shadow suddenly materialized frantically, looking around as if searching for something, or someone, and calling out once again "hello? Where are you? Do you need help?" It was concerning seeing Dark Shadow so out of it, but what truly alarmed him was what happened next. Because one seconde his quirk was just looking around, and the next they were trying to leave through the window, absentmindedly shoving away whoever got in their way.The poor boy didn't even have time to react before his quirk was outside, seemingly aiming for one of the park benches around the school. It took Tokoyami far more energy than usual to dematerialize Dark Shadow, despite the other being in their light form. Sadly though the damage was already done, everyone was looking at him. The bird boy tensley tried to make himself as small as possible. The last thing he wanted was for people at UA to think of him as dangerous, to think that he couldn't control his quirk. He already had trouble making friends because of his appearance, and people in the past thinking of Dark Shadow as dangerous. He didn't want to lose the friends he made at UA.The others must have sensed his discomfort, seeing as they all turned back to their Tests. And while they were sneaking him concerned glances every now and then, no one commented on the strange incident. Present Mic looked at him in worrie, and his classmates tried not to be oblivious about their looks. All the while Dark Shadow was restlessly coiling in their resting place, demanding to be set free.As if that wasn't already bad enough, it just kept happening, over, and over, and over again. Sometimes during classes, sometimes during lunch, and sometimes even at night. Keeping Dark Shadow under control became increasingly more difficult, and the whole class began to notice the quirk's strange behavior. It shouldn't have been a problem, he and Dark Shadow rarely had trouble talking with each other, especially since they had a telepathic connection. And if something was wrong, the other would usually always tell him. But now, whenever Tokoyami asked his shadowy friend what the problem was, they would either just disappear, or spout completely incoherent nonsense about someone needing their help.Eventually it happend at the possibly worst possible time. Though to be honest it was bound to happen at some point. Homeroom. He was working on whatever assignments Aizawa Sensei had given them, he was too exhausted from keeping his quirk under control to really care what it was, when it happened again. Only this time Dark Shadow was visibly agitated, no, they were furious. This time they were not even looking around, or asking questions, just going straight for the Windows. Shoving Mineta out of the way, probably with more force than necessary, to be able to leave the class once again through the window. And Tokoyami could do nothing except to Stare in horror as he was far too tired to take control of his quirk, especially when they got this strong.Except, this time Dark Shadow didn't get very far, before they suddenly vanished in a cloud of black. Tokoyami felt the horofing feeling of his quirk being ripped away from him, paired with the sudden emptiness in his abdomen where his quirk would usually rest. Looking into his teacher's glowing red eyes, Tokoyami felt ashamed over the fact that he had such little control over Dark Shadow. The bird boy shrunk in on himself, with every step his teacher took towards him."Tokoyami, what is going on with you and Dark Shadow? This is not the first incident like this, according to the other teachers." The boy averted his eyes, he felt terrible for causing so much trouble lately "I don't know what's wrong, Dark Shadow keeps trying to get out, but they won't tell me why, not even through our telepathic link. I just don't know what to do anymore." As Tokoyami sunk down in defeat Aizawa looked deep in thought, a powerful quirk like Dark Shadow could be incredibly dangerous if out of control. But something told him that the shadow creature wasn't trying to cause trouble.So without hesitation the tired pro hero opened the window. Turning to his student, he said "well, then let us see what they want, if anything goes wrong i can just erase them and we can think of something else." Without another word Aizawa blinked, and just like that the restless, almost painful feeling of Dark Shadow coiling in his core was back. But this time he didn't try to keep the other down, instead allowing his quirk to come back out.This time the Shadow was even angrier than before, they didn't say anything instead they rushed towards the window once again, leaving without a second thought. Tokoyami could feel the eyes of his classmates boring into his soul before they began to race towards the remaining Windows, looking outside to see what Dark Shadow would do.The Shadow creature quickly made their way towards the same park benches they had tried to get to before. Shoji and Jirou, who were closest to the windows, were using their quirks to see and hear what Dark Shadow would do.Soon enough the sentient shadow seemed to arrive at the bench they were aiming for. Turning upside down to look underneath it the shadow seemed to have found what they were looking for, seeing as they stayed in said position. After a short while Shoji addressed the class " they are talking to someone or something." Tokoyami was just about to urge the other to tell him what his quirk was saying, when the other continued "they are asking what the something is doing here and if they need help" at this Aizawa perked up "is someone with them? Are they hurt, or lost?" "That's the thing, there is nothing there other than Dark Shadow, and if there was it is not making any sounds, at all" it was Hagakure who then spoke her confusion "what if they are just really quiet? or what if they have an invisibility quirk like me?" Jirou turned towards the floating uniform next to her answering the other girls question "they would still have a heartbeat we should be able to hear. But there is nothing there."Tokoyami felt sick, what if Dark Shadow was going insane? how could he even help his shadowy friend in such a case? Or worse, what if he was going insane and it was affecting his quirk? And while the class was animatedly talking among themselves about what they thought might be going on, Dark Shadow was still talking to the nothing under the bench, blissfully unaware of the chaos they had unleashed on the class.Soon the sentient shadow returned to the classroom, as they entered the lights flickered for just a moment, and the room grew ever so slightly colder. But since they were all busy talking, no one seemed to notice. Dark Shadow finally seemed content and happy, returning to Tokoyami's side with a smile, not once noticing Tokoyami distress, which they would normally pick up on almost instantly. The class was just about to start questioning the shadow, but Aizawa beat them to it "are you ok now?" Dark Shadow nooded, while never once losing their smile.Tokoyami absentmindedly thought how strange it was that his shadowy friend didn't just dematerialize now that they were satisfied with whatever had happened. And that it was quite weird that they were holding one of their claws away from them, as if they were holding something, but Tokoyami found once again that there was nothing there. He tried not to think about it too much.Aizawa gave the shadow creature a pat on the head before dismissing the incident completely, returning to teaching once again. But Tokoyami couldn't shake the feeling that this had only been the beginning. Though he tried not to linger on the thought, instead opting to ,for now, returned to his assignments. As he was working, he tryed hard to ignore the uncanny feeling of being watched.
<<EOFANFIC>>

prompt: write a story about Haikyuu!!,  Teen And Up Audiences No Archive Warnings Apply Gen 僕のヒーローアカデミア | Boku no Hero Academia | My Hero Academia (Anime & Manga) Midoriya Izuku & Yagi Toshinori | All Might Hero Public Safety Commission & Midoriya Izuku Midoriya Izuku Yagi Toshinori | All Might Hero Public Safety Commission (My Hero Academia) Discord: No Writing Academia Remix Event 2023 (My Hero Academia) Past Brainwashing Past Mind Control Sleeper Agents Blood and Violence Midoriya Izuku Needs A Hug Yagi Toshinori | All Might Needs a Hug Parental Yagi Toshinori | All Might Hero Public Safety Commission Employee Midoriya Izuku Hero Public Safety Commission's Bad Parenting (My Hero Academia) Hero Public Safety Commission Raises Midoriya Izuku Corrupt Hero Public Safety Commission (My Hero Academia) Conditioning Midoriya Izuku Has a Bad Time Midoriya Izuku Has PTSD Help this boy please
completion:
Given everything, Izuku felt like he should have been more prepared for this to happen eventually. After all, Aoyama had been there in class the first time the trigger words were said. Aoyama, who was working for the League of Villains. Aoyama who knew what the trigger words were.

Sure, he had made sound-dampening earplugs, coded specifically to the phrase a part of his costume with the help of Mei, but he never really thought he’d need to worry about it. It was a precaution at most. Nothing more.

“

Scientia Potestast Est

.” While he couldn’t hear the words echo across the battlefield, it didn’t make it any less heart wrenching to watch Yagi fall into that familiar pose that was ingrained into his very being from so many years of training when he was young.

The first time he was taken away by the commission for training in their program, he was five. Part of it, he would later admit to himself, was his fault. He didn’t scream hard enough, he didn’t try and tell enough people, he didn’t beg his family enough not to send him. But, it didn’t really matter in the end. They were taking him one way or another.

Five was too young, compared to everyone else, they were all at least ten, the few of them that were there, but that didn’t stop the Commission from taking him. A confirmed quirkless child had to start earlier than everyone else, after all. They had to be useful to the commission or they’d never be useful to anyone.

What use would a quirkless child ever be in a world where quirks were valued more than talent, hard work, or skill?

After his first day in that place, when he just sat down and got to know people, his memory was fuzzy at best. Pain was often a common placeholder for his actual memories. There was too much built up there, too much to dig into for him to delve into what really happened during those five years he was cooped up in their little jail. Enough about what really happened could be told from just looking at his body, though. Scar tissue littered his skin like junk on Dagobah Beach and the basic fighting skills stuck with him. The gun training in particular stuck with him, although that was a little (

big, his mind whispered traitorously

) part of his training that he was willing to ignore. No one ever had to know about that little fact.

The end of his training though, that was stronger. He could remember that time more, even if faintly. More of everything. Whispers about him. Whispers about taking him back later to become 

more 

or worse yet, keeping him there. Then, there were other little things too. He didn’t see the other kids anymore. (

Were there other kids anymore?

)

There was blood on his hands. 

There was always blood on his hands.

(

Was it their blood? Did he kill them?

)

He couldn’t remember.

That was perhaps the most terrifying part. The lack of memory.

He could’ve hurt people. Killed people. Or worse.

And he’d never know. Not while the memories were too hard to touch. Not while the white walls and the white floor and the tick-tick-tick of the eternal clock still lived in his head rent free. Not while the red covered still his hands in his mind. Not while the red seeped from under the doors and the corners of the walls.

Not while it kept coming back.

He wasn’t ever quite the same after he came out the first time. Sure, his mother greeted him back like nothing had happened and Kacchan was just as mean as ever but it meant nothing in the end. Things were different. He was different. More different than he was really willing to admit.

The second time though… The second time was so much worse.

When he briefly went vigilante, he was taken again by the Commission for a short time. He wasn’t really sure how long he was gone, all the days of being gone blended together, both in and out of the center.

The worst part might’ve been that his memories didn’t leave that time. He’d been useless, unable to use his quirk for the first time since he got it. Sure, they had said the trigger words and put him in semi-unconsciousness while doing it that time, but they were more clever that time, leaving him aware and knowing. They wanted him to know what he did that time. They wanted him to know the authorization codes, the lists of names, the hallways. The places. The faces.

At this rate the Commission wasn’t going to last much longer anyways, this was just their backup plan. 

He

 was their backup plan in case everything else went and someone had to take over.

Perhaps he wasn’t the best person for the job, but he was the only one left who’d gone through it that was still alive and fighting. He still wasn’t sure what had happened to all the other kids that went through it, but their names and faces had long slipped his memory into the abyss of unknowing, never for him to recover. The blood he still scrubbed out from under his nails in his dreams said enough from that.

It was easier to cover up after that second time. His friends had expected him to be traumatized after going vigilante for a few months anyways, they didn’t see anything different from what they already expected.

And that led him all the way back to this, seeing Yagi fall into that oh so familiar pose.

Yagi shouldn’t have even been on the battlefield in the first place. He should’ve been back with the healers at best, but yet here he was standing next to Izuku with that familiarly blank look.

“Orders not found. Awaiting orders,” he could hear Yagi say as he finished up with the guy he was fighting and made his way over to his mentor.

The others around him seemed to panic, thinking it was the effect of a quirk that had somehow made it through their defense unit. Those same words that held tight to his consciousness in his dreams, were whispered across the field, voice echoing as others mimicked him in confusion, “Voice not recognized. Handler not authorized. Awaiting handler.”

The protection unit around his mentor parted like the red sea as he made his way into the dead center, closing up behind him just as smoothly.

Oh so slowly, he took a deep breath and clicked his tongue to get Yagi’s attention, “Yagi? Dad? Do you recognize me?”

Yagi turned to him and his shoulders loosened ever so slightly, “Voice recognized. Designation Tango-Yoda-Two-Two-Six-Five. Handler clearance code required.”

Izuku took a careful breath, hesitant but firm, “Clearance code, Alpha-Three-O-Eight-Nineteen-Twelve.” 

He was at a loss on whether this was all his fault or he was grateful he went through it if only to save his mentor in this moment. But either way, he couldn’t leave him here.

He’d have to use what they gave him, no matter how much he hated it, just this once.

“Clearance code accepted. Handler authorized. No orders found. Awaiting Orders,” Yagi said, his voice as blank as ever.

“Order issued: exit ready mode,” Izuku rushed forward to hold his mentor for the moment he would collapse.

“Order accepted. Exiting ready mode. Reboot initiated. Expected downtime: one minute, twelve seconds.”

That minute was perhaps the longest of his life, just sitting in the middle of the protection unit with his mentor in his arms. He covered Yagi’s ears and picked him up bridal style as Yagi opened his eyes.

“Let’s go,” Izuku mouthed to him and took his mentor off of the battlefield, making sure to hold his hands on his ears all the while.

He was lucky no one asked questions at the end of the battle. They were, after all, still at a loss given everything that had happened over those days of constant fighting. At a loss at the failing state of the government and the wounds they had all sustained. In comparison, ten minutes seemed like nothing.

Yagi was concerned he knew, which is what led them into the private meeting room a few days later.

“About the program-,” Yagi had started before Izuku cut him off.

“It was when I went vigilante. They took me again, I’m not really sure for how long. But,” he hesitated, “I know they’re going to come for me again soon. I was the replacement in case everything went out the window after the battle.” Izuku gave a quiet sigh.

“You know you don’t have to.” Yagi offered. “I can protect you from them. You don’t have to do it.”

Izuku took a deep breath, sighing slightly, “I knew this would happen a long time ago, Dad. I resigned myself to this fate when they took me the second time. The Izuku that wanted to be the number one was killed a long time ago. For now, I’m just going to find peace in this. Maybe I can even help people.”

“Izuku… please. You don’t know what they’re capable of. It’s worse than you think-” Yagi tried to say.

“It’s been over forty years since you went through it, Dad. I’m sixteen. I spent five years, almost a third of my life, in that place. Don’t tell me that I don’t know what they’re capable of when they’ve already dictated my life for this long. At least I can make a difference here.”

“Izuku- please. I don’t want to lose you.”

“It’s not up to you. I made up my mind a long time ago already.”

It was better if it was him instead of anyone else. After all, he was strong enough to be their soldier and just traumatized enough to know he had to go along with it.

They could break him.

They could tear apart his very being and put him back together over and over again.

But he’d never let them get to his friends.

Now, perhaps the only thing left he was useful for was the commission’s warfare, both psychological and physical. It wasn’t like he could really be a hero anymore. Too much blood still seeped from the walls of his mind.

There were too many years of training, even as they tried to escape him, ingrained in him.

This was for the best.
<<EOFANFIC>>

completion: Katsuki blames it on a lot of things. Firstly, on the fact that Todoroki Shouto exists. That he exists loudly. With his dumb soba face and his stupid hair and his—god help us all—sweater paws. That’s—offensive. Katsuki is offended. Katsuki is also sleep deprived. Sleep deprived and pissed off and recently made aware of the existence of a group chat on Deku’s phone named bakutodo canon?? with precisely nineteen participants. Nineteen. He could recognize Aizawa-sensei’s phone number, for fuck’s sake.So. Maybe that’s why he does it.Maybe that’s why, in his mind, it’s a perfectly reasonable idea to flick class prince Todoroki Shouto right in the middle of the forehead, barely give him enough time to look up from his excessively sugary cereal, and then—God. And then lean over the breakfast table and bite his cheek. Like, full-on bite it. Not too hard, obviously, Katsuki is not some savage, but— Enough to, like, mark his territory.Because that’s how his sleep-addled mind rationalizes it. Katsuki is marking his territory.Todoroki blinks at him. Katsuki hasn’t even let go yet. It kind of pisses him off even more, honestly. That Todoroki is this easy to bite. He shouldn’t be easy. Not for anyone. Does he just. Go around letting random extras bite him? Hah? Does Katsuki need to force him into one of those seminars for appropriate workplace behavior before they’re even proper pro heroes? Do the extras come up with threadbare excuses to touch him when Katsuki’s not around? Does Todoroki need his honor Actively Protected? Are they surrounded by heathens?Eventually, mostly from the bubbling (and admittedly irrational) anger, Katsuki lets go.Wordlessly and with perfect calm, Todoroki goes to wipe his cheek. His cheek, which is still slightly shiny with Katsuki’s spit.Like an absolute idiot, Katsuki reaches forward to grab his wrist. To delay the—the fuckin’ inevitable erasure of himself from Todoroki’s life. From Todoroki. He can picture it without much effort. Graduation, maybe a half-hearted hug that Katsuki only lukewarmly protests. Going from meeting once a week with everyone there to meeting once a month to everyone branching out and taking on foreign work and only meeting at weddings and baby showers and, like, Deku’s All Might worship meetings, probably. No longer an excuse to have Todoroki around all the time. No more—no more this. No more biting him just because he’s close enough and doesn’t seem to mind it.“Don’t,” Katsuki says. Can’t even look at him. Like a coward. Which he doesn’t appreciate, but he is. He’s scared, when it comes to Todoroki Shouto. For obvious and varied reasons. Reasons like he doesn’t want me, reasons like he could have anyone, reasons like I’m going to break him, I’m not good enough for him. Reasons like I’ve already gotten too lucky, I don’t get to have another thing I don’t deserve. Valid reasons. Good reasons. Reasons he should fucking listen to.“It’s wet,” Todoroki says, like the only issue with Katsuki biting him is the mild discomfort that comes after the fact. Like the act itself is perfectly normal, maybe even—even expected. Like Katsuki gets to bite him. Earned the privilege, or some shit.Katsuki doesn’t have a right to, and yet— “What are you, a goddamn cat?” he hisses.“No,” Todoroki says evenly. “Actually, I was wondering… did you get hit with something? Is that why you bit me?”Hah? So the stupid pretty boy thinks Katsuki just goes around biting people now? That he got hit by some random extra’s quirk without anyone finding out and has consequently lost all self-control? And he’s just—what? Fucking chill with that?“Fuck you,” Katsuki hisses, arms crossed over his chest. “I’m—I’m fucking fine. No quirk. No nothing.”“But then why did you bite me?” Todoroki asks, all wide-eyed and disgustingly earnest. It’s bad for Katsuki’s heart. He’s weak. He’s not even twenty yet. Deku probably has a guide all about surviving Todoroki’s puppy eyes. Katsuki should demean himself enough and ask. No other option at this point.“Because.”“Because what?”“Because you’re fucking adorable,” Katsuki admits. Confesses. Fucking—yells it. Because it’s kind of a lot. Too big to just say normally. Too big in general. Everything is too big, around Todoroki. Too big and too warm and too much to do anything about.“I am?” Todoroki asks, like he doesn’t hear it three-point-five times per day on average. Or maybe like—like Katsuki saying it means something more. Something bigger. Or whatever. It’s just dumb hope. But then again—maybe all of humanity’s continued existence is just dumb hope. Dumb hope that tomorrow will be better, dumb hope that steady breathing is enough, dumb hope that maybe—just maybe—the class pretty boy likes you best.“Yeah,” Katsuki says quietly. “You are.”“Oh,” Todoroki says. “Thank you.”And then—The edge of his mouth curls up, and he’s back to his sugary cereal. Chewing all happy and hamster-cheeked. Because his mouth is fucking tiny. Because he, in general, despite having a few centimeters on Katsuki, is fucking tiny. Fuckin’—pocket-sized, really.“That’s it?” Katsuki asks. Violently against his own will. But he asks, still. Because it’s early and they’re alone and Katsuki can always blame it on something later. (Something besides a specific four-letter word.)“Was there supposed to be more?”This fucking idiot. “Yeah,” Katsuki yells. “Yeah, there was.”“Oh.” Too cute. Stupid pretty boy. “Like what? Do I—,” At this, he looks down all shy like some demure Disney princess. “Do I bite you too?”“No,” Katsuki says, even if he wouldn’t particularly mind Todoroki biting him or—or anything else. Holding his hand. Kissing him. The—the other stuff. Wedding vow stuff, too. Everything. “Not—not just because I did it. Not unless you, you know, actually want to.”Todoroki considers this like they have all the time in the world. Puts a hand on his chin like he’s already reached eighty and everything. “I think I want to kiss you,” he says eventually. “If that’s also okay.”Oh my God. Oh my God oh my God oh my God. Katsuki puts both hands over his face. Screams into them. Too much. Too fucking cute. Too early in the goddamn morning. “I hate you,” he says, and when he looks up Todoroki actually looks—Disappointed? Fuck. Shit. That’s not how this shit is supposed to go. It’s—it’s not supposed to go any particular way, actually. Because it’s not supposed to happen in the first place. Katsuki has comfortably planned his life around sabotaging all of Todoroki’s potential romantic pursuits before they bloom, and figuring out how to take his virginity as a platonic thing and, like, eventually moving in together for convenience and adopting two cats. There. Efficient and without unnecessary embarrassment.It’s looking a little necessary right now, though.With Todoroki all pouty and perfect and stupidly, stupidly kissable.“Hey,” Katsuki says. Soft. He doesn’t know how to do that, not really. But he tries. For Todoroki. Because Todoroki is important. “I like you, dumbass. A lot. Okay?”“The same way you like Midoriya?”Fuck no. God, did he have to bring another man into this? His childhood friend, too. Just to twist the knife, apparently. “No, you idiot,” Katsuki says, “the—the same way you like me. Hopefully. You know, unless I’m a fucking idiot.”Todoroki smiles at him. It’s fucking lethal. “You’re not an idiot, Katsuki,” he says. “Don’t be mean to yourself.”“I’ll be as mean as I fucking want,” Katsuki protests. “What’s the goddamn point if—if you’re not with me?”At this, Todoroki has the audacity to put his hand over Katsuki’s slightly trembling one. “I’ll always be with you,” he says, like that’s the easiest promise he’s ever had to make. “If you want me, I’ll be there.”Katsuki scoffs. “It’s not an if thing, moron.”Todoroki looks particularly pleased with this, despite the fact that his stupid cereal must be getting disgustingly soggy. “It’s not?”Katsuki shakes his head. “No,” he confirms. “It’s not. So—don’t go letting random extras bite you, okay?”“Can they kiss me?”What the— “Hell no.”“Hug me?”“If you want them to, I guess.”“Hold my hand?”“Only if I get to do it more often.”“Date me?”“No,” Katsuki says vehemently.Todoroki, once again, looks pleased. “So you should do it,” he says evenly. “You know, since everyone else apparently can’t.”Katsuki blinks. Did he just— “You wanna date me, pretty boy?”Todoroki shrugs, soggy cereal apparently forgotten. “You’ve made it clear you’re my only choice.”“Damn right,” says the middle school bit of Katsuki, the smug leftovers glad for another trophy. Except—no. That’s not how this goes. Actually— He coughs. “You want it too. Right, halfie?”“You?” Todoroki asks, like he doesn’t fucking know. But maybe—maybe he doesn’t. Maybe Katsuki isn’t the only one a little too scared.Shakily, Katsuki nods. “Yeah,” he says, “me. If that doesn’t suck for you.”“It doesn’t suck,” Todoroki confirms. “Not at all.”And—It’s a start. A good one. (Katsuki wants to bite him again.)<<EOFANFIC>>

completion:
The first one to discover that Class 1-A has had merch made of them is, unsurprisingly, Midoriya.Shouto is made aware of this fact when Uraraka’s piercing squeal of delight lances into his brain.“IT’S ME!” Her forearms flap wildly, hands balled into tight fists as she gushes over the tiny charm Midoriya pulled out of his shopping bag. “Tsuyu-chan, look! It’s me!”“Wait, actually?” Kaminari follows Asui to the door. Shouto trails behind, along with several other people with presumably similar goals of seeing What Exactly Is Up.“It’s almost as cute as the real thing,” Asui ribbits, her hands wrapping gently around the charm. Uraraka blushes.“They had charms of all of us!” Midoriya explains, excitement shining in his eyes. “Us and 1-B—the whole shelf was labeled ‘UA’s rising stars’! I literally almost screamed when I saw—look, they even had Shinsou-kun!”“DIBS!” Ashido and Kaminari scream together, both grabbing for the tiny purple object Midoriya produces from his bag. He surrenders it, and Shouto watches as the two of them playfully scuffle.Within minutes, the entire class is clustered around Midoriya and alternately cooing, squealing, or just plain freaking out over the tiny plastic replicas of themselves. Sero has actual tears in his eyes as he solemnly proclaims that his is “the best thing he owns now”.“Todoroki-kun, c’mere! You need to see yours!” Shouto blinks quizzically at the charm in Midoriya’s hand—a tiny figure of him, left hand raised and with a handful of flames.“It certainly is me,” he agrees. Midoriya beams.“You can keep this one, don’t worry!” he promises, pressing it into Shouto’s hands. “I got enough that I could have one and still give everyone theirs!”That is the moment that Shouto notices a double of the charm in his hand hanging from one of the zippers on Midoriya’s big yellow backpack. His chest feels warm when he realizes a charm of Midoriya is attached to the same zipper, resting against the tiny Shouto like they belong together. The next time the charms come up, Shouto is walking across campus. Near the woods where Hatsume’s “babies” run wild far too frequently, Uraraka, Jirou, and Midoriya are digging through the bushes, with the latter nearly in tears.Shouto picks up his pace. Midoriya is clearly distraught about something, and that won’t do at all.“It’s okay, we’ll find it,” Jirou is saying as he comes into earshot. “It couldn’t have been flung far—if we can’t, we’ll go get Shouji.”“Found him!” Uraraka cheers before Shouto can ask what they’re looking for, raising her fist triumphantly. “Deku-kun, I found him!”Midoriya gives a cry of relief and rushes over to her, taking whatever she found in his hands and holding it tight.“What happened?” Shouto asks, trying to squash down an entirely inappropriate flare of envy that Uraraka was the one to save the day. What matters is that Midoriya isn’t upset anymore.“My Todoroki-kun charm got snagged on my All Might when I opened my backpack,” Midoriya explains, fastening the minuscule Shouto back onto his zipper home. “He fell into the bushes.”Shouto looks at charm Shouto, now safely resting against charm Midoriya once more. On the zipper opposite them, one of Midoriya’s All Might charms looms far more ominously than Shouto can remember it ever looking before.He swallows, suddenly having the unmistakable feeling that he is a man whose days are numbered. “Okay,” he says. “I’m glad it turned out alright.”This time, the All Might charm seems to say. It happens again in class, although this time Midoriya is fast enough to rescue the charm before it hits the floor and skitters off into a corner.Shouto eyes the All Might charm apprehensively. Unlike last time, there’s no proof it snagged the Shouto charm, but there’s something about its smile…“Todoroki-kun? Everything okay?”Shouto shakes himself. “It’s fine. I’m just glad you didn’t lose your charm.”Internally, he resolves never to let All Might find out that he’s head-over-heels for the man’s protégé. Just in case Midoriya’s backpack proves to be prophetic. 
”Todorokikunwillyougoonadatewithme?”
Shouto blinks, trying to process the flood of words that just hit his ears all at once. “What?”Midoriya once again proves he is a far superior man to Shouto, because he somehow manages not to bolt. Instead, he takes a deep breath and says, with cheeks so flushed he almost looks like a strawberry, “I-I said… Todoroki-kun, will you go on a date with me?”This time, the message reaches Shouto’s brain, and he promptly catches fire.That, apparently, is enough to make Midoriya panic.“Oh my god I’m so sorry I shouldn’t have said anything just forget it ever happened why did I listen to Uraraka-san—”“Yes!” Shouto blurts, internally cringing at how desperate he sounds. Midoriya freezes.“Eh?”“Yes. Yes, I will go on a date with you. I would like that very much.”“Oh.” Midoriya’s voice is approximately six octaves higher than normal. “Uh. Okay, wow, great.”“Do you… have somewhere in mind?” Shouto is keenly aware of how little expertise he has in the arena of romance, but if there’s one thing he does know, it’s that Midoriya will have an answer about any topic nine times out of ten.Apparently this is the tenth time, because he blushes harder and admits “I don’t know, I didn’t think I’d get this far.”That’s… promising. They end up seeing a movie, an old  animated one that’s playing at a nearby theater.It’s not the sort of movie Shouto thinks he would choose for himself—a fairy-tale fantasy—but he likes it very much. What he likes even more is Midoriya’s font of trivia on the train ride home.“—But honestly the author’s involvement in the adaptation process was also kind of a weakness, because some stuff ended up being out of place. Like that line about tacos, that was in the book and it was just as weird there.”Shouto has the sudden urge to put his arm around Midoriya, followed by the realization that he’s allowed to do that, this is a date.“Also, believe it or not, there were actually no female unicorns in literature before the novel was written! So in a way, Amalthea was kind of the blueprint for almost every media that has unicorns in it after 1968!”Shouto nonchalantly starts raising his arm while nodding. “So that cartoon Ashido likes is based on this?”“I mean, very loosely I guess? It’s more like an evolutionary ancestor, or a parent plant dropping a seed—“Something catches Shouto’s eye as he inches his arm steadily closer to Midoriya’s shoulders.Midoriya’s backpack rests on his lap, having been brought along to serve the vital purpose of sneaking their snacks into the theater. Now, the snacks are gone, but the backpack—and its charms—remain.The All Might charm that now haunts Shouto’s weirder nightmares has landed in between the charms of him and Midoriya, neatly holding them apart from each other.Shouto is aware by now that he is putting far too much stock in the opinion of a one-inch-high scrap of plastic, but he nonetheless finds himself retracting his arm.Something like concern flashes in Midoriya’s eyes. “Todoroki-kun? Is everything okay?”“It’s fine,” Shouto lies, because how can one reasonably be expected to admit to being intimidated by an inanimate object he could easily throw the length of a train car if he were so inclined? “Did the cat cause any massive changes to literature?” The final straw comes when they’re studying in Shouto’s room, Midoriya’s (no, Izuku’s, he said Shouto could call him Izuku) backpack resting innocently next to the door. After about half an hour of puzzling out the most frustrating grammar in existence (seriously, the English language can get fucked), Izuku pauses, stretching his arms over his head.“Shouto-kun?” Shouto’s heart skips a beat as he looks up to meet his boyfriend’s(!) gaze. “Wanna take a snack break? There’s gummy worms in my backpack.”Well. Gummy worms certainly do sound good, but… “Are you sure? If you’re having trouble with English…”Izuku blushes. “Uh. About that…”Shouto blinks. “Izuku?”“I. Uh. I’m kind of… fluent.”There’s no way Shouto heard that right. “Fluent.”“Yup.”“In English.”“Pretty much, yeah.”Apparently it’s possible for someone to become even more attractive because one is annoyed with them, because Shouto has the sudden and intense urge to kiss his stupid face. “So all those times you asked me for help…”Izuku at least has the decency to look ashamed of himself. “I was. Kind of just looking for an excuse to spend time with you.”Shouto doesn’t know whether he’s endeared or deeply, deeply annoyed. “Unbelievable. Did you leave your pencil in my room on purpose, too?”The question was rhetorical, but Izuku’s silence speaks volumes. “You did, didn’t you.”“Maybe.”Shouto drops his head into his hands. “And it never occurred to you to offer to help me with this bullshit?”Izuku blinks. “Not until this moment, no.”That is the final straw. “I’m taking all the gummy worms,” Shouto declares, standing up and crossing the room to Izuku’s backpack.He fully intends to make good on the threat, too, but the plan goes awry when he tries to open the backpack.
The fucking All Might charm.
This time it’s managed to hook its arm around the chain of the Shouto charm as he pulls the zipper. The effect winds up being the extremely alarming image of All Might grabbing him, presumably to fling him far away from Izuku.Shouto drops the zipper and flees to the other side of the room, settling next the the sliding door.“Shouto-kun? What’s wrong?”“That stupid charm is out to get me!”Izuku’s eyes flick between the backpack and Shouto, perplexed. “What?”“It’s been haunting me ever since you bought the new ones!”Shouto can see the penny drop before Izuku dissolves into giggles.“My—you’re scared of my All Might charm?” he manages to gasp between bouts of laughter.“Intimidated, not scared,” Shouto grumbles. “It keeps threatening me.”“Because it keeps snagging on the Shouto-kun charm?” Izuku is laughing so hard that there are tears in his eyes. “That’s—sorry, Shouto-kun, I shouldn’t be laughing at you, I just—that’s really funny.”Shouto would probably be much more indignant if Izuku’s laugh wasn’t so adorable.“…Hey, Shouto-kun?” Izuku walks across the tatami floor and settles next to Shouto, bumping their shoulders together. “You know it doesn’t actually mean anything, right? Like, you don’t have to worry about All Might coming after you.”“Forgive me if the mental image of my boyfriend’s dad throwing me into the sun is a little hard to shake.”“Oh my god, he’s not my dad!” Izuku shoves him in exasperation. “And he likes you, anyway! You don’t have to worry about that, trust me.” Nevertheless, the next time Shouto sees the All Might charm, it’s been moved to a different zipper, while the Shouto charm still hangs right next to the matching Izuku.Ha, Shouto thinks, far more smugly than is really warranted. I win.<<EOFANFIC>>

completion:
Chapter Text
Shinsou drops the controller in defeat as Kaminari beats him once again at Mario Kart. He lies back on the couch.  He is tired. Not that unusual for him, but not sleeping for two days still makes him drowsy, as used to it as he is. He gets up, ignoring Kaminari’s wounded gasp, announcing that he’s going to sleep. Really, he’ll probably just lie down in his bed and look at the ceiling until he passes out. If that happens before his morning alarm rings.He steps forward, and slips. Maybe he’s more tired than he thought – his thoughts are cut up when he feels himself falling, way longer than he should, but no wind crosses him, until he touches solid ground. Shinsou sits up, opens his eyes – he hadn’t realized he closed them. He looks around. He’s in a room – not a room, per se, he doesn’t see any doors. Just walls and hallways, an ugly yellow wallpaper that reminds him of Kaminari’s old Pikachu plushie, the carpet and ceiling yellow too. The lights above him are too bright, flickering regularly and buzzing incessantly loud.“Shinsou!” He jumps up, his guard falling back down when he sees Kaminari run towards him, grabbing onto his arm. He’s smiling, but it’s shaky, too wide. He’s scared, Shinsou’s brain supplies, realizing that this is pretty fucking creepy, actually.“Shinsou, I don’t like this place. Wherever it is. How did we get here?” Kaminari asks, speaking too fast for Shinsou’s poor sleep-deprived brain. He blinks a couple times, trying to get used to the bright light.“I… Slipped. And fell. I’m not a hundred percent sure I’m not hallucinating, to be honest,” He mumbles. Kaminari’s face falls at that, before he smiles again.“I fell too! I don’t know how, I just shifted on the couch – we were in the common room, right?” He asks. Shinsou nods.“Yep. With Sero, Ashido, and…”“Yaomomo!” He says, face lighting up. Shinsou turns around, both relieved and strangely uneasy when Kaminari drops his grip on his arm and approaches Yaoyorozu, who’s sporting the most concerned look he’s ever seen on her face. Which is a new record, actually.“Shinsou, Kaminari, are you okay?” Shinsou tunes out their voices as the hum of the lights fill his head. It’s so loud, he can’t stand it. He crouches down, suddenly, feeling panic deep in his bones. His hands fly to his ears, covering them, but the noise is still there – his friends’ voices are muffled, he thinks he can make up a worried tone, his name – he shakes his head, sitting completely, the carpet feeling moist against his socked feet. He shakes.A hand lands softly on his shoulder, a voice brings him back, going over the humming, slowly. Shinsou opens his eyes to see Sero.He curses, his breath stuttering, as Sero helps him up.“How – How many of us are in here?” Sero shrugs, “I don’t know man. Hopefully it’s only people that were in the common room, it already sucks we’re stuck here.”Sero’s always too relaxed, it’s almost scary, but right now it brings Shinsou a hint of familiarity he appreciates.Eventually, as Shinsou tries to come back to his senses and the others theorize about why they’re here, and where’s here, Ashido appears in one of the hallways and cries as she sees them.“I thought I was alone,” She cries as Yaoyorozu holds her shoulders and tries to reassure her.“You’re not, we’re here,” She soothes. The soft ring of her voice washes over Shinsou, and he sighs. “We should… Try to walk around. Search for a way out,” He mumbles, not saying anything when Sero squeezes his hand once softly before letting go again.“This place is huge,” Ashido says with teary eyes. “It’s just yellow room after yellow room, nothing ever changes. It’s creepy as hell,” She says, going back to her usual self slowly. Kaminari startles them all when he gasps and laughs in glee, brandishing his phone, until he discovers there’s no signal, nothing. He’s the only one who has his phone, turns out. Shinsou jumps when Kaminari puts his phone right in front of his face, realizing he missed another bit of conversation.“What are you doing,” Shinsou mutters. Kaminari smiles.“Filming! If we don’t make it out of there before tomorrow, I want Aizawa-sensei to believe our excuse for being late. Absent, God forbid,” He laughs. Shinsou sighs, but nods, and they start walking.Ashido wasn’t exactly right. The rooms aren’t identical, a wall is always slightly out of place, a light flickering more or less. The hallways are long, nothing makes sense, and they’ve ended up in the room Shinsou fell in over and over again, even by walking in a straight line – Yaoyorozu being the smart one, she thought of leaving her cardigan in the room, folded neatly in a corner. Shinsou tries to ignore the hum of the lights, the nauseating smell of mold coming from everywhere, focusing on his friends’ voice instead. They’re worried, even Shinsou, socially inept as he is, can tell. Kaminari’s voice still hasn’t stopped trembling, and Yaoyorozu is muttering at Midoriya level speed, trying to figure out how to get out of here. Ashido is holding Yaoyorozu’s hand, looking around shakily, as if to make sure they’re alone. Sero’s the most relaxed, but he’s keeping an eye on Shinsou. He seems less worried about the situation, and more worried about his friends.Shinsou feels out of it. He can’t get himself to worry, he can’t panic, he can’t see this as real. It is real, he knows it is, it has to be. He’s never had dreams or nightmares this realistic, never had hallucinations this elaborate, but he can’t take it seriously. He feels out of his body, like he’s looking at a couple of teenagers walking around a mono-yellow liminal space and thinking  damn, I’m glad that’s not me.  Shinsou loses another chunk of time. He knows he must have, because there’s a door in front of them.  Finally, he hears someone whisper. But no one dares get closer. Shinsou sighs.“I’ll open the door,” He mumbles. As his hand touches the handle, the buzzing of the lights invades his brain like insects, and he falls. The carpet is wetter than it used to be.
<<EOFANFIC>>

Chapter Text
Katsuki Bakugou, also known as Kacchan, is one of the most complex and interesting characters in My Hero Academia. He has a brash personality, a sharp tongue, and a fierce desire to become the greatest hero.Bakugou was born with an incredible quirk, the ability to expel explosive sweat from his palms, which he could ignite on command to create powerful blasts. His quirk, which he had always seen as his strength, became a burden in childhood when his classmates would bully him or ostracize him for his power.Despite this, Bakugou never gave up on his dream of becoming a hero. With his determination and relentless work ethic, he earned a place at UA High School, the most prestigious hero academy in the world.At UA, Bakugou was pushed to his limits, but he refused to back down. He trained harder than anyone else, always looking to improve his abilities and outdo his classmates. He was fiercely competitive, but he also showed a surprising level of loyalty to his friends, especially to those he saw as comrades in arms.Bakugou's complex personality was further revealed when it became clear that he struggled with insecurity and jealousy towards other students with seemingly more impressive quirks than his own. He was always trying to prove himself and show that he was just as capable as anyone else, but it often came off as arrogance.However, Bakugou's growth as a person and as a hero was slowly revealed throughout the series. He began to develop empathy for his classmates, even showing a surprisingly compassionate side in the midst of battle. He formed a strong rivalry with Izuku Midoriya, which eventually blossomed into a deep bond of mutual respect and admiration.Bakugou's growth as a person was tested the most when he learned to confront his painful past. His time in the orphanage, where he was known as Ray, had left deep scars on his psyche. But with the support of his friends at UA and his own strong will, Bakugou was able to confront his past and begin to heal from it.Through his journey, Bakugou proved himself to be one of the most dynamic and complex characters in the series. His passionate spirit, acute senses, and intense desire to be the best shine through his entire character arc.Whether Bakugou is blasting opponents with his powerful quirk, standing up for what he believes in, or showing a rare moment of vulnerability, he has become a fan-favorite character in My Hero Academia, known as much for his explosive personality as his explosive power.
<<EOFANFIC>>

completion:
Chapter Text
Izuku woke up as he always did in his cold lonesome bed. He stretched his arms and stood up to go get ready for school.His curly hair went in all directions and he had to spend extra time just to make his hair slightly bearable.He threw some water onto his face to just really make sure he was actually awake. And he was.As the cold was yet hit his face he thought about how he absolutely didn’t want to go to school.He wanted to stay at home. But if he asked his mom if he could he would have to explain all the bullying to her and Izuku really didn’t want to do that.Although he was sure she already knew.But if he actually got confirmation that she knew about it and didn’t do anything about it, he would break. So the bullying was something he didn’t have the heart to explain.Izuku quickly got together a toast and ran to school. The fresh summer air hit his face as he ran and his hair got tangled once again. After some minutes of running and standing uncomfortably close to strangers at the bus he arrived at school.Izuku walked into the classroom quietly trying his best at not being seen. He quickly moved toward his seat and sat down right before the teacher walked in.As the teacher counted over all the students making sure everyone was present his hair bobbled around uncontrollably while nodding his head at each student he counted.This was a regular scene in the morning. In the start of the school year Izuku had almost begun laughing but kept it in as the teacher yelled at other students who didn’t quite have the same resistance to laughter. Since that morning filled with loud angry screams from the teacher, just a few individuals had the guts to laugh.Those few individuals included Izukus ex best friend ‘Kacchan’. Kacchan wasn’t afraid of anything or anyone. And he was for sure not scared even just a little when the teacher begun screaming. Kacchan just begun laughing more. Izuku slightly smiled at those memories. Although they weren’t friends anymore Izuku still wanted to be like Kacchan. He didn’t want to be scared of anyone or anything. But his daydreaming quickly came to an end when the teacher slammed shut his book after noting down that no students were missing from this lesson.As his greatly used notebook shut he begun talking.“So today we will talk about where you guys want to go after this summer is over. This is your last chance to apply to your next school. So let’s all take this together.”The teacher glanced at his class. Quickly passing his eyes around making sure everyone was listening.“So let’s start off with UA. This who want to apply for UA please raise your hand.”The class got silent and everyone looked around to see those who raised their hand.Kacchan of course raised his hand and people nodded approvingly. And Izuku slightly raised his. He raised his hand just enough that he could be seen. And being the black sheep of the class others noticed quickly.His peers erupted in laughter. Those close and far away begun mocking him.And Izuku felt every single glare. Especially Kacchan’s. He buried his head in his arms trying to get away from it all. And after a few minutes of the mockery the teacher got everyone to quiet down. And he went on with asking about the other schools and soon the class ended.Throughout the day Izuku received multiple beatings and harmful comments. Because how dared he? Because how dared the quirkless loser apply for UA?And at the end of the day Izuku sat alone in the classroom packing his notebook and pencil case into his backpack. He wanted to get back home quickly. But as expected he was stopped.Kacchan and a few others were standing at the door blocking it.And as Izuku nervously begun packing faster Kacchan approached.He raised his arm and hit Izuku in the stomach, making Izuku bend down in pain. He slowly put his hand on Izukus shoulder. And slightly used his quirk to leave a burn mark.“So you still wanna be a hero deku?” He said mockingly.Izuku could only nod in fear.“You of all people wanna save others?!”He raised his volume.“Don’t even try useless nerd. A quirkless loser such as you won’t make it.”Kacchan let go of his shoulder and turned away.As he was walking he slowed down slightly as if he had remembered something important.“But I mean if you really wanna be a hero you could take a swan dive off of the top of a building and hope for a quirk in your next life.”As the last sentence left his mouth Izuku freezed. And he thought about it.
<<EOFANFIC>>

completion: Katsuki stands annoyed in the physiotherapist's office on campus.He’s been waiting in the room for a total of fifteen  (15) minutes without getting attended. He normally gets in earlier in the day, since the moment he was dumb enough to tear his anterior cruciate ligament doing a fucking easy jump during a stupid rehearsal, but today he had to help set up the dance practice and couldn’t make it to therapy in the usual time. And now the room is full.He usually gets in at 2 o’clock and gets out within half an hour, and one would think that 45 minutes wouldn’t make that big of a difference, but the thing is, soccer practice ends at 2:30, and rugby starts at 3:30, which means that, right now, the room is full of jocks. He could theoretically go to the other physiotherapist, the one that is actually closer to the dance studio and is supposed to attend him, but that one is stupid and Katsuki will be damned if he is not treated by the best at the field, so every day he walks with a (dumb) crutch (he could totally move without it) to the stadium and gets attended by Chiyo. She, for some unknown reason, likes him, and he thinks she is better than the other extras on campus.One kid leaves the room.“Alright, boys,  ” the little lady says with a sweet, hurried smile “there’re just so many of you today! Katsuki, darling, come sit here, it’s the left one right? ”Katsuki just nods and starts to move to the right side of one of the two litters, the other already taken.“You too, Eijirou. You two are gonna have to share today ”Katsuki looks at the  shitty-hair-idiot-looking-jock who Chiyo is talking to. He knows him, or at least, he has seen him before. His group friend is loud and he always has a stupid smile on his face. The red-haired walks optimistic and sits on the litter, extending his right leg next to Katsuki’s left one. They are not yet touching, but just from there, Katsuki can feel the warmth coming from the other body. He huffs, not caring to hide his irritation.Chiyo connects them to the same electro-stimulator and goes to attend a boy who seems to have sprinted his ankle. The muscles in their thighs start to rise and fall in an apparent same course.Katsuki feels like he sees it in slow motion, the moment ‘Eijirou’ turns at him and says:“Hey bro! What happened to you ”Katsuki doesn’t want to answer, he doesn’t. He doesn’t know the guy and doesn’t care what his senseless hair may think of him, so maybe it’s the pretty face of the boy, or the voice of (stupid) Deku at the back of his head telling him to put some effort on the whole being nicer thing, but he ends up saying “ACL and meniscus tore ” while looking away.“No way man!  ” He keeps talking and smiling and at this point, it doesn’t seem like he is going to stop “I got the same thing last year! We are knee twins! ” Knee twins. How does someone manage to be so dumb and endearing at the same time? He wants (does he?) to let it there, but a response escapes his lips in a gruff, low fashion.“You got operated? ”“Yes! Three months ago! I’m hitting the gym and coming here but still can’t actually practice ”Eijirou makes a pout before adding “But I’m improving, I may be in the games two, max three months from now. And you? You also got operated? ”Katsuki clicks his tongue.“No ”“Oh. When did you get injured? What were you doing? ”He doesn’t like remembering it (he feels weak every time he does, not that he would ever recognize it, this type of injury happens to the strongest of athletes thank you very much) but he has had to explain it so many times that the words flow out of him before he can catch them:“I was dancing at practice. I had to do a jump after changing directions, it snapped ”Eijirou does a face “Same here. I mean, I wasn’t dancing or jumping, but I did change directions while running and it was it  ” he puts his hand behind his neck, in apparent shyness “When will you get operated? I mean, will you? ”He could choose not to get operated and still dance, but it is not the safest option, and he knows it will be bothering him. The operation will slow him from getting back on the scenario, sure, however, he will be back, and he will still be the best.“Yes, two weeks from now”   “Awesome! ”Eijirou proceeds to blab about the rugby team and how they are doing so good this season, despite the multiple leaves due injury they have suffered; about his friend, Hanta, who somehow managed to crack his elbow just from tripping while running (they were not even at practice); about the best exercises to do before and after the operation; and about how it hurts so bad man, good luck.Katsuki finds himself engrossed in the tales of the boy and is surprised when the damned machine ends its cycle and Chiyo comes back to them to do the rest of the therapy. When she rolls his knee in an elastic and starts moving it, he is still listening to the kid.“Alright. That’s all for today, Katsuki ” Chiyo chimes in, putting the elastic away and moving towards Eijirou.Katsuki gets up and takes his crutch and bag quickly. He does have a class in twenty minutes.“Wait! Can I maybe get your number?  ” And he says it like it’s the most important thing in the world, and his blush matches his hair “Y’know, in case you want to ask anything about the recovery or… something? ”He is smiling widely, and his eyes must be very convincing, because Katsuki gives him his number..<<EOFANFIC>>

prompt: write a story about Haikyuu!!,  Teen And Up Audiences No Archive Warnings Apply M/M 僕のヒーローアカデミア | Boku no Hero Academia | My Hero Academia (Anime & Manga) Takami Keigo | Hawks/Todoroki Enji | Endeavor Takami Keigo | Hawks Todoroki Enji | Endeavor Takami Keigo | Hawks-centric Soft Takami Keigo | Hawks Takami Keigo | Hawks Needs a Hug POV Takami Keigo | Hawks Todoroki Enji | Endeavor Redemption Getting Together Love Confessions Confessions First Kiss Kissing Gentle Kissing hand holding Requited Love Requited Unrequited Love Divorced Todoroki Enji | Endeavor/Todoroki Rei
completion:
Two weeks pass after the raid on the Paranormal Liberation Front. 
 
Hawks is released from the hospital with his burns still sore and his wings still short, just as Endeavor is released with new scars and a broken heart. They don’t have time to rest. Shigaraki and the rest of the PLF are on the run, AFO is still hunting after Midoriya, and they along with All Might, Best Jeanist, and other top heroes have to help- no matter what the public says about them.
 
But the public is an increasing problem that Hawks is starting to wish he could have Endeavor burn to the ground. He has been nothing but loyal to the commission, and Endeavor has as well, yet… They’re still being attacked. Perhaps Endeavor has committed his fair share of sins, but he’s trying to atone. Speaking of that- on top of all of the stories about Endeavor’s abuse of his children and his failure to defeat Shigaraki, there has been a new story; one that he’s divorcing his wife, Rei Todoroki.
 
Hawks has a lot of feelings about it. On one hand, he’s upset that Endeavor has yet another thing to be stressed out about in his already stressful life. On the other hand… He’s had a pathetic crush on the number one hero since he was a young teenager, and though he never actually got the chance to interact with said hero until this year, he’s fallen in love with him. So, to hear that he’s single is a relief.
 
Not that Hawks thinks he has any more of a chance than he did before…
 
Endeavor is more than twenty years his senior, way out of his league, and an often-times cold and unsympathetic man despite his warm presence. Hawks suspects Endeavor doesn’t know about his feelings- that Endeavor would surely reject him if he did know.
 
But, Hawks is fearful that they won’t be able to win this one. Shigaraki is strong, All For One is strong. Many heroes have quit and the ones that are left have  lowered morales. Hawks is terrified.
 
As scared as he is, though, he wants to live a life with no regrets. He doesn’t want to risk him or Endeavor dying without telling the older man the truth.
 
How to do it, he isn’t sure. Hawks is a romantic at heart despite his string of casual, meaningless relationships, so he thinks of doing a big grand gesture in a hot air balloon before deciding against it. The public can’t know about this. He also thinks of doing something smaller, like a bouquet of flowers and a private dinner, but that would be a mess if Endeavor were to reject him. He’d be left alone with the flowers in front of two uneaten five star meals and untouched glasses of wine that cost more than all of his hero gear combined.
 
Eventually, Hawks gives up on the idea of making it romantic. It’ll happen when it happens.
 
When it happens? In Hawks’s car. 
 
Hawks drives Endeavor to the fancy Todoroki home after a long sixteen hour day of tracking Midoriya and helping him with the villains that AFO has been sending to capture him. After making sure that Midoriya was safe with All Might and Best Jeanist rotating their tracking shifts, they tiredly crawled into Hawks’s car and hit the road in the early evening. It’s silent and a bit awkward as Hawks prepares himself to watch Endeavor exit the passenger’s seat and walk away, partially because Endeavor hates playing music in the car, mostly because his feelings are eating away at him.
 
Right as Endeavor unbuckles his seatbelt, Hawks speaks- far too fast for his own good, far too fast for him to do the logical thing and stop himself.
 
“Endeavor, wait,” Hawks starts. Endeavor’s hand, which was previously on the handle of the passenger’s side door, falters. “I need to talk to you… It’s not about hero work. This is kind of sudden, I know, but I want you to know that I appreciate how well you’ve been handling everything recently; especially Dabi and my past that he revealed. You know, you’re the only one that hasn’t brought that up? But more importantly, even with everything you’ve been through, you’ve still stayed strong enough to keep going and help everyone no matter how badly the public treats you. You’re amazing, you know that?”
 
“Well…” Endeavor trails off. His cheeks are dusted a light pink, and his eyes are narrow with what appears to be suspicion. He doesn’t look convinced that Hawks’s words are true or genuine at all, and Hawks can’t blame him for that. “Thank you. I appreciate the sentiment.”
 
Endeavor goes to open the door again. Like a game of cat and mouse, Hawks keeps him trapped once more by speaking.
 
“That’s not it, actually… This is really awkward, and I’m sure you’re going to hate me for saying it when you’re going through so much right now, but I love you. I’m in love with you. I would’ve rather waited, but you know, things just keep getting worse and I’m scared there will never be a right time. So, I’ll say it now; you’ve been the only one to make me truly smile for a long time now, and I’ve fallen in love with you because of it.”
 
Endeavor blinks.
 
“Are you joking?”
 
Hawks shuts off his car, grips the steering wheel, and swallows the lump of anxiety in his throat.
 
“No, I’m not. I’m being honest with you. I know it’s a lot to take in, but… I hope you can accept it for what it is.”
 
Hawks assumes that a lot of things will happen; surely, Endeavor will reject him, refuse to work with him ever again, and condemn him for his feelings.
 
But, to his surpise, Endeavor’s gaze softens. Those steely blue eyes that have always seemed to pierce straight through Hawks, they morph into something kinder before Endeavor rushes to reach out. Hawks flinches. He’s squeezing his eyes shut and bracing himself to be hit or pushed away until calloused hands are placed on either side of his face. Large, warm hands hold him so tenderly that he gathers the courage to open his eyes.
 
Endeavor is looking at him with such unbridled affection that it has Hawks’s heart skipping a beat.
 
Just how many times will Endeavor be able to make his fickle heart do that before the thing finally breaks? Or stops?
 
“Hawks…” Endeavor sighs, his voice shaky. His eyebrows furrow in confusion as he deactivates his quirk and tries to figure out just how to address Hawks in a situation as intimate as this. “Keigo? Or would you prefer Takami?”
 
“No, my name is Hawks now,” Hawks says with a shake of his head. “Keigo… Is foreign to me. I’d rather forget it. Call me Hawks instead.”
 
“Then, Hawks… It must’ve taken a lot of courage to say those things to me.”
 
“Yeah,” Hawks nods and stares down at Endeavor’s chest, unable to meet the older man’s eyes.
 
“Part of the reason I divorced Rei… Forgive me for talking about such an unsavory thing right now, but it was because I noticed that I was starting to feel a certain way for you. I was finding excuses to work with you later and later. I kept staring at you when I thought you weren’t looking, I… I couldn’t stop thinking about you,” Hawks smiles at that. Relief floods him so heavily that he feels himself go faint. He thinks of the first day they got lunch together and fought Nomu. Even then, all he could do was catch looks at Endeavor when the older man was focused on something else. He thinks of the many nights spent fantasizing about what they could be if things were different. Now, it’s actually happening. “Imagining things that I thought could never be, but even if I thought we could never happen, it wasn’t fair to try to salvage what I had with Rei when I was starting to fall in love with you. So, I broke it off.”
 
“So, you…”
 
“Yes. I reciprocate your feelings,” Endeavor clarifies and, much to the younger man’s disappointment, lets go to cross his arms over his chest and lean back in the passenger’s seat.
 
“Then… What happens to us now? There’s no way we can go public with this, with us.”
 
Endeavor hesitates. It’s the only time that Hawks has seen him do so. The reward that comes with waiting for Endeavor to get over whatever qualms he has is worth it, though, as just seconds later, Endeavor’s face is hardened with determination and his hot lips are sweetly pressed against Hawks’s much colder ones. Hawks lets out a garbled noise of surprise before gathering the composure to thread his hands through Endeavor’s warm, fiery red locks and kiss him back. 
 
“We can’t go public, at least not yet, but I’m alright with that if you are.”
 
“God… This is such a mindfuck,” Hawks laughs to himself as they break apart. His lips taste like Endeavor, like cinnamon and sugar and raw passion. He wants more of it desperately. “I was totally expecting you to cut me off!”
 
“Tch, please,” Endeavor rolls his eyes, as if the idea is ridiculous. Hawks owlishly blinks in return and damn near jumps out of his skin when Endeavor reaches over to hold his hand. “I’d never… Even if I didn’t return the feelings.”
 
“What are we?” Hawks questions.
 
He’s used to using and being used in return; casual sex, flings that don’t mean anything, people who only want him for his body. He’s never been in a real relationship with someone who takes him on dates and spends time with him without wanting something in return. For Endeavor to seem interested in that with him of all people, it feels like a dream.
 
“Let’s say partners for now, yes?” Endeavor asks while giving Hawks’s hand a reassuring squeeze. “We can take things slow… Go on some private dates when we have the time, explore these feelings a little more. But for now, we can be partners.”
 
“I like the sound of that!” Hawks agrees with a smile, and for once, Endeavor actually smiles back.
<<EOFANFIC>>

completion: Once upon a time, there was a very poor kingdom. It was the poorest kingdom in the land of UA. This Kingdom belonged to the Uraraka family.King Uraraka had always wanted a child. He looked at his peers around him, and saw how many children each of them had. King Enji Todoroki and his Queen Rei already had three, each one covered in the finest fabrics for their clothing, and the older ones adorned in the most expensive of jewels.And so the King of the Uraraka Kingdom had complained to his wife.And eventually, they succeeded. They had a beautiful baby girl, who they named Ochako.The King was so overjoyed that he decided to write all invitations to Ochako's birthday celebration by hand. Himself.As the king, he was a VERY IMPORTANT PERSON. And so he had a very long list of people to invite. Kings of other kingdoms, all the important fairies in the area... Also his family, and his wife's family.He got through most of the invitations without a problem. However towards the end he got tired. And in his exhaustion he forgot one person.That one person was his sister.Now, he does have his excuses for not inviting his sister. He was tired, for one thing. But he also hadn't spoken to her in years because he didn't approve of her practicing the Dark Arts.His sister was very confused by her lack of invitation. She was also furious. Did her brother really think he could exclude her?She showed up to the party anyway. And the king greeted her happily, thinking she had recieved an invitation.When it came time for her to take her revenge, she did so stealthily. She sprinkled a bit of dust over the baby Ochako, and stayed in a corner, muttering words only known to demons and other foul beings. A few people heard her, but all they did was avoid the crazy lady mumbling to herself in a corner.The curse wasn't noticed until way later. One of the servants picked up baby Ochako, and noticed she felt a bit too light. However, the servant dismissed it as nothing and handed the baby to her father.He threw his baby in the air, expecting her to fall down into his waiting arms. Instead, she stopped and hovered near the ceiling, cackling at the panicked people below her.They had to get the tallest ladder in the Kingdom, and even then her father had to grasp the end of her clothing with a pair of tongs to pull her down.The King went to beg his sister for help, knowing that she may have a dark spell to reverse whatever happened to his sweet daughter.The witch only smiled, and claimed that she had nothing to do with it, and nothing to help the Princess.There were many mishaps with baby Ochako over the years.Once, her mother had an open window, and opened another at the other end of the room where Ochako was sleeping. A wind came in, swept up the baby, and took her away. The entire castle was in a panic until she was found giggling under a rose bush.Another time, she figured out how to pull herself out of her crib, and was found laughing upside down near the ceiling.They decided she should not be left alone after those incidents.The servants enjoyed the company of baby Ochako. They could often be found playing ball with her, tossing her between themselves. They were careful not to throw her too high, for fear that she would not come back down.The King and Queen were stressed about it. When Ochako came of age, would any Prince or Princess want to marry her? Would ANYONE want to marry her? How would the Uraraka family line continue?They also worried that Ochako would float away in the wind, never to be seen again.When Ochako ran, she had to scoop up stones so that she wouldn't float away. Running was also a very loose term for what Ochako did. She took great leaps across the ground, nearly floating away before the stones pulled her down.One day, when King Uraraka came back from negotiations with the Kirishima Kingdom, Ochako ran out to greet her father. However, there were not any rocks nearby for Ochako to hold. So, she picked up a toad and ran with that instead. She reached to kiss her father, but wind blew her to the side. Ochako ended up kissing a nearby guard instead.The Uraraka family got tired of all the mishaps having a daughter who was unaffected by gravity brought. So, they brought over some docters to try to figure out how to gain her gravity back. However, everything they suggested would end up harming their daughter, so the royal family declined every suggestion. They would just live life normally.The King and Queen invited the royal family of a recently established kingdom over to do negotiations. King Kurogiri brought his adopted children, Prince Tomura, Princess Kenji, Prince Jin, Prince Shuuichi, and Princess Himiko with him. The Uraraka Castle was on the border of a lake. The Uraraka King and King Kurogiri decided to take their families out onto the lake, for more bonding. Ochako and Himiko were on seperate boats, so Ochako asked her father if she could switch boats to be with her friends.King Uraraka thought if he threw her straight across, and someone on the other side caught her, it would work perfectly. So he picked her up and prepared to throw her into Princess Kenji's waiting arms. However, the King slipped. He fell down ono the boat, and the downwards momentum put Princess Ochako in the lake. Everyone panicked until they realized Princess Ochako was swimming with ease. And she was laughing.They decided it was harmless the let her swim, so Tomura, Kenji, Jin, Shuuichi, and Himiko joined her in the water.Of course, the very same lake would someday help Ochako gain her gravity back, and meet the love of her life.<<EOFANFIC>>

completion:
Chapter Text
The studio was quiet, save for the soft sound of music and the rhythmic tapping of shoes against the polished wood floor. Hidden in the shadows, Katsuki watched her move with all the grace and beauty he had ever seen and had only ever seen with her.Mesmerized, he couldn't tear his eyes away from her. She moved with such fluidity and precision, each step and turn executed flawlessly. He was drawn in by the beauty of her movements, the elegance of her posture, the precision of her steps. It was as if she was in another world she created, lost in the music and the dance.With each turn, each leap, each graceful gesture, his heart pounded in his chest. It was like witnessing something magical, something pure and perfect and utterly transcendent. It felt like a privilege to be there and witness that moment in time.He could not look away even if he tried. A man could be dying beside him, and still he would not look away from her. He could have been dying, and he would not have looked away just to witness her dance.He had always had trouble doing so. Everything blurs into a haze, and all that remained was her, dancing before him as she did when they were children. It was as though she had brought him to the world she was lost in. She brought him to her world without even knowing it. He was transported to a world of beauty and art and passion.He watched her move, every muscle in her body working in perfect harmony. Her hair was not in a bun and was instead in her usual ponytail, and her hair moved fluidly with her body as though it were another limb that swayed and danced with the music. She was a sight to behold, and he knew he would never forget it like he never forgot the thousand times before. As the dance came to an end, she paused for a moment, catching her breath. The shadows concealed him, and he remained silent, not wanting to disturb the moment.He could have stayed in the shadows longer, content to just watch her. But in the end, he couldn't help himself, not wanting to let her slip between her fingers again. He made that mistake once and it was once too many. His mind was at odds with each other between wanting her back and reminding him why he left in the first place but then again, it didn’t matter anymore. She was but a few feet away from him. Katsuki could smell her and he needed more. He stepped forward, his footsteps echoing in the empty room. Momo turned, surprised, and he could see the question in her eyes.“Princess,” he breathed out. She bit on her lower lip, looking at him like he was just an image conjured by her mind, her back straight and perfect as ever, alert. “He sent you?” She asked tentatively. “Really? You’re the one he chose this time?” A sly grin came to her features slowly, lighting up her whole face like the ones Katsuki held dearly in his dreams. “He finally caved in.”He arched his brow, not letting his lips return her smile. He scowled at her, admonishing, “You gave the boss no choice.”They stood in silence for a moment, the music still playing softly in the background. And for a moment, it was as if time stood still. It had been five years since they last saw each other after all. It was almost like they were back in that small world of hers where nothing could go wrong, time frozen and they could do anything. But as time was known to do, it went on without a care of the two people in that studio. A long loud honk came from the street below them accompanied with a series of shouts that brought them back to their grim reality.  Momo’s face turned sour really quick. “I did what I had to do. You left me,” she gritted through her teeth, the anger in her eyes cold. Her voice dropped down to a whisper, her dark eyes glistening with tears, “You chose my father over me.” Katsuki couldn’t do anything but stare, every part of his body itching to gather her up in his arms and stop her tears with kisses as though he wasn’t the reason for them. “You chose  power  over me,” she hissed. “And you’ve been a bad Princess,” he said back, his voice raspy and low, practically growling, as the images that he had been shown of all the things Momo had been doing for the past two years came to mind. Things and actions that even her father had had enough of that he had to bring Katsuki back for her. For a while, she didn’t speak. She strode to where her bag was on the floor and picked it up, not once breaking her gaze away from him. “It got you back, didn’t it?” She asked, shrugging in a nonchalant manner and strode closer to him. “I always get what I want.”“Momo—,”She didn’t stop walking until there were no steps to take. “My life is in your hands.” She leaned in close to him, making Katsuki freeze in place. She kissed his cheek, just right before the corner of his lips. “Welcome back, Katsuki,” she whispered without pulling back, brushing her nose against his as she dragged her flat palm down his chest down to his belt where she lingered her hand over for a few moments like she was going to go lower. He swallowed.Then she pushed him out of the way and stormed out of the studio in the same beat. Katsuki already knew she was going to make his life a living hell as he moved to follow her without a second thought, ready to guard her from anything that could bring her harm even from himself if it came to it.
<<EOFANFIC>>
