completion: Bakugo Katsuki sat restrained in a chair, surrounded by members of the League of Villains. Tomura had just paused for an answer to his practiced recruitment spiel. Emiko stood between him and Himiko, wishing she’d stayed in her room. Just seeing his face sparked fear in her, even though his fiery glare was fixed solely on Tomura. They seemed locked in a staring contest. Neither blinked, neither made any moves for a moment. It was just Bakugo and Tomura, and the offer that hung between them. The tense silence was broken with a barking laugh.“That’s fucking rich. I’m not a villain, assholes, and if I was, I wouldn’t join a buncha fuckin’ extras like you.” A smug smirk spread across his face as he leaned towards Tomura as if he was the one in charge. Her body instinctively moved away. She could hear sparks, little fireworks popping from Bakugo, though he was wearing cuffs that covered his hands. He shouldn’t be able to use his quirk. He shouldn’t.Tomura just laughed, though the way he raked his nails up and down his neck betrayed his frustration. Her mask suddenly seemed stifling. The air was thick, her airways tight. There was no reason for panic. She was safe, she was fine. Bakugo couldn’t hurt her. If he tried he’d be dead, she’d kill him But she still couldn’t breathe. Without thought, she ripped her mask off, quietly hyperventilating.Another laugh; this time mocking. “Of fuckin’ course you’re a ‘villain’, Kekkan.” His determined gaze turned malicious as he bared his teeth. “Only a defect like you would ever join these extras.” Defiance flared in her tense chest, her mouth filling with the taste of blood. She’d bitten her cheek. Against better judgement, she shoved past Himiko and stood in front of Bakugo.“They’re n-not fucking extras.”“They’re not on your level.” He snarked, implying that she was somehow lower than an extra. She knew he considered her subhuman. It didn’t stop that from hurting. From angering her. “It’s a wonder the League of Villains let you in. Are you fuckin’ Crusty Hands McFuckface or somethin’?”Her fist made contact with his face quicker than Tomura could reply. Bakugo’s nose cracked on impact, her knuckles throbbing. “Tomura w-would never.” Emiko defended, disgusted at the insinuation. Neither of them could even imagine each other that way, they were practically siblings for fuck’s sake! “You’re fucking pathetic! You’ll regret this once you’re in Tartarus,” His laugh grated at her ears as she shook with rage.“You’re more of a fucking villain than any of us will ever be.” Her voice was steady and cold, the feelings that had been whirling around her head coming to a swift stop. “Heh?” That asshole had the audacity to be amused at the accusation. Someone pressed a knife into her hand, hilt first. There was no need to look back to know that it was Himiko. The other girl pressed a kiss on the back of the hand that held her knife. Her favorite knife.Bakugo barely shifted in his chair, his eyes dark. “You really are a defect.” The moment he noticed the knife, he raised a perfect eyebrow. “You won’t do shit.” She stepped closer. The solid hilt of her weapon sat comfortably in her hand. Who did he fucking think he was?“You think you’re so fucking strong, huh Bakugo?” This was beginning to feel like an out-of-body experience, words popping into her brain and passing through her mouth without a filter. Her previous anxiety had been replaced with an icy clarity. Though her limbs still buzzed, it was with something else. “You think that you can do whatever the fuck you want, because you have such a heroic quirk, you’re going to be Number One.”Her voice came out louder than she meant it to. Hot tears welled up in her eyes, blurring Bakugo’s detestable form. Though he had been kidnapped, he was calm. He had come through barely scathed. He was fine, while she bore the scars of his hatred. “You will never,” The word was punctuated by a step towards him. “Ever,” She shifted her grip on the blade, leaning forward, leaning over him. “Be a hero.”Her arm shot out to grasp his throat tightly. Ruby eyes that usually held such fire, such self-assurance, were afraid. Despite that, they were set in an ever-present glare. He liked to pretend he was untouchable, invincible, all-powerful, even in the face of his own death. “You’re bluffing.” He choked out, wheezing as she tightened her grip. “You won’t do it. You’re t-too weak.”No. She wasn’t. In fact, he was. Bakugo Katsuki, self-proclaimed future Number 1 Hero, was at her mercy. He gulped, trying to get in any air. She felt the muscles in his throat move with the action. His life was in her hands. Her mouth twisted itself into a smile. She felt giddy, energy sparking throughout her body. “Are you fucking crazy?” Now he was scared, she could tell.A laugh escaped her, and it felt so natural, so freeing, “I hate you.” Tears streamed down her face, dripping onto his face as she looked over him. Satisfaction bloomed at the sight of tears on his paling face as he lost breath, even if they weren’t his. She felt like spring wound tight, like the moment before a gun is fired. It was just her and her enemy. Their eyes met, him looking up and her looking down. Seeing him like this, below her, caused something in her to preen. It demanded more. It filled her with a deep hunger, a burning desire to ruin him. “I hate you so fucking much.” Despite being pale in the face, he still growled as if he were the predator. “You w-won’t.”Feigning mercy, she let go. Stepped back. A triumphant grin replaced his terror, eyes that had just been wide with terror lit with confidence. Taking it in, she adjusted her hold on her knife. Her heart pounded like she’d been in a fight. Breaths came out heavy and harsh, her eyes burning. Bakugo dared to laugh, dared to taunt her. “I knew you’d fail. Defects can’t do shit.”A hum of acknowledgment accompanied a stomping kick to his knee. It crunched against the edge of the chair, drawing out a shout from the ‘undefeatable’ Bakugo Katsuki. She followed it up with the next one, imagining his kneecaps shattering, imagining him having to crawl for the rest of his life. “Argh, you fucking bitch! I’ll kill you!”Even now, his threats affected her. Faint sparks of something like fear skittered throughout her nerves. It made her indescribably itchy, her skin feeling uncomfortably electric. She cut through the rope tying him down. “Maybe in another life.” She snarled, grabbing him by his aggravating blond hair and raising her knife. Her hands shook in the momentary pause before she brought the knife down.Her knife plunged into his chest with little sound except the gasp that escaped him. Now he looked genuinely afraid. Finally, he understood the fucking consequences of his actions. She yanked the knife out of his flesh, crimson blood following its exit. She knew he was in immense pain right now. His lips wobbled and his jaw was visibly tense, his breath alredy labored. His pain felt like her release, a weight lifting momentarily until—he leaned up, grimacing, and bit her nose.She dropped him. Then stabbed him. And then she did it again. She drove the knife into him almost recklessly, her usual care for efficiency forgotten. Her aim was impaired by blurry vision and adrenaline. Each wound she made, each expression of pain from him, each spreading blood stain on his UA uniform was like a reward. This was what she got, what she deserved after years of him. Not only him, but everyone else who’d made her life hell. He was one of the worst in a long line of abusers.The weapon slipped out of her blood-soaked hands long after she’d killed him. She was on the floor, breath coming out in rough pants. Though her hands prickled as his blood dried on her hands, the rest of her felt blissfully numb. Nothing in her responded to him now, except for a flood of relief and satisfaction. And yet, looking at his body and sitting in the aftermath of his murder, she choked up.Hot tears ran down her face as she began to sob, hyperventilating and digging her nails into her palms. She didn’t understand. She was so fucking happy, she felt safe with him here for once, she wouldn’t be hurt by him again—and she was having a breakdown. Someone’s voice broke through the haze, arms thrown around her clearing it away.“It’s okay! You did it, Miko-chan!”She allowed Himi-chan to pick her up off the ground as a portal formed underneath the mutilated corpse that had been Bakugo Katsuki. Emiko melted into her arms, clutching her like if she let go, she’d get lost in this. A familiar hand rested on her shoulder. “I’m… proud of you.” Rasped Tomu-nii, and her heart swelled with love. She loved her family, she loved Himi-chan and Tomu-nii and Kurogiri and Twice and Magne and even Dabi and Spinner and Mr. Compress. For once, she felt like she wasn’t an outcast. Amid villains, covered in blood with the body of her abuser on the floor; this was where she felt safest.Though she hadn’t meant to kill him, she didn’t regret it.<<EOFANFIC>>

completion: Flying towards the main battle, Hawks couldn't help but think back to the events that had lead to this. When he had heard from Twice about Shigaraki's plan on upgrading, he had known that he had to out a stop to it before it could even happen or else the whole League wouldn't be redeemable anymore. And so he did. He informed the Commission about the hideout and stayed out of the heroes' way; he had kept Twice busy, but aside from that he hadn't taken part in the raid. No villain had been armed by him. Now it was time to finally act on his idea. Hawks landed between the heroes and the villains in the battlefield, his back directly in front of Endeavor. He folded his wings and watched with dull eyes as Shigaraki lounged at him for being a goddamn traitor. Before he could reach him the hero extended a hand in his direction. The invitation was clear and everyone stopped to look at the number 2 as if he had gone mad. Maybe he had "I can get you and the whole League in the new villain rehabilitation program of my agency. You don't have to be thrown into Tartarus, with my influence and if I were to take full responsibility for you, the Commission will allow it." He paused to let that information sink in. Because he was so popular and well liked, the people would support his idea, everyone knew it. "This society needs to change, I know that better than most. But killing those who are innocent isn't the way of doing it." Shigaraki snarled at the hero, raising his hand to once again prepare himself to disintegrate Hawks. Suddenly he felt his quirk leave him and he narrowed his eyes, checking subtly his surroundings. Eraserhead must be there somewhere. His attention snapped back to the traitor as he kept talking. Did he ever stop? His brain was getting foggy "Take my hand Shigaraki, either to kill me or to give you and your League a chance to change." Slightly behind Hawks Endeavor's stare shifted from the villains to the winged hero. "Hawks-" "Please shut up Endeavor-san." And he did, without any complaints. There was a weird note in Hawks voice that made all pros at the scene look at his back. He didn't turn to meet even one gaze, his eyes focused solely on the League of villains. There was a lull in the battlefield, neither side moved or spoke. Shigaraki slightly relaxed his stance, bringing up a hand to scratch at his neck. This would be complicated. He stared at the still outstretched hand, before looking at his companions. Spinner met his gaze evenly, completely trusting his decision.  Toga was shifting her bright eyes from the hand to Shigaraki, her opinion clear in her lack of hostility. He didn't bother looking at Kurogiri, he knew that no matter what his answer would be, he would always have him by his side.  Compress' posture was pondering, as if he wasn't all that sure of the realism of it, but also wouldn't hate it if it was indeed true.  Twice was focused intesely on Hawks and where before betrayal had been written all over him, now hope had taken its place. The hero still wanted to help them, just in a different way. Dabi was the most surprising of them all. His brows were furrowed, but the corners of his mouth were twitching, like he was about to smile. Huh, he wasn't aware that he and Hawks had gotten this close during the latter's examination trial -lots of good that did-. The number 2's voice brought Shigaraki's attention back to him once again. Why was he still feeling so at ease in Hawks presence? He had betrayed them. "Make your choice Shigaraki and walk away today with either my full support or a corpse." The villain simply glared at the other, he knew damn well he couldn't kill him or even harm him with Eraserhead there. With a blink Hawks seemed to finally realize it too and he turned his head away from him to look at something in a random alleyway.  "Eraserhead turn off your quirk, there will be no need for it." The sentence was followed by an intense, seemingly one sided, staring contest, which Shigaraki decided Hawks had won, if the feeling of his quirk rushing back to the tips of his fingers was anything to go by. Now he could kill the hero, the traitor. Hawks was back at staring at them and he opened his mouth again. Shigaraki was tempted to just disintegrate him that very moment, but something -no, it was not trust, not anymore- compelled him to listen. "I haven't told the Commission any useful information about any of you. If I had, you would all be either dead or captured by now."  "Oh, so should we be grateful, traitor?" Shigaraki interrupted the hero's speech, speaking for the first time since Hawks had landed. His hissing voice held something dangerous, but it wasn't anger as one would expect, it was- It was hurt. "No, definitely not, I was merely saying it to make my point." He smiled, not the lazy, cocky smile he had when speaking with other heroes, or the bright, cheerful one he had with the oress and public. It was smaller, softer and his eyes came alive. He often had that smile with them and it was becoming increasingly difficult for Shigaraki to convince himself that it had been just an act to make them trust him. "I believe in you, always have. Under all that hurt and damage brought to you by this society and people with more power that they should have, you are good. You're good people, I know that, I saw that. People with hopes and dreams you fight to turn into reality. And as long as you want to, you can still change." From somewhere behind him Twice let out a strangled sound and beside him Dabi made an abrupt movement, taking half a step forward before recollecting himself. He knew what they wanted, it was all too clear. It was something that they needed.  But what about him? Was he about to follow the very same damned man who had been betraying them for months? Blindly place his shattered trust in his hands only to have him break it again? What was it that Tomura wanted? He lowered his hand from where it was furiously scratching bloodied flesh, staring at the one still outstretched in front of him. What was it that Tenko wanted?<<EOFANFIC>>

completion:
Big red shoes pitter pattered against the forest floor. “Kacchan, c’mon!”“Slow down, Zuku!” The two small boys finally came to a stop in front of a pond with a small waterfall on the side. It was a beautiful little area that only they knew about. The boys had dubbed it their special meeting spot. They would usually meet at the park or each other’s houses, but this was a private spot that meant a lot to them.Izuku waited until the blond was close enough behind him before turning around with a shy grin.“Zuku, what is it? Why’d you wanna come here today? We haven’t come here in a while.”Izuku looked down, his green eyes looked at his feet, stubby hands nervously behind his back, as if holding something.“I- um, w-wanted to give Kacchan a gift.” “Really?” Katsuki flushed a bit. Izuku nodded adorably, his viridian curls bouncing with the movement.He slowly took the pale purple flowers from behind his back. He handed it- well, shoved it into his best friends’ hands. Usually Katsuki didn’t like silly flowers, but seeing the other bashfully giving him some made his heart flutter.“U-Um! Mom said it m-means that I admire you a-and your strength. And I do, Kacchan is amazing! I think Kacchan I-Is really cool!” The blond was at a loss for words. No one had ever given him flowers before. “Is this why you didn’t want to come here?” “I didn’t want Kacchan to see me growing the flowers here..”“You.. grew them for me?” Katsuki had wondered why Izuku actively avoided their main spot whenever they were together. Part of the blond hurt at the thought that he didn’t wanna be here anymore.Izuku nodded again, his cheeks flushed to the point where he looked like a strawberry. Katsuki bit his cheek.“Uwaah-! No biting, Kacchan!”He pulled away and hugged him. Izuku thought his little heart would explode since he knew his best friend didn’t like physical affection that much. Once they pulled away, Katsuki looked to the side. His red eyes scanning the other parts of the forest. Looking everywhere but him.“Thanks.. Zuku.”Izuku lit up instantly. “You’re welcome, Kacchan!” That day had been a good day for the blond. He remembers returning home, still with a light flush on his cheeks.His mom came out of the kitchen. “Welcome home, brat. How was your day with Izu?” “It was fine.” He said, attempting to hide the flowers behind his back.“Whatcha got there?” She inquired. “Tch. It’s nothing!”Mitsuki was unimpressed and crossed her arms with a smirk, staring down at the embarrassed child. “Brat, I know you’re hiding something behind your back.” “Am not!”“Katsuki.” The blond grumbled when he knew that there was no point in hiding them. Damn, his mother was smart. He shyly got the flowers out from behind his back. “Zuku got me flowers, ma.” Mitsuki was going to tease him when she saw what type of flowers they were. Since she was Inko’s best friend, she knew that the other knew about flowers. She loved to garden.The flowers he held were Blue Stars. She cooed, making Katsuki blush more. She turned and went to tell her husband. Katsuki grumbled when he could hear her squeals from the kitchen.Nevertheless, he went up to his room and sat on his bed. He placed the flowers there before going back downstairs to get a vase and water for them in his room. He didn’t know how to take care of flowers properly, but he’ll ask the hag later. Once they were in the safety of a vase by his window, he couldn’t help but feel that pounding in his heart again. It was always that same feeling that he couldn’t describe.Part of him thought it was just happiness. He really had been happy when Izuku gave him the flowers. It was sweet and unlike any gift he had ever gotten from anyone.
“U-Um! Mom said it m-means that I admire you a-and your strength. And I do, Kacchan is amazing! I think Kacchan I-Is really cool!”
 I admire you.. Katsuki flushed and groaned again. He wanted to do something for Izuku too. He thought about getting him flowers as well. Since Katsuki was the way he was, he was determined to get him the best damn flowers ever. —— They walked together once again, a week later, to their meeting spot.“Zuku. I got you something..”Izuku’s big eyes were filled with curiosity and wonder, as he tilted his head in a cute way, as if asking a question.“Kacchan got something for me?” “Tch. Yeah. Close your eyes, silly Zuku.”Izuku giggled in anticipation, but closed his eyes.“Open your hands.” Izuku obediently did it as the blond boy placed the flowers in his hand. “Open your eyes..” The greenette opened his eyes and saw a mini bouquet of some white, clumpy looking flowers tied together by an orange string.“I looked it up on ma’s computer. Their Gardenias.”Izuku remembered that that was the flower that his mom taught him about as well. He blushed as he remembered their meaning. He started to tear up as Katsuki swore he saw his eyes sparkle as the light reflected off of his glossy eyes. “K-Kacchan.” He launched himself into Katsuki’s arms. His tiny hands grabbing at his shirt. “Does.. does Kacchan really mean it?”Katsuki felt his heart break when he heard the uncertainty in his voice. “Of course I mean it, Zuku! They aren’t for any other extra!” He pulled away and wiped the other boys’ tears, even though they didn’t stop. “Stop crying..” He muttered sweetly as he put his small hands on Izuku’s face, using his thumbs to wipe the oncoming tears.“C-Can’t help it.. Kacchan is so sweet to me.” He leaned in as the blond took his hand off of his face and kissed his cheek. “T-Thank you, Kacchan!” His face lit up the entire area. He swore he even saw sparkles on his eyelashes as he closed his eyes with a happy grin. From that point on, Katsuki had actually liked to get him flowers. Specifically the romantic-themed ones. Instead of all the time like he wanted, he left it to just every time it was the nerd’s birthday. Seeing his big round eyes light up when he knew most of the flowers’ meanings made it all worth it. Katsuki discovered that the feeling in his heart all this time was love. He knew Izuku was all he needed in his life.<<EOFANFIC>>

prompt: write a story about Haikyuu!!,  General Audiences No Archive Warnings Apply F/M 僕のヒーローアカデミア | Boku no Hero Academia | My Hero Academia (Anime & Manga) Jirou Kyouka/Kaminari Denki Kaminari Denki Jirou Kyouka Kirishima Eijirou Fluff Canon Compliant Slice of Life
completion:
Denki thinks he’ll never fully understand Jiro.Oh, sure, he knows her, at least the way friends know each other. He knows she didn’t always want to be a pro hero, that she learned to play the guitar at the age of five, that her jacks can stretch up to ten metres, that she lets out a sort of suffocated snort when she really wants to belly-laugh instead.He knows that she likes sushi and katsudon, but is just as much of a fan of greasy American food, that she can put away a full submarine sandwich without batting an eyelid, that she prefers people to not know about her sweet tooth and that she really loves spiced apple cake.He knows that she’s always been more than a little self-conscious about her quirk, that she struggled at middle school and faced difficulties forming connections there because she didn’t have the flashiness to stand out or the confidence to always stand her ground.He knows that she’s among the most sardonic people he’s ever met, a near-endless well of vitriolic quips and putdowns that only ever seem to come out to play when it’s just him getting on her nerves, and that she’ll back off when Momo gives her a reproachful look out of the corner of her eye.He knows that she has an absolutely beautiful singing voice, and that she calms her nerves by belting out eighties power-ballads and thrash-metal staples, alternating between guttering howls and hollering notes, but that she will only do it in the safety of her room, where she thinks nobody else can hear her.He has all these preconceived ideas over what kind of girl she is, and yet every time he thinks he’s got her figured out, she disarms him with another smile.It always comes when he least expects it too. When he’s chewing on the end of a pencil, trying to nail down the answers from the latest pop quiz from Present Mic, his gaze will wander to her in class, and she’ll flash him a smirk.When they’re out in field practice, stripped down to their uniformed gear, and he’s trying to hit the targets set up across the gymnasium with a bolt of electricity, he’ll glance at her and be rewarded with an encouraging grin.When they are out on mock studies, waltzing through combat situations, he’ll catch her as she stabs her jacks in and she’ll return his expression with a burst of euphoric adrenaline.He’s stopped trying to catalogue all the smiles she has – there are too many to count, and each one sends a different shiver down his spine, from happiness, to apprehension, to frustration, to absolute glee.Denki is shook out of his reverie, staring across the common space towards where Jiro is sat in conversation with Uraraka and Yaoyorozu, when Kirishima taps him on the shoulder. He jerks with a start and pivots to face his classmate.“Dude, you OK?” comes the question. “I’ve been trying to talk to you for, like, five minutes, man.”His mind blanks for a moment before he refocuses. “Yeah, I’m fine. Just lost in thought.”Kirishima isn’t dumb and Denki knows that. It doesn’t surprise him that the redhead promptly flashes his gaze across to the gaggle of girls squished onto the loveseats across the room from them.His friend returns his gaze to him. “I can figure that.”Denki pouts. He’s tempted to point out that he’s seen Kirishima’s gaze caught on Ashido for more time than could be called platonically friendly, but the wiser part of him decides he does not want to open that can of worms.“Eh, screw you,” he responds instead. “What’s up?”Kirishima scratches his head. “Do you want to come play pool? Midoriya and Iida are going to play doubles against me, and Bakugo’s turned me down as partner.”The latter titbit isn’t exactly a surprise. Their blonde classmate has been a foul mood all week long. He has been shooting violent glares – well, more than usual – at Midoriya, who had uncharacteristically paid him little attention in return. He was probably sulking as a result.Denki stretches out from the stool at the breakfast bar where he had been perched. His neck cracks, and from across the room, he catches Jiro’s gaze momentarily flash to him before it returns to Ururaka, as she gesticulates.“Yeah, sure thing,” he says. “Let me just grab my jacket.”He had left his garment draped over the back of the sofa earlier on, and ambles around the counter to head on over and pick it up. As he passes the girls, he momentarily feels a burst of static warp the air, followed by a low hiss.“Kyoka, you alright?” comes Yaoyorozu’s voice behind him, and Denki pivots to glance over his shoulder. Jiro is shaking out her wrist, grimacing slightly, as if she had just been zapped –
Oh.
He did have a tendency to let off little shocks when he was flustered. He hadn’t thought being lost in his own mind necessarily qualified as such, but apparently that wasn’t the case.“Yeah, ‘m fine,” Jiro responds, neutrally, still flexing her limbs. Denki can see the small hairs on the back of her arm, stood erect and ever so slightly tremoring.Before he can apologise, she jerks her head towards him and locks eyes. He braces himself for a acidic remark about keeping his quirk until control, because it’s so basic, y’know –“Let me know next time you’re gonna do that dude,” she says without heat, and the smile with her words is positively blinding.He desperately hopes his jaw doesn’t go slack, or that his blush races up to his cheekbones, but before he can respond, she has turned back to the rest of her friends. He glances over at Kirishima, who looks between the pair before he simply shrugs.Yes, Denki thinks he’ll never fully understand Jiro. And to be honest? That’s absolutely fine with him.<<EOFANFIC>>

prompt: write a story about Haikyuu!!,  General Audiences No Archive Warnings Apply M/M 僕のヒーローアカデミア | Boku no Hero Academia | My Hero Academia (Anime & Manga) Kaminari Denki/Shinsou Hitoshi Shinsou Hitoshi Kaminari Denki Fluff very minor angst Toshi makes chilli Denki has a history with chilli Denks has bad timing Love Confessions Dates are discussed super short They Own a little Inn together!!!
completion:
Denki’s smile is strained as another out of towner checks out, being insulting enough that he almost lost his temper. Almost. He sighs in relief as the doors close behind the prick, and he grabs the walkie immediately.
“Where are you at Toshi?” asks Denki into the walkie before he pulls out the bell and the lunchbreak mini stand that sits behind the bell on the counter’s half-wall ledge.
“Staff kitchen, the sink’s giving me trouble. You good, Denks?” asks Hitoshi, sounding frustrated and worried as his voice comes through the walkie.
“Just tired. See ya in a minute.” replies Denki, holding the walkie close to his lips as he double-checks everything is as it should be.
It’s quiet after that as Denki makes his way to the staff kitchen, the room sits through an archway in the middle of the space between the actual employee break room and the front desk. Of course, Hitoshi is underneath the sink, cursing the pipes as usual, when Denki steps into the room. His interest is piqued by the steaming pot sitting on a hot pad on the table, two plates set around it, and Denki’s brows scrunch together at the set-up. They usually eat right next to each other, not across from each other… almost like they’re on a… a date…?
“Denki, what are you doing?” asks Hitoshi as he catches sight of his feet from where he’s dealing with a fucked-up pipe.
“Uh, just trying to see what you got hiding in this covered pot that smells a lot like the spicy chili my Gram Gram makes for Gramps. But also… How are you doing with that pipe?” asks Denki softly as he settles himself into the chair and watches Hitoshi lean up and use the wrench to tighten something.
“I had to go get a replacement one from dad’s pal down the road, but once I get this tightened, it should be good to go.” replies Hitoshi lightly, laying the wrench next to him to double check everything. “Can you turn the water on for me?”
“Hm, sure!” replies Denki easily as he stands and places himself off to the side of the sink to turn the water on lightly.
“Cool, it looks like I only need to tighten it a little bit more. Go ahead and turn it off for me, Denks, thanks.” replies Hitoshi softly as Denki listens and shuts the water off before leaning over to look at him. “Hey, I uh- That is the chili your Grams makes, I had to call her up, so I hope it’s right.”
Denki feels his heart pound in his chest, and he doesn’t know why he’s still waiting.
“Hey, Toshi,” starts Denki softly as he looks at this man he’s wanted for far too long.
“Yeah, Denks.” replies Hitoshi quietly as he finishes fixing the pipe.
“Will you go out with me? Dinner in a few days, maybe? When your dad and Pops come to help for the weekend? I’d just really like it if you were up to going on a date with me…” says Denki nervously as he wrings his hands, trying to sound casual as he lets himself lean back against the counter, not looking anywhere but at the wall.
“Wha-?” starts Hitoshi as he moves to lean up, only to smack his head harshly against the pipes. “Fuck, shit, ow!”
“Oh, fuck, I’m such an idiot. Are you okay, Hitoshi? I should’ve waited to ask you. Fuck me. I’ll get an ice pack from the freezer!” says Denki as he curses himself, leaning down to look at Hitoshi as he manages to disentangle himself from the mess that is their sink pipes before Denki is off rushing to the freezer to pull out one of their ice packs and a rag to lessen the frigid feeling of the pack.
“Denks, calm down, it’s okay. I’m probably gonna have a goose egg sized knot on my forehead, but I’m alright.” says Hitoshi with laughter in his voice as he looks at Denki’s frantic rushing.
“Here, put this on your head, maybe we can keep it from being too bad. And then I’ll have to make you do it every like twenty minutes or something. Well, twenty on and twenty off, that way you’re not freezing your head. But yeah, that’s gonna be the plan. Let’s get you up and at the table, I can dip out the food, but why plates? Oh, there are bowls on top of the plates, I’m an idiot. Okay, come on.” rambles Denki as he tugs Hitoshi up, guiding him to the table and lightly holds the ice against his forehead over the red spot starting to knot up already.
“Denki, I appreciate that you’re freaking out. Truly, but you know I've been hurt worse fixing this stuff up. So, would you just let me respond to your question?” asks Hitoshi with a chuckle as he cups Denki’s face as he leans down by him, bringing them close together.
“I-uh- sure…” murmurs Denki nervously as his eyes look for an escape.
“Yes, we can go on a date, yes we can do that when my dad and pops get here, but I made this meal for us in the hope that we could consider this our first date in the place we built together. Would that be okay?” asks Hitoshi softly, smiling in a way that makes Denki want to kiss him or cry because it’s so fucking soft.
“Yes please.” replies Denki happily, tears blurring his vision as he blinks rapidly, letting them drip from his lashes as that happy feeling begins to explode in him.
“Good, then why don’t we eat? And we can talk about why you sounded so off on the walkie.” replies Hitoshi lightly as his thumbs wipe away the last few tears that fall as Denki grins so hard his cheeks hurt.
“That sounds good to me.” replies Denki as Hitoshi releases his now dry, lightly streaked face, and he stands only to slip into his chair moments later.
And they talk, dipping out their chili that tastes exactly like Denki’s Gram Gram makes, and it’s perfect because it’s them. It’s in the little motel that they built, in the little town that brought them together in the first place.

It’s them.

So, when they’re done eating, when they finish packing the food as the bell on the front desk dings, Denki and Hitoshi share a soft, chili kiss before hurrying to do their jobs. Hitoshi answers the phone as it goes off while Denki checks the new out-of-towners in, and it feel right.


<<EOFANFIC>>

completion: Hawk’s day just kept going downhill. But then again when did it not.The commission were being bitches (nothing new) and decided to put him in another diet because the other four totally hadn’t ended up with him in the hospital because of lack the right nutrition and his handlers being to stubborn to admit the diets were only doing harm.Then, like the absolute, complete and utter assholes they were they decided to tell him, at the last fucking minute, he had a press conference. With Endeavour. Who just so happened to be the reason his boyfriend has massive amounts of trauma and faked his own death.The only thing Hawks was looking forward to was meeting up with his boyfriend who just so happened to be the A ranked villain Dabi. But, because the day just couldn’t get worse, there was a hostage situation near the end of his shift that took a couple hours to resolve and that meant he was late.When he finally got home Hawks kicked off his boots and took off his jacket before stumbling to the bathroom to clean some of the grim of his face.“Hey pretty bird.” He heard from behind him before familiar arms wrapped around his waist.“How was work birdie? I saw the news.” Hawks allowed himself to crumble. Leaning against Dabi and turning around to hug him back and bury his face into Dabi’s shirt.Dabi picked Hawks up and carried him over to the sofa. Rubbing circles on Hawks’s back Dabi asked, “What did they do?” Who ‘they’ was was clear to both of them. The commission. Dabi knew the shady things the commission did. He had enough evidence to send them crashing and burning. But he couldn’t reveal it to the public until Hawks left, otherwise Hawks would be affected as well.Hawks managed to get the words, ”Another. Fucking. Diet.” out with each word punctuated by a sob. Hawks continued to sob into his boyfriends shoulder.His sobs eventually began to slow down and become quieter. Then finally he fell asleep curled up on Dabi’s chest with his arms wrapped protectively around Hawks.——When Hawks woke up he and Dabi were now curled up in bed instead of the sofa. He shot up and twisted his neck almost 180 degrees to look at the clock. After a few seconds of blinking at it to try and make sense of what it was saying he remembered that today was, thankfully, his once every two week full rest day.Dabi groaned and tugged on his arm, “‘s too early.” he mumbled, “you’re letting the cold air in, c’mere.” Dabi dragged Hawks back down onto the bed and latched on wrapping his arms around the winged hero. “Don’ leave yet.” Dabi slurred into his neck. Hawks chuckled, “Ok ok. I won’t, I don’t need to today luckily.” he assured the overgrown heated teddy bear that was clinging to him. Hawks sighed in relief as he ran his fingers through Dabi’s hair as he let the stress of waking up too late melt away.The sound of knocking ripped the peaceful couple out of their light doze.“Hawwwwks are you expecting someone?” Dabi groaned while nudging the hero not so gently towards the edge of the bed.“No.” Hawks huffed as he got out of bed and stretched his wings. He made his way to the front door of his apartment, shutting the bedroom door in case it was one of his colleagues.He peered through the peep hole to see who it was.It was his bestfriend, the bunny hero Mirko. He took a deep breath to brace for the unholy amount of energy she always had in the morning.Then he opened the door.Mirko aka Rumi was indeed at his door. Holding a…? Hawks barely had time to process the chicken plushie in her hand before it whacked him in the face and she was gone.Hawks, grumbled as he stood up and picked up the chicken plushie from where it landed beside him and walked over to the “chicken closet” so it could join the other 1638 plushies that had already been yeeted at him.After adding to the mountain of plushies he made his way back to the bedroom to rejoin Dabi.He found Dabi star-fishing on the bed and went to go poke him to get him to shift over but before he could Dabi’s phone buzzed and both of them jumped about a foot in the air.With his wings still puffed up Hawks reached over to pick up Dabi’s phone and hand it to his villainous boyfriend.Dabi unlocked his phone and looked at the message. He groaned loudly, “Handy McFuckface wants us to come innnn it’s ‘important’ apparently.” Dabi slurred, still half asleep. Hawks pouted, “Do we have to?” he whined. There was another buzz. Dabi checked the new message. “Well. If we don’t go we’ll probably die.” Dabi said matter of factly, “It’s games night.”——When Dabi and Hawks walked into the bar that was the LoV’s headquarters they saw a tense stand-off between Shigaraki and Spinner.The TV was on the character selection screen. Suddenly Shigaraki threw a chair at Spinner, “You fucking BITCH!” Shigaraki screeched, “IM PRINCESS PEACH YOU LITTLE BASTARD!”“IM TALLER THAN YOU AND ITS MY TURN TO BE PEACH! YOU WERE PEACH LAST TIME ITS MY TURN!”“DONT BRING HEIGHT INTO THIS!”“SHORT.”After a few more minutes of arguing they flipped a coin. Shigaraki won and was now subtly-not-so-subtly rubbing it in Spinners face.——Hawks groaned and rolled over. He had to go into work today and there was no getting out of it.Prying himself out of Dabi’s arms he got up and reluctantly started getting dressed into his hero uniform ignoring his boyfriend’s pleas for him to come back to bed.Making his way to the kitchen Hawk’s mood dropped further as he glanced at the new diet he had been put on.After he ate his sad excuse for a breakfast he kissed Dabi who was staggering out of the bedroom before heading out to work.——Fuck this bullshit he’s out. He could only bear so much of Endeavour being Endeavour and he was at his limit. He was calling Dabi.Hawks stepped out of the meeting room he had been in with Endeavour and a couple of assholes from the Commission to ‘go to the toilet’. In reality he was calling his boyfriend.After only two rings Dabi picked up, “Dabs,” Hawks said, speaking into his phone quietly, “now please. I can’t take it anymore. Please.”“You sure Birdie?”“Absolutely.”He hung up. Taking a deep breathe he put on a fake smile and went back into the meeting room.Less than 10 minutes later he received a notification and so did Endeavour. He glanced down at the message and smiled. It was a request for assistance in a fight against the League. Hawks jumped up and sprinted to the front door, wings spreading as soon as he was outside.It didn’t take long to reach the scene and it wasn’t hard to find either with the plumes of black smoke rising from several cars and shops.Hawks circled above the fight and was watching both sides intently.He knew the heroes thought he was looking out for them but in reality he was looking out for the League.His eyes zeroed in on Miriko, he could tell by her stance and the way her left ear was flicking that she was preparing for a kick. At Dabi.Hawks reacted with lightning speed diving down and grabbing Dabi while flying by just fast enough to dodge the bunny hero’s powerful hind legs.“Good to see you to Feathers.” Dabi wheezed slightly winded due to the speed Hawks had grabbed him and dragged him off the ground at.Hawks looked down and saw Miriko’s confused look. Then she got the attention of some of the other heroes present. They all looked up at him confusion morphing into looks of horror as one of them asked if Hawks could be the traitor.Hawks smirked as he flew to where Shigaraki and Kurogiri were standing. He gently placed his lover down before zooming of to grab the rest of the League and bring them back to Shigaraki, leaving stunned and confused now ex-coworkers behind.When they were all gathered Kurogiri opened up a warp gate and Hawks’s flock, his new family, went through.Hawks looked back and smiled sadly at Miriko and glared at the others. Especially Endeavour.He was going to have a lot of explaining to do when he next talked to Miriko. She deserved to know why.<<EOFANFIC>>

prompt: write a story about Haikyuu!!,  Teen And Up Audiences No Archive Warnings Apply Gen 僕のヒーローアカデミア | Boku no Hero Academia | My Hero Academia (Anime & Manga) Midoriya Izuku & Yagi Toshinori | All Might Aizawa Shouta | Eraserhead & Midoriya Izuku Midoriya Izuku Yagi Toshinori | All Might Aizawa Shouta | Eraserhead Tsukauchi Naomasa Nezu Class 1-A (My Hero Academia) Hurt Midoriya Izuku Protective Yagi Toshinori | All Might Protective Aizawa Shouta | Eraserhead Dimension Travel Villain Aizawa Shouta | Eraserhead Parental Yagi Toshinori | All Might Other Additional Tags to Be Added
completion:
Chapter Text
Midoriya is falling. Midoriya is falling into a vortex and can’t stop.Midoriya is falling into a vortex, can’t stop, and screaming at the top of his lungs.Midoriya blacks out. He wakes up. It wasn’t the slow, gradual kind of waking, like when coming off from an afternoon nap. No, he wakes up violently, in a panic, pushing himself up from the medical bed he was attached to and gasping for breath.“Young Midoriya!” a familiar voice calls from his side. But Midoriya is still too disoriented to recognize it right away. He flinches from the loud voice, trying to get away from the source.“Hey, hey, easy there, kid.” Gentle hands guide him back into a lying position, and he is too tired to argue against it. He just woke up and yet feels like he could sleep for another twelve hours.But he can’t sleep now. He needs to assess any threats, like he was taught to in class. It wasn’t safe to let his guard down.His eyes, pained from all the bright lights, attempts to blink away the blurriness in them and focus. There’s a large yellow dot to the side of him, their hands still at his shoulders and Midoriya realizes they're rubbing small circles onto his back in an attempt to comfort him. All at once his body sags into the hospital bed — and yes, he’s in a hospital, the familiar antiseptic smell assaulting his nose — and his mind settles just a bit easier. He knew that gesture.All Might. All Might is here. He is not in the hands of Shigaraki or Eraser. He is safe.He finds himself slipping back into unconsciousness and is powerless to stop it. The momentarily adrenaline rush he had when he woke was gone and all there was left was bone weary tiredness clawing throughout him, and the small comforting words All Might was whispering.  “You know, you shouldn’t be doing that. We still don’t know if he actually is Midoriya or, really, what the hell is happening at all considering there’s a Midoriya currently in class at UA. For all we know this could be Toga, or some other plan to destroy you from the League.” Tsukauchi sighs and rubs at his eyes tiredly. He was in desperate need of sleep, a shower, and food — in that order — but this was far more important.All Might was still standing over the sleeping figure in the hospital bed. He had taken his hands off their back but was soon replaced by resting on their head when they whimpered in their sleep. When he talks, his voice is filled with soft compassion. “You know as well as I do that Toga would’ve transformed back by now. Not to mention that she’s not that good of an actor. Did you see how absolutely terrified he looked when he woke up? Like- like  he thought he was about to be tortured… or maybe had been, before he was found.”“That still doesn’t leave out that this could be an attempt against you—”“Did you not hear what I said?” All Might hisses, turning to glare at the Detective. “He looked  terrified. He looked like he was ready to break his hands from those cuffs and jump out the window if it meant freedom. You can’t fake that.”Tsukauchi knows that. He agrees that the boy before them, covered in cuts and dark, ugly bruises, was not faking the panic that had flooded him as soon as he woke. Nor how he seemed to recognize All Might and instantly relax under the other man’s hands. But that only made him more suspicious — well, not exactly suspicious, more like wary. He was hesitant to let his guard down around someone who had been found on the outskirts of a forest in the early hours of the morning, unconscious and clothes filthy, no identification on him until someone at the hospital recognized him as the ‘bone breaking kid from UA’ and told the responding officer looking into the mysterious boy. Which had led him on the case and notifying All Might almost immediately.There were so many questions yet to be answered. The most glaring was why this kid looked like an exact copy of All Might’s successor, Midoriya Izuku. Tsukauchi had already confirmed with Nezu that there was no way the Midoriya at UA could’ve been Toga or some other imposter, security cameras proving there was no suspicious activity in the last twenty four hours. And blood tests confirmed they were an exact match with the one currently on file for Midoriya which while not impossible, were hard to fake. For all intents and purposes the boy All Might was currently shushing softly back to sleep was Midoriya Izuku.But Tsukauchi wasn’t going to take any chances, especially when All Might seemed so willing to accept it as law that this was his successor. One of them had to use their brain and, as usual, it was going to be him.Tsukauchi sighs again, his second within the past two minutes but the thousandth in the last twelve hours, and stretches his legs. “I’ll make some calls to my contacts again. See if I can get any information about cloning or, hell, maybe we finally reached the next big disaster — time travel.”All Mights snorts quietly, glancing at his friend in amusement. “Don’t joke about that. You’ll probably call it into existence. Not like that'd surprise me with our luck.”“I wasn’t joking.”“Go home, Tsukauchi. When you’re done calling around. He isn’t going to wake up anytime soon by the looks of it. You’ll need your energy when you talk to him when he does wake up.”Tsukauchi raises a disbelieving brow. “You? Trying to be the voice of reason and advocating for taking care of yourself? Maybe the League already got to you.” All Might sends him a half hearted glare. “Shut up. And get out, go.” He tries to shoo the Detective out but that requires leaving his spot at the bedside and he feels reluctant to do so. He feels tethered to the bed — no, not the bed, to the boy sleeping in the bed. It’s the same feeling he has when he visits young Midoriya in Recovery Girl’s office after getting hurt during training. Protective. Worried.“Alright, alright. I’m going.” Tsukauchi relents with a passing chuckle, moving towards the hospital door. His hand is on the handle when he glances back and asks, “And what about you? You should go get some sleep too while you can. I’ve got people posted at the door so no need to worry about him doing anything.”All Might shakes his head. He wasn’t worried about what the young boy would do in the slightest. If anything, he was worried about someone coming in and hurting  him, if looking at those injuries were anything to go by. “I’ll get some sleep here.” There was an old, wooden chair for visitors close to him. It’ll be uncomfortable to sleep in, and the sleep wouldn’t be refreshing at all, but it was better than the alternative which was leaving.He gazes down at the restless boy. He’s twitching in his sleep, chest rising faster, a sure sign of experiencing a nightmare. All Might’s hand, which had been sitting limply in the dirtied green curls, moved without his permission. His fingers card through gently, aware to not disturb the knots currently residing in his hair. And just like that, similar to earlier, the boy’s face relaxes — a soft puff of air hits All Might’s arm as his breathing turns normal.“He’s not your Midoriya, you know.”All Might knows this. His Midoriya is currently taking a math test back at UA. His Midoriya was safe and uninjured and clean. His Midoriya was not the boy he was presently comforting right before him.And yet… “It feels like him.” He admits in a choked whisper. He wasn’t All Might’s Midoriya but every instinct screamed at him that it was. He felt it right in his bones with every fiber of his being.The boy feels like Midoriya and right now Midoriya is in danger, injured, and alone. There was an ache in his heart, a deep unsettling feeling because he’ll be damned if he ever lets his boy be in harm’s way. He decides right then and there that he was going to protect the boy in front of him. Even as Tsukauchi gives him a disapproving look as he leaves, no doubt accurately reading the determination in his face but too tired to call him out on his recklessness at the moment, All Might doesn't care. His friend could list a hundred reasons why this was a bad idea but he only needed one for why it was good.Because this is Midoriya.
<<EOFANFIC>>

High School
completion: In a world where 80% of the world has a defining trait, a superpower, a quirk, something that incites a lifetime of decisions only they could make, what makes someone a hero? Is it the way they beat up criminals and pose for the camera, giving a rare motivational line every now and then? Is it someone who volunteers for their community, cleaning trash and doing small acts for the betterment of society? To Izuku Midoriya, being a hero meant giving everything you have to save one person. He wholeheartedly believed that to spur change in the world, you just have to help one person. If that is what it means to be a hero, why does he feel so alone? Why does it feel like he's the only one who would give his life away at a moment's notice? After being diagnosed Quirkless at 4 years old, he realized that the world is a lot different than he thought. Growing up around kids like Bakugo Katsuki, he realized there was a difference between the Heroes and the heroes, the professionals, and the ones whose bodies moved on their own.When Izuku was 8, he was still hopeful about being a Hero, he knew he didn't have a quirk, but Izuku was smart, he took notes on heroes, watched the news, and occasionally was a bystander to fights, trying to absorb as much information as he could. He still believed that all he needed was the will to save one person and to keep moving forward, no matter what anyone said. The bullying at school was getting worse, although he didn't get hit very often, he felt the stares, the abrasiveness in the voices directed to him, and the rage of his only friend whenever he did anything that didn't sit well with him, which was mostly everything. Izuku saw something in Bakugo Katsuki, something that made all of the yelling and punching acceptable to him, he saw something in him, he saw someone who had the potential to help millions, so much more than what Izuku could do. So he stayed close to him, he always tried catching up to him, because he was already so far ahead. He knew the consequences of annoying Bakugo, but he dealt with them, knowing it was worth it, seeing the spark that could one day save countless lives.At age 10, Izuku was used to his school life, he experienced everything people could throw at him and more, but it didn't make things any easier. He still strongly believed in his definition of a hero, still taking as many notes as he could about heroes, constantly surfing the web for new stories, when he stumbled upon the story of Danjuro Tobita. Tobita was a student at a Hero school who used his quirk to help someone who fell from a building, hindering the Pro Hero who was on their way to save them. He learned that Tobita was an upbeat student who wanted to inspire people by becoming famous himself, even though he had failed his provisional license test 4 times and was at risk of being kicked out. Izuku saw the similarities between him and Tobita, wanting to inspire people by becoming famous and saving the people he could. But, was this right? Was it right for someone completely unqualified (powerless?) to attempt to save someone, and risk interfering? If Izuku was there, would he have hindered the Pro in the same way, would his body moving on its own become something that costs lives instead of saving it? He didn't sleep that night, instead pondering this question and what it meant.At 12, Izuku was different, stories akin to Danjuro Tobita still heavily weighing on him. It caused Izuku to reexamine his definition of a hero. He used to intervene in fights all the time, not wanting other people to be hurt, but rather taking their suffering upon himself, but things had changed. When Izuku saw fights now, he hesitated, his body no longer moved on its own. He felt conflicted, he wasn't putting everything he had into saving one person, but when Tobita tried to save that falling worker, he caused more harm than good. Was this the same as Izuku intervening in fights? Did his intervention ultimately lead to someone being more hurt? Maybe the kids would be picked on even more if Izuku intervened. He wasn't sure anymore, he found himself freezing more often than usual. Eventually, he decided telling a teacher was his best course of action. An authority figure, someone the kids had to listen to... someone with power, someone who could make a difference. As he called the teachers, his eyes grew a little dim, feeling as if this was all he could ever do. Growing up made him realize that the world was a lot greyer than he thought. He learned about an American superhero, Captain Celebrity and started diving deep into his life. He was a hero who wanted to spread joy, but also occasionally waited for the cameras before he deployed. He was a playboy, someone who was constantly showing off and flirting, even when married and having a kid. He wasn't who Izuku's ideal hero was, but was it a bad thing? He was still saving people, and although he was a flirt and playboy, he was still a hero, someone who recognized his flaws and worked on improving himself. Izuku realized how one's views on heroism were impacted by the life one lives. How could anyone be a true hero as he envisioned, when everyone had been stained by the world?... or almost everyone. There was someone who was different, someone who stood out because of their charming personality and their dedication to saving people. Izuku had always been a huge fan of All Might but was also extremely curious about him. What made All Might so different? Was it the times he lived in that caused this disconnect? Why was he able to put his all into saving people and somehow keep his heroism seemingly untainted?At age 14, Izuku Midoriya's dream was crushed, meeting All Might in a fateful encounter that could've gone a million different ways. He learnt about All Might's injury, and how he was a husk of the man he once was. He asked if someone without a quirk could be a hero. Does someone like him have a chance? All Might's answer surprised him, telling Izuku that he shouldn't be a hero and that there are other ways to help people. It made him realize that All Might's heroism wasn't pure either. He put this persona on for the public, to keep the peace, but he was also someone who had seen the shades of grey of the world.As Izuku walked back home, he heard explosions and saw a crowd forming. He made his way to the front and realized it was the sludge villain, someone who got free because of his previous intervention with All Might. He realized who the villain's new hostage was as well, Bakugo Katsuki. Izuku looked at him and saw many things, a friend, bully, classmate, (hero?). Izuku thought back to the fights he chose not to intervene in, and how he called the teachers instead, and saw that the Pros were already here, but, they couldn't save Bakugo, he was going to die if they didn't act and they were still just waiting for someone with a better quirk.Then Izuku saw his eyes, he saw the eyes of someone who was calling out for help, who was calling for someone, anyone who could help him. His eyes didn't discriminate at that moment, all he needed was a saviour, no matter if they were an old man who looked like a skeleton or a skinny quirkless teen. At that moment, Izuku's heroism showed its true colours, and he felt free from the shades of grey of the world. His body moved without thinking, trying to do something, anything that could save him. He thought back to all his notes and how he spent his whole life trying to be someone who could give it there all to save one person. He threw his backpack at the villain's face to give Bakugo some time to breathe and tried to crawl him out with everything he had. When Bakugo questioned him, all he said was "It looked like you needed saving" sparking something in the blonde boy, something that had been buried under years of being told he was the best, his own idea of heroism. As the sludge villain raised his arm to hit Izuku, he realized that this was the moment he was waiting for, this was the one person he was going to give everything to save, and he was glad that even after all those years of doubting his ideal heroism, at this moment, those concerns didn't matter, because he was going to save one person, someone who had so much more potential than he ever did, someone who could save countless lives and become a symbol of victory. His sacrifice gave All Might the time he needed to power up and defeat the villain, and save Bakugo Katsuki.Change starts with one person, it was something Izuku Midoriya lived and died by, and now something Bakugo Katsuki lives by as well. In that one moment, Izuku's true heroism was highlighted over everything else, he didn't freeze, or call a teacher, he did everything he could at that moment to save someone. Izuku saw potential in Bakugo, and Bakugo wasn't going to let that be in vain. Izuku knew his capabilities, he knew that he was quirkless and didn't have the power to save people, so he gave his life for someone who he knew could save more people than he ever could. In this world, his actions spurred a change much greater than he ever could have imagined, and he could rest easy knowing that he died a true hero.<<EOFANFIC>>

completion:
As soon as they got the news that Izuku was conscious and awake, Class 2-A immediately gathered together to storm the hospital where he was staying to visit. Of course, because of his mental state and recovery process, all nineteen of them couldn’t fit themselves in the room, so they went with the old fashion way of taking turns instead. All of them desperately wanted to see the greenet and Bakugo, so it was a rough start with who would go in first and see them.

Hitoshi wasn’t one of those people.

Quite frankly, he wanted to be the last one to go in. Because Hitoshi imagined that he was the last person Bakugo wanted to see. And he wasn’t sure if he wanted to see Izuku.

Even if he was Reaper and had no control over his own actions because of Ankoku’s influence, it was still Izuku that held the gun. Pointed at his dad. Seconds away from shooting him if it wasn’t for Bakugo’s inference.

He felt bad for feeling this way, but Hitoshi couldn’t help it. He tried telling himself it was Ankoku’s fault, that he was the person to blame and should only be blaming him. That Izuku was just a kid. Just like him. Like all of them and Eri.

“Hey.”

A gentle voice broke Hitoshi from his thoughts, jolting at the hand that rested on his shoulder before meeting the golden eyes of Kaminari.

“Whatever you’re worried about, don’t be.”

“H-How do you know I’m worried…?”

Kaminari’s lip thinned as he stared back at Hitoshi evenly, simply replying, “Really ‘Toshi? Someone blind could see how clearly worried you are…”

“That didn’t make sense.”

“Exactly…! So stop worrying!” Kaminari lightly punched him on the shoulder, grunting until the blond pulled Hitoshi up and attempted to push him toward the room, “You won’t need to worry if you just talk to the guy…!”

“He was asking for you, too.”

Hitoshi blinked as he looked over to Todoroki, who had stepped out of the hospital room for the next person to head inside.

“Wha-Which… Who…?”

“Izuku. He said your name. I think he’s worried about you just as you’re worried about him.” Todoroki cocked his head to the entrance as he gently smiled with reassurance, “So get in there already, Shinso.”

With a last shove from Kaminari and a tight grip on the plastic bag he held, Hitoshi swallowed the lump in his throat before he walked past Todoroki. Each step toward the room felt like his execution, taking a deep breath before he willed himself inside and faced the two.

The first sight he saw after two weeks of nothing kind of surprised him, but it also helped ease the heavy weight on Hitoshi’s shoulders from the light atmosphere. Bakugo was trying to get Izuku to stop eating the chocolate that he was gifted, the items in his bag feeling irrelevant and unnecessary. A laugh escaped his lips before he could stop himself, which brought their attention to him.

“Hitoshi.”

It was so refreshing to see that light back in his eyes.

“Hey, Izuku. Has Katsuki been giving you problems?”

“Oh please, 

this

 guy is the one that’s the problem…! Along with the rest of your little shits for giving Izuku nothing but sweets!”

“Then I guess you won’t like what I got for him.” Hitoshi chuckled, walking toward the stool at Izuku’s bedside as he pulled out a small bar of dark chocolate, which had the greenet’s eyes instantly.

“Oh come on, really…?! You idiots are just trying to give Izuku an unhealthy diet!”

“It wasn’t on purpose… And chocolate can actually be good for you, Katsuki, helps the brain, your mood, depending on how much you eat, but obviously the amount that he has…” Hitoshi trailed off when rough hands reached out to touch him.

Instinctively, Hitoshi shifted back before recognizing whose hands it was, watching with guilt as Izuku flinched.

“Sorry- Shit, Izuku, I’m sorry- I didn’t mean to back away, you…” Hitoshi gently reached out, carefully holding the boy’s hands in his as he looked him in the eye, reassuring, “I’m sorry. Go ahead.”

For an uncomfortable few seconds, Izuku continued to hold eye contact with him before he eventually broke it, Hitoshi mentally sighing at that as the curly-haired teen went back to what he was going to do. He tried not to move when cool fingers touched his face, outlining old scars that would forever stain his expression.

“The same.” Izuku murmured, running his fingers up and down his face while Hitoshi looked at the greenet’s own scars.

They were much more visible now, thanks to the stupid muzzle that dug into Izuku’s skin and left open wounds.

“Hurt?”

“I should be asking you that, Izuku…” Hitoshi gulped, reaching his hand up to hold one of Izuku’s before slowly moving his other to trace the lines on the boy’s face.

“It doesn’t.”

“Then mine don’t either. But that’s only because I haven’t been muzzled in a long time…” Hitoshi’s hands twitched when he said that, his vision suddenly growing blurry. He tried to blink the water from his eyes, but that only caused them to fall, bowing his head down as he cried into Izuku’s hand, “I’m sorry…! You didn’t deserve that- I’m sorry, I’m sorry…!”

“Not your fault… Hitoshi.”

“You don’t deserve it…”

“Neither did you.”

Hitoshi continued to cry as Izuku pulled him in for a hug. It lasted longer than he would have wanted it to, Hitoshi finally gaining control of his emotions again as he wiped at his eyes and stopped the waterworks. When he broke away from the contact, he was faintly surprised to find Izuku’s own tear trails, but what was most shocking would be Bakugo’s teary gaze watching them.

Sniffing, Hitoshi wiped the last of his tears away and stood up from the stool, clearing his throat as he spoke, “I should probably go… Let everyone else see you and how you guys are doing.”

“Yeah, yeah, get out of here. And tell the extras that if any one of them brings Izuku any more chocolate, I’m going to blast their ass to hell and back.”

Hitoshi chuckled and before he could walk away, something held him firmly in place, turning back to find Izuku holding out his pinkie, hearing his soft request, “I’ll see you… later?”

Smiling, Hitoshi held out his pinkie and intertwined it with Izuku’s, squeezing it as a promise.

“I’ll see you later.”
<<EOFANFIC>>

When Aizawa told them that Shinso would be moved to class 2-A, Denki could tell that he short-circuited on the spot.Now, he could be friends with someone as cool as Shinso! Although the boy had openly declared his refusal to make friends, that had never stopped Denki! For example, Bakugo -Kacchan spiting him- was a mad dog with everyone, but Denki could tell he cared in his own way.The new school year brought several changes. One included an empty seat and a change of how they sat. It was strange not to see Aoyama's brilliance. Denki missed it, but at least he knew that Aoyama Yuga had died as a hero and hoped that people would remember him as a victim, not a villain.Now Denki would sit at desk number 6 and Shinso at desk 10. But that wouldn't stop Denki from befriending him. It was his personal mission.Jiro gave his shoulder a gentle squeeze. "Just... don't be sad if he...you know...rejects your attempts."Denki snorted, scratching the small scar on his forehead hidden in his bangs. "As if that's possible... you know? Happiness pours out of me like-""Remember what you talked about with Hound Dog." Jiro reminded him. "Don't minimize how you feel. Not like last year."He nearly died while fighting a war he and his friends didn't start. He saw his teachers and mentors die as his friends tried to survive against better-trained, blood-thirsty villains. All of it motivated his whole happy-go-lucky idiot façade to fall apart.That feeling of worthlessness. Maybe everyone saw him as a comic relief. He wasn't good enough to be a hero. He was too stupid.Everything blew up in his mind.Denki hadn't been resentful, but he felt good when Bakugo and Jiro apologized. Everything was better!"I won't," Denki answered, smiling to reassure her.Jiro still didn't seem 100% sure of his statement but ended up nodding and ruffling her hair."Way to go, Pikachu."  Hitoshi sighed, looking at the door to 2-A in front of him."That is." He told himself. "I got it."There were 5 minutes left before class started. Mr. Aizawa was probably still hiding somewhere in the school, preparing to appear as soon as the bell rang.Most likely, Mr. Aizawa would introduce him to his new classmates, and he had prepared his self-introduction since last year."Shinso Hitoshi. I'm not here to make friends." He muttered.But was that still true? After everything that had happened earlier in the year, would he still say that? He wasn't friends with anyone in the Hero Course. Besides, Monoma always found an excuse to talk to him and Kaminari, who had been friendly the few times they had interacted.Focus on being a hero. He thought. Whether or not there's friendship, first think of yourself.Hitoshi sacrificed a lot to get that spot in class A. Sleepless night, learning to eat vegetables no matter how much he hated them, training until exhaustion, calluses on his hands, and multiple scratches with the capture cloth."It's time."  Denki saw purple out of the corner of his eye, and the first on his list was scream in excitement, but Midoriya stepped forward. "Shinso! Welcome!After the whole One For All vs. All For One thing, Midoriya was back to quirklessness. It was cool how determined he continued to be a hero, changing his battle style and adapting to the underground style.It was great to be in a class with such amazing people.Shinso greeted with a shy smile, the same one he had come with after the matter of Aoyama's traitor status was deemed helpful in defeating All For One.Denki had felt so stunned at the time. If anyone had seen his face, they would say he had hearts in his eyes.Denki waved animatedly among the welcoming community.Shinso thanked them for the warm welcome and walked past Denki to take the last seat in the row.If Denki's gaze followed him until he flopped down on the desk, no one knew more than Jiro, who gave him a fond smile as he rolled his eyes.Fortunately for Hitoshi, Mr. Aizawa didn't request his introduction since everyone already knew him.Also, to his dismay, he assigned them in permanent pairs for the entire school year.Hitoshi had always been the lonely boy who worked alone. It was better to do things at his own pace and way, with no one to slow him down or rush him, worrying only about himself."I think we'll be partners, Shinso."Kaminari Denki was a team player. At his first year's sports festival, Todoroki Shoto chose Kaminari as part of his team, rejecting better candidates.In the joint training, Kaminari created a whole plan based on him sacrificing himself for them and giving Asui and Hitoshi the spotlight.In the first war, he absorbed a full blow from the front lines, protecting all those behind him and allowing them to stand a chance against the Paranormal Liberation Front.In the second war, he stayed behind as support, using his electrical charge to maintain the electromagnetic field that contained Shigaraki Tomura.Although Kaminari had an A+ in cooperation, Hitoshi had an A+ in academics. The weaknesses of both were found as strengths in the other.Hitoshi looked at his mentor, who wore his typical maniacal smile as he watched their interactions. It was obvious that their teacher paired them up so that, at the end of the year, they could learn from each other."It seems so, Kaminari," Hitoshi replied.  A week had passed since the start of classes, and everyone knew that Denki's clumsiness would appear at any moment."What was it?" Shinso asked, looking at the blue ink covering Denki.
My stupidity
"My pen kinda exploded," Denki said with a half smile, shrugging.Shinso blinked slowly at the walking disaster that was Denki."You'll stay blue forever." Shinso blurted out.He almost lost the meaning of the words from the tone of his voice.Denki couldn't help but snort. "Did you just make a joke?"For a second, he caught Shinso's eyes widening slightly before the bored look was complemented by a shrug. "Could be yes, could be no. But I know you'll find a way to make it fashionable at school."And, just like that, he left Denki's side, going straight to Mr. Aizawa's desk. "Is it weird that I like someone I haven't talked to much?" Hitoshi asked as Mr. Aizawa gave him a bottle of water.The man gave him a strange look before grunting and running a hand over his weary face."You kids and your kid stuff." The man groaned as he greedily drank from his own bottle. "If this is about Kaminari, I'll tell you that he's a kid who can get along with everyone. Even Monoma doesn't have him written off as nasty but just annoying."That wasn't the answer he was looking for, but Mr. Aizawa didn't let him say another thing."I told you that as long as you don't lose sight of your goals, you can do whatever you want, even if it's something you've always done without." The man continued without making an effort to look at Hitoshi. "So yeah, it's normal if you like someone without a lot of time knowing each other or without a lot of talking."Still, he didn't help Hitoshi with that strange feeling in his chest when he thought of Kaminari and how the blond pushed past his barriers without seeming to try hard enough.Denki waved his hand as his eyes focused on Shinso walking through the sea of students. The insomniac realized this and approached him with his typical tired gait."Kaminari." Shinso greeted with that deep voice that Denki could describe as ideal for picking up girls.Denki nodded in acknowledgment. "I wanted to invite you to partner in the following exercises!" He exclaimed with more enthusiasm than he wanted it to sound.Shinso blinked slowly, obviously confused, but sighed slowly.Denki -feeling he had screwed up everything- began to wave his hands desperately, looking for a way to fix it. "I understand if you don't want to! I know there are better companions but maybe-""Agree." Shinso snapped back.And then it was Denki's time to freeze. "Are you seriously going to team up with Kaminari, Shinso?" Jiro asked with a raised eyebrow as she approached them, her arms crossed over her chest.Hitoshi commonly liked Jiro. She was cool, had good taste in music, and was one of the sanest people in class A, but those words didn't like him so much.Who was she to question his alliance with Kaminari?"Yes, any problem?"
