completion: As one steps into the room, they are immediately greeted with an overwhelming sense of heroism. The room is filled to the brim with hero merchandise, ranging from action figures to posters and everything in between. There are posters of all the popular heroes, their names emblazoned across the top in bold letters, and their iconic symbols plastered below. The walls are practically screaming with hero worship.On the bed, amidst a pile of disheveled sheets and blankets, lie a few Disney plushies, providing a stark contrast to the intense heroism of the room. There is a small Mickey Mouse, a Winnie the Pooh, and a Tigger, each looking slightly out of place amidst the chaos of the room.The shelves lining the walls are overflowing with half-filled notebooks, each filled with scribbled notes and ideas. Some are adorned with stickers of favorite heroes, while others are covered in sketches of potential hero costumes. The shelves also house an impressive collection of hero books, ranging from biographies to comic books, each one well-loved and well-read.The floor of the room is scattered with clothes, strewn haphazardly across the floor in a colorful mess. There are hero t-shirts, hero hoodies, hero socks, and hero pajamas, all jumbled together in a chaotic pile.Above, the ceiling is adorned with old, long-gone, and faded glow-in-the-dark stars. They were once a source of fascination and wonder for the room's inhabitant, but now they serve as a faded reminder of days gone by.Overall, the room is a messy yet cozy space, clearly belonging to someone who is passionate about heroes and everything they stand for. The hero merchandise, disney plushies, half-filled notebooks, and scattered clothes all come together to create a space that is uniquely their own, filled with their hopes, dreams, and inspirations.As Todoroki steps into the room, he is immediately taken aback by the sheer amount of hero merchandise and clutter that fills every corner of the space. His eyes scan the walls, shelves, and floor, taking in the chaotic yet fascinating display of Midoriya's love for heroes. He can't help but be impressed by the passion that Midoriya clearly has for the hero world.Midoriya, noticing Todoroki's arrival, turns to face him with a smile on his face. "Hey, Todoroki! What do you think of my room?"Todoroki chuckles softly and shakes his head, "It's... certainly something, Midoriya. I don't think I've ever seen so much hero merch in one place before."Midoriya grins widely, clearly pleased with Todoroki's reaction. "Yeah, I guess I kind of went overboard, didn't I?"Todoroki nods in agreement, "Just a little. But it's okay. I can see how much you love heroes and everything they stand for. It's... inspiring, really."Midoriya's face lights up with joy at Todoroki's words. "Thank you, Todoroki. That means a lot coming from you."Todoroki smiles softly and glances around the room once more, taking in the chaotic yet endearing display of Midoriya's passion. Despite the clutter and mess, he can't help but feel a sense of warmth and comfort in the room, knowing that it belongs to his dear friend and fellow hero-in-training.Midoriya suddenly lost his balance and fell backwards onto the floor, causing Todoroki to look at him with concern. However, before Todoroki could say anything, Midoriya quickly sat up and grabbed a stitch plushie from the pile of scattered toys next to him. He then tossed it towards Todoroki, who was taken aback by the sudden gesture and the fact that he had no idea who Stitch was."What's this?" Todoroki asked, holding the plushie in his hand and examining it closely.As Todoroki examined the Stitch plushie in his hand, Midoriya's eyes widened in surprise. "You never watched Lilo & Stitch!?" he exclaimed, his voice filled with shock and disbelief.Todoroki looked up at Midoriya, who was now sitting upright on the floor, with a confused expression on his face. "I'm sorry, Midoriya. I just never got around to watching it," he replied sheepishly.Midoriya shook his head in disbelief. "But it's such a classic! It's one of my favorite Disney movies of all time. How could you not have seen it?"Todoroki shrugged, feeling a bit embarrassed. "I guess I just never had the chance to watch it growing up."Midoriya nodded, understandingly. "Well, we'll have to fix that. We can watch it together sometime."Todoroki smiled, grateful for Midoriya's understanding and eagerness to share his favorite movie with him. Despite feeling a bit out of his depth in the world of popular culture, he couldn't help but be fascinated by Midoriya's passion and knowledge.Midoriya looked at Todoroki, a mischievous glint in his eye. "How about now? Want to watch Lilo & Stitch right now?"Todoroki chuckled at Midoriya's enthusiasm. "Sure, why not? It can't hurt to catch up on some classic Disney movies."Midoriya grinned widely, clearly excited at the prospect of sharing one of his favorite movies with his friend. "Awesome! Let me just find the DVD," he exclaimed, beginning to rummage through the piles of merchandise and clutter that filled the room.Todoroki watched with amusement as Midoriya searched for the movie, feeling a sense of warmth and comfort in the chaos of his friend's room. Despite not being familiar with all of the heroes and popular culture references, he couldn't help but be drawn in by Midoriya's infectious enthusiasm and passion.As Midoriya continued to search through the piles of merchandise and clutter in his room, Todoroki settled down on the floor, making himself comfortable amidst the mess. He looked up at the glow-in-the-dark stars that were stuck to the ceiling, noticing how faded they had become over time. Despite the mess and chaos of the room, Todoroki couldn't help but feel a sense of warmth and comfort in the space, knowing that it belonged to his dear friend and fellow hero-in-training.As Todoroki admired the stars, Midoriya finally emerged from the piles of toys and plushies, triumphantly holding up the Lilo & Stitch DVD. "Found it!" he exclaimed, grinning widely at Todoroki.Todoroki smiled back at him, feeling a sense of excitement at the prospect of watching the classic Disney movie. "Great. Let's get started."Midoriya quickly popped the DVD into the player and settled down next to Todoroki on the floor. As the movie began to play, Todoroki couldn't help but be drawn into the story, feeling a sense of wonder and excitement at the colorful characters and fantastical world of Lilo & Stitch. Despite the mess and clutter of the room, he couldn't imagine a better place to watch the movie than in the midst of Midoriya's passionate and enthusiastic love for heroes and popular culture.As they settled in to watch Lilo & Stitch, Midoriya and Todoroki couldn't help but provide a running commentary on the movie."Oh man, I forgot how cute Lilo is," Midoriya exclaimed, as the little Hawaiian girl appeared on screen.Todoroki nodded in agreement. "And Stitch is quite the troublemaker," he added, as the little blue alien wreaked havoc on the island.Midoriya chuckled. "That's why I love him. He's just like us heroes, always causing chaos and then fixing things up afterwards."As the movie continued, they both found themselves getting caught up in the story, laughing at the antics of Lilo and Stitch and cheering them on as they faced various challenges and obstacles."This is such a great movie," Todoroki remarked, as they watched the emotional scene where Lilo and Stitch say goodbye to each other.Midoriya nodded, his eyes misty with tears. "I know, right? It's so heartwarming and emotional. And the soundtrack is amazing too."As the end credits began to roll, they both sat in silence, reflecting on the movie they had just watched."That was amazing, Thank you for sharing the film with me." Todoroki finally said bluntly, breaking the silence.Midoriya smiled at him, feeling a sense of contentment and joy. "I'm glad you liked it, Todoroki. It's one of my favorite movies of all time."As the credits continued to roll, Midoriya turned to Todoroki with a beaming smile on his face. "Thank you so much for watching Lilo & Stitch with me," he said, his eyes shining with emotion.Todoroki smiled back at him, feeling a sense of warmth in his chest. "Of course, Midoriya. I enjoyed it a lot."Midoriya's smile widened and before Todoroki knew what was happening, he was pulled into a tight hug, surrounded by all of the hero merch and plushies that littered the floor.Todoroki was momentarily surprised by the sudden physical affection, but he quickly relaxed into the embrace, feeling the warmth of Midoriya's body and the softness of the plushies around them.They stayed like that for a few moments, caught up in the emotion of the movie and the warmth of their friendship. Todoroki felt a sense of gratitude for Midoriya's unwavering enthusiasm and passion for the things he loved, even if they weren't always familiar to him.Eventually, Midoriya released him from the hug and they both sat back on the floor, surrounded by the mess of Midoriya's room.Todoroki wasn't sure what to say, but he felt a sense of connection and comfort in the chaos of the space. As they sat on the floor, surrounded by the mess of Midoriya's room, Todoroki's eyes drifted up to the faded glow-in-the-dark stars that adorned the ceiling. He couldn't help but feel curious about them."Midoriya, what's the story behind those stars on your ceiling?" he asked, his voice quiet and contemplative.Midoriya looked up at the stars and a smile spread across his face. "Oh, those. Kacchan and I put them up when we were kids," he said, his voice tinged with nostalgia.Todoroki raised an eyebrow, intrigued. "Really? Why?"Midoriya chuckled. "Well, Kacchan always used to say that he was going to be a hero and go to space someday. And I wanted to be a hero too, so I said I would go with him. We put up those stars so that we could practice our space navigation skills," he explained, a fondness in his voice.Todoroki couldn't help but feel touched by the story. Despite the chaos and conflict that often surrounded Bakugou’s and Midoriya's relationship, there was a deep bond of friendship and shared dreams that connected them."That's really sweet," Todoroki said, a small smile on his lips.Midoriya nodded, his eyes shining with emotion. "Yeah, it was. I haven't thought about those stars in a while. It's nice to remember where we started from."Todoroki nodded in agreement, feeling a sense of gratitude for the moments of peace and connection that he shared with his friends amidst the chaos of the boy in front of his.As the night wore on, Midoriya and Todoroki continued to talk and reminisce, sharing stories and memories as they sat surrounded by the mess of Midoriya's room.In that moment, they were simply two friends, united by their shared dreams and experiences. The hero merch, plushies, and scattered clothes were forgotten, replaced by the warmth and comfort of their friendship.And as they finally said their goodbyes and left the room, Todoroki couldn't help but feel grateful for the messy, chaotic space that had brought them together.<<EOFANFIC>>

prompt: write a story about Haikyuu!!,  Teen And Up Audiences Graphic Depictions Of Violence Gen M/M 僕のヒーローアカデミア | Boku no Hero Academia | My Hero Academia (Anime & Manga) Iida Tenya & Midoriya Izuku & Todoroki Shouto & Uraraka Ochako Midoriya Izuku/Todoroki Shouto Iida Tenya Midoriya Izuku Uraraka Ochako Todoroki Shouto Shopping Malls Stabbing Blood and Violence using Endeavor's credit card to buy All Might merch
completion:
Tenya had a bad feeling.

Tenya didn’t know why he had a bad feeling. He was just at the mall with Midoriya, Uraraka, and Todoroki. There was no reason for the apprehension he was feeling, but it was there, and Uraraka could tell.

Uraraka gently tugged Tenya to the side. “Iida-kun what’s wrong?”

Tenya shook his head. “Nothing is the matter, Uraraka-kun. I apologize for worrying you.”

Uraraka narrowed their eyes. “I think you’re lying.”

“I’m not,” Tenya assured, “I… There’s this feeling in my gut that something is wrong, but there isn’t. There’s nothing to fix. I’m just being idiotic.”

“Hey,” Uraraka said, giving Tenya’s arm a little chop, mimicking the way Iida chopped the air sometimes. “Don’t talk down to yourself like that. Your feelings matter, even if you think they’re misplaced.”

Tenya gave them a nod of appreciation. “Thank you, Uraraka-kun. You’re a good friend.”

“Hell yeah, I am!” Uraraka cheered, pumping their fist. “And so are you!”

“Iida-kun! Uraraka-san! Look at this!” Midoriya called over, waving enthusiastically.

“Coming, Deku-kun!” Uraraka cried, grabbing Tenya’s hand and pulling him over to Midoriya’s side.

Midoriya had found an All Might collectible figurine, and it was quite incredibly made, as well.

“Isn’t it a bit awkward, though? Since we know him, personally?” Uraraka voiced bluntly.

“He doesn’t care,” Todoroki voiced, not looking away from the figure, “He already owns too much All Might merch to be embarrassed.”

“It’s 5,000,000 yen,” Midoriya said sadly, holding the price tag.

Todoroki snatched it. “I’ll buy it for you.”

Midoriya tried to protest. “You don’t-”

“It’s Endeavor’s money, not mine,” Todoroki brushed off. “He’s an asshole that deserves to have his money spent on All Might merch.”

Uraraka laughed as Midoriya seemed to try to find a response and failed. Tenya smiled in amusement.


This is nice.



If only this feeling would go away.


Todoroki was already at the register, handing the figure in their hands to the check-out person.

“Thank you. Is this all for you?” the receptionist asked, putting the figurine in a bag.

Todoroki whirled over their shoulder. “Quick! Everyone, grab whatever you want!”

The receptionist let out a startled laugh as Uraraka came running over with 6 or 7 Funko Pops in their arms.

“Get these, too!” Uraraka demanded, dumping the Funko Pops on the counter.

“Done,” Todoroki agreed as the check-out person scanned the Funko Pops and bagged them.

“That’ll be 9,210,000 yen,” the receptionist stated as Todoroki handed over a card.

A pause, and then, “Thank you! Would you like your receipt?”

“No, thank you,” Todoroki dismissed grabbing the bag and pulling out the All Might figurine, handing the bag to Uraraka. “Here you go, Izuku-kun.”

“Thanks, Shoto-kun,” Midoriya said, a small smile on his face. He turned to Uraraka. “I can’t believe you’re more of a sugar baby than I am to my own partner.”

Uraraka spluttered, and Midoriya and Todoroki both laughed at them. Tenya also couldn’t help but give a hearty laugh.

“No fair, even you, Iida-kun?! What has this come to?!”

The group left the store, and Tenya’s apprehension spiked. He tensed.

“What’s wrong, Iida-kun?” Midoriya asked, sounding concerned.

Iida shook his head. “Nothing’s wrong.”

“Iida-kun…” Uraraka sighed.

“It’s alright if we need to pick this up at another time,” Todoroki assured. “We can always-”

“Look out!”

Todoroki stiffened, and it took a second for Tenya to realize that someone had tried to warn them about a group of villains coming their way. And one of them had a knife buried in Todoroki’s side.

Midoriya screamed as the villain yanked the knife out. Todoroki seemed to be in too much shock to react as the villain aimed to stab them again.

Tenya moved.

The villain was kicked across the hall, slammed into the opposite wall, dropping unconscious.

Tenya looked over at the rest of the group of villains, who hadn’t acted yet. There were 9 left, and they looked confident.

Todoroki dropped to their knees, slamming their right hand to the ground. A pillar of ice shot at them, capturing 4 of the villains.

One of the remaining villains moved forward, lunging at Todoroki. Midoriya pulled Todoroki out of the fight with his rope-like quirk factor, and Tenya and Uraraka intercepted the villain, Tenya delivering a blow to the gut and Uraraka throwing him over their shoulder.

Squelch
.

There was a hand inside Tenya’s gut. He hadn’t seen the villain coming. Tenya cried out in pain as he kicked the villain away from him, knocking her unconscious.

Tenya curled in on himself, unable to stay standing.

Midoriya let out a cry of rage. Tenya watched in awe as he bounced between the 3 still-standing villains, Uraraka assisting with some blocks and hits of their own.

Soon enough, they were all down. Mall security was there soon enough, cuffing the perpetrators and taking them to the holding station where more qualified police officers would take care of them.

Tenya and Todoroki were taken to the hospital soon afterwards. Tenya just needed several stitches. Todoroki needed surgery.

Midoriya and Uraraka waited with Tenya as Todoroki was in operation.

“So, the moral of the story is, if Iida-kun senses something is wrong, there definitely is something wrong,” Uraraka concluded.

Midoriya nodded sagely. “Iida-kun is the epitome of knowledge. He knows there is something wrong with the force.”

Uraraka gasped. “Iida-kun is a jedi!”

“Don’t be stupid, Uraraka-kun,” Iida sighed.

Uraraka ignored him. “Iida-kun is smart enough to know that Star Wars isn’t fictional. He knows that the force is real and uses it to sense when danger is near!”

Midoriya gave Iida a slight bow with his head. “Teach us, great Iida-sama. We want to know the ways of the force.”

“You’re both idiots,” Iida said with a smile.

“But we’re your idiots!” Uraraka said with too much cheer in their voice.

A nurse entered. “Your friend, Todoroki Shoto, has just exited surgery. He will be brought here, shortly.

Katsuki was about four years old when his hand was first held by another. And it isn’t anyone you’d expect it to be, either — not his mom nor his dad. Instead of his parents being the one to hold his hand (like they should have many instances before, such as when they cross the street while migrating from fashion shop to makeup shop again and again. But no, they didn’t even spare him a glance as they walked across the busy road, leaving Katsuki on the other side of the sidewalk until his terrified, crybaby ass would finally run across the crosswalk after losing sight of them around the corner, calling out “

Momma!

He was building a sand castle and fiddling with the details of it, drawing small stars and other shapes in the slightly wet sand with a stick. The sand wasn’t normally wet; Katsuki had just quickly wandered into the woods by the playground —

Anyways — Katsuki had been sitting there, minding his own business in the sand, happily drawing designs on his castle without a peep. And then, out of nowhere, Izuku comes racing towards him, tears spilling down his fat, freckled cheeks like mini waterfalls. Katsuki was concerned at first, dropping his shovel and blinking rapidly at all the conflicting emotions on Izuku’s face — fear and relief, worry and happiness. Katsuki didn’t even have a chance to mutter a word in before Izuku had flung himself at him like a bullet impacting into skin — knocking Katsuki over onto the ground. He grunted as he fell, but his huff was unheard over Izuku’s tearful wails and cries.

yooouuuu!

”

” Izuku shrieked, “You were gone a minute ago!

Katsuki stuttered in surprise and fond exasperation as Izuku dragged him up off the ground by yanking his arm. Then, Izuku took his hand and raced towards the teacher on duty.

A little bit better than he was seconds before. Izuku occasionally squeezed his hand every-now-and-then, his grip tightening and then becoming gentle again. Izuku never once let go of his hand. Even when the nurse checked him for wounds, Izuku kept a hold of Katsuki’s hand.

The sun only shined through there when it’s morning, so Katsuki figured it’s about 7. . . 7:30 in the morning. 
 
Momma and Papa leave for work at 7:45. 
 
Katsuki had 1, 2, 3. . . 4, no, 5 minutes to ask them what he wanted. Katsuki swallows down that stinging bile in his throat that seems to shake his whole body and make him feel hot with nervousness and anxiety. Fear, maybe. Yeah. 
 
He was scared. But he managed to man up and walk the first steps towards his doom. 
 
“Mo —” Katsuki’s voice cracked from lack of use and dehydration. “Momma?” he whispered softly, because Momma doesn’t like it when he’s loud. 
 
Mom turned to him, her face the perfect picture of annoyance. “What, brat? Are you hungry? Well too bad.” 
 
Katsuki 

was 

hungry, but he wasn’t to tell her that. That would make her angry. “No, I. . . I wanted to see if I could. . . if I . . .” 
 
“

Spit it out, you little fuck. 

You don’t stutter, 

how many times have I 

told 

you?

” 
 
Katsuki wanted to cry. But he didn’t. He spits out the rest of his question, fiddling his hands anxiously. 

 

“I want to go to work with you.” he said. 
 
All was quiet. Then, his mother laughs, loud and defeating and sharp, like a cackling hyena, cruel and mean and cold. 
 
“I could dress up for you.” he mumbled. His mother’s laughing abruptly stops and even his father looks up from the newspaper, his chocolate brown eyes seemingly interested in Katsuki’s words. 
 
“Mitsuki,” Papa started, “He could. . . he’s. . . it would be. . . 

good 

for the company. And it would teach him how to be. . . cooperative and well-behaved. He’d be great. He’d be a good boy, learning. . . 

responsibility 

so soon, don’t you think?” 
 
Katsuki does not like Papa’s smile. It’s creepy and unnerving. It made Katsuki’s heart pound with fear and it made his breathing hitch shakily. Papa’s tone sears itself into Katsuki’s brain, branding it with its odd feeling. 
 
And then Mother smiles. 
 
This is just the start of how Katsuki’s life crumbled before his eyes.

Chapter Text
 Screams, gunshots, cries and explosions. That’s all Eijirou could hear as he was hiding in a house that didn’t look like a house anymore. Furnitures all over the place, most burned and broken while some other were surprisingly still standing, like the chair in the corner that looked like it was never touched by the chaos that was playing behind the wall he was standing against, while he was reloading his rifle with the few ammunations he had left and trying to catch his breath, his throat and lungs burning.His weapon now charged, he take a look over his right shoulder to see if any enemies was in the area and was ready to start running again, but he felt a sharp pain in his left leg and suddenly he was on his knees, putting his hands in front of him in time to not hit the ground and quickly sat against the wall in hope he was not seen or heard by an opponent. Gritting his teeth, he searched for a wound on his leg and saw the piece of glass planted in his thigh right above the knee.How did he not feel it before ? Probably adrenaline. The red haired man rested the back of his head against the wall behind him and closed his eyes with a sigh.
“Great…”
Removing the glass shard by his own was very tempting and would probably ease the pain but he lost his bag with the first kit aid in it on his way here so treating his wound by himself may not be the best thing to do right now. Seems like he’ll have to go back to the rescue center to treat his wounds, plus he only got a few bullets left that probably won’t last for too long.And… he missed his lover. A lot. Katsuki and him barely see each other these days and don't spend more than a few hours together and they’re always too tired to enjoy each other's presence or to speak about things other than the hard and long day they had spent apart from each other. In the morning they only got time to share a few words and a quick kiss before they split again for another long day.Eijirou put down the rifle next to him and carefully took the necklace he hid under his shirt between his fingers, softly smiling as he saw the golden ring dangling on the silver chain. They got engaged only a few weeks before the war started. Taking the ring between his thumb and his index finger, he kissed it gently and said in a mutter :
“Seems like I’ll come home earlier today, my love”
Gunshots brutally broke the little bubble he was in and he quickly put the necklace back in his shirt and picked up his weapon, getting up with a hiss, using the wall as a support. The sounds of the shootings were getting closer and he waited a few seconds until a man ran past the house and crouched behind a burned car not too far away from him, panting and trying to reload his rifle but seeing the desperate expression on his face, he probably didn’t have bullets anymore.The guy was wearing the same uniform as him but looked a few years younger so Eijirou assumed he entered the troops not too long ago. He looked terrified and was clearly on the verge of crying as he removed the gun from his leg holster, his shaking hands unlocking the safety of the gun and Eijirou couldn’t help but to see himself during his first time on the field, almost five years ago.Taking a look at the opposite side, he saw the three opponents searching for the young man were far enough from the spots they were both hiding. Turning back to his comrade, he whistled shortly and loud enough so he could only be heard by the soldier, and it worked because after searching for the source of the noise, the young man spotted the red hair behind the wall and let out a sigh of relief seeing he was wearing the same uniform as him.Eijirou put his index finger against his lips, then signed not to make a noise and to stay where he was. He hoped the guy learned his lessons well.Sign language was learned to every soldier in their troops so they could communicate more easily on fields. It was originally an idea proposed by Katsuki after he lost most of his hearing during a mission and was approved by most of their superiors.The young man nodded so Eijirou kept signing to let him deal with the enemies and to cover his back. Another nod and Eijirou get in position to aim at the soldiers that were now a few meters away from them. He waited for them to be close enough so he wouldn't miss his targets.Once they were in his range, he pulled the trigger.  Two hours later, they were back to the rescue center. The young soldier helped Eijirou to walk by supporting him with an arm around his waist because the glass shard was starting to hurt more and more, gritting his teeth with each step that led him to the infirmary. He lay down in a bed and was left in the hand of the doctor that took care of his leg and other minor wounds, thanking the young man with a nod and the latter answered with a grateful smile. Eijirou swallowed the painkiller the doctor gave him and rested his head on the pillow laying his arm over his eyes with a sigh.He just needed some minutes and he’ll get up to see if Katsuki came back earlier too. As he was thinking about what they could do if they could go "home", a familiar voice calling his name interupted him. Eijiro lifted his arm to see his best friend at the end of the bed, looking back at him with a strange stare, like he was not expecting to see him here. Eijiro straightened to sit and gave him a smile, seeing he was safe too, except for some scratches and bruises, but nothing that seemed too serious.Katsuki told him last night that Denki and him would be on the same mission for the day, so that means his fiancé had already returned to the center too. As his usually cheerful and optimistic friend didn’t smile back at him, he knew something happened. With a sharp move that made him hisses because of the pain in his leg, he got up off the bed and approached the blonde with a limp.
“Where’s Katsuki ? Did he come back with you ?”
He asked with a lump in his throat and a fear Denki hated to see in his best friend's eyes.
“...He did b-but he-”
Eijiro didn’t let him finish his sentence as he sighed in relief.“You know where I can find him ? I want to surprise him” he said in a chuckle.Denki stared at his friend and tried to swallow away the tightness in his throat.
“Yeah… I’ll take you to him”
The red haired soldier put his arm around Denki's shoulder while the latter put his own arm around his waist to support him. Eijiro rested the side of his head against his friend’s and let out a grateful whisper.
“Thank you, brother”
The blonde didn’t respond to him and started to walk, tightening his hold on his waist, as he pressed his lips in a tight line. He didn’t have the heart nor the courage to tell him the truth.Maybe he should have.  The more they walked forward, the more Eijiro felt that something wasn't right with his friend.The silence surrounding them was heavy and almost suffocating. It was rare when they stayed in silence like that as they were both talkative people and the lump in his throat was getting bigger from the worry that Denki was hiding something from him. Something very serious. But he didn’t want to ask because it would mean he was doubting his friend and he would never do that.He could blindly trust him with his life.So he stayed silent and kept walking in the dark corridor that was enlightened by a few dim lights hanging on the walls, until they reached a double door, covered by blood stains and red hand prints. Eijiro frowned. He came here maybe one or two times since the war started but he knew what was behind these doors.He hated this place. The last time he came here he promised himself he would never come back.He didn’t understand why Denki brought him here. Katsuki can’t be behind these doors, his best friend probably wanted to prank him and Katsuki was waiting for him elsewhere, in a safe place !...Right…?

completion:
Chapter Text
Today was the day. No matter what she was gonna escape her parents' abuse.She had a quirk, not that she could use it. Her parents had brought her to the doctor to get tested, they were told her quirk, she wasn’t. She vaguely remembers her parents saying they were hippies or something like that before they left the office and took her home. 
It was almost time to watch the news while her parents were, somewhere. She didn’t really know where. She just knew she got to watch the news for an hour and a half and then she needed to hide. Or that’s what she used to do, today she was gonna run into the kitchen. 
But her mom didn’t put the news on. She put a disc in something before they left. 

If not the news, what else could I possibly be watching?

Is there anything else, the weather sure but that’s in the mornings. What did she put on?
The intro played and a name and logo came on the screen.
“Gisney? Disney? What is that?” She asked herself before it started playing. 
“Beauty and the Beast. Weird title, but all of this is weird so whatever”, she has a habit of talking to herself while her parents are gone at this hour.  She practices her speaking, in English and Japanese. 
 The disc plays and it finishes, she goes to run to the kitchen only to find her parents behind the couch with the knives that were supposed to be her ticket to freedom. She was gonna die here wasn’t she.
 Crap I didn’t even hear them come in, I was so focused on the tv. What do I do now? 
 Before she could scrape together a new plan her parents started forward, she fought back of course but before she hit her dads throat he got a few stabs in. Whatever. Think about that later Katsumi, you’ve still got one to go. Her mother was easier to deal with but soon she was down too. 
 She had no idea if her parents were dead or not but she was exhausted. She had at least 4 stab wounds and some kind of exhaustion thing that she heard spoken about regarding quirks. She had no idea if whatever requirement for her quirk was met but it felt the way they described and something in her gut told her she was right. 
 She just sat there for a couple minutes before she heard sirens. Now? They chose now??? After 3 years of nothing they come now when I’m probably the only living being left in the house. Great, just great. It's too late to leave, it'll only make me more suspicious as I'll definitely get caught. Whatever. Wonder what they came in for.
 There was a very loud knock on the door. “In the living room!” She shouted and hoped they would hear. The door burst in. “It was unlocked”, she muttered. She looked up to see the fire hero Endeavor. “Villain!”, he calls, “Where?!”, she responds looking everywhere. He points at her. “You.”, he says as if his word is law. Before lighting her arm on fire.
 She did her best to put it out, not before earning a burn that would probably scar if she didn’t go to the hospital. Thankfully the detective she heard so much about walked in and stopped Endeavor from doing more damage.
“What do you think you are doing?” The detective asks. “Stopping the villain” replied Endeavor as if it should be obvious. “Endeavor, that's obviously the victim who’s been calling for 3 years trying to get help. It looks like they tried to kill her today if she hadn’t defended herself, stop making things worse. Wait outside.” Endeavor was not happy as he went to wait outside.
“Sorry about that. I'm detective Tsukauchi. My quirk is called Lie Detector. Can I use it during our talk about what happened?” A nod. “Perfect, am I allowed to record this as well? It’ll keep you from answering repeat questions.” Another nod. “Okay, let me know if you want to stop at any time, okay?” “Okay.” 
“Detective Tsukauchi with the perceived victim. What’s your name?”
“Katsumi” “Truth. What is your quirk?”
“I’m not sure. The doctor told my parents but they never said anything other than that there was a requirement I was missing still.” “Truth.  Can you explain what happened today?”
“Well, today marks the third year since I started calling people to help me and I decided I was getting out with or without help and decided wounding my parents would be the best way to go about that. But when they came back they already had the knives from the kitchen and before I could figure out what to do now they attacked.” She takes a deep breath and winces. He notices, “Truth, are you injured anywhere other than the burn?”
“Yes, I have a couple stab wounds. I'm pretty sure they missed my organs but it still hurts y’know?” “Truth, okay let's get you bandaged up and then Endeavor will take you to the hospital. You need to be checked up for malnourishment and other injuries.”
“Okay”, she agrees and allows him to help her stand up. They made their way to the cop car and she got all bandaged up before she was sent with Endeavor to a hospital.



It didn’t take long for her to realize they were headed to the part of town that didn’t have a hospital as it was completely abandoned. 
“Hey where are you taking me?”
 Endeavor said nothing and grabbed her arm and dragged her into the middle of the area before leaving.
“You’re just gonna leave me here?” “You belong here, there are people like you here villain. Don’t try to follow me back.” And then he left.
 She walked around confused. No one lived here still, or did they, maybe people who don't want people to know where they are live here! “Hello?” She asks cautiously.
“Kid, get out of here, you shouldn’t be here.” Some guy with bad burns, and staples(?) said. “I don't really have anywhere else, not like I have any idea how to leave either.” She remarked as she approached the guy with weird things in his face connecting burned and not burned skin.
“Kid, what are you doing?” He backed up against a wall and she leaned in to look at the silver things. “I was right! They are staples!” “Kid? You know what, whatever, I can get you a room to stay in if you want. You’d have to pay rent and what not but you can figure that out on your own.” 
“Really? Thank you! What’s your name?” “Dabi” “Oooh we’re using fake names. Hmmm, call me Masayoshi! No wait that doesn’t sound right. Call me Justice!” “Kid you understand that I’m not just giving you a name that I chose at random right? It’s my name now. Also it means ‘cremation’ . Why was your first choice like the opposite?” “Hero’s wouldn’t bring me justice so I had to.” Shrugs, “Also did you know that Dabi means ‘dearly loved’ in Hebrew?” 
 He pinches the bridge of his nose, “No. I didn’t. Why do you know that? You’re what, 4?” “I’m 7. Also I read a big book of baby names and their meanings a while ago and I remember all the funny contrast in names from Japanese to other languages.” She smiles at him. “And why did you read a book like that?” He looked appalled.
 She shrugs, “There wasn’t anything else I was allowed to read outside of textbooks. It was a nice contrast okay?” “Oh god, whatever let's just go shortstack”
“Hey I’m not short you’re just a giant!” She exclaimed as she walked after him. “Yeah yeah don't care.”
 They reached a bar and Dabi went in. Katsumi he’s situated. “Hey shorty! Do you want a roof over your head or not?” Thunder clapped in the distance.“Coming!” She rushed into the building after him.
 The League Of Villains turned to see that Dabi was back and he had a- wait was that a child?!?!?
“The fuck do you have a child with you for.” A crusty looking man asked. “Found her in the square, she’s decided her name is Justice because the hero’s didn’t give her justice and so she had to. Don’t ask me what she means, I have no clue. Also she needed a place to stay and thought ‘Hey we have a small room available, she can figure out money and stuff on her own from there.’”
“Shortstack’s okay with us being villains?” Crusty asked. “Hey! I am not short! Also a hero called me a villain today”, shrugs “I mean, I did kinda, maybe kill my parents?” Everyone looks at her slightly shocked because she had been all sunshine moments before. “In my defence they tried to kill me so.”, shrugs again.
 The crusty man turns towards Dabi very dramatically. Dabi put his hands up in a surrendering way. “In my defense she weirded me out and then said the hero thing. Also I saw Endeavor drop her off here.” “He was supposed to take me to the hospital.” “Of course he was,” Dabi miuttered. She approaches the crusty, “What’s your name?” 
 The crusty man sighs before saying, “Tomura Shigaraki, you?” He sounded dead inside. “I’m Justice! Also are you okay? You sounded dead, also you need some lotion for your everything. You look crusty.” Everything went quiet before Dabi burst out laughing, everyone at the bar started laughing except the oblivious child and said crusty looking man. 
 The misty man approached before kneeling and asking “Does Ms. Justice like to sing?” “Mhm!” She replied, “why?” “Well” he began, “you can't pay for your room as you have no money and we could use live entertainment to liven up the bar a bit. You sing and in exchange you get to live here, eat and everything else you need. How does that sound?” “Great!! I don't have  anything other than my clothes, which aren’t even mine. They were given to me by the detective guy, he also bandaged up my burn and stab wounds!”
“Fuck my life” Dabi whispered, not quite quiet enough though. Katsumi turned to Dabi, “can I ask a question.” He sighed “sure why not.” “What does fuck mean? My parents said it but I don't know what it means.” “Crap!” He mutters. “Uhhhh it’s kind of a descriptor word, only it doesn’t describe how something is, it describes how you feel. The more fucks in a sentence the more upset or scared they are, but you shouldn’t use such a word yet, okay?” 
“Aw fuck. Why not?” She leaned towards Tomura and whispers quite loudly, “did I use it correctly?” He whispers back at the same volume, “yeah.” “Okay!” She smiles at him before turning back to Dabi who is running a hand down his face. “What?” She asks. “You’re already giving me a headache, let's get you to bed okay?” 
“Okay but I need pajamas.” He sighs again, I’ll just give you one of my t-shirts, okay?” “Okay!” She grabs his hand as he leads her towards her new room. 
 Maybe everything would be okay here.
<<EOFANFIC>>

“Oboro,” You say. The name falls from your lips like an involuntary slip of the tongue, unbidden, foreign. You decide against repeating yourself just for the sake of having the syllables graced upon you again, and the sky is blue overhead. Oboro blinks at you, slow and rhythmic, but he doesn’t stop humming this off-tune melody that you don’t recognise. “I—” You get the feeling that he’s not waiting for the continuation of your sentence, but he’s looking at you. Your breath is catching in your tight chest as your heart tremors, and you have this absurd thought that this boy could pry open your ribcage and pick out the wilted wildflowers overgrown within with gentle hands, and you’d let him dissect you with that stare alone, and you can’t really bring yourself to say anything more.  There’s a dreamy quality to the way Oboro looks, wispy cloud-like hair and green eyes, nostalgic. The clouds behind him meld into the stray pieces of hair he can never seem to tame into something decently flat against his skull, and you suddenly find it hard to even form coherent thoughts. Oboro has his head tilted slightly, humming soft, looking so at ease with his back against a tree trunk that you think you might be intruding into something private. Words feel like bricks in your mouth, sharp-edged and pointy, heavy with an unexplainable weight, like once uttered, that quizzical look on Oboro’s face will drop, along with that cocked eyebrow and infectious smile. It’s illogical, stupid—you should get this over with. You bite your lip.  His eyes have never left your face, and you think you should feel anxious, or uneasy, or something; not this tender thing, swelling alongside the notes he is still humming beneath his breath, to just—look. Look at him, at the reflection of you inside his irises, emerald and glassy. That’s not quite right, because Oboro’s eyes have never been green and dead, leaves plucked and trampled. You regard him again, and of course—it’s just a trick of the lighting. There’s nothing out of the ordinary, after all. Your gaze turns to the scenery laid out from where you’re both sitting on that hilltop, grass stains on Oboro’s hands and face, and it’s so quiet, peaceful. It seems that it’s just the two of you, here. It’s almost a comforting thought, except the air is still. His hair is windswept. Sometime between all those stuttering moments, you’ve settled on something to say. “It’s nothing.”  Oboro is still looking at you, you don’t need to turn your head to know. But you do that anyway, just in time to catch this striking grief in his wobbly smile and eyes. It’s sorrowful, for lack of a better word. (A better word, for example, would be apologetic.)  That isn’t quite right, is it?   There’s nothing out of the ordinary, and Oboro is smiling again. We’ll meet again, tinny and rattling and Oboro’s,  don’t know where, don't know when—  And the universe helps you continue, between your stuttering breaths, dedicated to this make-believe stageplay you’ve designed of your own volition. “It’s—nothing.”  
 But I know we’ll meet again—

 —Some sunny day. 
 “Please.” Gods, you’d beg. You’d get on your knees and grovel, because Oboro is fading,  dying, voice barely a whisper, bloody, dust-covered clothing unravelling thread by thread, the last woven fabric of this tiny little world you created. Relents.    The humming doesn’t stop. You choke up, watching Oboro revert back to an opaque form. He’s not smiling.  Keep smiling through—

 Just like you, always do—

completion:
Chapter Text

He hears buzzing. God, the buzzing doesn’t stop. He thought he was dead. 

Why am I not dead? Why? I want to be. 

He can feel his eyes drying out with how long his eyes have been open.
 
“-kid, kid, Shinsou,” Hitoshi hears in the distance. 

Ignore it. They want something from you. They always want something from you.

 

Cold. Why is it cold? 

 
Hitoshi is flooded with the ice in his veins, trying to pull at the invisible thread that’s trying to wiggle inside him.
 

Do I know this voice? I don’t. Maybe I do. 

 
“I’m going to touch your hands. Slowly. I’m right here, I’m slowly moving to warm your hands up,” a voice echoes in his head. 
 

God, I know that voice. Wait. Is that-

 
“Shinsou. Hitoshi. It’s Mr. Aizawa. We’re sitting outside the cat café by my house. You are sitting by the front door. The bell is jingling with all of the people moving in and out. I’m holding your hands because they are cold to the touch. Feel that? Do you feel them getting warmer? Present Mic is sitting to the left of you. He was on patrol with me. Can you see him? He’s shielding us from people walking by,” Aizawa states, trying to infiltrate Hitoshi’s thoughts so that he comes back to some semblance of reality.
 

Aizawa. Mic

. Aizawa’s been training him for the past few weeks, in hopes of transferring to the hero course. It’s certainly an adjustment for him, with him having to hide it from his foster family, even though he knows they don’t care enough to see where he’s at most of the time.
 
He can start to feel his eyes getting wet, and his hands starting to tingle, a sure sign that his hands are starting to regain feeling. He can hear a dull rumble in his ears, with sound starting to come back to him.
 
“Hitoshi. Are you back with me? Nod for yes, shake for no,” Aizawa instructs.
 
Hitoshi gives him a faint nod, to prove that he’s still on this plane. He can feel himself start to shake as he warms up.
 
“Okay kid, here’s the plan. Hizashi 

(wait, Mic?)

 is going to go up to our apartment, and get the guest room ready, and we’re going to warm up and get something to eat. Does that sound reasonable?” Aizawa asks, trying to get as much of Hitoshi’s input as possible.
 
Hitoshi just looks at him blankly, still not all together.
 
“I’ll take that as a yes. And I am carrying you. You are in no shape to walk the stairs,” Aizawa states firmly.
 
Hitoshi’s cheeks flush red with embarrassment and shock, 

shock that someone cares that much.

 
Hitoshi moves his head, looking for Present Mic, but he’s nowhere to be found. 

I guess he’s gone.

 
Aizawa grabs Hitoshi, putting his arms under his body and holding him like a parent would a child, allowing him to rest his head on his chest, covering him from the outside world.
 
He makes a grunt of surprise at how light Hitoshi weighs, making a note to get more information, and to make sure he stays fed. 
 
Hitoshi buries his face deeper into Aizawa’s chest as they climb the stairs to the apartment, feeling the beginnings of exhaustion seep back through his brain.
 

Safe.






On the list of things he had planned today,  a nap was a must, but bringing his trainee home so he could have a proper meal and sleep was not. 
 
He’d already had a long day, starting with Hizashi waking him up at an early hour, stating that “breakfast at the start of the day is a must, Sho!” He calls foul. He doesn’t need breakfast, and Shoto never comes downstairs to eat with them anyway.
 
Shoto. He had been living with Shota and Hizashi for almost 6 months and he’s still hoping to find that things get easier. Ever since Shoto told Aizawa about his home life, about the fear and hurt Endeavor had caused throughout his life, Shoto has yet to find peace or true safety, even with living at a safe home. 
 
He can’t blame him though. He’s been there before. All the restless nights and worries that he’s not safe, and desperately reaching out for someone powerful to take him away.
 
Shoto’s been in that house his entire life and has to adjust to having guardians who love and interact with him. The feeling is still foreign. Aizawa can see himself in Shoto, which makes it so hard to see that he’s not improving as fast as he’d hoped. 
 
His worries about Shoto however, seem to be sidelined as he walks closer to the cat café by their house, flanked by Hizashi as they see a lump of purple hidden under a thin jacket sitting by the back. 
 
“Sho, is that?” Hizashi questions, already knowing the answer.
 
“Shinsou!” Aizawa takes off running towards Shinsou’s figure on the ground, immediately dropping to the ground.
 
He can see that purple hair hidden under a small jacket, curling up to stay warm.
 
Aizawa moves his hands to take the jacket off, looking for Shinsou’s face, checking for a pulse, anything that proves he’s okay.
 
He sees his purple eyes staring off at a distance and he can see that Shinsou is not present, and he gets a good look at his face.
 
He sees the deep, dark bruising under his eyes, and can see why Bakugo so lovingly gives him the name “Eyebags”. He can see just how bone-tired he is, how he’s trying not to take up space, and wither away.
 
He has so many questions. But most pressing is, how did he end up here? Like this?
 
Hizashi runs up behind Aizawa, catching up and landing on the ground next to him.
 
“What happened? Is he okay?” Hizashi panics, looking at his husband for direction. He was always better at directing a crisis.
 
“He’s alive, breathing, and looks like he’s completely dissociated. He’s not present right now. I need him to be cognizant before I scare him, or need to move him,” Aizawa rattles off, the panic and worry clawing at his throat.
 
When he agreed to mentor Shinsou a few months ago, he never imagined he would become so attached to a student and involved in his caretaking. He can feel his insides twist and turn at the sight of one of his kids in distress and breaking down. He’s done it once this year, with Shoto, he’s unsure if he can handle it again with Shinsou.
 
He looks at Shinsou, covered in dirt and staring at the brick wall ahead. He sees no recognition in his eyes and can see how cold he is, wondering how long he’s been sitting on the ground. He sees the dried tear tracks digging their way through the grime on his face. As he looks longer at his face, he resolutely decides he will not let this kid out of his sight. Ever. Whatever has happened to him in the past, will never happen again. He will grow to be happy, warm, and safe. He will make sure of it. 
 
Looking at Shinsou, Aizawa takes notes. He needs to get him warm so he gets back to the present, so they can get him back to the house. Back to a bed and food. He looks like he’s been out here for days, unsure of what’s to come next.
 
He begins to speak to Shinsou slowly, loud enough to be heard but soft enough so that he doesn’t startle Shinsou. 
 
“Hitoshi. It’s Mr. Aizawa. We’re sitting outside the cat café by my house. You are sitting by the front door. The bell is jingling with all of the people moving in and out. I’m holding your hands because they are cold to the touch. Feel that? Do you feel them getting warmer? Present Mic is sitting to the left of you. He was on patrol with me. Can you see him? He’s shielding us from people walking by,” Aizawa explains to Shinsou, hoping to calm him and settle him so he feels safe to come back.
 
It takes a minute, but Aizawa can see small tears forming under Hitoshi’s eyelids, seeing them start running back down his face, as he holds his hands.
 
Hitoshi starts to blink more, can feel him shake, both signs that he’s coming back into himself.
 
“There you go, you’re doing so great. I am so proud of you, kid. I’m here when you get back. I’m here. We’re both here,” Aizawa pleads, trying to get Shinsou to react and see who is in front of him.
 
He sees Shinsou look at him and starts to see more recognition as his body shakes from the cold, so he takes the best chance he has.
 
“Hitoshi. Are you back with me? Nod for yes, shake for no,” Aizawa instructs.
 
Aizawa sees a faint nod from Shinsou. Thank you. 

Thank you.

 
“Okay kid, here’s the plan. Hizashi is going to go up to our apartment and get the guest room ready, and we’re going to warm up and get something to eat. Does that sound reasonable?” Aizawa asks, trying to get Shinsou to react as much as possible.
 
Shinsou just looks at him blankly, still not all together.
 
Aizawa decides firmly that Shinsou will not be walking to the house. 
 
“I’ll take that as a yes. And I am carrying you. You are in no shape to walk the stairs,” Aizawa states firmly.
 

What happened to you, kid? Have you been hiding this the whole time?

 
Aizawa picks Shinsou up, holding him like a parent who’s taking their kid to their room to tuck into bed. It feels natural, strangely. 

I should not look further into that. 

 
It’s only a short walk from the café to their apartment complex, but to him, it feels like years. Shinsou turns his head closer to his chest, trying to hide his face and get warm, and Aizawa almost disintegrates right then and there. He doesn’t know when this kid wormed his way into his heart, but he knows this is a forever feeling, and he’s going to talk to Hizashi about it later. Probably Shoto too. 





Maybe I’ll make Hizashi tell Shoto he’s getting a brother.







<<EOFANFIC>>

completion:
Chapter Text
Ten Years AgoThe hero public safety commission decided to give its breeding program one more try, this time using two of its best recruits, Hawk age 11 and Miruko age 13 sadly the child produced was less than satisfactory with a speaking disorder so they sent her into the care of a paid civilian named Midoriya Inko. Present DayIzumi knows she is smarter than most kids her age, at least she thinks she is, but if she was that smart then why did everyone hate her? Why couldn’t she speak? Why didn’t Inko (she had stopped calling her mom after the first beating) care about her? Izumi remembers the first time someone told her she was useless, she was three and accidentally used sign instead of writing on the whiteboard the teacher gave her and slapped for disobedience. It only got worse when she got her quirk, a combination of a rabbit and bird mutation that gave her gold wings and ears. People started screaming at her to hurt her ears and ripping her hypersensitive wings. When she went to the teachers about it she was punished then they went as far as encouraging the bullies and rewarding them for “creativity” with their torment. When she told about it Inko she was simply told, “I’m only paid keep you alive your condition doesn’t matter.” Then beat her for trying to get her classmates in trouble. By the time she turned seven she learned to take the beatings and minimize her presence. Now here she was at age ten ready to jump off the roof and end it all. She walked to the edge taking a breath then threw herself off the edge. The last thing she saw before blacking out was…a red feather?

completion: ashido unable to sleep due to having reoccurring nightmares of midnights death and the war. she bumps into kirishima who is also awake, now occupying the couch in the livingroom."hey" he greeted her, she was quiet. "can't sleep?" he raises a brow, she nods. he motions her to sit with him patting the empty spot beside him. she plops down next to the red head, shoulders slump obvious of exhaustion. she was jittery."you...okay? wanna talk about it?" kirishima places a hand on her back to try and soothe her, which works. he can feel her tense muscles loosen up."i keep....i keep having nightmares of midnight-sensei's death. that big monster almost killing me and–" she was cut of by a fit of tears and uneven breathing. by instinct (a newly created one) kirishima wraps his shaky friend in his arms."it's not fair- why- why did this happen?! it's our fault she died!" she said between sharp breathes and hiccups. "ashido no it's not our, not your fault. we did what we could, you did what you were able to do in your power!" he holds her tighter as she cries harder, he can feel tears swelling in his eyes."that's the problem! i could've done more! if i wasn't so scared and weak i could've done something!" ashido was now crying hysterically, gripping tightly at kirishima's shirt, screaming that it was her fault. kirishima not sure how to descelate the situation, continues to hold her tight and rub circles in her back, repeating: "it's not you fault , you did what you could."having heard the screaming from downstairs, yaomomo and iida walked down."what's happening?" yaomomo asked iida who had just passed by her room. "I'm not sure, it could be an intruder or one of our classmates." they both head down with worry."kirishima? ashido? what happened?" iida approached the two on the couch. kirishima's eyes were glued on ashido who continued to cry onto his shirt. "is ashido alright?" yaomomo perked up behind them to get a closer look. she could see the tear stained shirt of kirishima."i couldn't sleep so i went down, i happened to bump into ashido here. but she lookdd distressed so i asked her if she was okay and...well...she couldn't sleep because she keot having nightmares about midnight-sensei." that name alone made the two tense up. iida frown visible and yaomomo's face covered in worry."I'll go make some tea, maybe that'll help calm her down, and you as well." she makes her way into the kitchen and starts prepping the tea.the sudden scream from ashido woke the others up, well more like alerted.tsuyu, ochako, jirou, kaminari, sero, todoroki, tokoyami and other came down in a rush, bakugou and midoriya trailing from behind."we heard someone scream...is everything alright?" uraraka questioned iida. the rest started asking questions too so he explained the situation."i see...oh mina." the girks gathered around kirishima and ashido giving them a hug.the rest follow, circling around them reassuring the now calmed girl."here you go ashido, kirishima. this will help you calm down. I'll make for the rest as well." she places down the teacups on the coffee table.bakugou and midoriya watching from the back, who were previously conversing in the balcony of bakugou. "this is my fault. if it wasn't for my personal fight between afo this wou–" he earns a painful smack at the back of the from bakugou. "ow...""if you're going to say this is your fault izuku, shut it. none of this is your fault. none of this is our fault." he made sure what he said was heard by the rest. "for gods sake, we're all kids. we're going to be incompetent, lacking and weak. what happened in the war was not fully our responsibility. you were given your task and asked to deliver, and you did. whatever happened then after was beyond your control and power." he aggressively rubs midoriya's head as some kind of example. "trust me, nome of this if your fault. I'm sure midnight-sensei and the rest would agree." he made a scowl but quickly faded into a softer look."bakugou is right. we're just kids, forced to fight in a war we were unprepared for." todoroki backs his statement."sorry for waking you guys up." ashido sniffled, rubbing her eyes. "it's alright, i couldnt sleeo either." jirou said, and the others started confessing."alright since we're all here and unable to sleep, how about we all have a sleepover here in the livingroom!" kaminari suggested.and they do.they end up talking away their uneasiness that no one dared to point out. they had a pillow fight, ate snacks, watched some dumb videos on yt on the tv. then fell asleep at 4am. except for one. later that morning,"what're ya dragging me out so early for huh shouta?" mic nags at the dark haired man. "just checking up on the kids." he unlocks the door quietly making his way in.as he makes his way in hid eyes land on the mentionex kids who are on the floor sleeping. he smiles fondly looking at them. "ohhh the kids had a sleepover party last night huh?" mic peered over his shoulder to take a look. "cut them some slack, they probably needed this."his eyes land on a disheveled looking blomde hair, bakugou.the blonde spots him at the same time. nodding his head."what happened here?" he motioned the crowd on the floor."ashido freaked out last night, woke everyone up. apparently she's been having reoccurring nightmares about midnight's death." his facial expression dropped.aizawa sighs. theyre just kida after all. he pats bakugou head who, was about to push him away but last second decided not to. he didnt want to move and wake up the sleeping midoriya on his lap."I'm sorry we adults are so incompetent." he hugs him."yeah yeah, now hush dont wana wake them up, they just fell asleep."<<EOFANFIC>>
